Select the Accounts @ Adjustments @ New Batch Adjustment option.  The Adjustment Batch Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate adjustment type and batch type.  Enter the account number or invoice number in the appropriate columns associated with the adjustment and press the Tab key. pages.title: Adjustment Detail List Form
pages.text: The Adjustment Detail List form lists the adjustments that match the selection criteria specified on the Adjustment Detail Search form.  Transaction outside of the normal billing cycle transactions (namely, invoices and payments) that affects the outstanding balance of a customer's account.  An adjustment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Debit and credit notes are commonly referred to as adjustments in Convergent Billing.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Singleview  See also Adjustment Batch, Adjustment Type, Payment, Debit Note, and Credit Note.  To view details of a specific adjustment listed on the form, double-click the appropriate entry, or highlight the entry and click the Details… button.  The Individual Adjustment Detail form is displayed.  To create an adjustment, click the New… button.  The setting of the Always Display List? option on the Adjustment Detail Search form determines whether this form is displayed when the search returns only a single record.  If a single adjustment record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Individual Adjustment Detail form.  If more than one adjustment record is returned, the records are listed on the Adjustment Detail List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Individual Adjustment Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Individual Adjustment Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Adjustment Detail List form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing an Adjustment  To view an adjustment:  Select the Accounts @ Adjustments @ Manage Individual Adjustments option.  The Adjustment Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  If the adjustment date is unknown, remove the date from the Adjustment Date field.  If appropriate, select the Always Display List? option.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Adjustment form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option was selected, the Adjustment List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Adjustment form from the Adjustment List form, double-click the appropriate adjustment in the list of retrieved adjustments, or select the appropriate adjustment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Adjustment form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on adjustments?  Recording an Adjustment  Adjustments can be entered in either of the following ways:  Individually  In batches of the same adjustment type.  Before entering an adjustment, ensure that accurate information about the customer is available, amount of the adjustment, and the adjustment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter an adjustment.  When entering an adjustment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer getting the adjustment.  The customer's account number can then be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about adjustments?

pages.text: The Adjustment Detail Search form is used to search for one or more adjustment records, based on the specified search criteria (for example, entry date, adjustment type, status, and number, credit and debit account numbers, and customer query number).  Selecting the Search for adjustments option enables the Search… button, to search for batches matching the specified criteria.  Selecting the Create a new adjustment option enables the New… button, to create an adjustment. Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  If the adjustment date is unknown, remove the date from the Adjustment Date field.  If appropriate, select the Always Display List? option.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Adjustment form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option was selected, the Adjustment List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Adjustment form from the Adjustment List form, double-click the appropriate adjustment in the list of retrieved adjustments, or select the appropriate adjustment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Adjustment form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on adjustments?  Recording an Adjustment  Adjustments can be entered in either of the following ways:  Individually  In batches of the same adjustment type.  Before entering an adjustment, ensure that accurate information about the customer is available, amount of the adjustment, and the adjustment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter an adjustment.  When entering an adjustment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer getting the adjustment.  The customer's account number can then be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about adjustments?  Reversing an Adjustment  An adjustment can only be reversed once it is posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, an adjustment made as part of an adjustment batch can only be reversed if that batch is applied.  Adjustments included in an adjustment batch that is not yet applied can simply be removed from the batch.  To reverse an adjustment:  Enter an adjustment of equal (but opposite) value to the adjustment to be reversed.  In the Description field, cross-reference the adjustment number of the reversed adjustment.  Need more information on adjustments?  Deleting an Adjustment  To delete an adjustment not posted to a customer's account:  View the appropriate adjustment.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the adjustment is to be deleted.  An adjustment posted to a customer's account can also be deleted using the same procedure if:  The adjustment is not included on (appears on) an invoice or statement.  The adjustment has not been posted to the Sales Journal.  Security privileges are available.  If deletion is not possible, the adjustment should be reversed and the adjustment entered against the correct account.  Need more information on adjustments?

pages.title: Adjustment Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Adjustment Type Definition form is used to view, define, update, or delete an adjustment type.  The upper part of the form displays, or allows entry of, basic details about the adjustment type, such as its name and a description.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for specific details to be entered and viewed:  Settings  The Settings tab is used to enter a default adjustment description, expressions to generate adjustment numbers and adjustment batch numbers, and to select an entity validation definition to customise the Individual Adjustment Detail form.  Account Details  The Account Details tab is used to:  Select the default currency associated with the adjustment type.  If a default currency is selected, the currency must be the same as the currencies associated with the debit and credit accounts.  Define account types and default GL codes associated with the adjustment type when adjustments are applied or deducted.  Specify the function used to determine how adjustments are allocated to invoices.  Currency Conversion  The Currency Conversion tab is used to select the function used to determine discrepancy amounts caused by the currency conversion.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified). pages.title: Attribute Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Attribute Type Definition form is used to enter, view, and update an attribute type.  Controls the representation of an entity's attributes.   For users of Singleview Convergent Billing, an attribute type defines the format, characteristics, and validation rules for a form field.   Attribute types are the major components for entity validation.  Based on a reference type, they also define the representation of an entity's attributes externally, allowing the entity's data model to be tailored for integration with external systems.  They can also define additional non-stored attributes that are derived from an entity's stored attributes.   Attribute types are defined independently of the data entry fields to which they relate, which allows the same attribute type to be used for multiple fields.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Process Engine  See also Derived Attribute, Derived Non-Stored Attribute, and Reference Type.  The upper part of the form displays, or allows entry of, basic details about the attribute type.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs:  Display  The Display tab is used to:  Specify how entered data is to be displayed in a field (for example, field label, field width, display format, an edit mask, and alignment of data entered).  Associate help with the field by entering hint text, and selecting a help entry definition.  Properties  The Properties tab is used to define the properties of a field by specifying the type of attribute type, using a various options.  For example, the attribute type can be based on a reference type, SQL query, expression, data type, or the original field.  The attribute type can also be based on whether the field is mandatory, how the field is displayed (visible, enabled, can be updated), type of data that can be entered, restrictions on the data that can be entered, default value, and field validation.  Security  The Security tab is used to configure:  Fields to be masked or encrypted.  This option is not available for attribute types based on reference type, SQL query, or expression.  Field security to determine users who can view a field, users who can update a field, and whether a field is disabled or enabled for specified users.  SQL  The fields on the SQL tab are used to specify a general SQL statement that defines values that can be set for this attribute type.  Defining the values is similar to defining a reference type in that it results in a drop-down list being displayed for the attribute type.    The SQL tab is enabled only when the SQL Query option is selected in the Attribute type is based on field.  When using an SQL query or expression, items can be defined as available or unavailable for selection from the drop-down list.  To enable an item, return a numeric field as the final column in the query or expression array.  If this column returns 1, the item appears in the drop-down list; otherwise, the item is hidden.   Expression  This tab is used to specify an expression that defines the possible values that can be displayed for the attribute type. Defining an expression is similar to defining a reference type in that it results in a drop-down list being displayed for the attribute type.   The Expression tab is enabled only when the Expression option is selected in the Attribute type is based on group on the Properties tab.  Integration  The Integration tab is used to define attribute types that tailor a Convergent Billing entity's data model for integration with external systems.    Configurers can:  Specify an attribute as a key field that, in conjunction with other key fields, identifies an entity instance.  Define an interface label that can be used to access a field of a entity.  Add a new derived non-stored attribute to an entity and defines its derivation.  Declare a field as a reference to another Convergent Billing entity.  Determine whether an attribute's value can be updated as an input, or read as an output.  The fields enabled on the Display, Properties, Security, SQL, and Expression tabs depend on the type of attribute being created (determined by the option selected in the Attribute type is based on group on the Properties tab).  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing an Attribute Type  To view an attribute type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Attribute Types option.  The Attribute Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of attribute types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate attribute type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate attribute type.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on attribute types?  Defining an Attribute Type  To define an attribute type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Attribute Types option.  The Attribute Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on attribute types?  Updating an Attribute Type  Modifying an attribute type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the attribute type.  To update an attribute type:  View the appropriate attribute type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the attribute type as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.    If the attribute type is used by another element, a Confirm window is displayed.  Click the Yes button.  Need more information on attribute types?  Deleting an Attribute Type  Deleting an attribute type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the attribute type.  To delete an attribute type:  View the appropriate attribute type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the attribute type is to be deleted.  Need more information on attribute types?

The Attribute Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on attribute types?  Updating an Attribute Type  Modifying an attribute type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the attribute type.  To update an attribute type:  View the appropriate attribute type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the attribute type as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.    If the attribute type is used by another element, a Confirm window is displayed.  Click the Yes button.  Need more information on attribute types?  Deleting an Attribute Type  Deleting an attribute type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the attribute type.  To delete an attribute type:  View the appropriate attribute type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the attribute type is to be deleted.  Need more information on attribute types?

pages.title: Audit Detail Form
pages.text: The Audit Detail form is used to view auditing records.  The upper part of the form displays basic details about the selected record; for example, database table, user, or any other expressions entered to restrict the search for the specified audit record.  The lower part of the form displays the audit records matching the search criteria, and typically information about the type and time of changes to a record.  Associated Actions  Editing Configuration Items  To edit a configuration item for a database table to set auditing on or off:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Configuration Items option.  The Configuration Item Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  For example, to find a list of configuration items, select Configuration Item Type from the drop-down list in the Search field, and enter the required value AUDIT_TABLE in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined configuration items matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate configuration item and click the Detail… button, or double-click the configuration item to be changed.  The Configuration Item form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click Update on the toolbar.  The appropriate configuration item is displayed in Update mode.  Update the form:  Select TRUE or FALSE as required for the value of the Enabled attribute in the Base Attributes grid.  Select the appropriate table.  Select TRUE or FALSE as required for the value of the Include New Data in Audit attribute in the Base Attributes grid.  Select TRUE to save all data for both the new and old record.  Click Save on the toolbar.  Need more information on audit records?  Resetting Oracle Triggers  To control the auditing process by resetting the Oracle triggers:  Select the Server Tasks @ Schedules option.  The Schedule Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Schedule Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Select Reconfigure Auditing from the Schedule Type drop-down list.  Complete the parameters for a one-off task.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Submit Schedule form is displayed.  Click the Submit button.  The new audit configuration takes effect as soon as the Reconfigure Auditing task has completed successfully.  Need more information on audit records?

pages.title: Audit Search Form
pages.text: The Audit Search form is used to search for audit records to track changes to selected tables in the database, using a specific table, user, range of audit creation dates, or SQL Where clause.  The Table drop-down list enables the returned audit records to be restricted to the selected table, and it contains only those tables configured for auditing.  The User drop-down list enables the returned audit records to be restricted to the selected user.  Multiple instances of the Audit Detail form can be displayed by deselecting the Reuse last audit form option.  If multiple instances of the detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several audit records) the Reuse last audit form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last audit form? option overrides the display of information in a new form; in such cases, the details are displayed in the existing form.  Associated Action  Viewing Audit Records  To view audit records:  Select the Maintenance @ Security @ View Audit Records option.  Select the database table with audit records to be viewed from the drop-down list in the Table field.  Optionally, enter any other search criteria to restrict the search.  Click the Audit… button to retrieve the audit records.  The Audit form displays a grid with one row for each audit record and a column for each field in the database table.  More than one audit record window can be open at the same time.  If this is required, enter new selection criteria in the Audit Search form and click the Audit… button.  However, if the new selection is to overwrite the previous selection, select the Reuse last audit form? check box before clicking the Audit… button.  Need more information on audit records?

pages.title: Bill Run Detail Form
pages.text: The Bill Run Detail form is used to view bill run details.  The upper part of the form displays basic details about the bill run such as bill run ID, bill run type, status, creation start date, effective date, effective day of month, and whether the bill run is for quality assurance or statement purposes.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs, each displaying more specific details of the bill run:  Details  The Details tab is used to specify:  Number of customer hierarchies associated with the bill run when the bill run was first created.  Total amount of the bill run, billing schedule associated with the bill run, task that originally created the bill run, and last operation performed by the bill run.   Error Details  The Error Details tab is used to display details of a bill run failure.  Summary of Operations  The Summary of Operations tab displays a summary of all operations performed on the bill run.  However, the summary may not be accurate if one or more operations in the bill run have failed.  How the information is displayed depends on the value of the Combine Billing and Revoke Operations? check box:  If the check box is not selected:  The tab displays a list of all billing or revoke operations performed on the bill run.  If one operation is performed multiple times, the results are combined into one row per operation.    If the check box is selected:  Revoke operations are combined with the corresponding billing operation and only one row is displayed.  For example, if the RGP had performed 10 operations on the bill run and the RGP Revoke had performed 2 operations on the bill run, the row for the RGP would display 8.  If there are failed operations, only the statistics for the '30 - Invoice/Statement Generation (BGP)' and '50 - Apply Invoices' operations are guaranteed to be accurate.  Pending Tasks  The Pending Tasks tab specifies any tasks pending for the bill run.  General  The General tab specifies additional information about the bill run.  The fields displayed on this tab depend on the bill run type.  Auditing Information  The Auditing Information tab specifies all billing operations that have been performed on the bill run, including revoke operations.  The form can only be displayed in View Only mode.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Bill Run  To view bill run details:  Select the Server Tasks @ Bill Runs option.  The Bill Run Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns only a single bill run, the Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If a single bill run record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If more than one bill run record is returned, the records are listed on the Bill Run List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Bill Run Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Bill Run List form is displayed.  If the search returns more than one bill run, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run and click the Details… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run.  The Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?  Viewing a Customer's Bill Run Details  View the appropriate customer's details.  Select the Billing tab on the Customer Detail form.  Click on the Bill Run Details… button to see the customer's bill run details.  Performing an Operation on a Bill Run  The Perform Operation… button is enabled only if the user has:  Sufficient privileges to access the One-Off Task Definition form  Schedule creation privileges for at least one of the operation tasks supported by the current bill run type.  To perform an operation on a bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Perform Operation… button.  The Perform Operation form is displayed.  Highlight the customer billing operation to be performed, and click the Submit button.  The One-Off Task Definition form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to submit the task.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email.  Need more information about bill runs?  Displaying a List of Failed Customers  To display a list of customers that failed on the bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Failed Customers… button.  The Failed Customer List form is displayed in View Only mode.  To view more specific details on why the customer failed on the bill run, click the Details… button.  The Bill Runs for Customer form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: Bill Run List Form
pages.text: The Bill Run List form lists bill runs that match the selection criteria specified on the Bill Run Search form.  The setting of the Always Display List? option on the Bill Run Search form determines whether this form is displayed when the search returns only a single record.  If a single bill run record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If more than one bill run record is returned, the records are listed on the Bill Run List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Bill Run Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Bill Run  To view bill run details:  Select the Server Tasks @ Bill Runs option.  The Bill Run Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns only a single bill run, the Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If the search returns more than one bill run, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run and click the Details… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run.  The Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?  Viewing a Customer's Bill Run Details  View the appropriate customer's details.  Select the Billing tab on the Customer Detail form.  Click on the Bill Run Details… button to see the customer's bill run details.  Performing an Operation on a Bill Run  The Perform Operation… button is enabled only if the user has:  Sufficient privileges to access the One-Off Task Definition form  Schedule creation privileges for at least one of the operation tasks supported by the current bill run type.  To perform an operation on a bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Perform Operation… button.  The Perform Operation form is displayed.  Highlight the customer billing operation to be performed, and click the Submit button.  The One-Off Task Definition form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to submit the task.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email.  Need more information about bill runs?  Displaying a List of Failed Customers  To display a list of customers that failed on the bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Failed Customers… button.  The Failed Customer List form is displayed in View Only mode.  To view more specific details on why the customer failed on the bill run, click the Details… button.  The Bill Runs for Customer form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: Bill Run Search Form
pages.text: The Bill Run Search form is used to search for one or more bill run records using criteria such as bill run type, bill run, status of the bill run, schedule, effective date range, and creation start date range.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or clearing the Always Display List? or the Reuse Detail Form? check boxes. If a single bill run record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If more than one bill run record is returned, the records are listed on the Bill Run List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Bill Run Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Bill Run  To view bill run details:  Select the Server Tasks @ Bill Runs option.  The Bill Run Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns only a single bill run, the Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If the search returns more than one bill run, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run and click the Details… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run.  The Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?  Viewing a Customer's Bill Run Details  View the appropriate customer's details.  Select the Billing tab on the Customer Detail form.  Click on the Bill Run Details… button to see the customer's bill run details.  Performing an Operation on a Bill Run  The Perform Operation… button is enabled only if the user has:  Sufficient privileges to access the One-Off Task Definition form  Schedule creation privileges for at least one of the operation tasks supported by the current bill run type.  To perform an operation on a bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Perform Operation… button.  The Perform Operation form is displayed.  Highlight the customer billing operation to be performed, and click the Submit button.  The One-Off Task Definition form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to submit the task.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email.  Need more information about bill runs?  Displaying a List of Failed Customers  To display a list of customers that failed on the bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Failed Customers… button.  The Failed Customer List form is displayed in View Only mode.  To view more specific details on why the customer failed on the bill run, click the Details… button.  The Bill Runs for Customer form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: Bill Run Type Form
pages.text: The Bill Run Type form is used to define, view, and update one or more bill run types.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for bill runs specified with that type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Bill Run, Billing, and Schedule.  The upper part of the form displays basic details about the bill run type such as its name, description, and if the bill run is used for quality assurance or statement purposes.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering and viewing more specific bill run type details:  Settings  The Settings tab is used to specify:  The default icon used to represent bill runs of this type, and the currency that billed or revoked amounts are stored in.  The function used to summarise the state of the bill run after the current task or process has finished the associated bill runs and bill run operations.    Entity validation used to configure the display of general statistics for bill runs and bill run operations of this type.  Supported Tasks  The Supported Tasks tab is used to configure schedule types that can be executed on bill runs of this type.  The tab also allows the compatible schedule types to be filtered based on the operation status of the bill run.  Status Highlighting  The Status Highlighting tab is used to configure different display characteristics for an individual bill run summary status.  The display characteristics that can be specified are the icon, font colour, and cell colour.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Bill Run Type  To view a bill run type:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Bill Run Types option.  The Bill Run Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined schedule types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run type.  The Bill Run Type form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?  Defining a Bill Run Type  To define a bill run type:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Bill Run Types option.  The Bill Run Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Bill Run Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The access privileges granted by the system administrator determine the options available.  Need more information on bill runs?  Deleting a Bill Run Type  To delete a bill run type:  View the appropriate bill run type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the bill run type is to be deleted.  The access privileges granted by the System Administrator determine the options available.  Need more information on bill runs?  Updating a Bill Run Type  To update a bill run type:  View the appropriate bill run type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Bill Run Type form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the bill run details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The access privileges granted by the System Administrator determine the options available.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: Bill Run Type Search Form
pages.text: The Bill Run Type Search form is used to search for and list one or more bill run types using a specific field, criteria, and method.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for bill runs specified with that type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Bill Run, Billing, and Schedule.  The lower part of the form is used to list each of the bill run types returned by the search that matches the specified criteria.  Multiple instances of the Bill Run Type Detail form can be displayed by deselecting the Reuse Form? option.  Determines whether or not multiple instances of a detail form are displayed when a specific object is selected in the right-hand panel of the form and the Detail… button is clicked.  To display multiple instances of the appropriate form, ensure that the check box is not selected.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Bill Run Type  To view a bill run type:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Bill Run Types option.  The Bill Run Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined schedule types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run type.  The Bill Run Type form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?  Defining a Bill Run Type  To define a bill run type:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Bill Run Types option.  The Bill Run Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Bill Run Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The access privileges granted by the system administrator determine the options available.  Need more information on bill runs?  Deleting a Bill Run Type  To delete a bill run type:  View the appropriate bill run type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the bill run type is to be deleted.  The access privileges granted by the System Administrator determine the options available.  Need more information on bill runs?  Updating a Bill Run Type  To update a bill run type:  View the appropriate bill run type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Bill Run Type form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the bill run details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The access privileges granted by the System Administrator determine the options available.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: Bill Runs for Customer Form
pages.text: The Bill Runs for Customer form displays details of all bill runs that have been executed for the customer.  On the left-hand side of the form, the hierarchy tree displays bill runs for the customer.  A customer may have multiple bill runs, and each bill run may have multiple operations.  If the root node is highlighted on the left-hand side of the form, the right-hand side lists all bill runs with their last operation.  The operations are listed in reverse, chronological order.  If one of the bill runs is highlighted on the left-hand side of the form, the right-hand side lists all of its operations and their status (in reverse, chronological order).  Clicking the:  Expand/Collapse button expands or collapses the node that is highlighted in the hierarchy tree.  Perform Operation… button displays the Perform Operation form that lists all operations scheduled for the customer.  The Perform Operation… button is enabled only if the user has sufficient privileges.  Bill Run Details... button displays the Bill Run Details form, with details of the bill run that generated this bill run operation.  Associated Actions  Creating a New Customer  Customer details are recorded on the Customer Detail form, which can be accessed by:  Using the Customer Search form  Dragging and dropping the customer icon into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Although both methods can be used to create customers, the second method is primarily used to create customer nodes within a customer hierarchy.  To create a customer using the Customer Search form:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ New Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria on the Details tab.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, click the Address tab and select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the address details.  Ensure that the Create a new customer option is selected and click the New… button.  The system performs a search of the database and then displays either the Customer Detail form or the Customer List form.  When the New… button on the Customer Search form is clicked, a search of the database is performed based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Customer List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Customer List form; the Customer Detail form is then displayed in Insert mode.  Any information entered on the Customer Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Customer Detail form irrespective of the mechanism by which the Customer Detail form is displayed.  If the Customer List form is displayed, view each of the records displayed.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button on the Customer List form.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Invoice Formats… button on the Invoicing tab.  The Customer Invoice Format form is displayed.  Select an invoice format.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To create a customer using the technique of dragging and dropping:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  To create a:  root customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the Hierarchy node (located at the top of the left-hand panel).  child customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel.  Node that is a direct subordinate (or child) of a node (referred to as a parent customer node) located at the next highest level of the customer hierarchy.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  A child customer node can also be the parent customer node of a node (or nodes) located at a lower level in a customer hierarchy.  See also Customer Hierarchy, Parent Customer Node, and Root Customer Node.  In both cases, the Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by the system.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the customer icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes (listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form) or the hierarchy node.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the customer icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Viewing a Customer's Details  To view a customer's details:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ Manage Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the name of the customer in the Customer Name field.  Enter additional search criteria in the other fields, if required.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the details.  Select one of the following options:  Always Display Hierarchy?  If a single customer record is returned from a search, that customer’s details are displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If more than one customer record is returned, the records are listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display Hierarchy? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Reuse Last Hierarchy? option to list customers on single or multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form.  If multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form are required for display (for example, to focus a search for a specific customer) the Reuse last hierarchy? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last Hierarchy? option overrides the display of the customer hierarchy in a new form; the customer hierarchy is displayed in the existing form.  Select the Search for customers option and click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single customer record, the Customer Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display Hierarchy? option was not selected).  More than one customer record, or the Always Display Hierarchy? option was selected, the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed listing each of the customer records that matched the search criteria in a new form.  If the Reuse Last Hierarchy? option was selected, the customer records are displayed on the last Customer Hierarchy form.  To view:  Items associated with a specific customer record, click the customer name in the left-hand panel; the items (contacts, products, services, equipment, queries, and contracts) associated with that customer are listed in the right-hand panel (if all available display options are selected).  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Details of a specific customer record, double-click the appropriate customer record, or select the record and click the Details… button.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on customers?  Viewing a Bill Run  To view bill run details:  Select the Server Tasks @ Bill Runs option.  The Bill Run Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns only a single bill run, the Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If a single bill run record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If more than one bill run record is returned, the records are listed on the Bill Run List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Bill Run Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Bill Run List form is displayed.  If the search returns more than one bill run, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run and click the Details… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run.  The Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: Cache Status Form
pages.text: The Cache Status form is used to view and manage internal elements of the Convergent Billing client, which affect the performance of the Convergent Billing client.  Saving the query cache to disk enhances performance.  Because the cache is loaded on startup using the saved cache content, the content is available immediately it is required rather than waiting for the cache to be built.  Caches can be cleared using Clear Cache buttons and must be cleared when underlying elements are modified.  Examples of underlying elements are reference types, attribute types, or entity validation components for the query cache, or icons for the icon cache.  Refreshing security settings (Ctrl+F5) implicitly clears the query and icon caches.  The form consists of the following tabs:  Query Cache  The Query Cache tab displays statistics on executed queries (Active Cache Statistics) or ready to execute (Prepared Cache Statistics).  The size of each cache is displayed and can be updated.  The tab contains the Active Cache Contents and Prepared Cache Contents tabs, which list the queries in each cache.  Icon Cache  The Icon Cache tab displays the number of cached icons.  Server Message Queue  The Server Message Queue tab displays information about messages exchanged between the client and server processes, and contains the following tabs:  Event Queue, which displays messages received from the server which are yet to be processed.  Socket Response List, which displays subscribed events requiring a reply from the server but do not require an acknowledgment from the server.  Socket Acknowledgement List, which displays subscribed events requiring a reply from the server and require an acknowledgment from the server.  Registered Forms  The Registered Forms tab displays the forms that have been built into the client.  Automation  The Automation tab is used to specify configuration for running automation functions.  Log Files  The Log Files tab enables tracing of some types of calls, and specifies the locations of the files that contain the traces.

pages.title: Call Details Form
pages.text: The Call Details form lists each call associated with a specific service number.  For each call, this information includes the B-Party ID, call start date-time, duration of the call, currency in which the charge for the call is made, and the charge.    The form also includes the proportion of the charge to be billed to the account associated with that service number, and text to be printed on the invoice for that call in addition to the call charge.  Associated Actions  Viewing Service Details for Invoices  To view the details of a generated invoice:  View the appropriate invoice.  Click the Invoice Details... button.  The Invoice Item Details form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria in the Invoice Hierarchy Search Criteria group and click the Search button.  A list of entities matching the specified criteria is displayed in the Invoice Hierarchy section.  Select the appropriate entity.  The invoice charges for the entity are displayed in the Item Details grid.  Need more information on invoices?  Viewing Service Details for Statements  To view details for a generated statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Click the Statement Details... button.  The Statement Item Details form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria in the Invoice Hierarchy Search Criteria group and click the Search button.  A list of entities matching the specified criteria is displayed in the Invoice Hierarchy section.  Select the appropriate entity.  The statement charges for the entity are displayed in the Item Details grid.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: Call Usage Display Form
pages.text: The Call Usage Display form is used to:  View and print customer usage details.  Display the total amount of charges for the selected service number. pages.title: Charge Category Definition Form
pages.text: The Charge Category Definition form is used to enter, view, and update a charge category.    Identifies the default account type to which a calculated tariff charge or benefit is posted (allocated).  For services, the charge category also identifies a specific account number.  The association between a tariff and a charge category is specified when the tariff is defined and is referred to as the tariff/charge category pair.  By default, the charge category associated with a tariff is used each time that tariff is used.  However, the charge category can be overridden when defining a customer type, service type, customer node, or service.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Account Type and Tariff.  The upper part of the form is used to specify the name of the charge category, its description, and type of charge for which it is defined.  The lower part of the form consists of the details for 'to' and 'from' accounts.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Charge Category  To view a charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option. The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button. A list of the defined charge categories matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate charge category and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate charge category.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).  Defining a Charge Category  To define a default charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option.  The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  If required, assign the appropriate account number.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Updating a Charge Category  To update a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the charge category details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Deleting a Charge Category  To delete a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the charge category is to be deleted.  Need more information on charge categories?

Customer  The Customer tab specifies details about the customer who has entered into the contract (for example, name, type of customer, account number, and status of their account).  Contact  The Contact tab specifies details about the primary contact for the contract.  The information on this tab is entered automatically based on the customer information entered, but can also be modified.  Account Management  The Account Management tab specifies the method by which the contract was obtained (the sales channel), user responsible for the contract record, and account manager responsible for the contract.  Overridden Contracts  The Overridden Contracts tab specifies any contracts that are superseded by this contract.  Related Documents  The Related Documents tab specifies any documents related to the contract.  Comments  The Comments tab specifies any general purpose comments relevant to the contract.  General  The General tab specifies additional information about the customer.  The fields displayed on this tab depend on the customer type specified. Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified). Drag the Contract icon onto the appropriate customer node.  Click the Contract icon and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor until the required customer's name is highlighted.  Drop the icon by releasing the mouse button.  The Contract Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged onto the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one with an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  Enter the contract details.  To allocate all compatible services in the customer's hierarchy to the contract, ensure that the Allocate all services? check box is selected.  If the Allocate all services? check box is selected, in addition to all available services being added to the contract, any new services created for the customer are also automatically added to the contract.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on contracts?  Updating Contract Details  To update a contract record:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Contract Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the contract details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar. Multiple contracts, or the Always display list? option is selected, the Contract List form is displayed.  To access the Contract Detail form from the Contract List form, double-click the appropriate contract record in the list of retrieved contracts, or select the appropriate record and click the Details… button.  Need more information on contracts?  Allocating a Service to a Contract  To allocate a service to a contract:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the Service Search… button.  The Service Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria and ensure that the Available Services option is selected.  Click the Search… button.  The Available Services List form is displayed in view only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate service and click the Allocate button. Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate service and click the Deallocate button.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about contracts? Set the date-time from when the cancellation is to take effect.  The cancellation date must be within the date range of the current record.  If today’s date is within the date range of the current record, the cancellation date defaults to today’s date.  Otherwise, the cancellation date defaults to the Start Date of the record.  Click the Continue Cancellation button.  The message 'Record cancelled successfully' is displayed.  Click the OK button to confirm that the contract be cancelled. pages.title: Contract Type Form
pages.text: The Contract Type form is used to view, define, and update a contract type.  The upper part of the form is used for entry and display of basic details about the contract type such as its name and description, duration of contract, default grace period, and icon used to represent the contract type.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs each allowing more specific details to be entered and viewed:  Contract Defaults  The Contract Defaults tab is used to:  Define defaults for contracts of this type (for example, default account manager, contract form, contract status, sales channel, expiry warning period, and renegotiation period).  Apply entity validation to the Contract Search form and the Contract Detail form.  Product Details  The Product Details tab is used to associate specific products and services with the contract type. If service type is also specified, only services of the specified type can be selected for the base product.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Contract Type  To view a contract type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Contract Types option.  The Contract Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button. pages.title: Convergent Billing Configuration Form
pages.text: The Convergent Billing Configuration form is used to:  Customise the view of the configuration.  Create, view, and manipulate a configuration entity.  View and access the configuration items (product definitions, tariffs, subtotals, equipment types, service types, facility groups, derived attributes, and product offers) associated with a configuration.  Change the level of detail displayed for each configuration entity.  Copy and print configuration diagrams.  Re-build the Convergent Billing internal variable dependency tables.  The form is divided into two panels:  The left-hand panel displays the hierarchy of Singleview Convergent Billing configuration objects.  The right-hand panel displays additional detail about the item selected in the left-hand panel.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Diagram of the Configuration  To display a diagram of the configuration for the object selected in the left-hand panel:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Select an object.  The diagram is displayed in the right-hand panel of the form.  To view the configuration object's:  Properties, select the Explorer @ Properties View option.  Contents, select the Explorer @ Grid View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Viewing the Properties of a Configuration Object  To view the properties of a configuration object:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Properties View option.  Click the relevant object.  Click in the second level of the hierarchy, then select the relevant object from the third level to display that object's properties in the right-hand panel.  The properties can also be viewed by right-clicking on the relevant object and selecting Properties.  To view a configuration object's:  Diagram of the properties, select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Contents, select the Explorer @ Grid View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Viewing the Items Referenced by a Configuration Object  To display the items referenced by a configuration object:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Grid View option.  Right-click on the configuration object and select References.  The References form with the items referenced by the selected object is displayed in the right-hand panel of the form in grid view.  To view the configuration object's references in diagram view, select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?   Viewing the Contents of a Configuration Object  To view the contents of a configuration object:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select Explorer @ Grid View option.  The contents of the object are displayed in the right-hand panel.  When viewing a grid, objects can be expanded or collapsed by double-clicking the object in the right-hand panel.  To view the configuration object's:  Diagram, select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  References to the object are displayed to the left of the object.  Properties in a grid format, select the Explorer @ Properties View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Modifying the Presentation of Configuration Information  To change how configuration information is displayed:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer option, then the appropriate method of displaying the configuration information (Grid View, Diagram View, or Properties View).  Selecting Properties View displays the properties of the selected configuration object in a grid format.  When viewing a grid, each object can be expanded or collapsed by double-clicking the object in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Modifying the Configuration Details  To modify configuration details:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer option, then the appropriate method of displaying the configuration information (Grid View, Diagram View, or Properties View).  Navigate to the relevant entity by expanding or collapsing the view.  Highlight the entity, click the right mouse button, and select the Detail… option.  Use the Insert, Update, or Delete buttons on the toolbar to modify the configuration.  The buttons are only enabled if appropriate security settings are available.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Modifying the Explorer Options  To modify the Configuration Explorer options:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Options... option.  The Explorer Options form is displayed.  Modify the relevant options and click OK.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Viewing the Explorer Legend  To view the explorer legend:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Legend... option.  The Explorer Legend form is displayed.  To view a specific entity, folder type, or icon, right-click on the relevant object and select the appropriate option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Printing Configuration Information  To print configuration information:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Select the relevant diagram.  Right-click on the diagram and select Print Diagram.  The Print Selection form is displayed.  Enter the required printer selections and click OK.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Copying a Configuration Diagram  To copy a configuration diagram:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Select the relevant object to display a diagram.  Right-click in the right-hand panel of the form and select Copy Diagram.  The diagram is copied to the clipboard for pasting into other applications.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?

pages.title: Customer Charge Category Form
pages.text: The Customer Charge Category form is used to view and update a list of charge categories for the specified customer.  Person or organisation using one or more products.  Each customer is given a unique primary account against which invoices are raised.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Account, Contact, Customer Node, Customer Type, Product, and Product Offer.  Identifies the default account type to which a calculated tariff charge or benefit is posted (allocated).  For services, the charge category also identifies a specific account number.  The association between a tariff and a charge category is specified when the tariff is defined and is referred to as the tariff/charge category pair.  By default, the charge category associated with a tariff is used each time that tariff is used.  However, the charge category can be overridden when defining a customer type, service type, customer node, or service.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Account Type and Tariff.  The list of charge categories is displayed in chronological order and includes Charge Category, Number, Proportion, To Account Number, To General Ledger, To Account Class, From Account Number, From General Ledger, and From Account Class fields.  Using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  The form can be displayed in one of two form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Charge Category  To view a charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option. The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button. A list of the defined charge categories matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate charge category and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate charge category.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).  Defining a Charge Category  To define a default charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option.  The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  If required, assign the appropriate account number.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Updating a Charge Category  To update a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the charge category details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Deleting a Charge Category  To delete a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the charge category is to be deleted.  Need more information on charge categories?

Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Account, Contact, Customer Node, Customer Type, Product, and Product Offer.  To record and save details for a new customer, a contact must be assigned to the customer.  The contact assigned to the customer, referred to as the primary contact, is typically the person to whom the customer’s invoice is sent.  If required, additional contacts can be assigned to the customer.  For example, if the primary contact for a customer is the Accounts Payable clerk, a secondary contact could be the customer’s financial director who would be contacted if payments are continually late.  If details for the contact have been recorded in Singleview Convergent Billing, their record can be searched for and assigned to the customer by using the Search… and the Assign buttons.  A new contact record can be created by clicking the New… button, and any records listed can be viewed by clicking the Details… button. When the New… button on the Person Search form is clicked, Convergent Billing performs a search of the database based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Person List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Person List form; the Person Detail form is then displayed.  Any information entered on the Person Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Person Detail form. Select the Address & Phone tab, and enter at least one address and one phone number.  If required, complete the fields on the Other and General tabs. If an update to an historical or future record is required, double-click the appropriate entry (the entry having the date range spanning the date to which the changes are to be backdated).
