If all mandatory fields have been completed, the details are saved, the message 'Changes saved successfully' is displayed on the status bar, and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  Need more information on contacts?   Deleting a Contact  Rules for Deleting a Contact  A contact record can be deleted only if:  The record is not assigned as the primary contact for a customer or customer node.  Main or initial contact associated with a customer.  If more than one contact is listed for a specific customer, one of those contacts is specified as the primary contact.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Contact and Secondary Contact.  A query is not assigned to that contact.  Any customer enquiry recorded and subsequently processed is referred to as a query.  [[FigureXref:60287-1]] displays the query process.  [[Figure:60287-1]]  Query Process  A query can be recorded against a customer (existing or potential) or, more rarely, against a contact.  Recording a query against a contact is used to accurately record information reported by customers, and for an organisation to obtain statistical information on the types of inquiry being handled and the frequency of each type.  A query must first be recorded (usually by the person who deals directly with the customer making the enquiry) and then either resolved immediately or forwarded electronically to a work group to be resolved.  The act of forwarding the query to a work group is referred to as progressing the query.  If the designated work group cannot resolve the query, or can only provide a partial answer, that work group progresses (forwards) the query to another work group.  Progression continues until the initial query is resolved and a response is made to the customer.  The progression of a query from creation to resolution, using one or more work groups, is referred to as the query workflow.  [[FigureXref:60287-2]] displays the query progression.  [[Figure:60287-2]]  Query Progression  Query workflow ensures that each query is resolved in the fastest possible time and in the most efficient manner, regardless of the query type.  While a query remains unresolved, it is regarded as being open.  Until it is resolved, it is regarded as being closed.  When a query is forwarded to a work group, that work group actually receives a copy of the query and uses the copy as their ‘working’ document.  The ‘working’ document is referred to as a progression and is used to record any actions taken by the work group and, where possible, the solution to the original query.  Document used to record the actions taken by a work group to resolve a query.  If the query cannot be resolved by the current work group, that work group adds resolution text to the progression before forwarding the query to another work group.    Each progression therefore contains progress text (detailing the actions taken by a previous work group) and resolution text (detailing the actions performed by the current work group to resolve the query).  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progress Text, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  If the query cannot be resolved by the nominated work group, that work group adds text to the progression (known as resolution text) stating what actions were taken and what progress was made, and forwards a copy of the progression to the next work group.  The resolution text copied from the previous progression becomes the progress text on which the new work group bases its actions.  The process of forwarding a copy of a progression to the next work group continues until a work group can resolve the query.  At this point, a copy of the text stating how the query can be resolved is recorded against the original query and the query is deemed to be closed.  The query workflow mechanism ensures that each progression and the original query are retained and can be viewed.  Text on which a work group bases its actions.  The progress text is created as resolution text by the previous work group before progressing the query to the current work group.  For the initial progression, the progress text is a copy of the query text.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progression, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  Text added to a progression by a work group.  If this work group has not resolved the query, the resolution text becomes the progress text for the next work group.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress Text, Progression, and Query Text.  The contact is not in use in the date range specified.  A contact can be assigned to more than one customer record (as a primary or secondary contact).  Each primary contact assignment must be removed before the specified contact record can be deleted.  Person, other than the primary contact, assigned as an additional contact for a customer.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Customer Contact and Primary Contact.  To delete a contact record:  View the appropriate Person Detail form.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Specify the date from which to delete the contact.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, the date and time.  Click the Yes button to delete the contact record.  To cancel the request to delete the specified contact, click the No or Cancel button.  Need more information on contacts?  Assigning as a Primary Contact  A primary contact is assigned as part of creating a customer.  A primary customer contact can be changed if required.  Changing the Primary Customer Contact  To replace (change) the primary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Open the Contact tab.  Details of the current primary customer contact are displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode. If details for the replacement contact are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.   If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode. A prompt is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure. Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  If details for the replacement contact have been recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed. Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Record the details for the replacement contact and then save those details.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the contact.  Click the No or Cancel button to leave the existing contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Unassigning a Customer Contact  A primary customer contact cannot be removed, only replaced (changed).  Secondary customer contacts can be removed, replaced, or modified whenever required.  To remove (unassign) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Select the row containing the contact to be removed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is placed in Update mode and the specified contact is removed.  Depending on privileges and the value in the Start Date field, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about customers?  Creating a Query for a Contact  A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Customer Detail Form
pages.text: The Customer Detail form is used to enter, view, and update customer details.  Person or organisation using one or more products.  Each customer is given a unique primary account against which invoices are raised.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Account, Contact, Customer Node, Customer Type, Product, and Product Offer.  The upper part of the form displays, or allows entry of, basic details about the customer.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs that allow more specific information to be displayed or entered:  Accounting  The Accounting tab is used to:  View details about a customer’s primary account, such as their account balance, created date, and active date.  Enter account management details (for example, sales channel and region code), tax class, and GL code.  Any charge categories applicable to the customer can be displayed by clicking the Charge Categories… button.  Secondary accounts can be viewed and new accounts added by clicking the Other Accounts… button.  Invoicing  The Invoicing tab is used to:  Select the customer’s report level, invoice cycle, and invoice formats.  Specify the customer’s postal and site address.  Set the customer to prepaid without statements.  Invoice functionality on the tab is disabled for a prepaid without statements customer.   Billing  The Billing tab is used to enter billing information for the customer (for example, billing priority, complexity, and configuration code).  Bill runs for the customer can be suppressed, and number of bill run cycles to suppress and cut-off date for suppression can be specified.  Clicking the Bill Run Details… button displays the Bill Run Detail form that contains details of bill runs that have been executed for this customer.  Clicking the Immediate Bill Run… button displays the One-off Task Definition form; completing the appropriate fields and clicking the Save button on the toolbar runs an immediate bill run for the customer.  For prepaid without statements customers, billing functionality is disabled, and the Billing tab is hidden.  Payment  The Payment tab is used to record details about the customer’s preferred method of payment.  The preferred method is usually one of the following: cash, cheque, direct debit, auto-debit, or credit card, and the payment location is a nominated bank, post office, or by mail.  Depending on the selected payment type, one or more of the fields in the lower part of the tab may have to be completed.  Credit   The Credit tab is used to record credit details for a customer, such as their credit limit, comments about their credit history, and for corporate customers, their expected annual turnover.    Apart from the Credit Limit field, all fields on this tab are documentary (that is, the information is not referenced or used by any part of Singleview Convergent Billing).  Contact  The Contact tab is used to assign a person as the primary contact for the specified customer.  If details of the required person are not stored in Singleview Convergent Billing, facilities are provided on this tab to record those details before assigning that person to the customer.    Additional contacts (referred to as secondary contacts) can be assigned to the customer using the Other Contacts… button.  Classification  The Classification tab is used to record further details about a corporate customer (for example, company number and industry that they service).  Information entered in the fields on this tab is documentary, but can be incorporated into specific customer reports; for example, the company number is often included on invoices and statements sent to the customer.  Lists  The Lists tab displays the lists that have been configured for the customer.  The left-hand panel displays the type of list that can be selected and the right-hand panel displays the information associated with the selected list.  General  The General tab is used to enter additional information about the customer.  The fields on this tab depend on the specified type in the Customer Type field.  The List tab is displayed only if lists are associated with the selected customer type.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Entering Customer Details  Customer details are recorded on the Customer Detail form, which can be accessed by:  Using the Customer Search form  Dragging and dropping the customer icon into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Although both methods can be used to create customers, the second method is primarily used to create customer nodes within a customer hierarchy.  To create a customer using the Customer Search form:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ New Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria on the Details tab.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, click the Address tab and select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the address details.  Ensure that the Create a new customer option is selected and click the New… button.  The system performs a search of the database and then displays either the Customer Detail form or the Customer List form.  When the New… button on the Customer Search form is clicked, a search of the database is performed based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Customer List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Customer List form; the Customer Detail form is then displayed in Insert mode.  Any information entered on the Customer Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Customer Detail form irrespective of the mechanism by which the Customer Detail form is displayed.  If the Customer List form is displayed, view each of the records displayed.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button on the Customer List form.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Invoice Formats… button on the Invoicing tab.  The Customer Invoice Format form is displayed.  Select an invoice format.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To create a customer using the technique of dragging and dropping:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  To create a:  root customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the Hierarchy node (located at the top of the left-hand panel).  child customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel.  Node that is a direct subordinate (or child) of a node (referred to as a parent customer node) located at the next highest level of the customer hierarchy.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  A child customer node can also be the parent customer node of a node (or nodes) located at a lower level in a customer hierarchy.  See also Customer Hierarchy, Parent Customer Node, and Root Customer Node.  In both cases, the Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by the system.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the customer icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes (listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form) or the hierarchy node.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the customer icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Updating Customer Details  To update customer details:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the start date of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the form is displayed in Update mode.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  Update the customer details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Viewing Customer Details  To view a customer's details:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ Manage Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the name of the customer in the Customer Name field.  Enter additional search criteria in the other fields, if required.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the details.  Select one of the following options:  Always Display Hierarchy?  If a single customer record is returned from a search, that customer’s details are displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If more than one customer record is returned, the records are listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display Hierarchy? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Reuse Last Hierarchy? option to list customers on single or multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form.  If multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form are required for display (for example, to focus a search for a specific customer) the Reuse last hierarchy? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last Hierarchy? option overrides the display of the customer hierarchy in a new form; the customer hierarchy is displayed in the existing form.  Select the Search for customers option and click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single customer record, the Customer Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display Hierarchy? option was not selected).  More than one customer record, or the Always Display Hierarchy? option was selected, the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed listing each of the customer records that matched the search criteria in a new form.  If the Reuse Last Hierarchy? option was selected, the customer records are displayed on the last Customer Hierarchy form.  To view:  Items associated with a specific customer record, click the customer name in the left-hand panel; the items (contacts, products, services, equipment, queries, and contracts) associated with that customer are listed in the right-hand panel (if all available display options are selected).  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Details of a specific customer record, double-click the appropriate customer record, or select the record and click the Details… button.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on customers?  Unassigning a Customer Contact  A primary customer contact cannot be removed, only replaced (changed).  Secondary customer contacts can be removed, replaced, or modified whenever required.  To remove (unassign) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Select the row containing the contact to be removed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is placed in Update mode and the specified contact is removed.  Depending on privileges and the value in the Start Date field, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about customers?  Changing the Primary Customer Contact  To replace (change) the primary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Open the Contact tab.  Details of the current primary customer contact are displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  If details for the replacement contact are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.   If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.   Record the details for the replacement contact and then save them. A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the details of the current primary customer contact with those of the replacement contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Creating a Secondary Account  To create a secondary account:  View the Customer Details form for the appropriate customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Click the Other Accounts... button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on privileges and the start date of the record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Enter the account number (if known) and/or select the account type.  Multiple accounts of the same type can be added to a customer node, if allowed by the account type.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The account details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  If an account number is not entered, Convergent Billing assigns a number before saving the account details.  To enter additional secondary accounts, repeat Steps 3 to 5.  Close the Other Accounts form.  Need more information on accounts?  Assigning a Secondary Customer Contact  To assign a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode, listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in Update mode with the cursor positioned at the start of a blank row.  If details for the contact to be assigned are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the contact to be assigned in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A prompt is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Alternatively, the Person List form may be displayed if the details entered on the Person Search form are similar to another person in the database. Record the details for the contact and then save the details.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation to assign the nominated contact to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button.  Repeat steps 3 to 6 for each contact to be assigned to the customer.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Deactivating a Customer  To deactivate a customer:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Cancel Customer form is displayed.  Set the date on which the cancellation is to take effect.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Only the last customer detail history record can be cancelled.  The date must be between the start and end dates of the history record.  By default, the cancellation date is today's date at 12:00:00 AM.  Select the appropriate Final Invoice Details options.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Click the Continue Cancellation button.  The message 'Customer cancelled successfully' is displayed.  Click the OK button to remove the confirmation message.  Depending on the selected Final Invoice Details group options, one or more post-cancellation tasks may be performed.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Need more information about customers?  Changing a Secondary Customer Contact  To change (replace) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode, listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  If details for the replacement contact have been recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed. Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Record the details for the replacement contact and then save those details.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the contact.  Click the No or Cancel button to leave the existing contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Deleting a Customer  If the customer account is being finalised, the customer record can be deactivated (cancelled) rather than being deleted.  To delete a customer's record:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer to be deleted.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the History button on the toolbar.  The Customer History form is displayed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Customer Hierarchy Confirm Move Form
pages.text: The Customer Hierarchy Confirm Move form is used to confirm the move of one or more customer nodes or products.  Refer to Base Product and Companion Product.  Point in a customer hierarchy that represents a customer's primary account to which charges can be accrued.  Product instances and associated services can be created for each node.  Associated with each customer node is a reporting level, which determines whether that node receives an invoice, a statement, or neither.  For example, if an account is required for each division in a multi-national company, a separate customer node is used to represent each division’s account.  Customer nodes in the customer hierarchy are organised into a structure (usually mirroring the company’s organisational structure) that is similar to a family tree.  A family tree displays the relationship between members of a specific family.  Like a family tree, a customer hierarchy displays the relationship between customer nodes.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Child Customer Node, Customer Hierarchy, Customer, Customer Type, Parent Customer Node, Reporting Level, and Root Customer Node.  The upper part of the form displays information about the move.  The lower part of the form is used to specify the start and end dates for which the move is valid and to cancel the move.  Associated Actions  Moving a Customer Node  Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move Multiple Customer Nodes  A child customer node can be moved:  To another location within the same hierarchy  Out of a hierarchy, creating a new root customer node  To a different hierarchy.  To perform one of these actions, the following privileges must be available:  Update privileges on the customer being moved.  View privileges on the customer node that will become the new parent customer node of the node being moved.  View privileges for blacklisted customers (if the customer node to be moved is blacklisted).  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes within a hierarchy.  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes between hierarchies.  Depending on the type of customer node move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move a customer node:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving a customer node within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the customer node and drag and drop it on to the appropriate customer node.  If moving a customer node out of a hierarchy (that is, a child node is to become a root node), select the child node and drag and drop it onto the hierarchy node.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.    Enter the appropriate date range.  Depending on security settings, the Start Date and End Date fields consist of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Click the Continue button.  The customer node being moved has its start date usually set to the customer hierarchy search date.  If this date is less than the current date and the user does not have historical update privileges, the start date is set to the current date.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  The invoice cycle for all customers being moved is adjusted to be the invoice cycle of the new root customer node.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Moving Multiple Customer Nodes  Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move a Customer Node  Multiple customer nodes can be moved only if they are a group of child nodes under the same parent node.  For example, if MegaWork's Melbourne and Sydney offices are both to be moved from the Sales Division and located directly under the head office in the hierarchy, both child nodes can be highlighted and moved simultaneously.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move multiple customer nodes:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving child nodes within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the appropriate nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the appropriate customer node on the left-hand panel of the form.  To select:  A group of customer nodes next to each other, hold down the Shift key, select the first node in the group, then the last node in the group.  All nodes in between the first and the last are automatically highlighted.  Multiple customer nodes not grouped together, hold down the Ctrl key, and then click each relevant node.  If moving customer nodes out of a hierarchy (that is, a group of child nodes are to become root nodes), select the nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the hierarchy node on the left-hand panel of the form.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  If one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves.  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed, and why.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Moving a Product Instance  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  The following restrictions apply when moving a product instance:  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance was created as part of a product offer.  A product cannot be moved if its owning customer or target customer is blacklisted at any time during the move period and the user does not have access to view blacklisted customers on the Customer Form.  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance is cancelled, moved, or upgraded at the effective start date or any later date.   A product must be assigned to a customer node.  A product dragged over a root node or blank space of the hierarchy panel cannot be dropped.   Some information regarding the lists and charge categories may need to be entered (when prompted) before the product instance move can be completed.  If a product instance is moved, any changes made to it before or after the move start date are not carried over in the move.  For example, if the product instance is moved at an effective date before an equipment allocation change, following the move the variation of equipment allocation is not reflected.  A warning is displayed so the user can cancel the move.   To move a product instance:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instance (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that the product instance and not the associated service is dragged and dropped.  To drag and drop a product instance, click the product instance and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instance onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instance is dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  Need more information on products?  Moving Multiple Product Instances  If this is the first move performed since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances on the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  To move multiple product instances:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instances (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that product instances are dragged and dropped, and not the associated services.  To drag and drop product instances, select the product instances and while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instances onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instances are dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The Move Progress form is displayed.  Need more information on products?  Setting Preferences for Customer Node Moves  Depending on the type of customer move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple customer nodes are being moved, and one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences options.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To set cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all possible nodes and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group. pages.title: Customer Hierarchy Move Progress Form
pages.text: The Customer Hierarchy Move Progress form displays the progress of a customer hierarchy move.  Representation of a customer's hierarchical or billing structure.  The customer hierarchy consists of one or more customer nodes, each representing a customer account to which charges can be accrued.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Customer Node.  The upper part of the form displays information about the move, such as what is being moved, destination of the move, date range for which the move is valid, and progress of the move.  The lower part of the form is used for the next move.  Associated Actions  Moving a Customer Node  Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move Multiple Customer Nodes  A child customer node can be moved:  To another location within the same hierarchy  Out of a hierarchy, creating a new root customer node  To a different hierarchy.  To perform one of these actions, the following privileges must be available:  Update privileges on the customer being moved.  View privileges on the customer node that will become the new parent customer node of the node being moved.  View privileges for blacklisted customers (if the customer node to be moved is blacklisted).  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes within a hierarchy.  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes between hierarchies.  Depending on the type of customer node move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move a customer node:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving a customer node within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the customer node and drag and drop it on to the appropriate customer node.  If moving a customer node out of a hierarchy (that is, a child node is to become a root node), select the child node and drag and drop it onto the hierarchy node.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.    Enter the appropriate date range.  Depending on security settings, the Start Date and End Date fields consist of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Click the Continue button.  The customer node being moved has its start date usually set to the customer hierarchy search date.  If this date is less than the current date and the user does not have historical update privileges, the start date is set to the current date.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  The invoice cycle for all customers being moved is adjusted to be the invoice cycle of the new root customer node.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Moving Multiple Customer Nodes  Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move a Customer Node  Multiple customer nodes can be moved only if they are a group of child nodes under the same parent node.  For example, if MegaWork's Melbourne and Sydney offices are both to be moved from the Sales Division and located directly under the head office in the hierarchy, both child nodes can be highlighted and moved simultaneously.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move multiple customer nodes:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving child nodes within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the appropriate nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the appropriate customer node on the left-hand panel of the form.  To select:  A group of customer nodes next to each other, hold down the Shift key, select the first node in the group, then the last node in the group.  All nodes in between the first and the last are automatically highlighted.  Multiple customer nodes not grouped together, hold down the Ctrl key, and then click each relevant node.  If moving customer nodes out of a hierarchy (that is, a group of child nodes are to become root nodes), select the nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the hierarchy node on the left-hand panel of the form.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  If one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves.  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed, and why.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Moving a Product Instance  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  The following restrictions apply when moving a product instance:  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance was created as part of a product offer.  A product cannot be moved if its owning customer or target customer is blacklisted at any time during the move period and the user does not have access to view blacklisted customers on the Customer Form.  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance is cancelled, moved, or upgraded at the effective start date or any later date.   A product must be assigned to a customer node.  A product dragged over a root node or blank space of the hierarchy panel cannot be dropped.   Some information regarding the lists and charge categories may need to be entered (when prompted) before the product instance move can be completed.  If a product instance is moved, any changes made to it before or after the move start date are not carried over in the move.  For example, if the product instance is moved at an effective date before an equipment allocation change, following the move the variation of equipment allocation is not reflected.  A warning is displayed so the user can cancel the move.   To move a product instance:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instance (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that the product instance and not the associated service is dragged and dropped.  To drag and drop a product instance, click the product instance and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instance onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instance is dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button. If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set. To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences options.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To set cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all possible nodes and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group.  To display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes, select 'Display details form in update mode after each individual customer move'.  Click OK.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Changing Preferences for Product Instance Moves  Depending on type of move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple product instances are being moved, and one or more of the instances fail to move, preferences can be set to do the following:  Cancel all moves.  Move the instances that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select the Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences option.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all instances possible and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report' after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group. pages.title: Customer History Form
pages.text: The Customer History form is used to view a:  List of physical records held in the Convergent Billing database for the specified customer.  Person or organisation using one or more products.  Each customer is given a unique primary account against which invoices are raised.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Account, Contact, Customer Node, Customer Type, Product, and Product Offer.  The list of records is displayed in chronological order and includes the current record, one or more historical records (if available), and one or more future records (if defined).  Record having a start date in the future.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Current Record and Historical Record.  Record having an end date before today.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Current Record and Future Record.  Record having a start date before or equal to today, and an end date equal to or after today.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Process Engine  See also Future Record and Historical Record.  Specific record and, if appropriate privileges are available, to update and delete a record.  The form can be displayed in one of two form modes (View Only mode or Update mode), with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Any record can be deleted from the list.  If the only record on the list is deleted, the customer is deleted, but not cancelled.  If a record in the middle of the list is deleted, the Start Date of the row below is updated to match the End Date of the row above.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Customer's Details  To view a customer's details:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ Manage Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the name of the customer in the Customer Name field.  Enter additional search criteria in the other fields, if required.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the details.  Select one of the following options:  Always Display Hierarchy?  If a single customer record is returned from a search, that customer’s details are displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If more than one customer record is returned, the records are listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display Hierarchy? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Reuse Last Hierarchy? option to list customers on single or multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form.  If multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form are required for display (for example, to focus a search for a specific customer) the Reuse last hierarchy? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last Hierarchy? option overrides the display of the customer hierarchy in a new form; the customer hierarchy is displayed in the existing form.  Select the Search for customers option and click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single customer record, the Customer Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display Hierarchy? option was not selected).  More than one customer record, or the Always Display Hierarchy? option was selected, the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed listing each of the customer records that matched the search criteria in a new form.  If the Reuse Last Hierarchy? option was selected, the customer records are displayed on the last Customer Hierarchy form.  To view:  Items associated with a specific customer record, click the customer name in the left-hand panel; the items (contacts, products, services, equipment, queries, and contracts) associated with that customer are listed in the right-hand panel (if all available display options are selected).  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Details of a specific customer record, double-click the appropriate customer record, or select the record and click the Details… button.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on customers?  Creating a Customer  Customer details are recorded on the Customer Detail form, which can be accessed by:  Using the Customer Search form  Dragging and dropping the customer icon into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Although both methods can be used to create customers, the second method is primarily used to create customer nodes within a customer hierarchy.  To create a customer using the Customer Search form:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ New Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria on the Details tab.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, click the Address tab and select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the address details.  Ensure that the Create a new customer option is selected and click the New… button.  The system performs a search of the database and then displays either the Customer Detail form or the Customer List form.  When the New… button on the Customer Search form is clicked, a search of the database is performed based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Customer List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Customer List form; the Customer Detail form is then displayed in Insert mode.  Any information entered on the Customer Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Customer Detail form irrespective of the mechanism by which the Customer Detail form is displayed.  If the Customer List form is displayed, view each of the records displayed.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button on the Customer List form.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Invoice Formats… button on the Invoicing tab.  The Customer Invoice Format form is displayed.  Select an invoice format.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To create a customer using the technique of dragging and dropping:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  To create a:  root customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the Hierarchy node (located at the top of the left-hand panel).  child customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel.  Node that is a direct subordinate (or child) of a node (referred to as a parent customer node) located at the next highest level of the customer hierarchy.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  A child customer node can also be the parent customer node of a node (or nodes) located at a lower level in a customer hierarchy.  See also Customer Hierarchy, Parent Customer Node, and Root Customer Node.  In both cases, the Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by the system. Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar. The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the start date of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the form is displayed in Update mode. Deactivating a Customer  To deactivate a customer:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Cancel Customer form is displayed.  Set the date on which the cancellation is to take effect.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Only the last customer detail history record can be cancelled.  The date must be between the start and end dates of the history record.  By default, the cancellation date is today's date at 12:00:00 AM.  Select the appropriate Final Invoice Details options.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled. This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Click the Continue Cancellation button.  The message 'Customer cancelled successfully' is displayed.  Click the OK button to remove the confirmation message.  Depending on the selected Final Invoice Details group options, one or more post-cancellation tasks may be performed.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear. An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. The Customer History form is displayed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?
