pages.title: Customer Invoice Format Form
pages.text: The Customer Invoice Format form is used to:  View, update, and delete details of a specified invoice format associated with a customer node.  Specifies the format of generated invoices.  The format specified determines which invoice template is used during the Invoice Generation Process (IGP).  Can be specified on a per customer node basis.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Invoice Generation Process (IGP) and Invoice Template.  View invoice format options by clicking the Invoice Formats… button.  The form contains fields that display account name, invoice format, name of invoice receiver, and receiving address.  Associated Action  Selecting an Invoice Format  To select an invoice format or change an invoice format selection:  View the appropriate Customer Detail form.  Select the Invoicing tab.  Click the Invoice Formats… button.  The Invoice Format form is displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the required invoice format from the Invoice Format drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  After an invoice is generated for a customer in the selected invoice format, it is not possible to change the format or the order of the invoice formats for that customer.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: Customer Query Form
pages.text: The Customer Query form is used to record a new query and to display details of an existing query.  Enquiry made by a customer or contact that is recorded.  The resolution of that enquiry generally results in information being passed back to that customer or contact.  A query can range from an enquiry about available products by a prospective customer, to a complaint from a customer about charges on an invoice.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, it is progressed to a work group for resolution.  The query facility is also used to record internal enquiries.  For example, the query facility can be used to enquire about a customer's credit rating by raising a query and forwarding it to an organisation's finance department.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Progress, Progression, and Work Group.  The upper part of the form is used for entry and display of basic details about the query, such as the type of query, date on which the query was raised, and current status of the query.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs each allowing more specific details to be entered and viewed:  Request  The Request tab is used to document the customer’s enquiry.  Future-dated queries can be entered if entity validation is used to override the read-only behaviour of the Opened field.  Contact  The Contact tab is used to assign details that relate to an existing customer making an enquiry.  Customer  The Customer tab is used to enter the caller’s name, address, and contact number.  If the query is being assigned to an existing customer, details about the customer are automatically inserted into the fields on this tab.  Service  If the query relates directly to one of the customer’s services, the tab can be used to specify that service.  Facilities are provided on this tab to search for and assign the appropriate service to the query.  Contract  If the query relates directly to one of the customer's contracts, the tab can be used to specify that contract.  Facilities are provided on this tab to search for and assign the appropriate contract to the query.  Resolution  The Resolution tab is used to enter details about how the query was resolved, and must be completed before a query can be resolved.  The Resolution tab must not be completed if the query is to be progressed to a work force for resolution.  Dates  The Dates tab displays a set of date fields, most of which are completed automatically by Convergent Billing based on the query type selected and determined by an organisation's customer service policy.  The remaining dates are set resulting from performing tasks associated with resolving the query.   Future-dated queries can be entered if entity validation is used to override the read-only behaviour of the Opened field.  General  The General tab is used to enter information relevant to a specific query type.  The presence and number of fields on this tab depends on the query type selected.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  The Respond button is enabled when the form is in Update mode, the query is not closed, and a response date not set.  The Progress button is enabled when the form is in View Only mode, the query is not closed, and not progressed.  The Resolve button is enabled when the form is in View Only mode, the query is not closed, and not progressed, and information entered in the Resolution tab.  Associated Actions  Creating a Query  A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?  Viewing a Query  To view a query:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number, work force, or query type (or any combination).  Select the Query option in the Search for group and either the All or Opened option in the Status group.  Select the Opened option if the search should be restricted to unresolved queries (that is, still open).  Select the All option if the search should include both open (unresolved) and closed (resolved) queries.  Click the Search button.  Any queries that match the specified selection criteria are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query List form.  To view a specific query, double-click the query or highlight the query and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected query.  Need more information on queries?  Progressing a Query  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  Resolving a Query  A query recorded in Convergent Billing can be resolved in the following ways:  Immediately  If the enquirer can be provided with the details they require, without having to forward the query to a work force to get it resolved, enter text on the Resolution tab and close the query; there is no need to progress the query further.  By progressing it to a work force  If the enquirer cannot be provided with sufficient information, progress the query to the appropriate work force.  To resolve a query without progressing it to a work force:  Ensure that the appropriate query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Select the Resolution tab and enter text detailing how the enquiry was resolved.  Click the Save button.  A unique query number is assigned to the query.  If the query needs a response date and time assigned to it, click the Update button, then click the Respond button.  Click the Save button.  The date and time that the query was responded to can then be viewed on the Dates tab.  Click the Resolve button.  When prompted, confirm that the query is being closed.  Click Yes to close the query.  As a result of this action, the query status is set to 'Closed'.  To progress a query to a work force:  Ensure that the appropriate query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  The Customer Query Progress History form is displayed.  Select the most recent progression and click the Details… button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select the Resolution tab and enter text detailing how the enquiry was resolved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the query was resolved, click the Resolve button.  When prompted, click the Yes button to close the query.  If the query is not resolved, click the Progress button to forward the query to another work force.    When prompted, select a work force and click Yes.  As a result of this action, a progression is created and the resolution text from the query is copied to the Progress tab of the new progression.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Customer Query List Form
pages.text: The Customer Query List form lists queries that match the selection criteria specified on the Customer Query Search form.  Enquiry made by a customer or contact that is recorded.  The resolution of that enquiry generally results in information being passed back to that customer or contact.  A query can range from an enquiry about available products by a prospective customer, to a complaint from a customer about charges on an invoice.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, it is progressed to a work group for resolution.  The query facility is also used to record internal enquiries.  For example, the query facility can be used to enquire about a customer's credit rating by raising a query and forwarding it to an organisation's finance department.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Progress, Progression, and Work Group.  To view details of a specific query listed on the form, double-click the appropriate query, or highlight the query and click the Details… button.  The Customer Query form is displayed.  The setting of the Always Display List? option on the Customer Query Search form determines whether this form is displayed when the search returns only a single query record.  If a single query is returned from a search, that query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  If more than one query is returned, the queries are listed on the Customer Query List form.  The required query can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Query form.  Similarly, if a single progression is returned from a search, that progression is displayed on the Customer Query Progress form.  If more than one progression is returned, the progressions are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  The required progression can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Query Progress form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Query form (or Customer Query Progress form) when only a single query (or progression) is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Query List form (or Customer Query Progress List form) is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Query  To view a query:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number, work force, or query type (or any combination).  Select the Query option in the Search for group and either the All or Opened option in the Status group.  Select the Opened option if the search should be restricted to unresolved queries (that is, still open).  Select the All option if the search should include both open (unresolved) and closed (resolved) queries.  Click the Search button.  Any queries that match the specified selection criteria are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query List form.  To view a specific query, double-click the query or highlight the query and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected query.  Need more information on queries?  Creating a Query  A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Customer Query Progress Form
pages.text: The Customer Query Progress form is used to:  View details of a progression.  Record information in the Action and Resolution tabs.  The upper part of the form displays basic details of the associated query, such as the type of query, date on which the query was raised, and current status of the query.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs used to enter and view specific details about the progression:  Progress  The Progress tab displays a copy of the query text (entered in the Request tab of the original query) or a copy of the progress text (entered in the Resolution tab of the previous progression).  Contact  The Contact tab is used to view the recorded details about the person making the enquiry.  Customer  The Customer tab is used to view the caller’s name, address, and contact number.  Service  If the query relates directly to one of the customer’s services, the Service tab can be used to specify that service.  Contract  The Contract tab is used to view the details about the contract associated with this query.  Action  The Action tab is used to record any actions taken to resolve the original query.  Actions should be recorded on this tab even if full resolution os the query has not been achieved.  Resolution  The Resolution tab is used to enter details about how the query was resolved (fully or partially).    If the progression is to be forwarded to another work force, the text entered on this tab is used as the progress text for the next progression.  If the progression (and therefore the query) is now resolved, the text is used as the resolution text of the original query.  Information must be entered in the Resolution tab before the query can be progressed or resolved.  General  The General tab is used to view the information entered when the query was created.    The presence and number of fields on this tab depends on the query type selected.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  The Respond button is enabled when the form is in Update mode, the query is not closed, and a response date not set.  The Progress button is enabled when the form is in View Only mode, the query is not closed, and no information is entered in the Resolution tab.  The Resolve button is enabled when the form is in View Only mode, the query is not closed, it was not progressed, and information entered in the Resolution tab.  Associated Actions  Creating a Query  A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?  Viewing a Query  To view a query:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number, work force, or query type (or any combination).  Select the Query option in the Search for group and either the All or Opened option in the Status group.  Select the Opened option if the search should be restricted to unresolved queries (that is, still open).  Select the All option if the search should include both open (unresolved) and closed (resolved) queries.  Click the Search button.  Any queries that match the specified selection criteria are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query List form.  To view a specific query, double-click the query or highlight the query and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected query.  Need more information on queries?  Progressing a Query  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  Resolving a Query  A query recorded in Convergent Billing can be resolved in the following ways:  Immediately  If the enquirer can be provided with the details they require, without having to forward the query to a work force to get it resolved, enter text on the Resolution tab and close the query; there is no need to progress the query further.  By progressing it to a work force  If the enquirer cannot be provided with sufficient information, progress the query to the appropriate work force.  To resolve a query without progressing it to a work force:  Ensure that the appropriate query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Select the Resolution tab and enter text detailing how the enquiry was resolved.  Click the Save button.  A unique query number is assigned to the query.  If the query needs a response date and time assigned to it, click the Update button, then click the Respond button.  Click the Save button.  The date and time that the query was responded to can then be viewed on the Dates tab.  Click the Resolve button.  When prompted, confirm that the query is being closed.  Click Yes to close the query.  As a result of this action, the query status is set to 'Closed'.  To progress a query to a work force:  Ensure that the appropriate query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  The Customer Query Progress History form is displayed.  Select the most recent progression and click the Details… button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select the Resolution tab and enter text detailing how the enquiry was resolved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the query was resolved, click the Resolve button.  When prompted, click the Yes button to close the query.  If the query is not resolved, click the Progress button to forward the query to another work force.    When prompted, select a work force and click Yes.  As a result of this action, a progression is created and the resolution text from the query is copied to the Progress tab of the new progression.  Need more information on queries?  Viewing a Progression  View a progression by:  Searching for the progressions associated with a query and then viewing the relevant progression.  Clicking the Query Progressions button on the Customer Query form and then viewing the relevant progression.  To search for and view a progression:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number.  Select Progress-All in the Search For field.  Click the Search button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  To access and view a progression using the Customer Query form:  Search for and display the query with the relevant progressions.  The selected query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression, and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: Customer Query Progress History Form
pages.text: The Customer Query Progress History form is used to list progressions associated with the current query.  Enquiry made by a customer or contact that is recorded.  The resolution of that enquiry generally results in information being passed back to that customer or contact.  A query can range from an enquiry about available products by a prospective customer, to a complaint from a customer about charges on an invoice.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, it is progressed to a work group for resolution.  The query facility is also used to record internal enquiries.  For example, the query facility can be used to enquire about a customer's credit rating by raising a query and forwarding it to an organisation's finance department.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Progress, Progression, and Work Group.  To view details of a specific progression listed on the form, double-click the appropriate progression, or highlight the progression and click the Details… button.  The Customer Query Progress form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Progression  View a progression by:  Searching for the progressions associated with a query and then viewing the relevant progression.  Clicking the Query Progressions button on the Customer Query form and then viewing the relevant progression.  To search for and view a progression:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number. Click the Query Progressions… button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression, and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  Need more information on progressions?  Work on a Progression  To work on a progression:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  The Customer Query Progress History form is displayed with each of the progressions associated with the specified query.   Select the last progression and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed.  Click the Update button.  The Customer Query Progression Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  In the Action tab, record any actions taken to resolve the query. As a result of this action, a new progression is created and the resolution text from the current progression is copied to the Progress tab of the new progression.  Need more information on progressions?  Resolving a Progression  Ensure that work on the progression is completed.  To resolve a progression (and therefore resolve the associated query):  Ensure that the details on the Customer Query Progress Detail form have been saved.  Click the Resolve button.  A prompt is displayed for confirming that the query is to be closed.  Click Yes to close the query. pages.title: Customer Query Search Form
pages.text: The Customer Query Search form is used to search for one or more queries, or search for the progressions associated with a specific query, depending on the value entered in the Search For field.    Document used to record the actions taken by a work group to resolve a query.  If the query cannot be resolved by the current work group, that work group adds resolution text to the progression before forwarding the query to another work group.    Each progression therefore contains progress text (detailing the actions taken by a previous work group) and resolution text (detailing the actions performed by the current work group to resolve the query).  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progress Text, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  Enquiry made by a customer or contact that is recorded.  The resolution of that enquiry generally results in information being passed back to that customer or contact.  A query can range from an enquiry about available products by a prospective customer, to a complaint from a customer about charges on an invoice.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, it is progressed to a work group for resolution.  The query facility is also used to record internal enquiries.  For example, the query facility can be used to enquire about a customer's credit rating by raising a query and forwarding it to an organisation's finance department.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Progress, Progression, and Work Group.  The following search criteria can be specified: query number (if known) or query numbers having a common prefix, work group, query type, specific text (character string), and status.    Selecting the Search option enables the Search… button on the form, for searching using specified criteria.  Selecting the Create a new query option enables the New… button on the form for creating a new query.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or clearing the Always Display List? and the Reuse Detail Form? check boxes.  If multiple instances of the detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several payments) the Reuse detail form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse detail form? option overrides the display of information in a new form; the details are displayed in the existing form.  If a single query is returned from a search, that query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  If more than one query is returned, the queries are listed on the Customer Query List form.  The required query can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Query form.  Similarly, if a single progression is returned from a search, that progression is displayed on the Customer Query Progress form.  If more than one progression is returned, the progressions are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  The required progression can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Query Progress form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Query form (or Customer Query Progress form) when only a single query (or progression) is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Query List form (or Customer Query Progress List form) is displayed.  Only the Query Number, Query Type, and Text fields are enabled when the Create a new query option is selected.  Associated Actions  Creating a Query  A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?  Viewing a Query  To view a query:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number, work force, or query type (or any combination).  Select the Query option in the Search for group and either the All or Opened option in the Status group.  Select the Opened option if the search should be restricted to unresolved queries (that is, still open).  Select the All option if the search should include both open (unresolved) and closed (resolved) queries.  Click the Search button.  Any queries that match the specified selection criteria are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query List form.  To view a specific query, double-click the query or highlight the query and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected query.  Need more information on queries?  Progressing a Query  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  Viewing a Progression  View a progression by:  Searching for the progressions associated with a query and then viewing the relevant progression.  Clicking the Query Progressions button on the Customer Query form and then viewing the relevant progression.  To search for and view a progression:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number.  Select Progress-All in the Search For field.  Click the Search button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  To access and view a progression using the Customer Query form:  Search for and display the query with the relevant progressions.  The selected query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression, and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: Customer Query Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Customer Query Type Definition form is used to view, define, and update a customer query type definition.  Enquiry made by a customer or contact that is recorded.  The resolution of that enquiry generally results in information being passed back to that customer or contact.  A query can range from an enquiry about available products by a prospective customer, to a complaint from a customer about charges on an invoice.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, it is progressed to a work group for resolution.  The query facility is also used to record internal enquiries.  For example, the query facility can be used to enquire about a customer's credit rating by raising a query and forwarding it to an organisation's finance department.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Progress, Progression, and Work Group.  The upper part of the form displays, or allows entry of, basic information about the query type.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering or displaying more specific information:  Settings  The fields on this tab are used to specify default values for response and resolution times, default work force to handle queries, expression used to create unique query numbers, and icon for representing queries of that type.  Help Text  The Help Text tab is used to enter text to assist in handling the query (for example, questions the customer should be asked).  Entity Validation  The Entity Validation tab is used to select entity validation definitions to customise the Customer Query form, and its associated forms, for customers of a specific type.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Customer Query Type  To view a customer query type:  Select the Maintenance @ Customer Care @ Customer Query Type option.  The Customer Query Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined customer query types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate customer query type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate customer query type.  The Customer Query Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on customer query types?  Defining a Customer Query Type  To define a customer query type:  Select the Maintenance @ Customer Care @ Customer Query Type option.  The Customer Query Type Search Form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Customer Query Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customer query types?  Updating a Customer Query Type  To update a customer query type:  View the appropriate customer query type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Query Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the customer query type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on customer query types?  Deleting a Customer Query Type  To delete a customer query type:  View the appropriate customer query type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the customer query type is to be deleted.  Need more information on customer query types?

A query can range from an enquiry about available products by a prospective customer, to a complaint from a customer about charges on an invoice. pages.title: Customer Search Form
pages.text: The Customer Search form is used to search for one or more customers, based on specified search criteria on either the Details or Address tab.  The Address tab is used to enter the customer’s address (either in full or in part) so that it can be used as one of the search criteria.  The fields in which to enter the customer’s address are displayed only when an address format is selected (in the Format field).  The address format determines the layout (number and type of fields) of the address.  If a customer type is selected in the Details tab, the format defaults to the address format specified in the customer type.  The Details tab is used to:  Refine a search by specifying search criteria such as customer name, account number, customer type, service number, network number, and one or more primary IDs.  Only records matching all criteria specified are retrieved by the search and displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Enter information relevant to the customer to be created.  Any information entered is included on the Customer Detail form when it is displayed in Insert mode.  By default, all records active on the date the search is performed are included in the search.  The Search Date field can be used to search for historical records active at a specified time, or future records.  The display format for the retrieved record(s) can be chosen by selecting or clearing the Always Display Hierarchy check box.  If a single customer record is returned from a search, that customer’s details are displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If more than one customer record is returned, the records are listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display Hierarchy? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  A Soundex option is also included to allow a name similar to the one being searching for to be entered, if exact details are unavailable.  Searches based on customer name are case-insensitive.  Selecting the Search for customers option enables the Search… button on the form, to search for customers matching the specified criteria.  Selecting the Create a new customer option enables the New… button on the form, for creating a customer.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or clearing the Always Display Hierarchy? and Reuse Customer Form? check boxes.  If multiple instances of the Customer Detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several customers) the Reuse customer form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse customer form? option overrides the display of the customer's details in a new form; in such cases, the customer's details are displayed in the existing form.  Multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form can be displayed by clearing the Reuse Last Hierarchy? check box.  If multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form are required for display (for example, to focus a search for a specific customer) the Reuse last hierarchy? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last Hierarchy? option overrides the display of the customer hierarchy in a new form; the customer hierarchy is displayed in the existing form.  Associated Actions  Viewing Customer Details  To view a customer's details:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ Manage Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the name of the customer in the Customer Name field.  Enter additional search criteria in the other fields, if required.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the details.  Select one of the following options:  Always Display Hierarchy?  Reuse Last Hierarchy? option to list customers on single or multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select the Search for customers option and click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single customer record, the Customer Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display Hierarchy? option was not selected).  More than one customer record, or the Always Display Hierarchy? option was selected, the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed listing each of the customer records that matched the search criteria in a new form.  If the Reuse Last Hierarchy? option was selected, the customer records are displayed on the last Customer Hierarchy form.  To view:  Items associated with a specific customer record, click the customer name in the left-hand panel; the items (contacts, products, services, equipment, queries, and contracts) associated with that customer are listed in the right-hand panel (if all available display options are selected).  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Details of a specific customer record, double-click the appropriate customer record, or select the record and click the Details… button.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on customers?  Creating a New Customer  Customer details are recorded on the Customer Detail form, which can be accessed by:  Using the Customer Search form  Dragging and dropping the customer icon into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Although both methods can be used to create customers, the second method is primarily used to create customer nodes within a customer hierarchy.  To create a customer using the Customer Search form:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ New Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria on the Details tab.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, click the Address tab and select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the address details.  Ensure that the Create a new customer option is selected and click the New… button.  The system performs a search of the database and then displays either the Customer Detail form or the Customer List form.  When the New… button on the Customer Search form is clicked, a search of the database is performed based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Customer List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Customer List form; the Customer Detail form is then displayed in Insert mode.  Any information entered on the Customer Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Customer Detail form irrespective of the mechanism by which the Customer Detail form is displayed.  If the Customer List form is displayed, view each of the records displayed.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button on the Customer List form.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Invoice Formats… button on the Invoicing tab.  The Customer Invoice Format form is displayed.  Select an invoice format.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To create a customer using the technique of dragging and dropping:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  To create a:  root customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the Hierarchy node (located at the top of the left-hand panel).  child customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel.  Node that is a direct subordinate (or child) of a node (referred to as a parent customer node) located at the next highest level of the customer hierarchy.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  A child customer node can also be the parent customer node of a node (or nodes) located at a lower level in a customer hierarchy.  See also Customer Hierarchy, Parent Customer Node, and Root Customer Node.  In both cases, the Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by the system.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the customer icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes (listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form) or the hierarchy node.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the customer icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Updating Customer Details  To update customer details:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Depending on available privileges and the start date of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the form is displayed in Update mode.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  Update the customer details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?  Deleting a Customer  If the customer account is being finalised, the customer record can be deactivated (cancelled) rather than being deleted.  To delete a customer's record:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer to be deleted.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the History button on the toolbar.  The Customer History form is displayed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Customer Type Charge Category Form
pages.text: The Customer Type Charge Category form is used to:  View, define, and update a charge category associated with a customer type.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for customers specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each customer type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Customer and Icon.  Identifies the default account type to which a calculated tariff charge or benefit is posted (allocated).  For services, the charge category also identifies a specific account number.  The association between a tariff and a charge category is specified when the tariff is defined and is referred to as the tariff/charge category pair.  By default, the charge category associated with a tariff is used each time that tariff is used.  However, the charge category can be overridden when defining a customer type, service type, customer node, or service.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Account Type and Tariff.  Specify the name of the charge category, its description, and details of the 'to' and 'from' account type, GL code, customer type, and account number.  Using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  The Search Account Number and Assign Account Number buttons are used to search for and assign account numbers.  The buttons are enabled when the form is in Update mode.  To begin a search, select a value in the To Account Type field, and place the cursor in the To Account Number or From Account Number fields, and click the Search Account Number button.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Charge Category  To view a charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option. The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button. A list of the defined charge categories matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate charge category and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate charge category.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).  Defining a Charge Category  To define a default charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option.  The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  If required, assign the appropriate account number.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Updating a Charge Category  To update a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the charge category details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Deleting a Charge Category  To delete a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the charge category is to be deleted.  Need more information on charge categories?

pages.title: Customer Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Customer Type Definition form is used to view, define, and update a customer type.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for customers specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each customer type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Customer and Icon.  The upper part of the form allows entry and display of basic details about the customer type, such as its name and description, charge category details, and icon used to represent the customer type.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs, allowing more specific details to be entered and viewed:  Settings  The Settings tab is used to:  Specify the form to be used to enter customer details and defaults for various fields (for example, prime account type, report level, GL code, tax class).  Specify the address format to be used for the customer type.  Define the expression used to generate account numbers.  The use of the GL code specified on this tab is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  Credit and Payment  The Credit and Payment tab is used to enter default credit limits, payment methods, and payment due period, and early payment period for customers of a specified type.  Billing   The Billing tab is used to specify the maximum number of cycles or amount of time for which invoicing may be suppressed for root customers of the relevant customer type. pages.title: Derived Attribute Definition Form
pages.text: The Derived Attribute Definition form is used to view, define, and maintain a derived attribute.  Facility for deriving a new variable based on the values of other variables, which can be achieved by:  Using a simple expression  Conditional evaluation (similar to functions)  List evaluation type  Table look-up based on single, multiple, searching, or range indexes.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Evaluation Type, Master Derived Attribute, Product Definition, Slave Derived Attribute, Keyed Derived Attribute, and Variable.  The upper part of the form displays, or allows entry of, general information about the derived attribute, such as derived attribute name, description, start date and end date.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for more information to be displayed or entered:  Details  The Details tab is used to select information for the application environment of the derived attribute, context in which it will be used, mechanism used to derive the value returned, storage context, and data type returned.  Lookup Table  The Lookup Table tab is used to define details for a derived attribute defined with any of the table lookup evaluation types, or an evaluation type of Lists.    The tab specifies:  Details for the lookup table including table name, description, maximum number of rows in the table, result column number (result column the derived attribute will return), and the validation for the derived attribute.  Entity validation record that defines columns in the derived attribute table on which searches can be performed (if the storage context of the derived attribute is Global or Global Shared).  The Table… button is enabled only if Global, Global Shared, or Interface Definition is selected in the Storage Context field on the Detail tab.  If the value in Storage Context is Facility, this tab is not displayed.  Indexes  The Indexes tab is used to define the parameters for the index column in the lookup table.  Each index is specified on a separate row.  The tab is only displayed if the selected evaluation type is 'List', or one of the table lookup evaluation types.  If the value in Storage Context (on the Details tab) is Facility, this tab is not displayed.  Conditions  The tab is used to define conditional expressions, associated value expressions and, optionally, tariff split condition expressions.   It is only displayed if the selected evaluation type is one of the following:  Conditional: Single Value Returned  Conditional: Multiple Values Returned.  If specifying conditions for a derived attribute with an evaluation type of Conditional: Single Value Returned, the order of the conditional expressions is important because the value returned is the value associated with the first conditional expression that evaluates to TRUE.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Derived Attribute  To view a derived attribute:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Derived Attributes @ Definition option.  The Derived Attribute Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined derived attributes matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate derived attribute and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate derived attribute.  The Derived Attribute Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on derived attributes?  Defining a Derived Attribute  To define a derived attribute:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Derived Attributes @ Definition option.  The Derived Attribute Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Derived Attribute Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the data entry fields as required.  Evaluation Type: Conditional: Single Value Returned  Evaluation Type: Conditional: Multiple Values Returned  Evaluation Type: List  Evaluation Type: Simple Expression  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Best Match  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Multiple (1-10) Keys  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Searching  To define a derived attribute having an evaluation type of Table Lookup by Searching:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  Complete the data entry fields on the Details tab.  Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to Table Lookup by Searching.  Select the appropriate storage context.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field, ensuring that the definition is defined with at least one index and one result column.  If a user-specified wildcard is required, enter the wildcard value in the Wildcard String field on the Lookup Table tab.  Otherwise, leave the field blank and undefined values are treated as wildcards.  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global-Shared is used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed with the defined index and result columns.  Populate the table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  If a user-specified wildcard is set in the Wildcard String field, ensure that the wildcards entered in the index columns match the value in the field.  If Wildcard String field is not set, any undefined index columns are treated as wildcards.  A row can be included in the derived attribute table with all index columns specified as undefined wildcards.  This is the default row returned if no matches are found.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Single Range.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on derived attributes?  Updating a Derived Attribute  Modifying a derived attribute may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the derived attribute.  To update a derived attribute:  View the appropriate derived attribute.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Derived Attribute Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the derived attribute details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on derived attributes?  Deleting a Derived Attribute  To delete a derived attribute:  View the appropriate derived attribute.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the derived attribute is to be deleted.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.text: The Derived Attribute Table form is used to populate a predefined lookup table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  Table of values containing index values and associated result values.  The table is used to look-up the result value based on an index value that is calculated using an associated index expression.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Index Expression, Index Value, and Result Value.  Each row in the lookup table contains at least one result value for each index value.  To expand the:  Range of index values covered by the lookup table, add further rows of data.  Number of result columns, add fields to the entity validation definition used for the lookup table.  A Search Criteria group is displayed on the form if 'search' entity validation (using the Search Validation field) is defined on the Derived Attribute Definition form.  The Search Criteria section is displayed if entity validation is specified in the Search Validation field when defining the derived attribute array.  Search criteria can be used to filter the table rows displayed in the form.  Match Case and Wildcard check boxes are only available for string search fields.  If the Match Case check box is selected, a case-sensitive search is executed.  If the Wildcard check box is selected, the wildcard character % can be used in the string to represent zero or more unknown characters.  For example, ‘%value’ returns 1value, onevalue, and twovalue.  When a filter is applied, another filter cannot be applied (further searches are conducted on the unfiltered array).  Reordering records while a filter is applied is not possible.  The Up Arrow and Down Arrow buttons at the bottom of the Derived Attribute Definition form are unavailable while a filter is applied.  If the Where clause is defined in the search entity validation, filtering fields are ignored.  If the Go To functionality is used, the specified row is returned regardless of filtering values.  Pre-commit and post-commit expressions are also ignored for search entity validation.  Rows can be inserted, updated, and deleted when filtering is applied.  Row insertion behaviour is configurable using the SYSTEM_CLIENT configuration items. The APPEND_ON_DA_TABLE_INSERT and DUPLICATE_ON_DA_TABLE_INSERT attributes in the SYSTEM_CLIENT configuration item (see the System Configuration Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing) control how rows are added to the form.  The default behaviour of the APPEND_ON_DA_TABLE_INSERT attribute is to append rows at the end of the derived attribute table.  If set to BOOLEAN_NM_FALSE, a row is inserted before the selected row. The sequence numbers of the selected row, and subsequent rows, are incremented by 1.  The default behaviour of the DUPLICATE_ON_DA_TABLE_INSERT attribute is to duplicate values to the new row. If set to BOOLEAN_NM_FALSE, the new row is blank.  The buttons at the bottom of the form are used to navigate through the rows in the derived attribute table.  The following three buttons ('Go To' functionality) at the bottom of the form are used to navigate through the rows in the derived attribute table:  Go to row number  Go to first record  Go to last record  The Go to row number button is used to go directly to a row by entering a row number in the text box to the left of the button and clicking the button.  The 100 rows before and after the entered row number are also returned.   When the Go to row number button is clicked, the form is cleared, and the required records are retrieved from the database.  Therefore, any filtering or sorting used in the grid is cleared when the button is clicked.  The Go to first record button is used to go to the first record displayed in the grid (filtering and sorting is not cleared).  The Go to last record button is used to go to the last record displayed in the grid (filtering and sorting is not cleared).  The Go to first record and Go to last record buttons display the first and last rows, respectively, displayed in the grid, not necessarily the first or last records in the derived attribute definition table.  For performance reasons, the Convergent Billing client only retrieves records from the database as they are required; therefore, the derived attribute definition table is not always retrieved when it is initially displayed in the client.  For example, for a table with 1000 records, only the first 32 may be initially retrieved and displayed.  When the user scrolls past row 32, the next set of records are retrieved.  Therefore, clicking the Go to last record button when the table is first displayed may take the user only to row 32, not the last row in the derived attribute definition table.  If it is necessary to delete multiple rows from the table:  Press the Shift or Ctrl key while selecting the rows.  Press Ctrl+Delete, or select the Delete button to delete the rows. pages.text: The Derived Attribute Table History form is used to view and update historical records for derived attribute tables.   The date range for a derived attribute table history record can be changed provided that:  The range update of the derived attribute table record is within the start and end dates of its current derived attribute definition history record.  This means that the date ranges of a table history record cannot be updated to be within the bounds of a different history record of the current derived attribute definition.  All derived attribute table records must cover without overlap the full range of the history records for their derived attribute definition.  The effective start date of the first record of a derived attribute table history and the effective end date of the last record cannot be changed.  Derived attribute table history records can only be deleted if two or more table history rows span a date range that is covered by a derived attribute history record.  If this is not the case, either the previous record or the next record expand to fill the gap. pages.title: Entitlement Detail Form
pages.text: The Entitlement Detail form is used to view entitlement details.  The upper part of the form displays basic details about the selected entitlement.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs that allow more specific information to be displayed:  Details  The Details tab displays details about the entitlement being created.  The fields enabled on this tab are determined by the type of entitlement being created.  Recurring  The Recurring tab is displayed only when the Recurring option is specified in the Entitlement Class group on the upper part of the Entitlement Detail form.  The tab displays details of an allocation that recurs on a periodic basis for the entitlement. The tab also provides the option of suspending the recurring allocation and setting all allocations to the entitlement to expire.  Date Range  The Date Range tab displays details about the:   Entities that are associated to the entitlement  Duration of the entitlement being associated with the entity (date-time the entitlement becomes valid, and date-time the entitlement expires).  General  The General tab is used to display additional information about the entitlement.  The fields on this tab depend on the entity validation of the entitlement type.  Allocation  The Allocation tab displays details of all allocations for the entitlement. Each allocation is displayed on a separate row in the grid, and sorted in descending order of expiry and start date.  Associated Actions  View an Entitlement  Entitlements can be viewed from the following forms:  Customer Detail  Product Instance Detail  Service Detail.  To view an entitlement using the Customer Detail form:  View the customer’s details.  Click the Entitlements button.  To view an entitlement using the Product Instance Detail form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products or Companion Products option from the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate product record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Product Instance Detail form is displayed.   Select the Companion Products tab on the Product Instance Detail form.  Click the Entitlements button .  To view an entitlement using the Service Detail form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select Products and Services options from the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate service record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Service Detail form is displayed.   Click the Entitlements button.  Need more information on entitlements?
