pages.title: Entity Validation Definition Form
pages.text: The Entity Validation Definition form is used to enter, view, and update an entity validation definition.  Used to customise fields, add fields to generic forms, validate fields and forms, and add field security.  It can also be used to customise an entity's data model using derived non-stored attribute types, attribute display labels, attribute interface labels, and custom key field functions.   Entity validation is used in conjunction with reference types, attribute types, lookup functions and context-sensitive help.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Attribute Type and Reference Type.  The upper part of the form is used to enter basic details about the entity validation definition, select validation table and a parent table, specify key field functions, and enter validation expressions or post-commit expressions.  Contains variables that can be used in the default expression of an entity validation definition.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Entity Validation and Validation Table.  Table used within entity validation that contains a group of generic fields, including general fields, which can be customised.  Each table represents a specific area such as accounts, addresses, adjustments, and so on.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Entity Validation and Parent Table.  The lower part of the form is used to associate attribute types with generic Singleview Convergent Billing fields, use the Control Next feature, and enter default expressions.  The default expression in entity validation can execute almost any action; for example, assigning a default to a field, and printing a message.  To define a default for a field, the expression must contain the direct variable for the field referenced in the expression.  For example, to define a default of ‘500’ for the General 4 field of the Customer Detail form, the entity validation defining that field would contain the following default expression:  evCustGeneral4$ := ’500’;  where   evCustGeneral4$ is the direct variable for the General 4 field on the Customer Detail form.  Direct variables from both the validation table or parent table can be included in default expressions.  The Control Next feature is used to define intelligent defaulting and to configure fields to automatically change their configuration based on a value selected in another field.  For example, Control Next is used to configure the following scenarios if a user selects an option in one field:  More information is required based on that selection.  An additional field, used to enter further information, is displayed.    The characteristics of another field are inappropriate for the option selected, so the characteristics of the field are automatically modified.  The Control Next feature does not work on grids, except for derived attribute grids where child reference types are used.    Changing the configuration of fields based on the data entered in a separate field is achieved by allowing the attribute type assigned to one field to control the attribute type assigned to another field.    If the Control Next field (in an entity validation definition row) is set to Yes, the attribute type in that row has control over the attribute type in the row directly below it.  Depending on how the attribute types are set up, the Control Next feature can have the following effects:  If the controlling attribute type is based on a reference type that has a child attribute type associated with one of its reference items, that child attribute type overrides the attribute type in the next row when that reference item is selected.    The result is that the second field changes its configuration when an option is selected from the first field.  To display a new field on the form when an option is selected, an attribute type defining an invisible (or null) field must be defined.  The attribute type defining the blank field is then overridden and the new field is displayed.  If the controlling attribute is based on a reference type that has a child reference type associated with one of its reference items, that child reference type overrides any reference type specified in the attribute type in the next row when that reference item is selected.    The result is that the second field changes its reference list (drop-down list) when an option is selected in the first field.  Child reference types are supported only in derived attribute grids; they are not supported in other grids with entity validation.    For example, they are supported in the Derived Attribute Table form, Customer Lists, and Service Lists; they are not supported in the Payment Batch form, Adjustment Batch form, Customer Invoice Format form, and Customer Contacts form.  If the field being controlled has a default expression defined, that expression is evaluated when the field associated with the first attribute type is modified.  The above setup is used to define intelligent defaulting (automatically defaulting the value of a field based on data entered in a separate field).    Controls the representation of an entity's attributes.   For users of Singleview Convergent Billing, an attribute type defines the format, characteristics, and validation rules for a form field.   Attribute types are the major components for entity validation.  Based on a reference type, they also define the representation of an entity's attributes externally, allowing the entity's data model to be tailored for integration with external systems.  They can also define additional non-stored attributes that are derived from an entity's stored attributes.   Attribute types are defined independently of the data entry fields to which they relate, which allows the same attribute type to be used for multiple fields.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Process Engine  See also Derived Attribute, Derived Non-Stored Attribute, and Reference Type.  The Entity Validation Definition form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing an Entity Validation Definition  To view an entity validation definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Entity Validation option.  The Entity Validation Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of entity validation definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate entity validation definition.  The Entity Validation Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on entity validation?  Defining an Entity Validation Definition  To define an entity validation definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Entity Validation option.  The Entity Validation Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Entity Validation Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the Entity Name and Description fields.  Select a validation table.  Enter key field functions if required.  Enter validation expressions for Row Validation and Pre-Commit Validation, as required.  Select a field from the Column Name field, then the attribute type to be associated with the field from the Attribute Type field.  Set the Control Next field to Yes if required.  Enter a default expression if required.  To associate an attribute type to another field, position the cursor in the grid section of the form and press the down arrow.  A new row is inserted in the grid.  Repeat steps 7 to 9.  Enter in-transaction expressions in the In-Transaction Expressions tab, if required.  Enter post-commit expressions in the Post-Commit Expressions tab, if required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on entity validation?  Updating an Entity Validation Definition  Modifying an entity validation definition may result in corruption of data and forms that use the definition.  To update an entity validation definition:  View the appropriate entity validation definition.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Entity Validation Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the entity validation definition as required.  Select the Post-Commit Expressions tab to check if a legacy post-commit expression exists.  If a legacy post-commit expression exists, choose either the Move to In-Transaction List button or Move to Post-Commit List button.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the entity validation definition is used by another element, a Confirm window is displayed.  Click the Yes button.  If the entity validation is being used for a derived attribute and the number of columns or the data types of the columns have changed, the index expression rows on the Indexes tab of the Derived Attribute Definition form must be updated.  Need more information on entity validation?  Deleting an Entity Validation Definition  Deleting an entity validation definition may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the definition.  To delete an entity validation definition:  View the appropriate entity validation definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the entity validation definition is to be deleted.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.text: The Equipment Allocation form is used to allocate an item of equipment to a product instance.  Physical components required to provide a service; for example, modem, leased line, or mobile phone. The upper part of the form displays details about the equipment allocated to the specified product instance. An item can be allocated by clicking the Allocate… button, or viewed (before being allocated) by clicking the Details… button. The Transit tab is only displayed on the Equipment Search form if the equipment type is configured to enable the tab.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of equipment records matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate equipment record and click the Details... button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on equipment? Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.    The Equipment Search form is displayed.    Select the Create new equipment option.    Select the equipment type and enter the equipment serial number.    Click the New… button to insert a new equipment record.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Click the Save button.  To record (enter) equipment items in bulk:  Create the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Bulk Insert… button.  The Equipment Bulk Insert form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the serial number and/or network address for a specified item of equipment. Close the Equipment Bulk Insert form to return control to the Equipment Detail form.  Need more information on equipment? Update the equipment details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To update a range of equipment records of the same equipment type:  Search the appropriate equipment records and list them in the Equipment List form.  Select each equipment record to be included in the range to be updated. Specify the number of records to be updated in the Select how many items? field, and click the Select button. Specify the appropriate search criteria, ensuring that the Number of Items field is completed and contains a number greater than one.    Ensure the Always Display List? check box is selected.  Click the Search… button.  A list of the equipment records that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the range of equipment to be split and click the Split… button.  The Equipment Split form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate information and click the Continue Split button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed containing information about the new range of equipment items.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the form as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Equipment Reallocation Form
pages.text: The Equipment Reallocation form is used to replace an equipment item allocated to a product instance.  When a new equipment item is selected on the Equipment Allocation form, the Equipment Reallocation form is used to remove that item of equipment from the product instance.  Physical components required to provide a service; for example, modem, leased line, or mobile phone.  Equipment information is stored for information purposes only, but can also be used to allocate service numbers.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Service.  The fields displayed on this form vary depending on the configuration of the equipment type used, but usually a new status for the equipment item can be selected, and a description about why the equipment is being reallocated entered.  Associated Actions  Viewing Equipment Details  To view equipment details:  Select the Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.  The Equipment Search form is displayed.  The Transit tab is only displayed on the Equipment Search form if the equipment type is configured to enable the tab.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of equipment records matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate equipment record and click the Details... button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on equipment? To record (enter) equipment details for individual items of equipment:  Select either of the following options:  Customer Care @ Equipment @ New Equipment Items option.    Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.    The Equipment Search form is displayed.    Select the Create new equipment option.    Select the equipment type and enter the equipment serial number.    Click the New… button to insert a new equipment record.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Click the Save button.  To record (enter) equipment items in bulk:  Create the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Bulk Insert… button.  The Equipment Bulk Insert form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the serial number and/or network address for a specified item of equipment.  To add a new item, press the Down Arrow key to create an empty line and repeat step 3.  Repeat step 4 for each item of equipment to be inserted.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Close the Equipment Bulk Insert form to return control to the Equipment Detail form.  Need more information on equipment? To update the details of an individual equipment record:  View the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the equipment details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To update a range of equipment records of the same equipment type:  Search the appropriate equipment records and list them in the Equipment List form.  Select each equipment record to be included in the range to be updated.  For a contiguous number of equipment records, select the first record in the required range and do either of the following:  Hold down the Shift key, and select the last record in the required range.    Specify the number of records to be updated in the Select how many items? field, and click the Select button.  To select a number of individual equipment records, hold down the Ctrl key and select each record.  When more than one record is selected, the Detail… button on the Equipment List form is replaced with the Bulk Update button.  Click the Bulk Update button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode with details of the first equipment record in the selected range.  Make any required changes to the displayed record.  Any changes made to this record are also made to each of the other records in the selected range.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment? When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the equipment details are to be deleted.  Need more information on equipment? Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option.  The Product Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Follow the steps described in Prepare for Product Definition to populate the form.  Click the Services tab.  Place the cursor in the Allocation Form Entity Validation field and click the down arrow to insert the entity validation definition created in Step 1.  Save the product definition. The entity validation definition is usually set up to restrict the number of items displayed when allocating an equipment to a service.  For example, the definition may restrict the number of pools available from which equipment can be allocated (by Service Prefix, Region, or Pool Type).  Need more information about equipment types?  Splitting a Range of Equipment Items  Why split a range of equipment items?  A range of equipment items may need to be split.  For example, if a range of equipment items includes the serial numbers 0530 to 0539, and equipment items with serial numbers 0532 and 0533 are required to be reserved for a customer, the range of equipment items can be split to create following three ranges; 0530 to 0531, 0532 to 0533, and 0534 to 0539.    The original range of equipment is split by creating a new range 0532 to 0533, which is then removed from the original range.  The properties of the first and last range remain the same as the original range.  The range containing serial numbers 0532 to 0533 can then be changed to include a reservation for the appropriate customer.  To split a range of equipment items:  Select the Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.  The Equipment Search form is displayed.  Specify the appropriate search criteria, ensuring that the Number of Items field is completed and contains a number greater than one.    Ensure the Always Display List? check box is selected.  Click the Search… button.  A list of the equipment records that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the range of equipment to be split and click the Split… button.  The Equipment Split form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate information and click the Continue Split button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed containing information about the new range of equipment items.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the form as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment? Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select one of the equipment entries and click the Allocate button.  The Equipment Allocation form is displayed.  Select one of the following:  An item in each of the available equipment pools, and click the Select button.  A list of valid equipment items is displayed.  If no equipment pools are display in the Equipment Pool Select group, all equipment items held in the equipment inventory are listed.  Customer's equipment option and click the Select button.  A list of equipment allocated to the specified customer is displayed.  Choose one of the selection options in the Allocate equipment group and, where necessary, enter an appropriate value in the associated field.  The options in the Allocate equipment group on the Equipment Allocation form are used to select:  The first item in the range of items displayed  Select the First item in range option and click the Allocate... button.  Other item in the range of items displayed  The Other item in range option is available only when there is more than one item in the range.  Select the Other item in range option, enter the required item's serial number, and click the Allocate... button.  An item having a specific serial number  Select the Specific serial number option, enter the required item's serial number, and click the Allocate... button.  In each case, the specified item of equipment is allocated.  If equipment allocated to the customer is being reused, a warning message is displayed when the Allocate... button is clicked, prompting confirmation that it should be allocated.  Click the Allocate button.  Depending on system configuration, either the Product Instance Detail form or Equipment Reallocation form is displayed.  If the Product Instance Detail form is displayed, click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the Equipment Reallocation form is displayed, enter the appropriate information and click OK.  Need more information about equipment?

pages.title: Equipment Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Equipment Type Definition form is used to enter, view, and update details of an equipment type.    Specifies any defaults or entity validation for equipment specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each equipment type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Configuration Studio  See also Equipment, Service, Service Type, and Icon.  The upper part of the form is used to enter or view general information about the equipment type, such as its name and description.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs, for entering more specific details about the equipment type and the mechanism by which equipment numbers and service names are generated:  Settings  The fields on the Settings tab are used to enter general details about the equipment type being defined.  For example, the following can be specified:  Equipment form to be displayed  Icon to be used  Reference types that specify possible states  Warranty periods.  Ranges of equipment and whether a   Network addresses to be used as the basis for the equipment type.  Quarantine period  Status for the equipment type.  Quarantine and status can be used to specify a period of time in which the equipment is unavailable for use (for example, after a service number is cancelled).  The service number is then held in quarantine for the period specified until it is reactivated.  Encoding/Decoding  The fields on this tab are used to enter expressions to encode and decode equipment serial numbers and/or network addresses.  The make, model, and sub-type codes of the equipment can be used in the expression.  The encode and decode fields for:  Serial numbers are enabled only if the Allow ranges of equipment? field on the Settings tab are selected.  The network address are enabled only if both check boxes on the Settings tab are selected.  Entity Validation  The fields on this tab are used to enter:  Entity validation definitions  Optional set of validation rules to be applied against any equipment type.  Equipment validation can be used to provide a default layout for customers on the Equipment Detail form.  Similar validation definitions can be specified for the Equipment Search form, Customer Details form, Equipment Reallocation form, and Equipment Split form.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title. Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified). pages.text: The Event Trace Settings form is used to:  View and set trace debug levels for the test rating of an individual event or error event.  Cancel the submission of the event for test rating, using the Cancel button.  Submit the specific event for test rating, using the Continue button.  If the event is successfully rated, the Generated Test Charges form is displayed with the generated charges. The trace file is also displayed.  The application used to display the trace file is determined by the Windows configuration for the file name extension.  The user must have access to the directory where the trace files are created (the directory is specified in the CALLER_PREFIX attribute of the TRERATE configuration item).  If no charges are generated, a message is displayed informing the user that there were no charges generated. pages.title: Expression List Form
pages.text: The Expression List form is used to enter, view, and update details of an expression.  Combinations of operators (arithmetic and relational) and variables that return a single value when evaluated.  Variables used in an expression depend on the variable type, and the context and application environment in which the expression is being used.  Use of direct variables in expressions also depends on the defined database view.  Expressions are used in client and server processes.  In Process Engine, expressions can be used in searches, rule validations, parameters, and derivations; they can also be used to conditionally trigger the execution of EPM scripts.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Process Engine  See also Expression Block, Expression Parser Module (EPM), Expression Type, and Variable.  To enter an expression, do either of the following:  Place the cursor in the last expression field and press the Down Arrow key to display a new row in the grid below the last row.    Click the Insert button on the toolbar to insert a new row above the current row.  An expression can then be entered in the new row.  The sequence in which the expressions are executed can be changed using the Up and Down buttons.  Specific processing and conditions for some expression lists are:  Standard Tariff Eligibility Expression List  Specifies expressions that control the application of the tariff.  If the list is empty or all expressions evaluate to TRUE, the tariff is applied.  Which variables can be used in eligibility expressions depends on the application environment and context of the tariff as follows:  Application environment of Billing:  All variables with an application environment of Billing or Rating are available, except those with a context of Charge if the tariff's context is not Charge.  If a keyed charge is defined, the key variable name (defined in the Variable Name field on the Charges tab) is available.  Application environment of Rating:  Variables must have the same application environment and if the tariff is:  Global (Global Event? is selected), only variables with the same context are available.  Not global (that is, a product tariff), variables with a context of Service or Normalised Event are available, irrespective of the tariff's context.  Recurring/Activation/Cancellation Event Eligibility Expression List   Specifies conditions that control the generation (by the RGP) of a rental event for an entity (product, facility group, service, or equipment).  If the list is empty, or all conditions are TRUE, an event is generated.  Otherwise, if any expression in the list is FALSE, an event is not generated.  Depending on the entity the tariff is associated with, expressions can include direct variables from one of the following sets:  Direct variables based on RGP_PRODUCT_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_FAC_GROUP_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Direct variables based on RGP_EQUIPMENT_HISTORY_V.  Expressions can also include functions with an application environment of Any, Rating, or Data Entry.  A function with an application environment of Rating or Data Entry can be used within the expression list; however, rather than all direct variables available for the relevant application environment, only the direct variables referenced above are valid.  The eligibility expression lists do not run in a rating application environment, hence they do not have access to standard direct variables, tariffs and derived attributes. Derived attribute variables must not be used in this context. To access derived attribute details in the expression list, use the appropriate functional interface:  DerivedTableLookupByDatex&() for access to global derived attributes.  ServiceTableLookup&() for access to service context derived attributes.  CustomerNodeTableLookup&() or CustomerNodeTableLookup?[]() for access to customer node or customer derived attributes.  For more information about these functions, refer to the Configurer's Reference Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing (Vol. 2).  Recurring/Activation/Cancellation Event Assignment Expression List  Specifies the expressions that the RGP uses to assign values to the generated event for the entity (product, facility group, service, or equipment).  Fields of the event are assigned values by referring to direct variables based on the  RGP_NORMALISED_EVENT_V view.  For example, the C_PARTY_NAME field is set by assigning a value to the CPartyName$ direct variable.  Depending on the entity the tariff is associated with, expressions can include direct variables from one of the following sets:  Direct variables based on RGP_PRODUCT_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_FAC_GROUP_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Direct variables based on RGP_EQUIPMENT_HISTORY_V.  Expressions can also include functions with an application environment of Any, Rating, or Data Entry.  A function with an application environment of Rating or Data Entry can be used within the expression list; however, rather than all direct variables available for the relevant application environment, only the direct variables referenced above are valid.  The assignment expression lists do not run in a rating application environment, hence they do not have access to standard direct variables, tariffs and derived attributes. Derived attribute variables must not be used in this context. To access derived attribute details in the expression list, use the appropriate functional interface:  DerivedTableLookupByDatex&() for access to global derived attributes.  ServiceTableLookup&() for access to service context derived attributes.  CustomerNodeTableLookup&() or CustomerNodeTableLookup?[]() for access to customer node or customer derived attributes.  For more information about these functions, refer to the Configurer's Reference Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing (Vol. 2).  Assignment expressions are evaluated only for rental events.  Adjustment events are created by copying the values from the rental event being adjusted.  It is recommended that all data that affects the eligibility of the rating tariff or the content of the generated charge be included in the generated event (by the assignment expressions).  Including this data enables a tariff's eligibility criteria and charge expressions to avoid accessing RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V.  Depending on the cause of the adjustment, rental tariffs that access details in RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V may see the current details, rather than the details that caused the adjustment event to be generated.  Recurring/Activation/Cancellation Event Adjustment Expression List  Specifies the conditions that control the generation (by the RGP in adjustment mode) of an adjustment event for a previous rental event for an entity (product, facility group, service, or equipment).  If the list is empty, or all conditions are TRUE, an adjustment event is not generated.  Otherwise, if any expression in the list is FALSE, an adjustment event is generated.  Depending on the entity the tariff is associated with, expressions can include direct variables from one of the following sets:  Direct variables based on RGP_PRODUCT_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_FAC_GROUP_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Direct variables based on RGP_EQUIPMENT_HISTORY_V.  An expression can include direct variables based on RGP_NORMALISED_EVENT_V.  Expressions can also include functions with an application environment of Any, Rating, or Data Entry.  A function with an application environment of Rating or Data Entry can be used within the expression list; however, rather than all direct variables available for the relevant application environment, only the direct variables referenced above are valid.  The adjustment expression lists do not run in a rating application environment, hence they do not have access to standard direct variables, tariffs and derived attributes. Derived attribute variables must not be used in the context. To access derived attribute details in the expression list, use the appropriate functional interface:  DerivedTableLookupByDatex&() for access to global derived attributes.  ServiceTableLookup&() for access to service context derived attributes.  CustomerNodeTableLookup&() or CustomerNodeTableLookup?[]() for access to customer node or customer derived attributes.  For more information about these functions, refer to the Configurer's Reference Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing (Vol. 2).  Related Topic  Background Information about Expressions

pages.title: Expression Test Form
pages.text: The Expression Test form is used to test expressions in Convergent Billing.  The upper part of the form is used for entering the expression to be evaluated.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for viewing results of expression tests:  Results  The Results tab displays the results of the expression test once it is evaluated.  Debug  The Debug tab displays the results of the expression test once evaluated.  The Generate Function Call button on the form provides a quick way to generate the code required to test a defined function.  After a function name is entered in the Function Name field and the Generate Function Call button is clicked, skeleton code with a function call to the specified function and appropriate variables (of the appropriate types) are inserted in the upper part of the form.  The skeleton code can be modified, as required, before the expression is evaluated.  The behaviour of the Generate Function Call button can be customised by defining a function that is invoked when the button is clicked.  For example, the skeleton code inserted can be customised.  For more information, refer to the Configuration Fundamentals Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing.  Functions are evaluated by using the individual buttons on the form.  Associated Action  Testing an Expression  To test an expression:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Expression Test option.  Maximise the form to expand the Results field to its maximum size.  Enter the expression to be tested in the Expression field.  Skeleton code containing a function call to a defined function with appropriate variables can be inserted in the upper part of the form.  To insert the skeleton code, enter a function name in the Function Name field and click the Generate Function Call button.  The skeleton code can be modified, as required, before the expression is evaluated.  Click the Evaluate button.  The results of the expression are displayed in the Results field.  Expression blocks can be evaluated by entering them as described.  The braces are required around the expression block, and each expression in the block must end with a semicolon.  Functions can be called within a test expression.  Direct variables can be used in test expressions.  Other variables used in expressions are empty unless declared as local variables and assigned a value in the expression block.  Need more information on expressions?

pages.title: External Definition Form
pages.text: The External Definition form is used for configuring and validating external definition entities.  Validated external definitions can have their interfaces generated from the form.   The form's tabs allow for configuration of every aspect of the external definition and its interfaces, including:  Namespace  Associations with related external definitions  Content model and XML representation  Types of query interfaces to be generated  Linked Convergent Billing entity or Process Engine object  Search method  Elements or attributes that make up the external definition, if it is a complex structure.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs:  Settings  Description  The Description tab of the External Definition form is used to describe the current external definition.  Entity  The Entity tab of the External Definition form defines the Convergent Billing entity or Process Engine object that an external definition is linked to.  CB Group  The CB group defines a Convergent Billing entity and entity validation.  The entity validation and associated attribute types define how the data is transformed between internal and external representations including generated views.  Attribute types associated with the entity validation can be mapped to external definition elements and attributes on the Element tab.  For a Convergent Billing entity, after an entity validation is selected, the list of associated elements displayed in the Element tab is automatically generated from the entity validation's list of attributes.  Previously-generated elements, not those manually inserted, are removed first.  If the Entity Validation field is cleared, previously-generated elements are also removed from the list of elements in the Element tab.   PE Group  The PE group defines a Process Engine class and type object.  Facts associated with the object can be mapped to external definition elements and attributes.  For a Process Engine class, after a value for Object Type is selected,the list of associated elements displayed in the Element tab is automatically generated for the selected Class and Object Type combination.  Previously-generated elements, not those manually inserted, are removed first.  If the Object Type field is cleared, previously-generated elements are also removed from the list of elements in the Element tab.   For a Process Engine class with no Object Type selected, a complete list of elements associated with the selected Class can be automatically generated.  In this case, the Generate Elements button is displayed in the bottom right-hand corner of the Element tab.  Clicking this button generates the elements.   Abstract Group  The options in the Abstract group indicate if the external definition is an abstract definition used in a Convergent Billing or a Process Engine context.  The indicators are used in real-time interfaces for routing inbound messages through Convergent Billing or Process Engine.  This group is only available if the External? check box in the Settings tab is selected.  API Processing  The Sequence Number field in the API Processing group controls the order in which the interfaces of an external definition and its linked definitions are called.  Interfaces in a linked set of external definitions are called in an ascending numbered sequence.  See also  External Definition Form   Element Tab  Search  The External Definition Search form is used for searching and listing one or more external definitions.  The search criteria and method are specified in the upper section of the form.  The lower section lists the external definitions returned by the search that match the specified criteria.  Clicking the Detail... Button displays the External Definition form for the external definition selected in the lower section.    Multiple external definition definitions can be viewed simultaneously by deselecting the Reuse Form? check box.  Determines whether or not multiple instances of a detail form are displayed when a specific object is selected in the right-hand panel of the form and the Detail… button is clicked.  To display multiple instances of the appropriate form, ensure that the check box is not selected.  Associated Actions  Defining an External Definition  To define an external definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ External Definition @ External Definition option.  The External Definition Search form is displayed.   Click the New... Button.  The External Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.   Enter the external definition configuration.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Default external definition configurations can be generated from entity validation using the ExternalDefnGenerate&() function.  Need more information on external definitions?  Generating an External Definition View  To define an external definition that is eligible for view generation:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ External Definition @ External Definition option.  The External Definition Search form is displayed.   Click the New... Button.  The External Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.   Complete the View Name field.  In the View Generation drop-down list, select Pending.  Configure remaining fields as required.  Validate the configuration using the Validate... button on the Settings tab.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Run the dbsync server utility on the command line.  View generation can be initiated manually by a call to the biExternalDefnViewGenerate&() function.  Need more information on external definitions?  Generating an External Definition Interface  To define an external definition and generate interfaces for it:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ External Definition @ External Definition option.  The External Definition Search form is displayed.   Click the New... Button.  The External Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.   Select the External? check box.  In the Interface Generation drop-down list, select Pending.  In the Content Model drop-down list, select a content model other than Simple Content.  Select relevant check boxes from the Access group to configure the interface functions to be generated.  Configure other fields as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Click the Validate... button on the Settings tab.  The validation process is initiated.  In the Status drop-down list, select Validated to ensure that validation continues.  Click the Generate Interface... button.  The interface generation process is initiated.  The Interface Generation field is updated with the results of the interface generation process. pages.title: External Definition Namespace Definition Form
pages.text: The External Definition Namespace Definition form is used to create, update, and delete external definition namespaces.  External definition namespaces ensure the uniqueness of associated external definitions.  Associated Actions  Defining an External Definition Namespace  To define an external definition namespace:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ External Definition @ External Definition Namespace option.  The External Definition Namespace Search form is displayed.   Click the New... Button.  The External Definition Namespace form is displayed.   Enter a namespace name in the Namespace Name field.  The namespace name must be unique.  Enter a namespace abbreviation prefix in the Prefix field.  If a specific location is required, enter an absolute path in the Schema Location field that describes the location of the XML schema for the namespace.  If generating an XML schema with unqualified elements, select the Unqualified Elements? checkbox   Complete the Description field for the namespace, if required.   Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on external definition namespaces?  Viewing an External Definition Namespace  To view an external definition namespace:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ External Definition @ External Definition Namespace option. The External Definition Namespace Search form is displayed.  Enter the search criteria and select the search method.  Click the Search button. Namespaces matching the search criteria are displayed in the lower section of the form.  Select the namespace to update and click the Detail... button.  The External Definition Namespace form is displayed in View only mode.  Need more information on external definition namespaces?  Generating an External Definition  External definitions can be generated from XML schema files.  Restrictions apply when generating external definitions from XML schema files (see the System Configuration Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing). pages.title: Facility Group Definition Form
pages.text: The Facility Group Definition form is used to view, define, and maintain a facility group.    Collection of one or more service options (known as facilities) defined in a product and associated with a specified service.  A facility group must contain at least one facility, and can also contain details of compatible facility groups.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Configuration Studio  See also Facility and Facility Group Compatibility.  The upper part of the form is used to specify the name of the facility group, its description, effective dates, and an icon by which the facility group can be identified.    The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs that for listing facilities to be included in the facility group and the facility groups compatible with the facility group being specified:  Facilities  The fields on the Facilities tab are used to:  Select one or more facilities to be included in the facility group.  The list of available facilities (displayed on the drop-down list) includes only items that have been defined as reference items of the FACILITY reference type.  Remove a facility from the list of facilities specified for a facility group.  Compatibility  The fields on the Compatibility tab are used to specify one or more facility groups compatible with the current facility group.  The term 'compatible' refers to whether a nominated facility group can be configured with the current facility group; some facility groups may be mutually exclusive.  The list from which to choose a compatible facility group is restricted to those facility groups currently defined.  The Compatibility tab is also used to remove a facility group from the list of compatible facility groups.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Facility  To view a facility:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Reference Types option.  The Reference Type Search form is displayed.  Select Type Label in the Search field.  Enter FACILITY in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search button.  If the required reference type is not displayed, define it.  Select the FACILITY reference type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the reference type.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on facility groups?  Defining a Facility  To define a facility:  View the list of facilities on the Reference Type Definition form.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Reference Type form is displayed in Update mode.  Position the cursor in the last reference item listed and press the Down Arrow key on the keyboard.  A new row is inserted at the bottom of the table of reference items.  Enter details for the required facility.  If a facility is defined in error, delete that facility's definition by selecting the table row on which the facility is defined and clicking the Delete button on the toolbar.  Repeat step 4 for each facility required in the new facility group.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?  Viewing a Facility Group  To view a facility group:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Facility Group Definition option.  The Facility Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined facility groups matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate facility group and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate facility group.  The Facility Group Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on facility groups?  Defining a Facility Group  To define a facility group:  Ensure that all facilities to be included in the group have been defined.  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Facility Group Definition option.  The Facility Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Facility Group Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?  Updating a Facility Group  Impact of Updating a Facility Group  To update a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Facility Group Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the facility group details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?  Deleting a Facility Group  Do not delete a facility group if the facility group is referenced in one or more product instances because the product instances will be corrupted.  To delete a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the facility group is to be deleted.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Failed Customer List Form
pages.text: The Failed Customer List form is sed to list details of customers that failed on the bill run.  The details include the name of the customer, operation that failed, status of the operation, start and end date of the operation, and a message explaining why the operation failed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Bill Run  To view bill run details:  Select the Server Tasks @ Bill Runs option.  The Bill Run Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns only a single bill run, the Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If a single bill run record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If more than one bill run record is returned, the records are listed on the Bill Run List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Bill Run Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Bill Run Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Bill Run List form is displayed.  If the search returns more than one bill run, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Bill Run List form is displayed.  Select the appropriate bill run and click the Details… button, or double-click the appropriate bill run.  The Bill Run Details form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?  Viewing a Customer's Bill Run Details  View the appropriate customer's details.  Select the Billing tab on the Customer Detail form.  Click on the Bill Run Details… button to see the customer's bill run details.  Performing an Operation on a Bill Run  The Perform Operation… button is enabled only if the user has:  Sufficient privileges to access the One-Off Task Definition form  Schedule creation privileges for at least one of the operation tasks supported by the current bill run type.  To perform an operation on a bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Perform Operation… button.  The Perform Operation form is displayed.  Highlight the customer billing operation to be performed, and click the Submit button.  The One-Off Task Definition form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to submit the task.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email.  Need more information about bill runs?  Displaying a List of Failed Customers  To display a list of customers that failed on the bill run:  View the appropriate bill run details.  Click the Failed Customers… button.  The Failed Customer List form is displayed in View Only mode.  To view more specific details on why the customer failed on the bill run, click the Details… button.  The Bill Runs for Customer form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on bill runs?

pages.title: General Ledger Code Definition Form
pages.text: The General Ledger Code Definition form is used to view, define, and update a General Ledger (GL) code.    ID that each account in a general ledger is identified by, and sometimes known as an account code.  GL codes are used to map transactions in Singleview to the appropriate account in the external general ledger system.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Adjustment Type and Payment Type.  The upper part of the form is used to specify name of the code, its description, and period (date range) for which it is valid.  Mechanism for recording period-specific entity data.  A date range represents a period of time bounded by an effective start date and an effective end date.  A date ranged entity is an entity with data that can change over time, and the data is recorded for the date range that the data is valid.  The time span of the entity is defined by contiguous date ranges that specify historical, current, and future versions of the data.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Process Engine  See also Effective Date.  The lower part lists the associated reporting entity, currency, parent GL code, hierarchy level, account class, and account category.  Category (or subclass) of one of the available account classes a Convergent Billing account belongs to.  Although account categories are extensible, Convergent Billing does not validate account categories against account classes.  The following table lists default account categories supported in Convergent Billing.  Account Category  Account Class  Receivable  Asset  Payable  Liability  Deposit  Liability  Credit  Liability  Bank  Asset  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Account Class, Account Type, and General Ledger Account Category.  Specifies whether a Convergent Billing account is an asset or liability account.  Account classes are not extensible. pages.title: Graphical Task View Form
pages.text: The graphical task viewer provides an overview of all running and scheduled tasks and can be used to assist in schedule planning.  The graphical task viewer displays output from the Graphical Task View Search form in one of the following modes:  Monthly Calendar View, for planning task and resource allocations  The Monthly Calendar View graphs the total resource usage by all tasks for each time slot in a day over the graph period. The high-level view allows users to view total scheduled and available times, and redistribute scheduling to avoid excessive resource usage.  Weekly Calendar View, for planning task and resource allocations  The Weekly Calendar View graphs resource usage by individual task in time slot increments for each day over the graph period.  Gantt Chart View, for displaying task dependencies  The Gantt Chart View allows users to view dependency chains from start to finish. Dependency relations are indicated by arrows in the graph, and duration, start, and finish times are displayed in full for all tasks.  Virtual Resource Utilisation View, for displaying resource usage  The Virtual Resource Utilisation View displays the resource usage for all schedules against the usage limits for the active resource profile. System administrators can use the resource usage view to monitor UNIX and Convergent Billing resources.  Details of schedules and tasks displayed in the graphical task viewer can be retrieved by clicking on the item in the display.

pages.title: Graphical Task View Search Form
pages.text: The Graphical Task View Search form specifies the graph mode displayed in the Graphical Task View form, and the parameters on which the graph is filtered.    Details for tasks and schedules displayed in the Graphical Task View form can be retrieved by clicking on the item.   Related Topics  Task Prerequisites  Schedules and one-off tasks can be defined with prerequisites; that is, tasks that must be in a specified state before another task will run.  Prerequisite tasks allow complex operational frameworks to be defined to promote process automation and ensure tasks are run in the correct order.  For example, Tasks A and  B are prerequisites for Task C, and Task C must be completed before Task D can begin.  Prerequisite tasks do not have to be completed successfully to trigger the dependent task.  Tasks can also be defined to start whenever their prerequisite conditions are satisfied, regardless of the specified start date-time.  Schedules  Schedules are required to run tasks at specific times and frequencies in Convergent Billing.  Schedules are used to manage all billing tasks such as the rating of events, and the preparation and printing of invoices.  Schedules are also used to generate reports.  Tasks can be set up to run automatically at predefined intervals or at a specified time and date.  The schedule definition is determined in part by the associated schedule type.  When setting up a schedule, an instance on Convergent Billing can be specified to run the schedule.  If an instance is not specified, the schedule is run on the default instance defined for the scheduler.  (The default instance is defined in the STD configuration item.)  Preconfigured functions can be automatically executed on commencement or completion of a scheduled task, and notification messages provided to assist with system operations.  A schedule specifies:  When a task is to be run for the first time.  The Convergent Billing instance the schedule is run on.  The effective date (used as a base to compute the effective date for tasks that are created).  How often the task should be repeated.  What program the task needs to perform its function, and what parameters should be passed to it.  Selection parameters such as whether a report should include data on all customer nodes or only include data on a specific customer node.  Display parameters, such as whether the data included in a report is to be sorted, the sort order, and the sort sequence.
