pages.title: Individual Adjustment Form
pages.text: The Individual Adjustment form is used to enter, view, and update adjustment details.  Transaction outside of the normal billing cycle transactions (namely, invoices and payments) that affects the outstanding balance of a customer's account.  An adjustment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Debit and credit notes are commonly referred to as adjustments in Convergent Billing.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Singleview  See also Adjustment Batch, Adjustment Type, Payment, Debit Note, and Credit Note.  The upper part of the form contains the Adjustment Number and Adjustment Batch Number (optionally) read-only fields.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs, for entering details about the current adjustment:  Details  The Details tab is used to specify the adjustment type, adjustment amount, the date the adjustment was received, and the account to which the adjustment is to be posted.  Text to be displayed on the customer’s invoice or statement (Adjustment Text field), and additional non-printed comments (Description field) can be entered.  An adjustment amount can only be entered up to a user's predefined adjustment limit, and in the specified currency.  The Details tab is also used to associate a query to the adjustment.  Facilities are provided to search for, view, and assign the appropriate query.  If this form is being used to view a recorded adjustment and the adjustment was recorded as part of an adjustment batch, facilities are provided to view the associated adjustment batch.  General  The General tab contains general information about the adjustment.  The details in this section are dependent on the adjustment type associated with the adjustment.  If present, do not change the displayed details.  The Debit Account Details group may be completed by Convergent Billing based on the adjustment type selected and the type of account associated with the account specified.  If the adjustment type explicitly specifies a debit account type, the debit account number is set automatically and cannot be updated.  If the adjustment type does not specify a debit account type, a debit account number cannot be entered.  The details displayed in the Debit Account Details group depends on the site configuration.  Allocations  The Allocations tab is used to:  List outstanding invoices, adjustments, or payments associated with the account set in the Credit Account Number field on the Detail tab.  Allocate the adjustment (defined on the Details tab) to one or more of the displayed invoices, adjustments, and payments.  The Allocations tab is displayed when all the following conditions are met:  The user's form role includes the View Allocations access level for the Individual Adjustment form.  The Credit Account Number field on the Details tab specifies a prime account.  Either the Currency or Amount field on the Details tab contains a value.  A Receivable Type column is displayed only if an invoice, adjustment, or payment on the tab is divided into receivable types or a credit amount is assigned to receivable types.  The tab displays items according to these rules:  An invoice, adjustment, or payment with a zero total amount outstanding is displayed if the invoice has receivable types with non-zero outstanding amounts.    If an invoice, adjustment, or payment is divided into multiple receivable types, each division is displayed on a separate row in the grid with the Receivable Type column set.  If an invoice, adjustment, or payment has a receivable type, the Total Amount and Amount Due columns display the values for the receivable type.  Otherwise, the values are for are the amounts for invoice, adjustment or payment.  If a credit amount is divided into multiple receivable types, each receivable type is shown on a separate row with empty invoice-related columns.  Any credit amount not assigned to a receivable type is not displayed in a row on the tab.  Inserting or Updating a Payment  When inserting or updating an adjustment, the tab displays:  Invoices  Outstanding invoices, including invoices with an issue date after the value entered in the payment's Date Received field.  Invoices paid as part of this individual adjustment.  Adjustments  Outstanding adjustments for the credit account.  Adjustments paid as part of this individual adjustment.  Payments  Outstanding payments for the credit account    Payments paid as part of this individual adjustment.  All outstanding invoices, adjustments, and payments must be finalised before any adjustment amount is left unallocated as credit.  The adjustment can be allocated in the following ways:  To a single invoice, adjustment, or payment  Split between a number of invoices, adjustments, or payments  Credited to a specified account.  New individual adjustment amounts can be entered against each invoice, adjustment, or payment but the value must be between zero and the value of the Amount Due field inclusive.  The This Adjustment column on the Allocations tab can be edited if the Update Invoice Allocations access level is selected for the Individual Adjustment form in a user's form role.  Debit Account Allocations  The Debit Account Allocations tab lists outstanding invoices, adjustments, or payments associated with the debit account.  The tab is also used to allocate an adjustment (defined on the Details tab) to one or more of the listed invoices, adjustments, or payments.  An adjustment can be allocated as follows:  To a single invoice, adjustment, or payment  Split between a number of invoices, adjustments, or payments  Credited to a specified account.  When displaying an individual adjustment, only those invoices, allocated adjustments, and payments that have been paid as part of this adjustment, and credit amounts assigned to receivable types, are displayed.  The tab is displayed only if the View Invoice Allocations access level is selected for the Individual Adjustment form in a user's form role and the Debit Account Number on the Details tab is a prime account.  The This Adjustment column on the tab can be edited if the Update Invoice Allocations access level is selected for the Individual Adjustment form in a user's form role.  For information about setting form role access levels, refer to Update a Form Role.  Currency Conversion  The Currency Conversion tab contains information for making a currency conversion.  The Conversion Date field defaults to the Adjustment Date field on the Details tab and is updated when the Adjustment Date field is modified.  If the Conversion Date field is updated by the user, it is no longer updated when the Adjustment Date field is modified. Conversions are possible for the currencies set in the accounts specified by the Credit Account Number and Debit Account Number fields.  The Currency Conversion tab is visible only if the currency of the adjustment differs to that of the account in the Credit Account Number field.  Image  The Image tab contains status information for the adjustment image, and the option to regenerate or view the adjustment image.  By default, all fields on the tab are read-only.  The View Image button is only enabled if the Image Generated checkbox is selected.  The Generate Image button is only enabled if the Image Format field contains a value.  The Image tab is displayed only if configured for the selected adjustment type.  The Adjustment Number field is assigned automatically by Convergent Billing when the adjustment is saved.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.    A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing an Adjustment  To view an adjustment:  Select the Accounts @ Adjustments @ Manage Individual Adjustments option.  The Adjustment Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  If the adjustment date is unknown, remove the date from the Adjustment Date field.  If appropriate, select the Always Display List? option.  If a single adjustment record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Individual Adjustment Detail form.  If more than one adjustment record is returned, the records are listed on the Adjustment Detail List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Individual Adjustment Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Individual Adjustment Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Adjustment Detail List form is displayed.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Adjustment form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option was selected, the Adjustment List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Adjustment form from the Adjustment List form, double-click the appropriate adjustment in the list of retrieved adjustments, or select the appropriate adjustment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Adjustment form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on adjustments?  Recording an Adjustment  Adjustments can be entered in either of the following ways:  Individually  In batches of the same adjustment type.  Before entering an adjustment, ensure that accurate information about the customer is available, amount of the adjustment, and the adjustment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter an adjustment.  When entering an adjustment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer getting the adjustment.  The customer's account number can then be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about adjustments?  Reversing an Adjustment  An adjustment can only be reversed once it is posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, an adjustment made as part of an adjustment batch can only be reversed if that batch is applied.  Adjustments included in an adjustment batch that is not yet applied can simply be removed from the batch.  To reverse an adjustment:  Enter an adjustment of equal (but opposite) value to the adjustment to be reversed.  In the Description field, cross-reference the adjustment number of the reversed adjustment.  Need more information on adjustments?  Deleting an Adjustment  To delete an adjustment not posted to a customer's account:  View the appropriate adjustment.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the adjustment is to be deleted.  An adjustment posted to a customer's account can also be deleted using the same procedure if:  The adjustment is not included on (appears on) an invoice or statement.  The adjustment has not been posted to the Sales Journal.  Security privileges are available.  If deletion is not possible, the adjustment should be reversed and the adjustment entered against the correct account.  Need more information on adjustments?

pages.title: Individual Payment Form
pages.text: The Individual Payment form is used to enter, view, and update payment details.  Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  The upper part of the form contains a set of read-only fields in which information about the payment, such as the date it is recorded and its current status, is displayed.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering or viewing details about the current payment:  Details  The Details tab is used to specify payment type, payment location, payment amount, date the payment was received, and the account to which the payment is to be posted.  The payment type specified determines the currency in which the payment is recorded and determines whether additional information needs to be entered for the payment using fields on the General tab.  Set the credit account explicitly by entering a value in the Credit Account Number field or implicitly by entering a value in the Invoice Number or Adjustment Number field.  Tab out of the field to implicitly set the Credit Account Name field and, if not set, the Currency field.  A default is set for the Amount field equal to the:  Balance of the account, if the Credit Account Number field is entered but not the Invoice Number field.  Total outstanding amount for the invoice, if the Credit Account Number field was set by specifying the Invoice Number field.  Total outstanding amount for the adjustment, if the Credit Account Number field was set by specifying the Adjustment Number field.  For each of these default values, if the account is a liability account, the sign of the value is reversed before the value is displayed.  The Details tab is also used to enter the name of the person making the payment.  By default, the name of the primary customer contact for the specified customer account is used.  When a payment is recorded, this tab provides access to facilities that allow the payment receipt to be previewed and printed.  General  The fields displayed on the General tab depend on the value set in the Payment Type field on the Details tab.  Fields are often not displayed on this tab when the payment type is set for cash payments.  Default values for the Debit Account Details group may be set, depending on the payment type selected.  If the payment type does not specify a debit account type, the Account Number field cannot be entered; otherwise, it can be edited.  Details should be entered in all fields displayed on this tab.  Allocations  The Allocations tab is used to:  Display invoices or adjustments for the account in the Credit Account Number field on the Details tab.  Allocate payment to one or more of the displayed invoices and adjustments.  The Allocations tab is displayed when all the following conditions are met:  The user's form role includes the View Invoice Allocations access level for the Individual Payment form.  The Credit Account Number field on the Details tab specifies a prime account.  Either the Currency or Amount field on the Details tab contains a value.  A Receivable Type column is displayed only if an invoice on the tab is divided into receivable types or a credit amount is assigned to receivable types.   The tab displays items according to these rules:  An invoice with a zero total amount outstanding is displayed if the invoice has receivable types with non-zero outstanding amounts.    If an invoice is divided into multiple receivable types, each division is displayed on a separate row in the grid with the Receivable Type column.  Otherwise, the invoice is displayed in a single row, with an empty Receivable Type column.    If an invoice has a receivable type, the Total Amount and Amount Due columns display the values for the receivable type.  Otherwise, the invoice values are displayed.    If a credit amount is divided into multiple receivable types, each receivable type is shown on a separate row with empty invoice-related columns empty.  Any credit amount not assigned to a receivable type is not displayed in a row on the tab.  Inserting or Updating a Payment  When inserting or updating a payment, the tab displays:  Invoices  Outstanding invoices, including invoices with an issue date after the value entered in the payment's Date Received field.  Invoices paid as part of this payment.  Adjustments   Outstanding adjustments with a status of Applied.  Adjustments that have been paid as part of this payment.    All outstanding positive invoices or negative adjustments must be paid before any payment amount is left unallocated as credit.   The payment can be allocated in the following ways:  To a single invoice, adjustment, or payment  Split between multiple invoices and adjustments  Credited to a specified account.  A payment amount can be entered against each invoice but the value must be between zero and the value of the Amount Due field inclusive.  The Amount column on the Allocations tab can be edited if the Update Invoice Allocations access level is selected for the Individual Payment form in a user's form role.  Debit Account Allocations  The Debit Account Allocations tab displays invoices or adjustments associated with the debit account on the General tab, and can allocate the payment to them.    The Debit Account Allocations tab is displayed when all the following conditions are met:  The user's form role includes the View Invoice Allocations access level for the Individual Payment form.  The Debit Account Number field on the Details tab specifies a prime account.  The tab operates like the Allocations tab, with the following differences:  The total of the invoice and adjustment allocations and credit amount equals the negative of the payment amount.   All outstanding invoices or adjustments do not have to be paid before any payment amount can be left unallocated as credit.   The Amount column on the Debit Account Allocations tab can be edited if the Update Invoice Allocations access level is selected for the Individual Payment form in a user's form role.  Up-Front Charges  The Up-Front Charges tab lists any up-front charges associated with the specified account, the amount of each up-front charge, and the total of all up-front charges.  New up-front charges can be entered and existing up-front charges can be modified or deleted.  The Up-Front Charges tab is displayed only if a Credit Account Number is specified.  Currency Conversion  The Currency Conversion tab is used to display conversion details of a payment.  The Conversion Date field defaults to the Date Received field on the Details tab and is updated when the Date Received field is modified.  If the Conversion Date field is updated, it is not updated when the Date Received field is modified.  The tab is displayed only if the currency of the payment is different from the currency of the account.  A receipt number is assigned automatically by Convergent Billing when the payment is saved.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  The form allows access to the Summary of Changes form (using the Changes Summary… button).  If appropriate security privileges are available, this form also allows access to the Payment Rejection Details form (using the Reject Payment… button).  Associated Actions  Viewing a Payment  Search for and view details of a receipted payment using one of the following:  Receipt number  Account number into which the payment was made.  Name of the customer's account.  To search using a receipt number:  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ Manage Individual Payments option.  The Payment Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter the receipt number in the Receipt Number field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Payment Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Payment Detail List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Payment Detail form from this form, double-click the appropriate payment in the list of retrieved payments, or select the appropriate payment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search using an account number into which the payment was made:  Select the Accounts @ Accounts History option.  The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the customer's account number in the Account Number field.  Click the Refresh History button.  Details of all transactions associated with the specified account are listed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Detail... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search for the customer account into which the payment was made:  View the appropriate customer’s details.  Click the Account History… button.  The Account History form for the specified customer is displayed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Details... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  Need more information on payments?  Entering a Payment  To enter a payment:  Select the Accounts @ Payment @ New Individual Payment option.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the payment details on the Details tab.  The payment type selected determines the currency in which the payment is recorded and whether additional information needs to be entered in the fields on the General tab.  The payment type's GL codes are  displayed on the General tab.  The Credit Account Number and Invoice Number fields are used for the account or invoice number to which the payment is being posted.  Enter the account or invoice number and press the Tab key.  The account or invoice number is verified against accounts held in the database and, if valid, the corresponding account name, account number, outstanding invoice number, and amount are displayed.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed in the status bar.  To rectify this, press the Delete key and enter a valid account or invoice number.  If the payment is being made against a specific account (by entering the account number in the Credit Account Number field) the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field does not include any unapplied payments or adjustments (for example, future-dated payments).  If the payment is being made against a specific invoice (by entering the invoice number in the Invoice Number field) the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field includes unapplied payments and adjustments.  The date-time in the Date Received field defaults to the current date-time.  The date is overridden by entering the required date either directly or using the drop-down calendar.  The time is overridden by entering the required time; this may need to be done if the payment is entered retrospectively.  If a future date is entered, the payment is not applied until the specified date.  The Paid by group specifies the person who made the payment.  If required, search for and assign a different contact as the payee (use the Search... and Assign buttons located in the Paid by group).  For payments, the Invoice Number field reflects the current status.  The word 'Credit' is displayed if there are no outstanding invoices, 'Split' is displayed if the payment was applied to a number of outstanding invoices or if the payment is allocated to one or more invoices and an amount is left over in credit.  Select the General tab, and complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Invoices tab, and allocate the amount paid to one or more of the listed invoices.  If appropriate, select the Debit Account Invoices tab and enter the appropriate amounts.  If required, select the Up-Front Charges tab and enter the appropriate item and amount.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Clicking Save generates a receipt, assigns a receipt number to the payment, saves the payment details, and posts the payment amount to the specified account.  Control is returned to the Individual Payment Detail form.  If required, print the receipt.  Rather than entering a number of payments individually, consider creating a batch for each type of payment and adding payments as they are received to the relevant payment batch.  The payment batch can then be applied at the end of a predefined period (for example, at the end of the day, or at the end of a week).  An organisation's business practices and billing cycles determine whether this is viable, and if so, the frequency at which payment batches need to be applied.  Need more information on payments?  Rejecting a Payment  To reject a payment the appropriate security privileges must be available.  Why Reject a Payment?  Payments may need to be rejected.  For example, a payment must be rejected if the customer's cheque is returned by the bank having been dishonoured because funds are not available in the customer's account, or the cheque is missing a signature.  A credit card transaction also might not be approved because the payment would exceed the customer's credit limit, so the associated payment needs to be rejected.  To resolve these situations so that the transactions in the customer's account history reflect the account status, the payment needs to be rejected.  Rejecting a payment does not remove that transaction from a customer's account history.  It inserts an additional transaction, a debit transaction equal to the amount of the original payment.  Rejecting a payment allows reversal of the effect of posting a payment to a customer's account.  A payment can only be rejected when it has been posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, a payment made as part of a payment batch can only be rejected if that batch is applied.  Payments included in a payment batch that is not yet applied can be removed from the batch.  To reject a payment:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Reject Payment... button.  The Payment Rejection Details form is displayed.  If rejecting a payment retrospectively, it may be necessary to change the rejection date.  Select a rejection code appropriate to the reason for rejecting the payment.  Unless specifically told to do so, do not change the default values in the Credit GL Code and Debit GL Code fields.  Click the Save button to reject the payment.  Control is returned to the Individual Payment Detail form, where the Payment Status field is now set to 'Rejected'.  Rejected payments are displayed as debits on the Account History form.  The rejected payment is given the same receipt number as the original payment.  Need more information on payments?  Deleting a Payment  To delete a payment not yet posted to a customer's account:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment is to be deleted.  A payment posted to a customer's account can also be deleted using the same procedure if:  The payment is not included on (appeared on) an invoice or statement.  The payment has not been posted to the sales journal.  Security privileges to do so are available.  Need more information on payments?  Viewing a Payment’s History of Changes  When working with a payment batch, it is possible to view information about a selected payment's history (for example, that a payment was rejected and later accepted).    To view the history of any changes to a payment:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Select the appropriate payment from the lower part of the form.  Click the Changes… button.  The Summary of Changes form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Interface Definition Detail Form
pages.text: The Interface Definition Detail form is used to enter, view, and update interface definition details.    The upper part of the form is used to enter or view general information about the interface definition (for example, name, template type, interface type, and description).  The lower part of the form consists of tabs for entering operational details about the interface definition. The tabs displayed depend on the configuration of the selected interface template.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  View Interface Definitions  To view interface definition details:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Interface Definition option.  The Interface Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the relevant search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of interface definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the relevant interface definition and click the Details... button.  The Interface Definition Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on interface definitions?  Create Interface Definitions  To create an interface definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Interface Definition option. The Interface Definition Search form is displayed.  Select the Create a new interface check box.  Select the interface type from the Interface Type drop-down list.  Click the New… button.  The Interface Definition Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Select the interface template from the drop-down list in the Template Name field.  Complete the relevant fields.  Click the Save button.  Need more information on interface definitions?  Update Interface Definition Details  To update details of an interface definition:  View the relevant interface definition.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Interface Definition Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the relevant interface definition details.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on interface definitions?  Delete Interface Definitions  To delete an interface definition:  View the relevant interface definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the interface definition is to be deleted.  Need more information on interface definitions?

pages.title: Interface Definition Search Form
pages.text: The Interface Definition Search form is used to search for one or more interface definitions, or create interface definitions.  Search criteria can be specified on the Interface Type, Interface Template, and Name fields.  The Interface Template field is optional for searching and creating interface definitions. Values are available only when the Interface Type field is selected.  All templates of the selected interface type are listed. Values can be specified when searching for, or creating interface definitions, as follows:  When searching for interface definitions, if a value is specified, the search results are restricted to interface definitions based on the specified template.  When creating interface definitions, if a value is:  Specified, the interface definition is created based on the interface template specified.   Not specified, the first available interface template of the selected interface type is used.  Selecting the:  Search for interfaces option enables the Search… button on the form, for searching for interface definitions matching the specified criteria.  Create a new interface option enables the New… button, for creating interface definitions.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or clearing the Always Display List? and the Reuse Detail Form? check boxes.  Associated Actions  View Interface Definitions  To view interface definition details:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Interface Definition option.  The Interface Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the relevant search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of interface definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the relevant interface definition and click the Details... button.  The Interface Definition Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on interface definitions?  Create Interface Definitions  To create an interface definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Interface Definition option. The Interface Definition Search form is displayed.  Select the Create a new interface check box.  Select the interface type from the Interface Type drop-down list.  Click the New… button.  The Interface Definition Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Select the interface template from the drop-down list in the Template Name field.  Complete the relevant fields.  Click the Save button.  Need more information on interface definitions?  Update Interface Definition Details  To update details of an interface definition:  View the relevant interface definition.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Interface Definition Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the relevant interface definition details.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on interface definitions?  Delete Interface Definitions  To delete an interface definition:  View the relevant interface definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the interface definition is to be deleted.  Need more information on interface definitions?

The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  View Interface Templates  To view interface template details:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Interface Template option. Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of interface templates matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate interface template record and click the Details... button.  The Interface Template Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on interface templates? pages.title: Invoice Detail Form
pages.text: The Invoice Detail form is used to view:  Details of a specified invoice.  Legal document itemising charges (and possibly credits) accrued against that customer's account for services used by, or supplied to, that customer over a specified period.  Accrued charges for a customer node in a customer hierarchy can be 'rolled up' into the invoice for a node higher in the customer hierarchy.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Customer Hierarchy, Customer Node, Reporting Level, and Statement.  An electronic image of the invoice sent to the customer and reprint the invoice.  The upper part of the form displays:  Invoice details such as invoice number, associated customer account number, amounts owing and due, issue date, due date, and discounts that appear on the customer’s invoice.  Effective date of the bill run that generated the invoice, and is used to calculate recurring and usage charges.  The date in the Issued field specifies the date when the invoice was issued to the customer, and is used to calculate aging of the invoice.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs, for more specific details to be viewed:  Transactions  The Transactions tab specifies details about the payments and adjustments displayed on the invoice image (for example, date the transaction was completed, whether the transaction was an adjustment or payment, amount, and receipt number of the transaction).  Receivable Types  The Receivable Types tab specifies details about the receivable types associated with the invoice, such as the name and amount of the receivable type and the amount outstanding on the receivable type for this invoice.  Queries  The Queries tab specifies details about any queries raised against the invoice, such as query number, type of query, when the query was opened and closed, and how the query was resolved.  Images  The Images tab is used to specify details about the invoice image, such as the format of the invoice, name and address of the person who received the invoice, and whether or not the invoice has been printed.  General  The General tab is used to enter information relevant to a specific invoice type.  The fields and number of fields on this tab depends on the invoice type selected.  The form can only be displayed in View Only or Update mode, with the current mode indicated in the form's title.  Associated Actions  Viewing an Invoice  The method to use to search for and view the details of an invoice depends on whether the assigned invoice number is known.  If the invoice number is known:  Select the Accounts @ Invoices option.  The Invoice Search form is displayed.  Ensure that the Search field is set to Invoice Number and enter the invoice number in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search button.  If a valid invoice number is entered, the invoice is displayed.   Click the Detail… button.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the invoice.  If the invoice number is not known:  View the customer’s account history.  Double-click the appropriate invoice transaction in the list of transactions.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the specified invoice.  To locate the correct invoice transaction within the list of transactions, ask the enquirer for the date of the invoice; the date is usually printed prominently on the invoice in a predefined location.  Need more information on invoices?  Viewing Service Details  To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?  Viewing an Invoice Image  Image Viewer Requirements  An image can be generated in a number of different formats; the appropriate image viewer must therefore be available.  Consult the System Administrator about the relevant viewer used.  To view the image:  View the appropriate invoice.  Select the Images tab.  If the image has been generated, click the Invoice Image... button.  If not, click the Generate Image button.  Depending on whether the invoice image is generated, Convergent Billing may ask whether the user wants to:  View the image  Click the Yes button to display the image using the appropriate viewer, or the No button to regenerate the image.  Schedule a task to generate the image  Click the OK button to schedule the appropriate task.  A message indicating that the schedule was submitted to and reached the server is displayed.  When the scheduled task is complete, the appropriate viewer is run automatically to display the generated image.  To cancel the request to schedule a task to generate the image, click the Cancel button.  Need more information on invoices?

Legal document itemising charges (and possibly credits) accrued against that customer's account for services used by, or supplied to, that customer over a specified period. pages.title: Invoices for Adjustment Form
pages.text: The Invoices for Adjustment form is used to:  List outstanding invoices associated with the specified account.  Allocate an adjustment to one or more of those invoices.  Allocate the adjustment to the account as a credit.  When inserting or updating an adjustment, all outstanding invoices for this account and any invoices that have been paid as part of an adjustment are displayed.    Closing this form returns control to the Adjustment Batch form, and details about the allocation are inserted in the Invoice column of the current table row:  If the adjustment was allocated to a single invoice, the invoice number is inserted.  If the adjustment was allocated to more than one invoice, the word ‘Split’ is inserted.  If there were no outstanding invoices or the adjustment was not allocated to an outstanding invoice, the word ‘Credit’ is inserted.  Associated Actions  Creating an Adjustment Batch  To create an adjustment batch:  Collate adjustments into batches (groups) of the same adjustment type.  Select the Accounts @ Adjustments @ New Batch Adjustment option.  The Adjustment Batch Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate adjustment type and batch type.  Enter the account number or invoice number in the appropriate columns associated with the adjustment and press the Tab key. An adjustment number is assigned to the adjustment and displayed in the first column of the current row.  The account number or invoice number is verified against the account details held in the system and, if valid, corresponding account and invoice details are displayed in the relevant columns.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed on the Status bar.  To rectify this, click the Delete button and enter a valid account or invoice number.  Ensure that the customer name is correct.  If not, a valid, but incorrect account or invoice number has probably been entered.  To rectify this, click the Delete button to remove the row, click the Insert button to insert a new row, and re-enter the account or invoice number.  If there is a selected invoice for the account, the invoice number appears in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount of the adjustment in the Amount column, and press the Tab key.  The Invoices for Adjustment form is displayed in Update mode.  If there are a number of invoices against the account, the word 'Split' appears in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount of the adjustment in the Amount column, and press the Tab key.  The Invoices for Adjustment form is displayed in Update mode.  Allocate an amount to one or more of the listed invoices as required.  When an adjustment is being recorded, it (or part thereof) can be allocated to one or more of the outstanding invoices or simply recorded as a credit (or debit if it is a negative adjustment).  Recording an adjustment as a credit or debit (rather than against a specific invoice) may be necessary if, for example, it is not clear which invoice should be allocated the adjustment.  When an adjustment is made, Singleview automatically makes an initial allocation of the funds against any outstanding invoices (if there are any).  The initial allocations can be modified before the adjustment is applied.  Adjustments are allocated differently depending on the allocation function specified for the adjustment type.  After the initial allocation is made, view and update the allocations by selecting the Invoices tab (for an individual adjustment) or by selecting an adjustment and clicking the Invoices button (for a batch adjustment).  The amount allocated to each invoice and receivable type is displayed in This Adjustment field (in the Individual Adjustment Detail form for individual adjustments or in the Invoices for Adjustment form for batch adjustments). Any credit amount not allocated to an invoice is displayed in the Credit field. The Credit field is updated as funds are allocated or de-allocated to an invoice or receivable type.  To adjust the initial allocations made to the adjustment (whichever form is displayed):  Enter zero in the This Adjustment field of the invoices not being allocated any funds.  If the whole amount is being allocated against a single invoice, the full amount is entered in the This Adjustment field of the appropriate invoice.  If the amount is being allocated against one or more receivable types, enter the amount in the This Adjustment column for the appropriate receivable type.   If the adjustment is being split between two or more invoices, the required amount for each invoice is entered in the This Adjustment field.  Each time an amount is entered, an equivalent amount is deducted from the amount in the Credit field.  If the adjustment is more than the combined total of the outstanding invoice balances, the funds remaining are treated as a credit against the specified account.    The amount in the Credit field is displayed in brackets if amounts are entered with a total of more than the adjustment amount.  View and modify how an adjustment is allocated at any stage.  Press the Tab key or close the Invoices for Adjustment form.  Control is returned to the Adjustment Batch Detail form.  If the adjustment has been entered against more than one invoice, the word 'Split' is displayed in the Invoice column.  If the adjustment was not made against an invoice, the word 'Credit' (or 'Debit' if it was a negative adjustment) is displayed in the Invoice column.  If required, overwrite the default text in the Adjustment Text field and enter a description of (or reason for) the adjustment in the Description field.  Any text written in the Adjustment Text field is printed on the customer's next invoice or statement; text written in the Description field is saved with the adjustment details, but not printed.  Complete any other fields defined for this adjustment.  The fields displayed depend on the adjustment type selected for the batch.  As each adjustment is entered, the total value of the adjustments in the batch is displayed in the lower right corner of the form.  Press the Down Arrow key to insert the next adjustment.  A new row is inserted below the current row with a new receipt number.   Repeat steps 5 to 11 until all adjustments have been entered, or until the batch needs to be saved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Adjustment Batch Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  To post the adjustments to the respective accounts, apply the batch.  To close the adjustment batch without posting the adjustments, click the Close button on the toolbar.  Need more information on adjustment batches?  Reversing an Adjustment  An adjustment can only be reversed once it is posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, an adjustment made as part of an adjustment batch can only be reversed if that batch is applied.  Adjustments included in an adjustment batch that is not yet applied can simply be removed from the batch.  To reverse an adjustment:  Enter an adjustment of equal (but opposite) value to the adjustment to be reversed.  In the Description field, cross-reference the adjustment number of the reversed adjustment.  Need more information on adjustments?

pages.title: Invoices for Payment Form
pages.text: The Invoices for Payment form is used to:  List outstanding invoices associated with the specified account.  Allocate a payment to one or more of those invoices.  Allocate the payment to the account as a credit.  When inserting or updating a payment, all outstanding invoices for this account and any invoices that have been paid as part of a payment are displayed.  Amounts up to the amount owing can be allocated to a:  Single invoice, where the due amount of the invoice must be less than or equal to the allocated amount.  Combination of invoices, where the sum of the total allocation must be less than, or equal to, the combined payment amount.  Closing this form returns control to the Payment Batch form and details about the allocation are inserted in the Invoice column of the table row:  If the payment was allocated to a single invoice, the invoice number is inserted.  If the payment was allocated to more than one invoice, the word ‘Split’ is inserted.  If there were no outstanding invoices or the payment was not allocated to an outstanding invoice, the word ‘Credit’ is inserted.  Associated Action  Creating a Payment Batch  To create a payment batch:  Collate payments into batches (groups) of the same payment type.  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ New Batch Payment option.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in Insert mode.  Alternatively, the form can be displayed by selecting the Create a new batch option on the Payment Batch Search form and clicking the New... button.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate payment type and batch type.  Enter the account or invoice number associated with the payment and press the Tab key.  A receipt number is assigned to the payment and displayed in the first field of the current row.  The account or invoice number is verified against the account details and, if valid, corresponding account and invoice details are inserted into other fields.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed on the Status bar.  To rectify this, press the Delete button and enter a valid account or invoice number.  Ensure that the customer name is correct.  If not, a valid, but incorrect account or invoice number has probably been entered.  To rectify this, press the Delete button to remove the row, click the Insert button to insert a new row, and re-enter the account or invoice number.  If the payment is being made against a specific account (by entering the account number in the Credit Account Number field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field does not include any unapplied payments or adjustments (for example, future-dated payments).  If the payment is being made against a specific invoice (by entering the invoice number in the Invoice field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field includes unapplied payments or adjustments.  If there is a single invoice outstanding against the account, the invoice number and the total amount appears in the Invoice and amount columns respectively.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  If there are no outstanding invoices, the word 'Credit' is displayed in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  Click the Invoices… button.  The Invoices for payment form is displayed in Insert mode.  If there are a number of invoices against the account, the word 'Split' and the total amount outstanding appear in the Invoice and Amount columns respectively.  The Individual Payment form is used to break up the payment between the outstanding invoices associated with the account.   Allocate an amount to one or more of the listed invoices as required.  Press the Tab key or close the Invoices for payment form.  If necessary, change the date on which the payment was received.  This may need to be done if payments are entered retrospectively.  Select a value in the Payment Location column.  Complete any other fields defined for this payment.  The fields displayed depend on the payment type selected for the batch.  As each payment is entered, the total value of the payments in the batch is displayed on the lower right-hand corner of the form.  Press the Down Arrow key to insert the next payment.  A new row is inserted below the current row with a new receipt number.  Repeat steps 5 to 12 until all payments have been entered, or until the batch needs to be saved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to save the details of the payment.  A message confirming that the payment was inserted into the batch is displayed on the Status bar.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in View Only mode.  To post the payments in the payment batch to their respective accounts, apply the batch.  To close the payment batch without posting the payments, click the Close button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Move Preferences Form
pages.text: The Move Preferences form is used to set preferences for moving customer nodes and products within the Customer Hierarchy form.  Refer to Base Product and Companion Product.  Point in a customer hierarchy that represents a customer's primary account to which charges can be accrued.  Product instances and associated services can be created for each node.  Associated with each customer node is a reporting level, which determines whether that node receives an invoice, a statement, or neither.  For example, if an account is required for each division in a multi-national company, a separate customer node is used to represent each division’s account.  Customer nodes in the customer hierarchy are organised into a structure (usually mirroring the company’s organisational structure) that is similar to a family tree.  A family tree displays the relationship between members of a specific family.  Like a family tree, a customer hierarchy displays the relationship between customer nodes.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Child Customer Node, Customer Hierarchy, Customer, Customer Type, Parent Customer Node, Reporting Level, and Root Customer Node.  If moving customer nodes, the upper part of the form is used to specify whether the Customer Detail form is to be displayed after each node is moved, and to specify the outcome of a failed move.  Associated Actions  Moving a Customer Node  Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move Multiple Customer Nodes  A child customer node can be moved:  To another location within the same hierarchy  Out of a hierarchy, creating a new root customer node  To a different hierarchy.  To perform one of these actions, the following privileges must be available:  Update privileges on the customer being moved.  View privileges on the customer node that will become the new parent customer node of the node being moved.  View privileges for blacklisted customers (if the customer node to be moved is blacklisted).  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes within a hierarchy.  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes between hierarchies.  Depending on the type of customer node move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move a customer node:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving a customer node within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the customer node and drag and drop it on to the appropriate customer node.  If moving a customer node out of a hierarchy (that is, a child node is to become a root node), select the child node and drag and drop it onto the hierarchy node.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.    Enter the appropriate date range.  Depending on security settings, the Start Date and End Date fields consist of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Click the Continue button.  The customer node being moved has its start date usually set to the customer hierarchy search date.  If this date is less than the current date and the user does not have historical update privileges, the start date is set to the current date.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  The invoice cycle for all customers being moved is adjusted to be the invoice cycle of the new root customer node.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Moving Multiple Customer Nodes  Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move a Customer Node  Multiple customer nodes can be moved only if they are a group of child nodes under the same parent node.  For example, if MegaWork's Melbourne and Sydney offices are both to be moved from the Sales Division and located directly under the head office in the hierarchy, both child nodes can be highlighted and moved simultaneously.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move multiple customer nodes:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving child nodes within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the appropriate nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the appropriate customer node on the left-hand panel of the form.  To select:  A group of customer nodes next to each other, hold down the Shift key, select the first node in the group, then the last node in the group.  All nodes in between the first and the last are automatically highlighted.  Multiple customer nodes not grouped together, hold down the Ctrl key, and then click each relevant node.  If moving customer nodes out of a hierarchy (that is, a group of child nodes are to become root nodes), select the nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the hierarchy node on the left-hand panel of the form.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  If one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves.  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed, and why.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Moving a Product Instance  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  The following restrictions apply when moving a product instance:  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance was created as part of a product offer.  A product cannot be moved if its owning customer or target customer is blacklisted at any time during the move period and the user does not have access to view blacklisted customers on the Customer Form.  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance is cancelled, moved, or upgraded at the effective start date or any later date.   A product must be assigned to a customer node.  A product dragged over a root node or blank space of the hierarchy panel cannot be dropped.   Some information regarding the lists and charge categories may need to be entered (when prompted) before the product instance move can be completed.  If a product instance is moved, any changes made to it before or after the move start date are not carried over in the move.  For example, if the product instance is moved at an effective date before an equipment allocation change, following the move the variation of equipment allocation is not reflected.  A warning is displayed so the user can cancel the move.   To move a product instance:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instance (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that the product instance and not the associated service is dragged and dropped.  To drag and drop a product instance, click the product instance and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instance onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instance is dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  Need more information on products?  Moving Multiple Product Instances  If this is the first move performed since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances on the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  To move multiple product instances:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instances (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that product instances are dragged and dropped, and not the associated services.  To drag and drop product instances, select the product instances and while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instances onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instances are dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The Move Progress form is displayed.  Need more information on products?  Setting Preferences for Customer Node Moves  Depending on the type of customer move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple customer nodes are being moved, and one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences options.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To set cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all possible nodes and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group.  To display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes, select 'Display details form in update mode after each individual customer move'.  Click OK.  Need more information on hierarchies?  Changing Preferences for Product Instance Moves  Depending on type of move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple product instances are being moved, and one or more of the instances fail to move, preferences can be set to do the following:  Cancel all moves.  Move the instances that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select the Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences option.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all instances possible and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report' after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group.  Click OK.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: New Rerated File Detail Form
pages.text: The New Rerate File Detail form is used to:   Create and assign a rerated file to this normalised event error (using the Create button).  Type of event output when either of the following conditions occurs:  If an Event Normalisation (ENM) process successfully normalises an alpha event, but does not evaluate all normalised event file type expressions for that event, the event is output as a normalised error event.  Normalised error events are sent only to an Event Rating Output (ERO) process for output; they are not sent to any Event Rating (ERT) process, and so are not rated. The conversion is performed using the Event Normalisation (ENM) process.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Event Normalisation.  The upper part of the form displays the event ID, and the type.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs that display more information about the normalised event:  File  The File tab displays information about the event file, both normalised and original, including the file name, record number, external file record number (for normalised files), and the re-processed count (for original files).  Settings  The Settings tab is used to display fields and drop-down lists for viewing more event details.  The left part of the tab displays standard details (for example, full path, duration, pulses, volume, or charge).  The right part of the tab displays information such as the rate band, with the event source and class, bill run ID, and the root customer name associated with the event, if these are applicable. Party  The Party tab displays details on the calling, receiving, and chargeable parties associated with the event.  Attributes  The fields on the Attributes tab are used to select attribute types.  The attribute types specify label, hint text, and validation details associated with each of the general columns in the table of normalised events. pages.title: Normalised File Detail Form
pages.text: The Normalised File Detail form is used to view a normalised file.  File (either physical or logical) from which a group of normalised events were processed.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Normalised Event and Normalised Event Type.  The upper part of the form contains the normalised file name, normalised file type, event source, range of dates, and creation task (rater version and task ID).  The lower part of the form contains the following tabs that display more specific details about the file:  Statistics  The Statistics tab is used to view event statistics for the displayed, normalised file.  Statistics include rated and unrated event counts, normalised and rating error event counts, tracer event count, discarded event count, input event count (which is a sum of the decoded and corrupt event counts), reprocessed counts (both event and error event), deleted counts (both event and error event), and the external input event count.   Events  The Events tab is used to list events associated with the normalised file being displayed, and which are of a selected, normalised event type.  A single file may contain events of different, normalised event types.  Each normalised event type can have entity validation associated with it, which can affect display of the events in the grid.   The list of normalised event types that apply to the set of events appear in the left-hand list box.  The grid list on the right displays details for events of each type.  Error Events  The Error Events tab is used to list error events associated with the normalised file being displayed, and which are of a selected, normalised event type.  A single file may contain error events of different, normalised event types.  Each normalised event type can have entity validation associated with it, which can affect the display of the error events in the grid.  The list of normalised event types that apply to the set of error events appears in the left-hand list box.  The grid list on the right displays details for error events of each type. pages.title: One-Off Task Definition Form
pages.text: The One-Off Task Definition form is used to define and submit an immediate one-off task.  Action or operation scheduled to be performed on behalf of a client by the Scheduled Task Dispatcher (STD) process.  The STD process generates the required tasks based on the schedule definition.  A task is executed as a server process by the Task Launch and Monitor (TLM) process.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Schedule, Scheduled Task Dispatcher (STD) Process, and Task Launch and Monitor (TLM) Process.  The upper part of the form is used to:  Select a schedule type to run as an immediate one-off task, Convergent Billing instance the task runs on, email address to be notified on completion of the task, and effective dates.  Replicate the schedule to a specified set of instances.  The lower part of the form contains the following tabs for entering more specific details about the task:  Parameters  The fields on the Parameters tab are used to specify additional parameters for the schedule.  The schedule type determines which fields are displayed on the tab.  Some schedule types do not display any fields.  Task Generation  The Task Generation tab contains information regarding the tasks being created by this schedule.  Prerequisites  The Prerequisites tab is used to manage prerequisite conditions for this one-off task.  The tab contains a table of prerequisite conditions, with each row containing a task that forms a prerequisite condition for running the task.  The Search… and Assign buttons are used to add prerequisite tasks.  The Details… button displays further information about the selected prerequisite task.  The Start Task immediately when all prerequisites satisfied? check box is used to start the schedule as soon as all prerequisites are True rather than waiting for the scheduled start date, and can be selected even if no task prerequisites are specified.  The Prerequisites tab is visible only if the user has 'Insert detail records' privilege enabled for the One-Off Task Definition form (form code SCHEDIMM).  If email notification is not required, leave the Email Address field blank or set it to one of the following:  /dev/null  nobody.  The one-off task is submitted by clicking the Save button on the toolbar.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Scheduling an Immediate One-off Task  To schedule an immediate one-off task:  Select the Server Tasks @ One-off Task option.  The One-off Task Definition form is displayed.  Select the schedule type from the drop-down list.  The lower part of the form displays the parameters associated with the schedule type.  Enter any parameters that may be required by the schedule.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The schedule is saved and a one-off task is submitted.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task created.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email.  Need more information on schedules?  Schedules are required to run tasks at specific times and frequencies in Convergent Billing.  Schedules are used to manage all billing tasks such as the rating of events, and the preparation and printing of invoices.  Schedules are also used to generate reports.  Tasks can be set up to run automatically at predefined intervals or at a specified time and date.  The schedule definition is determined in part by the associated schedule type.  When setting up a schedule, an instance on Convergent Billing can be specified to run the schedule.  If an instance is not specified, the schedule is run on the default instance defined for the scheduler.  (The default instance is defined in the STD configuration item.)  Preconfigured functions can be automatically executed on commencement or completion of a scheduled task, and notification messages provided to assist with system operations.  A schedule specifies:  When a task is to be run for the first time.  The Convergent Billing instance the schedule is run on.  The effective date (used as a base to compute the effective date for tasks that are created).  How often the task should be repeated.  What program the task needs to perform its function, and what parameters should be passed to it.  Selection parameters such as whether a report should include data on all customer nodes or only include data on a specific customer node.  Display parameters, such as whether the data included in a report is to be sorted, the sort order, and the sort sequence.  Scheduling a Future One-off Task  To schedule a one-off task:  Select the Server Tasks @ Schedules option.  The Schedule Search form is displayed.  Select the Create a new schedule option and click the New... button.  The Schedule Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the data entry fields in the upper part of the form.   Select the schedule type from the drop-down list.  The Parameters tab is populated with the parameters associated with the schedule type.  Complete the fields on the Settings tab.  Complete the fields on the Parameters tab.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Submit Schedule form is displayed.  Need more information on schedules?
