pages.title: Optional Product Components Form
pages.text: The Optional Product Components form is used to:  List service and equipment types available to the product instance for allocation.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for equipment specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each equipment type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Configuration Studio  See also Equipment, Service, Service Type, and Icon.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for services specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each service type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Icon and Service.  Display details of the service and equipment types, number of additional components allocated, and maximum number of components available for allocation.  The options available for selection are dependent on the configuration of the product.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Service  To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?  Creating a Service  To create a service:  View the relevant product instance.  Highlight one of the service types listed.  Click the Create… button.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the Yes button to continue creating the service with the specified dates.  The Service Detail form is displayed.  If the dates are not correct, click the No or Cancel button to return to the Product Instance Detail form to change the dates.  Complete the form for the selected service.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  To allocate an optional service to the product instance, click the Add Service… button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, the Optional Product Component form is closed, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 2 to 6 for each additional component to be allocated to the product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?  Viewing Equipment Details  To view equipment details:  Select the Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.  The Equipment Search form is displayed.  The Transit tab is only displayed on the Equipment Search form if the equipment type is configured to enable the tab.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of equipment records matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate equipment record and click the Details... button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on equipment?  Allocating Equipment  To allocate equipment:  Verify that the equipment to be allocated is recorded in the equipment inventory.  View the appropriate product instance.  Select one of the equipment entries and click the Allocate… button.  If the item of equipment is not allocated, a message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the appropriate button.  The Equipment Allocation form is displayed.  Select either of the following:  An item in each of the available equipment pools and click the Select button.  A list of valid equipment items is displayed.  If no equipment pools are displayed in the Equipment Pool Select group, all equipment items held in the equipment inventory are listed.  The Customer's equipment only option and click the Select button.  A list of equipment allocated to the specified customer is displayed.  Choose one of the selection options in the Allocate equipment group and where necessary, enter an appropriate value in the associated field.  The options in the Allocate equipment group on the Equipment Allocation form are used to select:  The first item in the range of items displayed  Select the First item in range option and click the Allocate... button.  Other item in the range of items displayed  The Other item in range option is available only when there is more than one item in the range.  Select the Other item in range option, enter the required item's serial number, and click the Allocate... button.  An item having a specific serial number  Select the Specific serial number option, enter the required item's serial number, and click the Allocate... button.  In each case, the specified item of equipment is allocated.  If equipment allocated to the customer is being reused, a warning message is displayed when the Allocate... button is clicked, prompting confirmation that it should be allocated.  Click the Allocate button.  The selected item of equipment is allocated.  To allocate an optional equipment item to the product instance, click the Add Equipment... button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 3 to 6 for each additional equipment item to be allocated to the product instance.   Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Other Accounts for Customer Form
pages.text: The Other Accounts for Customer form is used to:  View a list of secondary accounts (if any) associated with the specified customer and details of a specific secondary account.  Create one or more additional secondary accounts and to update secondary accounts.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Secondary Account  The method to access and view a customer’s account depends on whether the account number is known.  If the account number is known:  Select the Accounts @ Account History option. The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the account number in the Account Number field.  Press Tab or click the Refresh History button. Transaction details associated with the specified account are displayed including the account balance.  If the account number is not known:  View the Customer Details Form for the customer.  To view the primary account, click the Account History… button.  The Account History form is displayed with details of the primary account including the account balance.  To view a secondary account, click the Other Accounts… button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Double-click the account to be viewed or select the account and click the Account History… button.  The Account History form is displayed with details of the specified secondary account.  Need more information on accounts?  Creating a Secondary Account  To create a secondary account:  View the Customer Details form for the appropriate customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Click the Other Accounts... button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on privileges and the start date of the record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  Enter the account number (if known) and/or select the account type.  Multiple accounts of the same type can be added to a customer node, if allowed by the account type.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The account details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  If an account number is not entered, Convergent Billing assigns a number before saving the account details.  To enter additional secondary accounts, repeat Steps 3 to 5.  Close the Other Accounts form.  Need more information on accounts?  Deleting a Secondary Account  Rules for Deleting a Secondary Account.  To delete a secondary account:  Security privileges must be available to delete the record.  The account balance must be zero.  No future records for this customer that specify this account must exist.  Primary accounts cannot be deleted.  To delete a secondary account:  View the appropriate account history.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the account is to be deleted.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: Payment Batch Form
pages.text: The Payment Batch form is used to:  Enter, view, and update payments of the same type to be processed as part of a payment batch, and to apply the payment batch; that is, post the payments within that batch to their respective accounts.  Set of individual payments of the same type processed at the same time.  Each payment within the batch can be viewed or modified until the batch is applied (processed).  A payment batch can be created incrementally (one or more payments at a time) over a period of time.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Payment and Payment Type.  Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  Un-apply an applied payment batch.  The upper part of the form displays:  General details about the payment batch, such as its description, types of payment it contains, and batch type.    Read-only fields in which information about the payment batch, such as the date it is recorded and its current status is recorded.  The lower part of the form lists payments processed (or to be processed) as part of the batch.  The Invoices… button is enabled if the View Invoice Allocation access level is selected for the form in a user's form role and the Credit Account Number for the selected payment is a prime account.  Clicking the Invoices… button displays the Invoices form to allow viewing of invoice allocations for individual payments within a batch.    If the Update Invoice Allocation access level is selected for the form in a user's form role, the user can also update individual payments within a batch, using the Invoices form.  For information about setting form role access levels, refer to Update a Form Role.  To update a form role:  View the appropriate form role.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Form Role form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the form role details as required:  Click on the Insert button to insert a new line in the grid for a menu item or form to which the form role is to provide access.  Highlight a form and click on the Access Level Settings button to display the access levels for that form.  Select the appropriate access levels for the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on security?  The form also allows access to the Summary of Changes form (using the Changes… button).  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  A payment batch number is assigned automatically by Convergent Billing when the first payment in a batch is saved.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Payment Batch  A search cannot be made for a payment included as part of a payment batch if the batch is not yet applied.  To view details of such payments, view the payment batch, and then details of the required payment.  To search for a specific payment batch and list the payments in that batch:  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ Manage Batch Payments option.  The Payment Batch Search form is displayed.  If known, enter the payment batch number in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Payment Batch form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If a single payment batch record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Payment Batch form.  If more than one payment batch record is returned, the records are listed on the Payment Batch List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Payment Batch form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Payment Batch form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Payment Batch List form is displayed.  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Payment Batch List form is displayed.  To access the Payment Batch form from this form, double-click the appropriate batch in the list of retrieved batches, or select the appropriate batch and click the Details… button.  The Payment Batch form is displayed listing each of the payments included in that batch.  If the payment batch is applied, view details of a specific payment by selecting that payment and clicking the Details... button (or by double-clicking the selected payment).  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed with the specified payment.  Need more information on payment batches?  Creating a Payment Batch  To create a payment batch:  Collate payments into batches (groups) of the same payment type.  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ New Batch Payment option.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in Insert mode.  Alternatively, the form can be displayed by selecting the Create a new batch option on the Payment Batch Search form and clicking the New... button.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate payment type and batch type.  Enter the account or invoice number associated with the payment and press the Tab key.  A receipt number is assigned to the payment and displayed in the first field of the current row.  The account or invoice number is verified against the account details and, if valid, corresponding account and invoice details are inserted into other fields.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed on the Status bar.  To rectify this, press the Delete button and enter a valid account or invoice number.  Ensure that the customer name is correct.  If not, a valid, but incorrect account or invoice number has probably been entered.  To rectify this, press the Delete button to remove the row, click the Insert button to insert a new row, and re-enter the account or invoice number.  If the payment is being made against a specific account (by entering the account number in the Credit Account Number field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field does not include any unapplied payments or adjustments (for example, future-dated payments).  If the payment is being made against a specific invoice (by entering the invoice number in the Invoice field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field includes unapplied payments or adjustments.  If there is a single invoice outstanding against the account, the invoice number and the total amount appears in the Invoice and amount columns respectively.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  If there are no outstanding invoices, the word 'Credit' is displayed in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  Click the Invoices… button.  The Invoices for payment form is displayed in Insert mode.  If there are a number of invoices against the account, the word 'Split' and the total amount outstanding appear in the Invoice and Amount columns respectively.  The Individual Payment form is used to break up the payment between the outstanding invoices associated with the account.   Allocate an amount to one or more of the listed invoices as required.  Press the Tab key or close the Invoices for payment form.  If necessary, change the date on which the payment was received.  This may need to be done if payments are entered retrospectively.  Select a value in the Payment Location column.  Complete any other fields defined for this payment.  The fields displayed depend on the payment type selected for the batch.  As each payment is entered, the total value of the payments in the batch is displayed on the lower right-hand corner of the form.  Press the Down Arrow key to insert the next payment.  A new row is inserted below the current row with a new receipt number.  Repeat steps 5 to 12 until all payments have been entered, or until the batch needs to be saved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to save the details of the payment.  A message confirming that the payment was inserted into the batch is displayed on the Status bar.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in View Only mode.  To post the payments in the payment batch to their respective accounts, apply the batch.  To close the payment batch without posting the payments, click the Close button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment batches?  Applying a Payment Batch  To apply (or re-apply) the payments in a payment batch to their respective accounts:  Ensure that the payment batch is saved.  Click the Apply button.  A message indicating that the payments in the payment batch have been applied (posted) is displayed on the Status bar.  Need more information on payment batches?  Un-applying a Payment Batch  Rules for Un-applying a Payment Batch  A payment batch can only be un-applied if a payment within that payment batch was not:  Included on (appeared on) an invoice or statement.  Posted to the Sales Journal.  Rejected.  To un-apply a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Click the Un-apply button.  The payments within the payment batch are un-applied and, if required, can be modified or deleted.  Need more Information about payment batches?  Viewing a Payment’s History of Changes  When working with a payment batch, it is possible to view information about a selected payment's history (for example, that a payment was rejected and later accepted).    To view the history of any changes to a payment:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Select the appropriate payment from the lower part of the form.  Click the Changes… button.  The Summary of Changes form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on payment batches?

If the payment batch is applied, view details of a specific payment by selecting that payment and clicking the Details... button (or by double-clicking the selected payment).  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed with the specified payment.  Need more information on payment batches?  Creating a Payment Batch  To create a payment batch:  Collate payments into batches (groups) of the same payment type.  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ New Batch Payment option.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in Insert mode.  Alternatively, the form can be displayed by selecting the Create a new batch option on the Payment Batch Search form and clicking the New... button.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate payment type and batch type.  Enter the account or invoice number associated with the payment and press the Tab key.  A receipt number is assigned to the payment and displayed in the first field of the current row.  The account or invoice number is verified against the account details and, if valid, corresponding account and invoice details are inserted into other fields.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed on the Status bar.  To rectify this, press the Delete button and enter a valid account or invoice number.  Ensure that the customer name is correct.  If not, a valid, but incorrect account or invoice number has probably been entered.  To rectify this, press the Delete button to remove the row, click the Insert button to insert a new row, and re-enter the account or invoice number.  If the payment is being made against a specific account (by entering the account number in the Credit Account Number field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field does not include any unapplied payments or adjustments (for example, future-dated payments).  If the payment is being made against a specific invoice (by entering the invoice number in the Invoice field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field includes unapplied payments or adjustments.  If there is a single invoice outstanding against the account, the invoice number and the total amount appears in the Invoice and amount columns respectively.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  If there are no outstanding invoices, the word 'Credit' is displayed in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  Click the Invoices… button.  The Invoices for payment form is displayed in Insert mode.  If there are a number of invoices against the account, the word 'Split' and the total amount outstanding appear in the Invoice and Amount columns respectively.  The Individual Payment form is used to break up the payment between the outstanding invoices associated with the account.   Allocate an amount to one or more of the listed invoices as required.  Press the Tab key or close the Invoices for payment form.  If necessary, change the date on which the payment was received.  This may need to be done if payments are entered retrospectively.  Select a value in the Payment Location column.  Complete any other fields defined for this payment.  The fields displayed depend on the payment type selected for the batch.  As each payment is entered, the total value of the payments in the batch is displayed on the lower right-hand corner of the form.  Press the Down Arrow key to insert the next payment.  A new row is inserted below the current row with a new receipt number.  Repeat steps 5 to 12 until all payments have been entered, or until the batch needs to be saved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to save the details of the payment.  A message confirming that the payment was inserted into the batch is displayed on the Status bar.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in View Only mode.  To post the payments in the payment batch to their respective accounts, apply the batch.  To close the payment batch without posting the payments, click the Close button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment batches?  Applying a Payment Batch  To apply (or re-apply) the payments in a payment batch to their respective accounts:  Ensure that the payment batch is saved.  Click the Apply button.  A message indicating that the payments in the payment batch have been applied (posted) is displayed on the Status bar.  Need more information on payment batches?  Updating a Payment Batch  Notes on Updating a Payment Batch  To update a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  If necessary, un-apply the batch.  Modify individual payments within the batch as required.  Save the modifications and re-apply the batch.  Need more information on payment batches?  Deleting a Payment Batch  A payment batch can only be deleted if it has not been applied, or applied and subsequently un-applied.  To delete a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  If required, un-apply the payment batch.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment batch is to be deleted.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Payment Detail List Form
pages.text: The Payment Detail List form lists the payments that match the selection criteria specified on the Payment Detail Search form.  Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  To view details of a specific payment listed on the form, double-click the appropriate entry, or highlight the entry and click the Details… button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed.  To create a new payment, click the New… button.  The setting of the Always Display List? option on the Payment Detail Search form determines whether this form is displayed when the search returns only a single record.  If a single payment record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Individual Payment Detail form.  If more than one payment record is returned, the records are listed on the Payment Detail List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Individual Payment Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Individual Payment Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Payment Detail List form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing Payment Details  Search for and view details of a receipted payment using one of the following:  Receipt number  Account number into which the payment was made.  Name of the customer's account.  To search using a receipt number:  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ Manage Individual Payments option.  The Payment Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter the receipt number in the Receipt Number field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Payment Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Payment Detail List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Payment Detail form from this form, double-click the appropriate payment in the list of retrieved payments, or select the appropriate payment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search using an account number into which the payment was made:  Select the Accounts @ Accounts History option.  The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the customer's account number in the Account Number field.  Click the Refresh History button.  Details of all transactions associated with the specified account are listed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Detail... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search for the customer account into which the payment was made:  View the appropriate customer’s details.  Click the Account History… button.  The Account History form for the specified customer is displayed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Details... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  Need more information on payments?  Recording a Payment  Payments can be entered:  Individually  In batches of the same payment type.  Before entering a payment, ensure that the following information is available:  Accurate information about the customer  Amount being paid  Payment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter a payment.  When entering a payment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer whose account is being credited. Then the customer's account number can be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about payments?

pages.title: Payment Detail Search Form
pages.text: The Payment Detail Search form is used to search for one or more payments, based on the specified search criteria, including entry date, payment type, payment status, receipt number, and credit and debit account numbers.  Selecting the Search for payments option enables the Search… button on the form for searching for payments matching the specified criteria.  Selecting the Create a new payment option enables the New… button on the form, for creating a new payment.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or deselecting the Always Display List? and the Reuse Detail Form? options.  If multiple instances of the detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several payments) the Reuse detail form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse detail form? option overrides the display of information in a new form; the details are displayed in the existing form.  If a single payment record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Individual Payment Detail form.  If more than one payment record is returned, the records are listed on the Payment Detail List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Individual Payment Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Individual Payment Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Payment Detail List form is displayed.  Only the Entry Date and Payment Type fields are enabled when the Create a new payment option is selected.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Payment  Search for and view details of a receipted payment using one of the following:  Receipt number  Account number into which the payment was made.  Name of the customer's account.  To search using a receipt number:  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ Manage Individual Payments option.  The Payment Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter the receipt number in the Receipt Number field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Payment Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Payment Detail List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Payment Detail form from this form, double-click the appropriate payment in the list of retrieved payments, or select the appropriate payment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search using an account number into which the payment was made:  Select the Accounts @ Accounts History option.  The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the customer's account number in the Account Number field.  Click the Refresh History button.  Details of all transactions associated with the specified account are listed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Detail... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search for the customer account into which the payment was made:  View the appropriate customer’s details.  Click the Account History… button.  The Account History form for the specified customer is displayed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Details... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  Need more information on payments?  Recording a Payment  Payments can be entered:  Individually  In batches of the same payment type.  Before entering a payment, ensure that the following information is available:  Accurate information about the customer  Amount being paid  Payment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter a payment.  When entering a payment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer whose account is being credited. Then the customer's account number can be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about payments?  Rejecting a Payment  To reject a payment the appropriate security privileges must be available.  Why Reject a Payment?  Payments may need to be rejected.  For example, a payment must be rejected if the customer's cheque is returned by the bank having been dishonoured because funds are not available in the customer's account, or the cheque is missing a signature.  A credit card transaction also might not be approved because the payment would exceed the customer's credit limit, so the associated payment needs to be rejected.  To resolve these situations so that the transactions in the customer's account history reflect the account status, the payment needs to be rejected.  Rejecting a payment does not remove that transaction from a customer's account history.  It inserts an additional transaction, a debit transaction equal to the amount of the original payment.  Rejecting a payment allows reversal of the effect of posting a payment to a customer's account.  A payment can only be rejected when it has been posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, a payment made as part of a payment batch can only be rejected if that batch is applied.  Payments included in a payment batch that is not yet applied can be removed from the batch.  To reject a payment:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Reject Payment... button.  The Payment Rejection Details form is displayed.  If rejecting a payment retrospectively, it may be necessary to change the rejection date.  Select a rejection code appropriate to the reason for rejecting the payment.  Unless specifically told to do so, do not change the default values in the Credit GL Code and Debit GL Code fields.  Click the Save button to reject the payment.  Control is returned to the Individual Payment Detail form, where the Payment Status field is now set to 'Rejected'.  Rejected payments are displayed as debits on the Account History form.  The rejected payment is given the same receipt number as the original payment.  Need more information on payments?  Deleting a Payment  To delete a payment not yet posted to a customer's account:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment is to be deleted.  A payment posted to a customer's account can also be deleted using the same procedure if:  The payment is not included on (appeared on) an invoice or statement.  The payment has not been posted to the sales journal.  Security privileges to do so are available.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Payment Rejection Details Form
pages.text: The Payment Rejection Details form is used to reject a payment recorded against a customer account, by specifying the date (defaults to today’s date), a code indicating the reason, and the affected credit and debit GL codes.  Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  When saved, a rejected payment is displayed as a debit in the account from which it is rejected.  A rejected payment is given the same receipt number as the original payment.  Associated Action  Rejecting a Payment  To reject a payment the appropriate security privileges must be available.  Why Reject a Payment?  Payments may need to be rejected.  For example, a payment must be rejected if the customer's cheque is returned by the bank having been dishonoured because funds are not available in the customer's account, or the cheque is missing a signature.  A credit card transaction also might not be approved because the payment would exceed the customer's credit limit, so the associated payment needs to be rejected.  To resolve these situations so that the transactions in the customer's account history reflect the account status, the payment needs to be rejected.  Rejecting a payment does not remove that transaction from a customer's account history.  It inserts an additional transaction, a debit transaction equal to the amount of the original payment.  Rejecting a payment allows reversal of the effect of posting a payment to a customer's account.  A payment can only be rejected when it has been posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, a payment made as part of a payment batch can only be rejected if that batch is applied.  Payments included in a payment batch that is not yet applied can be removed from the batch.  To reject a payment:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Reject Payment... button.  The Payment Rejection Details form is displayed.  If rejecting a payment retrospectively, it may be necessary to change the rejection date.  Select a rejection code appropriate to the reason for rejecting the payment.  Unless specifically told to do so, do not change the default values in the Credit GL Code and Debit GL Code fields.  Click the Save button to reject the payment.  Control is returned to the Individual Payment Detail form, where the Payment Status field is now set to 'Rejected'.  Rejected payments are displayed as debits on the Account History form.  The rejected payment is given the same receipt number as the original payment.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Payment Summary of Changes Form
pages.text: The Payment Summary of Changes form is used to view changes to the specified payment (for example, information showing that the payment was rejected and later accepted).    Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  The upper part of the form contains a set of read-only fields in which the account number, account name, and payment number are displayed.  The lower part of the form displays a history of changes made to the payment.

pages.title: Payment Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Payment Type Definition form is used to view, define, and update a payment type.  Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  The upper part of the form displays or allows entry of basic details about the payment type such as its name and description.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for more specific details to be entered and viewed:  Settings  The Settings tab is used to:  Enter expressions to generate receipt numbers and payment batch numbers.  Select an entity validation definition to customise the Individual Payment Detail form.  Account Details  The Account Details tab is used to:  Select the default currency associated with the payment type.  If a default currency is selected, the currency must be the same as the currencies associated with the debit and credit accounts.  Define account types and default GL codes associated with the payment type when payments are applied or deducted.  Specify the function used to determine how payments are allocated to invoices.  Rejection Details  The Rejection Details tab is used to select the description, and debit and credit GL codes for rejected payments of this payment type.  Currency Conversion  The Currency Conversion tab is used to select the function used to determine discrepancy amounts caused by the currency conversion.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form's title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Payment Type  To view a payment type:  Select the Maintenance @ Customer Care @ Payment Type option.  The Payment Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of payment types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate payment type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate payment type.  The Payment Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on payment types?  Defining a Payment Type  To define a payment type:  Select the Maintenance @ Customer Care @ Payment Type option.  The Payment Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Payment Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment types?  Updating a Payment Type  To update a payment type:  View the appropriate payment type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Payment Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the payment type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment types?  Deleting a Payment Type  To delete a payment type:  View the appropriate payment type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment type is to be deleted.  Need more information on payment types?

pages.title: Payment Type Search Form
pages.text: The Payment Type Search form is used to search for one or more payment types, using a specific field, criteria, and method.  Amount paid by a customer.  The payment is recorded against a specific customer's account and optionally against one or more specified invoices.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Payment Batch and Payment Type.  The lower part of the form is used to list payment types returned by the search that match the specified criteria.  Multiple instances of the Payment Type Definition form can be displayed by clearing the Reuse form? check box.  If multiple instances of the form are required for display (for example, to access details for several account types), do not select the Reuse form? check box.  If selected, the Reuse form? check box overrides display of information in a new form, and details are displayed in the existing form.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Payment Type  To view a payment type:  Select the Maintenance @ Customer Care @ Payment Type option.  The Payment Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of payment types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate payment type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate payment type.  The Payment Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on payment types?  Defining a Payment Type  To define a payment type:  Select the Maintenance @ Customer Care @ Payment Type option.  The Payment Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Payment Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment types?  Updating a Payment Type  To update a payment type:  View the appropriate payment type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Payment Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the payment type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment types?  Deleting a Payment Type  To delete a payment type:  View the appropriate payment type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment type is to be deleted.  Need more information on payment types?

pages.title: Perform Operation Form
pages.text: The Perform Operation form is used to select a schedule to be used for this bill run.  The top of the form displays read-only information about the bill run.  The read-only information includes the bill run ID, net operation, and operation status.  The lower part of the form lists tasks that can be scheduled.  The tasks are schedule types, rather than bill run operations.  Clicking on the Submit button displays the One-off Task form with relevant details of the selected schedule.  The operation is then submitted by saving the one-off task.  Clicking the Cancel button closes the form and cancels the execution of an operation for this customer's bill run.  Associated Action  Scheduling an Immediate One-Off Task  To schedule an immediate one-off task:  Select the Server Tasks @ One-off Task option.  The One-off Task Definition form is displayed.  Select the schedule type from the drop-down list.  The lower part of the form displays the parameters associated with the schedule type.  Enter any parameters that may be required by the schedule.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The schedule is saved and a one-off task is submitted.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task created.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email.  Need more information on schedules?  Schedules are required to run tasks at specific times and frequencies in Convergent Billing.  Schedules are used to manage all billing tasks such as the rating of events, and the preparation and printing of invoices.  Schedules are also used to generate reports.  Tasks can be set up to run automatically at predefined intervals or at a specified time and date.  The schedule definition is determined in part by the associated schedule type.  When setting up a schedule, an instance on Convergent Billing can be specified to run the schedule.  If an instance is not specified, the schedule is run on the default instance defined for the scheduler.  (The default instance is defined in the STD configuration item.)  Preconfigured functions can be automatically executed on commencement or completion of a scheduled task, and notification messages provided to assist with system operations.  A schedule specifies:  When a task is to be run for the first time.  The Convergent Billing instance the schedule is run on.  The effective date (used as a base to compute the effective date for tasks that are created).  How often the task should be repeated.  What program the task needs to perform its function, and what parameters should be passed to it.  Selection parameters such as whether a report should include data on all customer nodes or only include data on a specific customer node.  Display parameters, such as whether the data included in a report is to be sorted, the sort order, and the sort sequence.

pages.title: Person Detail Form
pages.text: The Person Detail form is used to enter, view, and update a contact’s details.  Person, position, or organisation recorded in Singleview that may need to be contacted.  A contact can have multiple accounts, addresses, or other details.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Process Engine  See also Customer, Customer Contact, Primary Contact, and Secondary Contact.  The upper part of the form is used to enter personal information about the contact such as their name, gender, type, status, birth date, and the date range over which the record for that contact is to be effective.  Clicking the:  Changes button displays the Summary of Change form with changes made between the current record and the previous record.  Queries button displays the Customer Query List form, for viewing queries associated with the person record.  References button displays the Person Reference form with details of records (customers, payments, queries, and so on) that have this person assigned to them.

pages.title: Person History Form
pages.text: The Person History form is used to view a:  List of the physical records held in the Convergent Billing for the specified contact.  Person, position, or organisation recorded in Singleview that may need to be contacted.  A contact can have multiple accounts, addresses, or other details.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Process Engine  See also Customer, Customer Contact, Primary Contact, and Secondary Contact.

pages.title: Person List Form
pages.text: The Person List form is used to list contacts that match the selection criteria specified on the Person Search form.  Person, position, or organisation recorded in Singleview that may need to be contacted.  A contact can have multiple accounts, addresses, or other details.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Process Engine  See also Customer, Customer Contact, Primary Contact, and Secondary Contact.  The list entry for any contact having a status of Bad Risk is displayed as greyed-out.  Contacts having a status of Bad Risk are displayed as greyed-out on the Person List form, indicating that the contact may be unsuitable as the primary contact for a customer; it does not indicate that there are restrictions imposed on the use of that contact’s details within Convergent Billing.  A company’s business rules and practices determine whether a person having a status of Bad Risk can be assigned to a customer and/or be assigned queries.  To view details of a contact listed on the form, double-click the appropriate entry, or highlight the entry and click the Details… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed.  To create a new contact, click the New… button.  The setting of the Always Display List? option on the Person Search form determines whether this form is displayed when the search returns only a single record.  If a single contact record is returned from a search, the details of that contact are displayed on the Person Detail form.  If more than one contact record is returned, the queries are listed on the Person List form.  The required contact record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Person Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Person Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Person List form is displayed.  The form is also used when searching for a contact to assign to a customer.  To assign a specific contact listed on the form, highlight the appropriate entry and click the Assign… button.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Contact’s Details  Contact details can be searched for and viewed using different methods:  Search for, and view details of, a specific contact.  Determine, and view details of, the contacts assigned to a specific customer.  The chosen method depends on what the primary requirement is for obtaining the information.  Need more information on contacts?  Creating a New Contact  Details of a new contact must be entered on the Person Detail form, which can be accessed from the:  Customer Care menu, by selecting the Customer Care @ People @ New Person option.  Customer Detail form, by clicking the New... button on the Contact tab.  The Person Search form is displayed, for recording details for the new contact.  To record details for a new contact:  On the Person Search form, enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields.  Select the Create a new person option and click the New… button.  Convergent Billing performs a search of the database and then displays either the Person Detail or Person List form.  When the New… button on the Person Search form is clicked, Convergent Billing performs a search of the database based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Person List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Person List form; the Person Detail form is then displayed.  Any information entered on the Person Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Person Detail form.  If the Person List form is displayed, view each of the records by selecting each record in turn and clicking the Details… button.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the fields in the upper part of the Person Detail form.  Select the Address & Phone tab, and enter at least one address and one phone number.  If required, complete the fields on the Other and General tabs.  Depending on the person type selected, the General tab may not contain any fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If all mandatory fields have been completed, the details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Person Reference Form
pages.text: The Person Reference form is used to list all references to the person selected on the Person Detail form.  In particular, the list displays customer care records that have this person record assigned to them.  A person record cannot be deleted, if any other items reference that record.  If many items reference the record, using this form to display those items simplifies the deletion process.  Click the:  Assign… button to assign the selected record to another form that requires a record of this type.  Details… button to display the details of a specific reference listed on the form.

pages.title: Person Search Form
pages.text: The Person Search form is used to search for one or more contacts by specifying search criteria on the Details or Address Tab.  The Address tab is used to enter the customer’s address (either in full or in part) so that it can be used as one of the search criteria.  The fields in which to enter the customer’s address are displayed only when an address format is selected (in the Format field).  The address format determines the layout (number and type of fields) of the address.  If a customer type is selected in the Details tab, the format defaults to the address format specified in the customer type.  The Details tab is used to:  Refine the search by specifying search criteria such as effective date, official name of the contact, family name, given name, phone number, and driver’s licence number.  Enter information relevant to the contact to be created.  Any information entered is included on the Person Detail form when it is displayed in Insert mode.  By default, all records active on the date the search is performed are included in the search.  The Effective Date field can be used to search for historical records active at a specified time, or to search for future records.  A Soundex option is also included for entering a name similar to the one being searching for if the exact details are unavailable.  Selecting the:  Search for persons option enables the Search… button to search for contacts matching the specified criteria.    Create a new person option enables the New… button to create a person.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or clearing the Always Display List? and the Reuse Detail Form? check boxes.  If multiple instances of the detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several payments) the Reuse detail form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse detail form? option overrides the display of information in a new form; the details are displayed in the existing form.  If a single contact record is returned from a search, the details of that contact are displayed on the Person Detail form.  If more than one contact record is returned, the queries are listed on the Person List form.  The required contact record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Person Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Person Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Person List form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Contact's Details  Contact details can be searched for and viewed using different methods:  Search for, and view details of, a specific contact.  Determine, and view details of, the contacts assigned to a specific customer.  The chosen method depends on what the primary requirement is for obtaining the information.  Need more information on contacts?  Creating a New Contact  Details of a new contact must be entered on the Person Detail form, which can be accessed from the:  Customer Care menu, by selecting the Customer Care @ People @ New Person option.  Customer Detail form, by clicking the New... button on the Contact tab.  The Person Search form is displayed, for recording details for the new contact.  To record details for a new contact:  On the Person Search form, enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields.  Select the Create a new person option and click the New… button.  Convergent Billing performs a search of the database and then displays either the Person Detail or Person List form.  When the New… button on the Person Search form is clicked, Convergent Billing performs a search of the database based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Person List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Person List form; the Person Detail form is then displayed.  Any information entered on the Person Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Person Detail form.  If the Person List form is displayed, view each of the records by selecting each record in turn and clicking the Details… button.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the fields in the upper part of the Person Detail form.  Select the Address & Phone tab, and enter at least one address and one phone number.  If required, complete the fields on the Other and General tabs.  Depending on the person type selected, the General tab may not contain any fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If all mandatory fields have been completed, the details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  Need more information on contacts?  Updating a Contact’s Details  If sufficient update privileges are available, changes can be made to a contact record, and backdated.  To update a contact's details:  Display the appropriate Person Detail form.  Click the History button on the toolbar. The Person History form for the specified contact is displayed in View Only mode.  Examine the date ranges of the records in the list of historical records (if more than one) to determine whether an update is required to an historical, current, or future record.  If an update to an historical or future record is required, double-click the appropriate entry (the entry having the date range spanning the date to which the changes are to be backdated).  The Person Detail form is displayed with details for the specified contact record.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on update privileges and the start date of the record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  Update the person details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If all mandatory fields have been completed, the details are saved, the message 'Changes saved successfully' is displayed on the status bar, and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  Need more information on contacts?   Deleting a Contact  Rules for Deleting a Contact  A contact record can be deleted only if:  The record is not assigned as the primary contact for a customer or customer node.  Main or initial contact associated with a customer.  If more than one contact is listed for a specific customer, one of those contacts is specified as the primary contact.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Contact and Secondary Contact.  A query is not assigned to that contact.  Any customer enquiry recorded and subsequently processed is referred to as a query.  [[FigureXref:3461-1]] displays the query process.  [[Figure:3461-1]]  Query Process  A query can be recorded against a customer (existing or potential) or, more rarely, against a contact.  Recording a query against a contact is used to accurately record information reported by customers, and for an organisation to obtain statistical information on the types of inquiry being handled and the frequency of each type.  A query must first be recorded (usually by the person who deals directly with the customer making the enquiry) and then either resolved immediately or forwarded electronically to a work group to be resolved.  The act of forwarding the query to a work group is referred to as progressing the query.  If the designated work group cannot resolve the query, or can only provide a partial answer, that work group progresses (forwards) the query to another work group.  Progression continues until the initial query is resolved and a response is made to the customer.  The progression of a query from creation to resolution, using one or more work groups, is referred to as the query workflow.  [[FigureXref:3461-2]] displays the query progression.  [[Figure:3461-2]]  Query Progression  Query workflow ensures that each query is resolved in the fastest possible time and in the most efficient manner, regardless of the query type.  While a query remains unresolved, it is regarded as being open.  Until it is resolved, it is regarded as being closed.  When a query is forwarded to a work group, that work group actually receives a copy of the query and uses the copy as their ‘working’ document.  The ‘working’ document is referred to as a progression and is used to record any actions taken by the work group and, where possible, the solution to the original query.  Document used to record the actions taken by a work group to resolve a query.  If the query cannot be resolved by the current work group, that work group adds resolution text to the progression before forwarding the query to another work group.    Each progression therefore contains progress text (detailing the actions taken by a previous work group) and resolution text (detailing the actions performed by the current work group to resolve the query).  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progress Text, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  If the query cannot be resolved by the nominated work group, that work group adds text to the progression (known as resolution text) stating what actions were taken and what progress was made, and forwards a copy of the progression to the next work group.  The resolution text copied from the previous progression becomes the progress text on which the new work group bases its actions.  The process of forwarding a copy of a progression to the next work group continues until a work group can resolve the query.  At this point, a copy of the text stating how the query can be resolved is recorded against the original query and the query is deemed to be closed.  The query workflow mechanism ensures that each progression and the original query are retained and can be viewed.  Text on which a work group bases its actions.  The progress text is created as resolution text by the previous work group before progressing the query to the current work group.  For the initial progression, the progress text is a copy of the query text.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progression, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  Text added to a progression by a work group.  If this work group has not resolved the query, the resolution text becomes the progress text for the next work group.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress Text, Progression, and Query Text.  The contact is not in use in the date range specified.  A contact can be assigned to more than one customer record (as a primary or secondary contact).  Each primary contact assignment must be removed before the specified contact record can be deleted.  Person, other than the primary contact, assigned as an additional contact for a customer.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Customer Contact and Primary Contact.  To delete a contact record:  View the appropriate Person Detail form.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Specify the date from which to delete the contact.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, the date and time.  Click the Yes button to delete the contact record.  To cancel the request to delete the specified contact, click the No or Cancel button.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Print Selection Form
pages.text: The Print Selection form is used to:  Define settings for printing Convergent Billing configuration information.  Browse for a specific printer.  Set margins, and to enlarge or reduce the size of the configuration diagram.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Diagram of the Configuration  To display a diagram of the configuration for the object selected in the left-hand panel:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Select an object.  The diagram is displayed in the right-hand panel of the form.  To view the configuration object's:  Properties, select the Explorer @ Properties View option.  Contents, select the Explorer @ Grid View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Viewing the Properties of a Configuration Object  To view the properties of a configuration object:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Properties View option.  Click the relevant object.  Click in the second level of the hierarchy, then select the relevant object from the third level to display that object's properties in the right-hand panel.  The properties can also be viewed by right-clicking on the relevant object and selecting Properties.  To view a configuration object's:  Diagram of the properties, select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Contents, select the Explorer @ Grid View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Viewing the Items Referenced by a Configuration Object  To display the items referenced by a configuration object:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Grid View option.  Right-click on the configuration object and select References.  The References form with the items referenced by the selected object is displayed in the right-hand panel of the form in grid view.  To view the configuration object's references in diagram view, select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?   Viewing the Contents of a Configuration Object  To view the contents of a configuration object:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select Explorer @ Grid View option.  The contents of the object are displayed in the right-hand panel.  When viewing a grid, objects can be expanded or collapsed by double-clicking the object in the right-hand panel.  To view the configuration object's:  Diagram, select the Explorer @ Diagram View option.  References to the object are displayed to the left of the object.  Properties in a grid format, select the Explorer @ Properties View option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Modifying the Presentation of Configuration Information  To change how configuration information is displayed:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer option, then the appropriate method of displaying the configuration information (Grid View, Diagram View, or Properties View).  Selecting Properties View displays the properties of the selected configuration object in a grid format.  When viewing a grid, each object can be expanded or collapsed by double-clicking the object in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Modifying the Configuration Details  To modify configuration details:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer option, then the appropriate method of displaying the configuration information (Grid View, Diagram View, or Properties View).  Navigate to the relevant entity by expanding or collapsing the view.  Highlight the entity, click the right mouse button, and select the Detail… option.  Use the Insert, Update, or Delete buttons on the toolbar to modify the configuration.  The buttons are only enabled if appropriate security settings are available.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Modifying the Explorer Options  To modify the Configuration Explorer options:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Options... option.  The Explorer Options form is displayed.  Modify the relevant options and click OK.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?  Viewing the Explorer Legend  To view the explorer legend:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select the Explorer @ Legend... option.  The Explorer Legend form is displayed.  To view a specific entity, folder type, or icon, right-click on the relevant object and select the appropriate option.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?
