The Convergent Billing Configuration form is displayed, and the Explorer option is added to the menu bar.  Select Explorer @ Diagram View option.  Select the relevant diagram.  Right-click on the diagram and select Print Diagram.  The Print Selection form is displayed.  Enter the required printer selections and click OK.  Need more information on Configuration Explorer?

pages.title: Product Definition Form
pages.text:
The Product Definition form is used to enter, view, and update details of a product definition. Combination of product components that form a specific type of product. Individual product instances based on the product type or definition can be created. Context: Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Configuration Studio See also Base Product, Product, Product Component, and Product Offer. The upper part of the form displays basic details about the definition such as its name, description, and period for which it is applicable. The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering and viewing more specific product definition details: Settings The Settings tab provides drop-down lists for selecting: Default work force to handle any queries that may result from using the product Initial status of the product Icon to be used to identify the product Product entity validation, used to override the display options for the selected product definition. Service and equipment entity validation, used to override the display options for the selected services and equipment. The Settings tab is also used to specify whether this is a base or companion product. For companion products, the tab is used to specify if more than one active instance of the same companion product can be assigned to a single base product. Services The fields on the Services tab are used to identify the service types and associated equipment types required for this product. The upper part identifies the service types and the lower part the equipment types. For a base product the mandatory status of the equipment types and service types is determined by its minimum and maximum ranges. The number of instances of the minimum range indicates the number of equipment or services that are mandatory, a zero minimum range indicates that the equipment or service is not mandatory. The range between the minimum and maximum ranges indicate the number of optional equipment or services that are available. The default values for the minimum and maximum ranges is 1. At least one service type must be assigned for each product. Tariffs The fields on the Tariffs tab are used to define tariffs and associated charge categories so they are made available in each instance of the product for each service. Tariffs can appear only once in the grid. Real-time tariffs associated with entitlements are displayed in the Tariff field. These tariffs cannot be changed in the Tariffs tab. Subtotals The fields on the Subtotals tab are used to define the subtotals to be made available in each instance of the product for each service. Tariffs should not be included in the list of subtotals; a separate tab is provided for tariffs. The following columns are available: Subtotal, which is used to specify the name of each subtotal defined for the product. Specify every defined subtotal, even though each product instance may require only a subset of the available subtotals. The subtotals used by any one product instance depend on the service types selected and the eligibility of each subtotal. Default Invoice Text, which is optional, for specifying text to be displayed on an invoice for each calculated subtotal. Any text entered in this field overrides the default text defined for the subtotal. GL Code, which is optional, for specifying the GL code to be associated with the subtotal value. By default, the code displayed in this field is that specified for the subtotal. The specified code can be overridden with another or removed from the field. The use of the GL code specified on this tab is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance. Compatibility The fields on the Compatibility tab are used to specify companion products that are compatible with the base product, and can be used in product offers associated with the base product. If products are added on this tab for a companion product, the product is not available to product offers. Facility Groups The fields on the Facility Groups tab is used to identify facility groups that have been defined for the product, whether those facility groups should be included as standard, and whether each facility group is available. Identifying a facility group means identifying the facilities provided by the facility group. If facility groups are defined correctly, some facility groups can be offered as standard and some as optional, depending on the facilities that each facility group provides. Derived Attribute Tables (Lists) The fields on the Derived Attribute Tables (Lists) tab are used to identify each of the derived attributes to be included in the product definition. A table row is inserted for each derived attribute to be included. Payment Items The fields on the Payment Items tab is used to: Identify payment items to be included in the product definition. Specify expressions that evaluate to the amount and label to be associated with the payment. The tab is displayed only for base products because payment items can only be defined for base products. Offer Tables The Offer Tables tab defines the derived attribute tables used to store pricing data for companion products associated with product offers. A derived attribute table may be shared by more than one companion product. The tab is displayed only if the Companion Product check box is selected. Entitlement Types The Entitlement Types tab defines the entitlement types available for use with a companion product (see the Customer Care and Product Configuration Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing). Changes to the tab are reflected on the Tariffs tab, with the list of real-time tariffs associated with the product automatically updated to match the tariffs specified by the current entitlement types. The tab is only displayed if the Companion Product check box is selected. Entitlement types are configuration objects that are delivered as part of an implementation, and are not expected to be updated by the service provider, and are created and maintained in Configuration Studio. The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title. A form can be displayed in one of the following modes: Form Mode Description View Only mode Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified). Insert mode Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing. Update mode Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified). To change the form mode: Current Form Mode New Form Mode Click the … View Only mode Update mode Update button Update mode View Only mode Save or Cancel button View Only mode Insert mode Insert button Insert mode View Only mode Save button Associated Actions Viewing a Product Definition To view a product definition: Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option. The Product Definition Search form is displayed. Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method. Click the Search button. A list of product definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed. Select the appropriate product definition and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate product definition. The Product Definition form is displayed in View Only mode. Need more information on products? Defining a Base Product To define a base product: Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option. The Product Definition Search form is displayed. Click the New... button. The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode. Complete the appropriate data entry fields in the upper part of the form. If a required component was not defined while specifying the product definition, define it and then return to creating the product definition. Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the Settings tab. Select each of the other tabs in turn and complete the data entry fields or table rows as required. Specifying Service Types and Equipment Types Specifying Tariffs Specifying Subtotals Specifying Compatible Products Specifying Facility Groups Specifying List Types Click the Save button on the toolbar. Perform the necessary post-product definition tasks. Need more information on products? Defining a Companion Product To define a companion product: Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option. The Product Definition Search form is displayed. Click the New... button. The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode. In the upper part of the form, enter the name of the companion product, its description, and the period for which it is to be in effect. Complete the appropriate fields on the Settings tab, and ensure that the Companion Product? option is selected. Complete the appropriate fields on the Tariffs tab, Subtotals tab, and optionally, the Compatibility tab, Derived Attribute Tables (Lists) tab, Offer Tables tab, and Entitlement Types tab. The Offer Tables tab defines the derived attribute tables used to store pricing data for companion products associated with product offers. A derived attribute table may be shared by more than one companion product. The tab is displayed only if the Companion Product check box is selected. Click the Save button on the toolbar. Perform the appropriate post-product definition tasks. Need more information on products? Updating a Product Definition Information in a product definition cannot be changed if it will invalidate product instances based on that product definition. Effect of Updating Product Components on Product Instances Product Component Effect of Update on Product Instances Tariffs Available immediately. Used next time events are rated. Example of how changing a tariff can adversely affect charges. When updating a product definition, the following changes cannot be made: Removing service or equipment types Increasing service or equipment type minimum values Decreasing service or equipment type maximum values Adding new service or equipment types to product definitions with a minimum
value > 0. Changing a tariff outside of the start/end date of the bill period. Changes to a tariff should be restricted to the start or end of a bill period, ensuring that charges are billed correctly. The following is an example of when a tariff is changed in the middle of a bill cycle. Product 1 is effective 01/01/00 to 15/01/02 and contains Tariff 1. Product 1 is effective 16/01/01 to end of time and contains Tariff 2. If the product is sold to a customer on 01/01/01 and the bill run is scheduled for 30/01/01, the charges for the bill run are based on Tariff 2. The bill run picks up the tariff that is effective at the time of the bill run and bases charges for the billing period on that tariff. Charge Categories Existing charge categories available immediately. Additional charge categories only available if the server process to update charge categories is run. Subtotals Available immediately. Used next time rated events are aggregated. Service Types Updating not permitted if product instances exist. Equipment Types Updating not permitted if product instances exist. Facility Groups Available to existing product instances, but only when product instance is itself updated. Facilities Available immediately in facility groups if the facility is used in a product instance. Derived Attributes Existing derived attributes available immediately. Additional derived attributes only available if the process to update lists is run. Product Group None. Product Icon Available immediately. Product Compatibility None. Payment Items None. Limitations when updating a product definition To update a product definition: Define any new product components, or modify product components required in the updated product. View the appropriate product definition. Click the Update button on the toolbar. The Product Definition form is displayed in Update mode. Update the product definition details as required. Click the Save button on the toolbar. Notify the system or billing administrator that a product has been updated. For the updated product to be available in the next rating/billing operation, some server tasks must be performed. Need more information on products? Deleting a Product Definition Deleting a product definition invalidates product instances based on that product definition. To delete a product definition: View the appropriate product definition. Click the Delete button of the toolbar. When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product definition is to be deleted. Need more information on products?

Updating a Product Definition Information in a product definition cannot be changed if it will invalidate product instances based on that product definition. Effect of Updating Product Components on Product Instances Product Component Effect of Update on Product Instances Tariffs Available immediately. Used next time events are rated. Example of how changing a tariff can adversely affect charges. When updating a product definition, the following changes cannot be made: Removing service or equipment types Increasing service or equipment type minimum values Decreasing service or equipment type maximum values Adding new service or equipment types to product definitions with a minimum
value > 0. Changing a tariff outside of the start/end date of the bill period. Changes to a tariff should be restricted to the start or end of a bill period, ensuring that charges are billed correctly. The following is an example of when a tariff is changed in the middle of a bill cycle. Product 1 is effective 01/01/00 to 15/01/02 and contains Tariff 1. Product 1 is effective 16/01/01 to end of time and contains Tariff 2. If the product is sold to a customer on 01/01/01 and the bill run is scheduled for 30/01/01, the charges for the bill run are based on Tariff 2. pages.title: Product Group Definition Form
pages.text: The Product Group Definition form is used to enter, view, and update a product group.  Base products can be grouped to allow related products to be located more easily when assigning products to customers.  Each product group is displayed on a separate 'tab' section on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Used in Customer Management for filtering the Product Catalogue.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Configuration Studio  See also Base Product.  The upper part of the form is used to view or enter details about the product group such as its name, description, and effective dates.  The lower part of the form displays a product table, listing products defined as part of the specified group.  The order in which the products are listed determines the order in which those products’ icons are displayed when the specified product group is displayed.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Product Group  To view a product group:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Group Definition option.  The Product Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of product groups matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate product group and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate product group.  The Product Group Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on product groups?  Defining a Product Group  To define a product group:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Group Definition option.  The Product Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Product Group Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the name, description, start date and, if required, the end date, for the new product group.  Select the first row in the product table, click the Insert button on the toolbar, and select the product to be added to the group from the drop-down list.  Repeat step 4 for any other products to be added to the product group.  If the wrong product is inserted, select the appropriate table row and click the Delete button on the toolbar.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product groups?  Modifying a Product Group  A product group can be modified at any stage after it is defined by:  Adding a product to a group.  Removing a product that is no longer required.  Moving a product to another group.  Modifying the group details (for example, name, description, and effective dates).  Need more information on product groups?  Deleting a Product Group  To delete a product group:  View the appropriate product group.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product group is to be deleted.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Product Offer Definition Form
pages.text: The Product Offer Definition form is used to enter, view, and update details of a product offer.  The upper part of the form displays basic details about the definition such as its name, description, tenant, and period for which it is available for sale.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering and viewing more specific product definition details:  Details  The Details tab provides drop-down lists and check boxes for defining basic configuration of the product offer. Basic configuration can include:  Product offer as a top-level offer  Base product associated with the product offer  Display settings when selected in the Product Instance Detail form  Category and sub-category to which the product offer belongs  Restricting the product offer for use with specific services or customer types.  Companion Products  The Companion Products tab is used to select one or more compatible companion products to be added to the product offer, and configure offer-specific settings. Configuration can include derived attribute tables, entity validation and whether the companion product is to be mandatory or optional.  Optional companion products can be configured to be selected by default when the parent product offer is ordered. The minimum and maximum numbers of optional companion products that must be selected when the product offer is sold can also be configured on this tab.  Child Offers  The Child Offers tab is used to select one or more child product offers to be added to the current product offer.   Optional child product offers can be configured to be selected by default when the parent product offer is ordered. The minimum and maximum numbers of optional child product offers that must be selected when the product offer is sold can also be configured on this tab.  Service Types  The Service Types tab is used to select one or more services to which the product offer is restricted.   The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  View a Product Offer  To view a product offer:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Offers option.  The Product Offer Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of product offers matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate product offer and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate product offer.  The Product Offer Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on product offers?  Define a Product Offer  Product offers can be created manually, or copied from an existing product offer and modified.  To define a product offer:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Offers option. The Product Offer Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Product Offer Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter name, display name, description, start date, and if required, end date for the new product offer.  If required, enter a code in the Stock Keeping Unit field, so the product offer can be quickly searched for.  If the product offer is a top-level offer, select the Top-Level Offer? check box.   Select a base product to associate with the offer.  If the product offer is not a top-level offer, and:  If the product offer is to be associated with a specific service, select the Service Specific? check box.  If the product offer is to be hidden when a product is sold to a customer, select the Hidden? check box.  If required, select a category and sub-category for the product offer.  If required, select a customer type to which the product offer is restricted.  Add companion products.  Add child product offers, if required.  A product offer must contain at least one component; that is, either a companion product or child product offer.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?  Add a Base Product to a Product Offer  A base product can be added only to top-level product offers, and only one base product can be added to each product offer.  To add a base product to a product offer:  Modify the appropriate product offer.  Select the Top-Level Offer? check box.  Select the product from the Base Product drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?  Add a Companion Product to a Product Offer  To be available for adding to a product offer, a companion product must be added to the compatibility list for the base product associated with the top-level product offer in the hierarchy.  To add a companion product to a product offer:  Edit the appropriate product offer.  Select the Companion Products tab.  If the base product is associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to view and change the status of companion product instances selected for this base product instance. Companion product instances are added using the Offer tab and can be created before the product instance has been completed.  Any companion instances created on an incomplete product instance receive the initial status of Product Creation.  If the base product is not associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to select one or more companion products to be added to this instance of the base product. The available companion products are defined when the product on which this instance is based, is defined. Companion products can be added to this tab only when the product instance is completed.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, select the product to be added to the offer from the Companion Product drop-down list, and select either Yes or No from the Mandatory drop-down list.  If a companion product is configured as mandatory, it is automatically assigned with the product offer.  If the companion product has a derived attribute table associated with it, edit the derived attribute table.  Any derived attribute tables configured in the companion product definition as mandatory must be populated with at least one row.  Repeat steps 3 and 4 for other companion products to be added to the product offer.  Enter a minimum and maximum number of companion products that must be selected when the product offer is sold.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?  Add a Child Product Offer to a Product Offer  To add a child product offer to a product offer:  View the appropriate product offer and select Update.  Click on the Child Offers tab.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, and select the product offer to be added from the Child Product Offer drop-down list.  Enter the minimum number of optional child product offers in the Offer Min field.  The child product offer is mandatory if the value is greater than or equal to 1.  If a child product offer is mandatory, it is automatically assigned with the product offer and its availability period is ignored.  If a child product offer is optional, it is available for sale with the parent offer, if the current date is within the availability period.  Enter the maximum number of optional child product offers in the Offer Max field.  Offer Max must be greater than or equal to both, Offer Min and 1.  For Offer Max to be 2 or greater, the child product offer must have at least one mandatory companion product. That is, either the minimum number of companion products is greater than or equal to 1, or at least one of the companion products is mandatory.  For optional child product offers, complete the Available Start Date and Available End Date fields as required.  Repeat steps 3 to 6 for any other child product offers to be added.  Enter a minimum and maximum number of child product offers which must be selected when the top-level product offer is sold.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the product offers in the child product offer table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the product offers are listed determines the order in which they are displayed in the tree pane on the Offers tab of the Product Instance Detail form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?  Modify a Product Offer  A product offer can be updated to:  Add or remove optional companion products.  Add or remove child product offers.  Modify availability dates for the product offer and other attributes of the product offer.  Modify derived attributes associated with a companion product, for a date range in the future.  The Product Offer Detail view in Business & Administration Studio can be used to perform these updates.  It is also possible to view product offers and perform some operations on product offers using the Product Offer Editor in Configuration Studio.  To modify a product offer:  View the appropriate product offer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Offer Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the product offer details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?  Delete a Product Offer  A product offer cannot be deleted if it is:  A child of another product offer.  Referenced by a current product instance.  To delete a product offer:  View the appropriate product offer.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product offer is to be deleted.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Product Instance Detail Form
pages.text: The Product Instance Detail form is used to enter, view, and update details about a product instance.  Specific combination of services and the associated tariff structure offered to a customer based on the framework provided by the corresponding product definition.  The original product definition is preserved, with the product instance being tailored to a specific customer's requirements.  Any changes made to the product definition affect only product instances created after the changes are made, not existing product instances.  Referred to as a Purchased Product in Customer Management.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Product Definition and Product Model.  The upper part of the form displays the product name, status of this instance of the product, and start and end dates (where relevant).  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering more specific details:  Detail  The Detail tab of the Product Instance Detail form lists items that must be created for the specified product.  Typically, this tab lists the service types for which a service must be created and any associated equipment types.  An item of each type listed on this tab must be completed before the product instance is complete and made active.  The following buttons can be used:  Create… button to create a service of the required service type.  Enabled only when one of the service types is selected.  Allocate… button to allocate an existing item of equipment to the specified service.  Enabled only when one of the equipment types is selected.  Add Service… button to select an optional service.  Enabled only when there are optional services available.  Add Equipment… button to select an optional equipment item.  Enabled only when optional equipment items are available.  Details… button to view more details on the equipment or service.  The information on this tab displays the current status of each component of the product instance.  Offers (available if the base product is associated with a product offer)  The Offers tab is used to:  View details about the product offers and companion products associated with the product instance.  Add new product offers or companion products to the current product instance.  Add another instance of the selected offer node and its children to the current product instance.  Move companion product instances between compatible product offers.  Facility Groups (available if the base product is not associated with a product offer)  The Facility Groups tab is used to:  Select one or more of the facility groups to be used by this instance of the current base product (and companion products if any have been added to the base product).  Enter details required by that facility group for the current product instance.  The available facility groups are defined when the product (on which this instance is based) is defined.  Facility groups are listed on this tab only when the product instance is completed.  Companion Products  If the base product is associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to view and change the status of companion product instances selected for this base product instance. Companion product instances are added using the Offer tab and can be created before the product instance has been completed.  Any companion instances created on an incomplete product instance receive the initial status of Product Creation.  If the base product is not associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to select one or more companion products to be added to this instance of the base product. The available companion products are defined when the product on which this instance is based, is defined. Companion products can be added to this tab only when the product instance is completed.  Upgrade/Move Details  The Upgrade/Move Details tab is used to:  Replace the current base product (on which this instance is based) with an alternative, compatible base product.  The compatible base products are defined when the product (on which this instance is based) is defined.  View details of any product moves.  Industry  The Industry tab is used to display other fields to provide additional (general) information about this product instance, if configured.  General  The General tab displays other fields to provide additional (general) information about this product instance.    If fields are present on this tab, they should be completed.  The lower part of the form is also used to:  View and enter details of any new up-front charges required before the product instance can be activated (using the New Up-Front Charge… button).  View details of the customer associated with the product instance (using the Customer Details… button),  View changes made to the product instance record (using the Changes… button).  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  A product instance is considered complete if all required service and equipment information has been entered.  Only completed product instances can be made active (that is, available for use and inclusion in a bill cycle).  Associated Actions  Viewing a Product Instance  To view summary information about each product instance:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select Products or Companion Products options from the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance associated with the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on products?  Creating a Product Instance  Products are typically implemented with product offers, to simplify product configuration and product instance creation.   If a Product Offer drop-down list is not displayed on the Product Instance Detail form, the product is not associated with a product offer.  In this case, follow procedure 2 to create the product instance.  Procedure 1  To create a product instance from a product associated with a product offer:  Assign a product to a customer or customer node.  Select a product offer to use with the product instance. The Offer tab is displayed.  Expand the Offer Hierarchy tree, if required.  Select optional child product offers and companion products by ticking the check boxes beside their entry in the tree. Mandatory child product offers and companion products will be selected automatically.  Placement of a companion product in the tree may affect the charges and entitlements configured for the product. Check configuration in the Companion Products tab to ensure that the desired settings are available.  Click the Apply Changes button. The Companion Products tab is displayed.  Select each of the companion products displayed, and add any further configuration information required.  Allocate equipment to each service (where required).  Create the required services.  One service must be created before the product instance is complete and can become active.  If required, select one or more of the available optional product components.  If required, select one or more of the available lists on the Customer Detail or Service Detail forms and create list items for each of those lists.  To save the product instance, click the Save button on the toolbar.  Procedure 2  To create a product instance from a product not associated with a product offer:  Assign a product to a customer or customer node.  Allocate required equipment to each service.  Create the required services.  One service must be created before the product instance is complete and can become active.  If required, select one or more of the available optional product components.  If required, select one or more of the available facility groups.  If required, select one or more of the available companion products.  If required, select one or more of the available lists on the Customer Detail or Service Detail forms and create list items for each of those lists.  If required, record any up-front charges associated with the product.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on products?  Modify a Product Instance  A product instance can be modified by:  Changing its status by activating, suspending, cancelling, and reactivating the instance.  Changing the product offer that the product instance is associated with.  Changing the status of a specific service within the product instance, by activating, suspending, temporarily disconnecting, cancelling, and reactivating a service.  Changing the status of a facility group, by activating, suspending, cancelling, and reactivating the facility group.  Adding one or more of the available facility groups.  Changing the status of a companion product.  Adding one or more of the available companion products.  Changing (upgrading or downgrading) the base product.  Need more information on products?  Deleting a Product Instance  A product instance can only be removed/deleted if it has a status of Product Creation.  If a product instance is not in this state, deleting a product instance is identical to cancelling that instance.  To delete an incomplete product instance (a product instance with a status of Product Creation):  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, specify the date from which to delete the product instance.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, the date and time.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product instance is to be deleted.  The product instance and all associated services are deleted.  Need more information on products? Product instances that are created as part of a product offer, or have been previously moved, upgraded, or cancelled, cannot be upgraded.  To upgrade a product:  View the appropriate product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  The From Product button is enabled if the product was merged or is the result of an upgrade.   The To Product button is only enabled if the product instance was previously upgraded.   Clicking the From Product button displays details of the product from which the product instance being viewed was upgraded or moved.    Clicking the To Product button displays details of the product to which the product instance being viewed was upgraded or moved.  Click the Upgrade button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the product to which the current product instance is to be upgraded.  Select the Detail tab and, if necessary, update the services required to make the new product instance active.  Complete the appropriate fields on the Facility Groups and Companion Product tabs for the upgraded product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more Information about products?  Creating a Service  To create a service:  View the relevant product instance.  Highlight one of the service types listed.  Click the Create… button.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the Yes button to continue creating the service with the specified dates.  The Service Detail form is displayed.  If the dates are not correct, click the No or Cancel button to return to the Product Instance Detail form to change the dates.  Complete the form for the selected service.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  To allocate an optional service to the product instance, click the Add Service… button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, the Optional Product Component form is closed, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 2 to 6 for each additional component to be allocated to the product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?  Viewing a Service  To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?  Move Companion Product Instances between Product Offers  The companion product must be associated with the origin and destination product offers.  To move a companion product instance from one product offer node to another:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click on the Offers tab.  Ensure that both the origin and destination product offer nodes are visible.  Hold down the CTRL key and drag and drop the instance to the target offer node.  To drag and drop product instances:   Select the product instances and hold down the left mouse button.  Move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Release the mouse button to drop the product instance onto the target node.  As the product instances are dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Click the Continue button.  The Move Progress form is displayed.  Need more information on product offers?  Remove a Companion Product Instance from a Product Offer  To remove a companion product instance from a product offer node:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click on the Offers tab.  Expand the product offer node.  Deselect the check box next to the companion product instance being removed. All instances of the companion product in that node are removed.  Click the Apply Changes button.  To remove a single companion product instance from a product offer node containing more than one instance of the companion product:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click the Companion Products tab.  Do either of the following:  Delete the record by selecting it and clicking the Delete button.  Cancel the product instance by selecting Cancelled in the Status drop-down list.  Need more information on product offers?  Change the Service Associated with a Product Offer  Changing the service for any child in the same service-specific sub-tree changes it for all product offers and companion products in the sub-tree. However, only the offer node at the top of the sub-tree is assigned to the service.  To change the service associated with a product offer:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click on the Offers tab.   Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select the product offer to be updated.  Select the required service in the Service Specific drop-down list.  Click on the Apply Changes button.  Need more information on product offers?  Associate a Service with a Product Offer  A service can be associated with a product offer if the offer is:  Not a top-level offer  Configured as a service-specific offer  To associate a service with a product offer:  Display the Product Offer Definition form.  Ensure that the Service Specific? checkbox is selected.  Select a service from the Service drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Product Upgrade: Allocation Form
pages.text: The Product Upgrade: Allocation form is used to allocate service and equipment components from one product instance (source product instance) to another (target product instance).  Optional services and equipment can also be added to the target product instance.  Specific combination of services and the associated tariff structure offered to a customer based on the framework provided by the corresponding product definition.  The original product definition is preserved, with the product instance being tailored to a specific customer's requirements.  Any changes made to the product definition affect only product instances created after the changes are made, not existing product instances.  Referred to as a Purchased Product in Customer Management.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Product Definition and Product Model.  The upper part of the form displays the source product instance service and equipment components.  The lower part of the form displays service and equipment components allocated to the target product instance.  The form is used when:  Splitting a multi-service source product instance into two or more separate target product instances  Merging two or more separate source product instances into a single multi-service target product instance  Upgrading products.  The form provides options, using buttons in the lower part of the form, to:  Allocate source product instance components to the target product instance.  Allocate selected components.  De-allocate selected components.  Individual components can also be dragged from the source product instance and dropped onto the equivalent target product instance component.  Associated Actions  Splitting a Product Instance Manually  Notes and Restrictions  The following terminology is used in the procedures given for splitting and merging product instances:  Source product instance (from which services or equipment are to be allocated)  Target product instance (to which services and equipment in the source product instance are allocated).  A product instance can only be split or merged if:  It was not created as part of a product offer.  Update security privileges for the Product Instance Detail form are available.  Compatible base products are available.  The product is configured to allow splitting or merging.  To split a product instance manually:  View the appropriate (source) product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab and click the Update button.  The Upgrade button on the tab is enabled.  Click the Upgrade button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the target product.  Select the target product from the drop-down list and click the Yes button.  The Product Upgrade: Allocation form is displayed.  To allocate all source product instance components, click the Allocate All button.  All components in the source product instance are allocated to the specified target product instance.  The Upgrade Status field for each of these components is now set to Used.  To allocate individual source product components, select one of the source product instance components and the equivalent target product instance component and click the Allocate button.  The Upgrade Status field for this component is now set to Used.  Repeat this procedure for each component required by the target product instance.  If a component is incorrectly allocated, select it and click the Deallocate button.  Click the Done button.  A message is displayed to:  Indicate the number of source product instance components allocated and the number of components still to be allocated.  Prompt whether the remaining components should be allocated to another product instance.  Click the Yes button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the next target product instance.  Repeat steps 4 to 7 for the next target product instance.  When all components of the source product instance have been allocated, the source product instance is split and each of the target product instances are saved with their new components.  On completion of the split, the source product instance is cancelled when each of the target product instances becomes active.  Need more information about products?  Splitting a Product Instance Automatically  Notes and Restrictions  The following terminology is used in the procedures given for splitting and merging product instances:  Source product instance (from which services or equipment are to be allocated)  Target product instance (to which services and equipment in the source product instance are allocated).  A product instance can only be split or merged if:  It was not created as part of a product offer.  Update security privileges for the Product Instance Detail form are available.  Compatible base products are available.  The product is configured to allow splitting or merging.  To split a product instance automatically:  View the appropriate (source) product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab and click the Update button.  The Upgrade button on the tab is now enabled.  Click the Upgrade button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the target product.  Select the target product from the drop-down list and click the Yes button.  A further message is displayed to:  Indicate the number of source product instance components allocated and components still to be allocated.  Specify whether to allocate the remaining components to another product instance.  Click the Yes button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the next target product instance.  Select the target product instance from the drop-down list and click the Yes button.  Repeat steps 4 to 6 until the product split is complete.  On completion, the Product Instance Detail form is displayed in View Only mode for the last target product instance.  On completion of the split, the source product instance is cancelled when each of the target product instances becomes active.  Need more information about products?  Merging a Product Instance  Notes and Restrictions  The following terminology is used in the procedures given for splitting and merging product instances:  Source product instance (from which services or equipment are to be allocated)  Target product instance (to which services and equipment in the source product instance are allocated).  A product instance can only be split or merged if:  It was not created as part of a product offer.  Update security privileges for the Product Instance Detail form are available.  Compatible base products are available.  The product is configured to allow splitting or merging.  To merge a product instance:  Assign the target product to the appropriate customer by dragging the product icon onto the customer listed in the Customer Hierarchy form.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed.  On the Detail tab, select one of the service component entries and click the Allocate button.  A message is displayed prompting for confirmation that the product dates are correct.  Click the Yes button.  A list of services associated with product instances of the specified product type assigned to this customer is displayed on the Service List form.  Select the service to be merged into the target product instance and click the Assign button.  The Product Upgrade: Allocation form is displayed.  The selected service component is allocated to the target product instance.  Either allocate all the source product instance components to the target product instance or allocate individual source product instance components.  To allocate all source product instance components, click the Allocate All button.  All components in the source product instance are allocated to the specified target product instance.  The Upgrade Status field for each of these components is now set to 'Used'.  To allocate individual source product components, select one of the source product instance components and the equivalent target product instance component and click the Allocate button.  The Upgrade Status field for this component is now set to 'Used'.  Repeat this procedure for each component required by the target product instance.  If a component is incorrectly allocated, select it and click the Deallocate button.  Click the Done button.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed for the target product instance.  To perform a full merge, repeat steps 2 to 6 for each of the other services required by the target product instance, then save the target product instance.  The Status field of the target product instance is now set to 'Active'; the source product instances are set to 'Cancelled'.  To perform a partial merge, create each of the other services required by the target product instance, allocate equipment (where necessary), then save the target product instance.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Profile Definition Form
pages.text: The Profile Definition form is used to view, define, and update profile definitions.  Set of attributes to control a user's access to, and usage of, elements of Convergent Billing and Process Engine.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Process Engine, Configuration Studio  See also Access Level, Permission, Security Group, User, Form Role, and Work Group.  The upper part of the form is used to enter general details about the profile.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs allowing more specific details to be displayed or entered:  Access Level  The Access Level tab contains a set of check boxes that define access rights to Convergent Billing for users assigned the profile.   Security Group  The Security Group tab contains a grid specifying the groups to which users with this profile belong.  The primary security group is added to this grid automatically.  The Access Level Settings button is used to select the access levels the user should have to data belonging to each security group.  Work Group  The Work Group tab contains a grid specifying the work groups to which users with this profile belong.  The Access Level Settings button is used to select the access levels the user should have to queries for each work group.  Form Role  The Form Role tab contains a grid specifying the form roles assigned to users with this profile.  Function Role  The Function Role tab contains a grid specifying the user-defined functions that are accessible to users with this profile.  Oracle Profile  The Oracle Profile tab is visible only if the Maintain Oracle Profile? check box is selected.  An Oracle profile is created with the same name as the Convergent Billing profile name.  The name must conform to Oracle's profile naming requirements:  All characters uppercase   First character in the set [A-Z]  Subsequent characters in the set [A-Z, _, 0-9].  The Password Attributes group defines failed attempts to log in, and life time (days) and password reuse.  The Reuse Max field is not visible until the Enable Password Reuse? field is selected.  General  The General tab is used to add new fields to the Profile Definition form using entity validation.  Used to customise fields, add fields to generic forms, validate fields and forms, and add field security.  It can also be used to customise an entity's data model using derived non-stored attribute types, attribute display labels, attribute interface labels, and custom key field functions.   Entity validation is used in conjunction with reference types, attribute types, lookup functions and context-sensitive help.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Attribute Type and Reference Type.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Profile  To view a profile definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Security @ Profiles option.  The Profile Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of profile definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate profile definition and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate profile definition. The Profile Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on security?  Defining a Profile  To define a profile definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Security @ Profiles option.  The Profile Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Profile Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on security?  Updating a Profile  To update a profile definition:  View the appropriate profile definition.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Profile Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the profile definition details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on security?  Deleting a Profile  To delete a profile definition:  View the appropriate profile definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the profile is to be deleted.  Need more information on security?

pages.title: Profile Search Form
pages.text: The Profile Search form is used to search for one or more profiles, using a specific field, criteria, and method.  Set of attributes to control a user's access to, and usage of, elements of Convergent Billing and Process Engine.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Process Engine, Configuration Studio  See also Access Level, Permission, Security Group, User, Form Role, and Work Group.  The lower part of the form is used to list profiles returned by the search that matches the specified criteria.  Multiple instances of the form can be displayed by clearing the Reuse form? check box.  If multiple instances of the form are required for display (for example, to access details for several account types), do not select the Reuse form? check box.  If selected, the Reuse form? check box overrides display of information in a new form, and details are displayed in the existing form.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Profile  To view a profile definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Security @ Profiles option.  The Profile Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of profile definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate profile definition and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate profile definition. The Profile Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on security?  Defining a Profile  To define a profile definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Security @ Profiles option.  The Profile Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Profile Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on security?  Updating a Profile  To update a profile definition:  View the appropriate profile definition.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Profile Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the profile definition details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on security?  Deleting a Profile  To delete a profile definition:  View the appropriate profile definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the profile is to be deleted.  Need more information on security?

pages.title: Properties Form
pages.text: The following properties of a data entry form can be viewed (and if required, modified):  Security group to which the data in the form belongs  Name of the user who last made changes to the data in the form  Date on which the changes were made  Entity ID that displays the database ID for this entity type.  Some configuration forms also have the following properties:  Version when latest modifications were made  Categories assigned to the entity.  All users are permitted to view such details; only users with Update security privileges for the form are permitted to modify the details.  Users permitted to modify this information can change the security group to which the information belongs.  Modifying the details allows data to be viewed by users who were not in the security group associated with the user who entered the data.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Form’s Properties  To view the properties of a data entry form:  Make the form active.  Select the Edit @ Properties option.  The Properties form is displayed.  The form displays the security group to which the data in the form belongs, name of the user who last made changes to the form, and date on which those changes were made.  Click the OK button to close the form.  Need more information on forms?  Modifying a Form’s Properties  To modify properties of a data entry form:  Make the form active.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the Edit @ Properties option.  The Properties form is displayed.  Modify the group by selecting an alternative group from the drop-down list.  Click the OK button to close the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on forms?

pages.title: Receivable Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Receivable Type Definition form is used to view, define, and update a receivable type.  Accounting entities used to:  Separate the amount owing on an invoice into different components.  When payments and adjustments are applied to an invoice, the payment or adjustment amount is allocated to the receivable type components using an allocation algorithm (for example, based on the priority of the receivable type).  Generate invoice receivable type history records that represent the accounts receivable sub-ledger.  The invoice receivable type history can be reconciled against the balances of the accounts receivable amounts uploaded to an external GL system.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also GL Code and Invoice Receivable Type History Records.  Name and description of the receivable type, period (date range) for which it is valid, its priority, and an associated GL code can be specified.  Mechanism for recording period-specific entity data.  A date range represents a period of time bounded by an effective start date and an effective end date.  A date ranged entity is an entity with data that can change over time, and the data is recorded for the date range that the data is valid.  The time span of the entity is defined by contiguous date ranges that specify historical, current, and future versions of the data.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management, Process Engine  See also Effective Date.  If the GL subsystem is disabled, the System Default? check box can be selected to specify whether the billing engine will use the receivable type as the default receivable type when allocating payments and adjustments. Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified). The Receivable Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on receivable types?  Updating a Receivable Type  To update a receivable type:  View the appropriate receivable type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Receivable Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the receivable type as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on receivable types? pages.title: Reference Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Reference Type Definition form is used to enter, view, and update a reference type.  Defined list of items that can be referenced throughout Convergent Billing.  Typically used for a list of predefined options for users.  Each item in a reference type is identified by a reference code.  A reference type should be used whenever there is a requirement to access a set number of values where the values are constants.  Reference types should not be used for variable value lists.  A shared class in Process Engine can map to a Convergent Billing reference type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Process Engine, Customer Management  See also Child Reference Type, Derived Attribute, Reference Code, and Lists.  The upper part of the form is used to display or enter basic details about the reference type.  The lower part of the form consists of a table for entering details of reference items in the specified reference type to be entered or viewed.  The order in which reference items are displayed in a reference type drop-down list is determined by the order in which the reference items are listed.  If it is necessary to delete multiple rows from the table:  Press the Shift or Ctrl key while selecting the rows.  Press Ctrl+Delete, or select the Delete button to delete the rows.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Reference Type  To view a reference type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Reference Types option.  The Reference Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of reference types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate reference type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate reference type.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on reference types?  Defining a Reference Type  To define a reference type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Reference Types option.  The Reference Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Add reference items to the table in the lower part of the form as required.  Each reference item must be entered on a separate row of the table.  To add a row to the table, press the Down Arrow key.  To insert a blank row before the current row, click the Insert button on the toolbar.  If necessary, change the order of the reference items using the Up and Down buttons.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on reference types?  Updating a Reference Type  Modifying a reference type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the reference type.  To update a reference type:  View the appropriate reference type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the reference type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on reference types?  Deleting a Reference Type  Deleting a reference type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the reference type.  To delete a reference type:  View the appropriate reference type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the reference type is to be deleted.  Need more information on reference types?

pages.title: Reprint Invoice Image Form
pages.text: The Reprint Invoice Image form is used to specify the method by which an invoice is reprinted.  Legal document itemising charges (and possibly credits) accrued against that customer's account for services used by, or supplied to, that customer over a specified period.  Accrued charges for a customer node in a customer hierarchy can be 'rolled up' into the invoice for a node higher in the customer hierarchy.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Customer Hierarchy, Customer Node, Reporting Level, and Statement.  The upper part of the form is used to specify whether an immediate task is scheduled (using the Direct option) to reprint the invoice image, or if the invoice is to be reprinted at predetermined scheduled intervals (using the Scheduled option).  The lower part of the form summarises the output method settings, including details on the printer, and invoice image format.  The Printer selection can be changed only when the Direct option is selected.  Associated Actions  Viewing an Invoice  The method to use to search for and view the details of an invoice depends on whether the assigned invoice number is known.  If the invoice number is known:  Select the Accounts @ Invoices option.  The Invoice Search form is displayed.  Ensure that the Search field is set to Invoice Number and enter the invoice number in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search button.  If a valid invoice number is entered, the invoice is displayed.   Click the Detail… button.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the invoice.  If the invoice number is not known:  View the customer’s account history.  Double-click the appropriate invoice transaction in the list of transactions.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the specified invoice.  To locate the correct invoice transaction within the list of transactions, ask the enquirer for the date of the invoice; the date is usually printed prominently on the invoice in a predefined location.  Need more information on invoices?  Viewing Service Details  To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?  Viewing an Invoice Image  Image Viewer Requirements  An image can be generated in a number of different formats; the appropriate image viewer must therefore be available.  Consult the System Administrator about the relevant viewer used.  To view the image:  View the appropriate invoice.  Select the Images tab.  If the image has been generated, click the Invoice Image... button.  If not, click the Generate Image button.  Depending on whether the invoice image is generated, Convergent Billing may ask whether the user wants to:  View the image  Click the Yes button to display the image using the appropriate viewer, or the No button to regenerate the image.  Schedule a task to generate the image  Click the OK button to schedule the appropriate task.  A message indicating that the schedule was submitted to and reached the server is displayed.  When the scheduled task is complete, the appropriate viewer is run automatically to display the generated image.  To cancel the request to schedule a task to generate the image, click the Cancel button.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: Rerated File Detail Form
pages.text: The Rerated File Detail form is used to view, update, or delete a rerate file.  The upper part of the form describes the rerate file name, event source, status, and creation task ID.  The upper part also displays the rerate start date.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs that display more information about the rerate file:  Statistics  The Statistics tab displays the input event count.  Error Events  The Error Events tab is used to view data on each of the normalised events errors assigned to the rerate file.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Normalised File  To view a normalised file:  Select the Server Tasks @ Events @ View Normalised Files and Events option.  The Normalised File Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the normalised files matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate normalised file and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate normalised file.  The Normalised File Definition form is displayed in View Only mode. The Rerated File Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of rerated files matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate rerated file and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate rerated file.  The Rerated File Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on normalisation?  Viewing a Normalised Event  To view a normalised event:  View the appropriate normalised file.  Select the Events tab to display any events returned for the file.  To display details of the event, highlight the event in the grid and click the Details… button.  The Normalised Event Detail form is displayed in View only mode.  Need more information on normalisation?  Viewing a Normalised Event Error  To view a normalised event error:  Select the Server Tasks @ Events @ View/Assign Error Events option.  The Normalised Event Error Search form is displayed. Determines whether or not multiple instances of a detail form are displayed when a specific object is selected in the right-hand panel of the form and the Detail… button is clicked. The Normalised Event Error Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the normalised error events matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate normalised error event and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate normalised error event.  The Normalised Event Error Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on normalisation? Update the rerated file details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on normalisation? The New Rerated File form is closed, and the error event is assigned to the new file.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on normalisation? When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the rerated file is to be deleted.  Need more information on normalisation?

pages.title: Schedule Definition Form
pages.text: The Schedule Definition form is used to view, define, and maintain a schedule.  Defines when an activity (or task) will be executed and the frequency at which that task will be executed.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Pre-schedule Count and Task.  The upper part of the form is used to enter general information about the schedule, such as its name and description.  The upper part of the form also displays the name of the schedule from which this schedule was replicated (if applicable) and the instance on which it is run.  The lower part of the form contains the following tabs for entering more specific details about the schedule:  Settings  The fields on this tab are used to:  Specify schedule type, instance name, email address, pre-schedule count, repeat units, repeat type, schedule status, and schedule dates.  Replicate the schedule to a specified set of instances.  If email notification is not required, leave the Email Address field blank or set it to one of the following:  /dev/null  nobody.  Task Generation  The Task Generation tab contains information regarding the tasks being created by this schedule.  Prerequisites  The Prerequisites tab is used to manage prerequisite schedules for this schedule.  The tab contains a table of prerequisite conditions defined on this schedule, with each row in the table containing a schedule whose tasks form a prerequisite condition for running the tasks associated with this schedule.  The Search… and Assign buttons are used to add prerequisite schedules.  The Details… button displays further information about the selected prerequisite schedule.  The Start Task immediately when all prerequisites satisfied? check box is used to start the schedule as soon as all prerequisites are True rather than waiting for the scheduled start date, and can be selected even if even if no task prerequisites are specified.  Parameters  The fields on the Parameters tab are used to specify additional parameters for the schedule.  The schedule type determines which fields are displayed on the tab.  Some schedule types do not display any fields.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode being indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Click the:  Tasks… button to display the Task List form with the tasks for this schedule.  The button is disabled if there are no tasks.  Child Schedules… button to display the Schedule List form with the child schedules for this schedule.  The button is disabled if there are no child schedules.  Bill Run… button to display the Bill Run Detail form with the bill run for this schedule.  The button is enabled only if the schedule’s type has the task type Bill Run Operation or Bill Run Customer Operation.
