pages.text: The Schedule List form is used to display a list of schedules in the database, which match the specified search criteria.  The schedules are initially listed by upper-case schedule name. The grid displays the schedule name, schedule type, description, instance name, first date, effective date, schedule status, and the task type.  Selecting a schedule and clicking the Details… button displays the Schedule Definition form with the selected task.  Double-clicking on a schedule row has the same result.

pages.title: Schedule Search Form
pages.text: The Schedule Search form is used to search for and list one or more schedules, using the specified search criteria: schedule type, schedule name, description, instance name, first date range, effective date range, schedule status, and task type.  Defines when an activity (or task) will be executed and the frequency at which that task will be executed.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Pre-schedule Count and Task.  Selecting the:  Search for schedules option enables the Search… button, for searching for schedules matching the specified criteria.  Create a new schedule option enables the New… button, for creating a new schedule.  The display format for the retrieved records can be determined by selecting or clearing the Always Display List? and the Reuse Detail Form? check boxes.  If multiple instances of the detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several payments) the Reuse detail form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse detail form? option overrides the display of information in a new form; the details are displayed in the existing form.  If a single schedule record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Schedule Detail form.  If more than one schedule record is returned, the records are listed on the Schedule List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Schedule Detail form.  If selected, the Always display list? option overrides the automatic display of the Schedule Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Schedule List form is displayed.  Only the Schedule Type, Schedule Name, Description, and Instance Name fields are enabled when the Create a new schedule option is selected.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Schedule  To view a schedule:  Select the Server Tasks @ Schedules option.  The Schedule Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of schedules matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate schedule and click the Details... button, or double-click the appropriate schedule.  The Schedule Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on schedules?  Schedules are required to run tasks at specific times and frequencies in Convergent Billing.  Schedules are used to manage all billing tasks such as the rating of events, and the preparation and printing of invoices.  Schedules are also used to generate reports.  Tasks can be set up to run automatically at predefined intervals or at a specified time and date.  The schedule definition is determined in part by the associated schedule type.  When setting up a schedule, an instance on Convergent Billing can be specified to run the schedule.  If an instance is not specified, the schedule is run on the default instance defined for the scheduler.  (The default instance is defined in the STD configuration item.)  Preconfigured functions can be automatically executed on commencement or completion of a scheduled task, and notification messages provided to assist with system operations.  A schedule specifies:  When a task is to be run for the first time.  The Convergent Billing instance the schedule is run on.  The effective date (used as a base to compute the effective date for tasks that are created).  How often the task should be repeated.  What program the task needs to perform its function, and what parameters should be passed to it.  Selection parameters such as whether a report should include data on all customer nodes or only include data on a specific customer node.  Display parameters, such as whether the data included in a report is to be sorted, the sort order, and the sort sequence. Select the Create a new schedule option and click the New... button.  The Schedule Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the data entry fields in the upper part of the form.  Complete the data entry fields on the Settings tab.  Complete the data entry fields on the Parameters tab.  Some of fields on this tab may be optional, depending on the associated schedule type.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Submit Schedule form is displayed.  Submit the schedule.  Need more information on schedules? Operations  The Operations tab defines the operational parameters of the schedule, including the expected and maximum duration for a task, and how the task should respond to being delayed, held, or overdue. pages.title: Service Charge Category Form
pages.text: The Service Charge Category form is used to view, update, and maintain a list of charge categories held in the Convergent Billing database for the specified service.  Provides a specific component of the overall product for which the customer is charged.  Each service has an associated service type, and unique service number against which usage is charged.  One or more facilities (service options) or items of equipment, or both, can be associated with each service.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Equipment, Facility, and Service Type.  Identifies the default account type to which a calculated tariff charge or benefit is posted (allocated).  For services, the charge category also identifies a specific account number.  The association between a tariff and a charge category is specified when the tariff is defined and is referred to as the tariff/charge category pair.  By default, the charge category associated with a tariff is used each time that tariff is used.  However, the charge category can be overridden when defining a customer type, service type, customer node, or service.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Account Type and Tariff.  Information for charge categories include charge category, sequence number, and proportion.  The form also includes account numbers, account classes, and GL codes to which charges apply and from which charges are deducted.  Using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  The form can be displayed in one of two form modes (View Only or Update), with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Charge Category  To view a charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option. The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button. A list of the defined charge categories matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate charge category and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate charge category.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).  Defining a Charge Category  To define a default charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option.  The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  If required, assign the appropriate account number.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Updating a Charge Category  To update a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the charge category details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Deleting a Charge Category  To delete a default charge category:  View the appropriate charge category.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the charge category is to be deleted.  Need more information on charge categories?

pages.title: Service Detail Form
pages.text: The Service Detail form is used to enter, view, and update details of a service.  Provides a specific component of the overall product for which the customer is charged.  Each service has an associated service type, and unique service number against which usage is charged.  One or more facilities (service options) or items of equipment, or both, can be associated with each service.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Equipment, Facility, and Service Type.  The upper part of the form displays basic details about the service, such as the service number, service type, service status, and dates when the service is required.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering and viewing more specific details about the service:  Details  The Details tab is used to specify more explicit details about the service being created.  The fields enabled on this tab are determined by the type of service being created.  Service Addresses  The Service Addresses tab contains the A-Address and B-Address tabs for entering address(es) to which the service is connected.  Contact  The Contact tab displays the details of the primary contact of the customer to whom this service is being assigned.  Facilities are provided on this tab to search for and assign a different contact for this service.  Industry  The Industry tab is used for industry-specific fields associated with the specified service type.  If fields are present on this tab, each field should be completed.  Contract  If the query relates directly to one of the customer's contracts, the tab can be used to specify that contract.  Facilities are provided on this tab to search for and assign the appropriate contract to the query.  Billing  The Billing tab displays billing details associated with the service.  The Priority field indicates the priority used to process the service's events during billing.  Within the same customer node, services with a higher priority (lower numerical value) are processed before services with a lower priority (higher numerical value).  The Complexity field indicates the time expected to perform a bill run on the service.   Lists  The Lists tab displays the lists that have been configured for the specified service type.  The left-hand panel displays the type of list that can be selected and the right-hand panel displays the information associated with the selected list.  General  The General tab displays only fields associated with the specified service type.    Fields present on this tab should be completed. A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Service  To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?  Creating a Service  To create a service:  View the relevant product instance.  Highlight one of the service types listed.  Click the Create… button.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the Yes button to continue creating the service with the specified dates.  The Service Detail form is displayed.  If the dates are not correct, click the No or Cancel button to return to the Product Instance Detail form to change the dates.  Complete the form for the selected service.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  To allocate an optional service to the product instance, click the Add Service… button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, the Optional Product Component form is closed, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 2 to 6 for each additional component to be allocated to the product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?  Updating a Service  To update a service:  View the appropriate service.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the service details as required.  Click Save on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?  Cancelling a Service  Cancelling a service cancels the whole product instance.  Restrictions apply when cancelling a service.  To cancel a specific service:  View the service using one of the available methods (summary or detailed).  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Change the date, if required, and click the Yes button.  To cancel all services associated with a specific product instance, cancel the product instance.  The following applies when cancelling services:  Delete button is enabled only if the service can be cancelled within the service's record date range.  Clicking the Delete button for services that do not have a status of Product Creation, cancels the service.  Minimum cancel date is set to the earliest date at which the service becomes optional, and remains optional until the end of time. The earliest possible cancel date is the service record's effective start date.  Default cancel date is set as follows:  If the maximum number of permitted services for the service's item exceeds the number allowed by the product instance or the companion instance settings and remains at that level until the end of time, the earliest date at which this occurs is used.  If the service becomes optional at some future date and remains optional until the end of time, that date is used.  If the service is optional as of today's date and remains optional until the end of time, today's date is used.  If a service becomes optional, then mandatory, then optional again, only the last optional period can be cancelled.  Need more information on services?  Deleting a Service  Restrictions apply when deleting a service.  To delete a service:  View the service using one of the available methods (summary or detailed).  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Change the date, if required, and click the Yes button.  The service status changes to Cancelled.  Using the Delete button is the preferred method for deletions.  The following applies:  Clicking the Delete button for services that have a status of Product Creation deletes the service.  The date from which to delete the service must be equal to the effective start date of the service.  Need more information on services?  Creating a List  To create a list:  Display either of the following:  Customer Detail form for the appropriate customer  Service Detail form for the appropriate service  Click the Lists tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate list from the left-hand panel of the tab.  Complete the fields on the right-hand side of the tab.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on lists?

pages.title: Service Search Form
pages.text: The Service Search form is used to search for one or more service records by specifying search criteria on the Details and Address tabs.  The Address tab is used to enter the service’s address (either in full or in part) so that it can be used as one of the search criteria.  The fields in which to enter the service’s address are displayed only when an address format is selected (in the Format field).  The address format determines the layout (number and type of fields) of the address.  The Details tab is used to refine a search by date, service number, network address, service type, and service status.  Specifying a product configured for this service type, a contract, and contract type associated with this service type can also refine the search.  By default, all records active on the date the search is performed are included in the search.  The effective date option can be used to search for historical records active at a specified time.  Provides a specific component of the overall product for which the customer is charged.  Each service has an associated service type, and unique service number against which usage is charged.  One or more facilities (service options) or items of equipment, or both, can be associated with each service.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Equipment, Facility, and Service Type.  The display format for the retrieved record(s) can be selected by selecting or clearing the Always Display List? and the Reuse Detail Form? check boxes.  If multiple instances of the detail form are required for display (for example, to access details for several payments) the Reuse detail form? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse detail form? option overrides the display of information in a new form; the details are displayed in the existing form.  If a single service record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Service Detail form.  If more than one service record is returned, the records are listed on the Service List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Service Detail form.  If selected, the Always display list? option overrides the automatic display of the Service Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Service List form is displayed.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Service  To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?  Creating a Service  To create a service:  View the relevant product instance.  Highlight one of the service types listed.  Click the Create… button.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the Yes button to continue creating the service with the specified dates.  The Service Detail form is displayed.  If the dates are not correct, click the No or Cancel button to return to the Product Instance Detail form to change the dates.  Complete the form for the selected service.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  To allocate an optional service to the product instance, click the Add Service… button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, the Optional Product Component form is closed, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 2 to 6 for each additional component to be allocated to the product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?  Updating a Service  To update a service:  View the appropriate service.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the service details as required.  Click Save on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?  Cancelling a Service  Cancelling a service cancels the whole product instance.  Restrictions apply when cancelling a service.  To cancel a specific service:  View the service using one of the available methods (summary or detailed).  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Change the date, if required, and click the Yes button.  To cancel all services associated with a specific product instance, cancel the product instance.  The following applies when cancelling services:  Delete button is enabled only if the service can be cancelled within the service's record date range.  Clicking the Delete button for services that do not have a status of Product Creation, cancels the service.  Minimum cancel date is set to the earliest date at which the service becomes optional, and remains optional until the end of time. The earliest possible cancel date is the service record's effective start date.  Default cancel date is set as follows:  If the maximum number of permitted services for the service's item exceeds the number allowed by the product instance or the companion instance settings and remains at that level until the end of time, the earliest date at which this occurs is used.  If the service becomes optional at some future date and remains optional until the end of time, that date is used.  If the service is optional as of today's date and remains optional until the end of time, today's date is used.  If a service becomes optional, then mandatory, then optional again, only the last optional period can be cancelled.  Need more information on services?  Deleting a Service  Restrictions apply when deleting a service.  To delete a service:  View the service using one of the available methods (summary or detailed).  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Change the date, if required, and click the Yes button.  The service status changes to Cancelled.  Using the Delete button is the preferred method for deletions.  The following applies:  Clicking the Delete button for services that have a status of Product Creation deletes the service.  The date from which to delete the service must be equal to the effective start date of the service.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Service Type Definition Form
pages.text: The Service Type Definition form is used to enter, view, and update a service type.  Specifies any defaults or entity validation for services specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each service type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Icon and Service.  The upper part is used to enter general information about the service type, such as its name, description, identifying icon, and service form to be used.  The lower part containing the following tabs is used for entering more specific details about the service type:  Settings  The Settings tab is used to specify the GL code, address format for A and B parties, cancellation status for services of this type if an associated product offer is cancelled, and entity validation details that can be assigned for the service type, allowing the service details displayed for this service type to be customised.  The use of the GL code specified on this tab is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  Charge Category  The Charge Category tab is used to override the behaviour of the default charge category to be used to create a charge category instance when a service of a specified type is created.  For example, the tab can be used to override the GL code to which charges are posted so that the GL code selected is based on a specific service type.  The field on this tab cannot be used to define a new charge category.  The use of the GL code specified on this tab is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  Equipment  The Equipment tab is used to define the default types and quantities of equipment required for the specified service type.  The types and quantities specfied on this tab are displayed in the equipment section in the lower half of the Services tab of the Product Definition form when the specified service type is selected for inclusion in a product definition.  The default types and quantities can be overridden on the Services tab of the Product Definition form.  Derived Attribute Tables (Lists)  The Derived Attribute Tables (Lists) tab is used to specify the service context derived attributes required for the specified service type.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Service Type  To view a service type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Service Types option.  The Service Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of service types that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate service type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate service type.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on service types?  Defining a Service Type  To define a service type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Service Types option.  The Service Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  If required, override the default charge category.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on service types?  Updating a Service Type  To update a service type:  View the appropriate service type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the service type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on service types?  Deleting a Service Type  To delete a service type:  View the appropriate service type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the service type is to be deleted.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: Service Type Search Form

Specifies any defaults or entity validation for services specified with that type.  If required, an icon can be specified to identify each service type.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Configuration Studio  See also Icon and Service.  The lower part of the form is used to list each of the service types returned by the search that matches the specified criteria.  Multiple instances of the Service Type Definition form can be displayed by clearing the Reuse form? check box.  If multiple instances of the form are required for display (for example, to access details for several account types), do not select the Reuse form? check box.  If selected, the Reuse form? check box overrides display of information in a new form, and details are displayed in the existing form.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Service Type  To view a service type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Service Types option.  The Service Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of service types that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate service type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate service type.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on service types?  Defining a Service Type  To define a service type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Service Types option.  The Service Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  If required, override the default charge category.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on service types?  Updating a Service Type  To update a service type:  View the appropriate service type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the service type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on service types?  Deleting a Service Type  To delete a service type:  View the appropriate service type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the service type is to be deleted.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: Set/Change Password Form
pages.text: Setting a password is valid only for users using internal authentication.  Consult the system administrator to determine if passwords are:  Authenticated internally  Case-sensitive.  The Set/Change Password form is used to set or change a Convergent Billing password.  When a new password is set, it becomes effective immediately and must be used the at the next log in to Convergent Billing.  If Process Engine is enabled, it is highly recommended that the password be updated in Process Engine using the User Tool to ensure integrity of additional Process Engine data.  Related Topic  Rules for Singleview Passwords  Setting a password is valid only for users using internal authentication.  Consult the system administrator to determine if passwords are:  Authenticated internally  Case-sensitive.  The new password must comply with the rules of the validation function associated with the security profile. The default rules require the new password to:  Be at least six characters in length.  Not include the @ or " characters.  Include at least one non-alphabetical character.  Be different from the old password.  There is no maximum limit on the number of characters in a password.  If password reuse rules are enabled by the System Administrator (in the user's profile), a password can be reused if the following conditions are met since the password was last used:  The password was changed the minimum number of times specified in the Reuse Max field.  The number of days specified in the Reuse Time field have elapsed.

pages.title: Singleview Convergent Billing Login Form
pages.text: The Singleview Convergent Billing login form is used to log in to Convergent Billing.  If more than one Convergent Billing instance is defined for logging in, the database instances are displayed in a drop-down list.  If single sign-on is in use, the user's Windows user name and password are used to log in to Convergent Billing.  The login form may not be displayed; instead, the client logs in automatically.  If the login form is displayed, the User name field is disabled and the Password field is not displayed.  Select a database (if required) and click OK.  If single sign-on is in use, a user cannot:  Set or change a password using the Set/Change Password form.  Set a password to expire.  Be locked by Convergent Billing or a user.  If single sign-on is not in use, enter a user name and password, and click the OK button.  The OK button is enabled only when all required details are completed.  Contact the system administrator if required details are not available, or if problems are encountered.  Depending on configuration, a warning may be displayed if a password is due to expire.  The warning displays the number of days until the password expires.  Click Yes to change the password using the Set/Change Password form; otherwise, click No and continue using the current password until it expires.  A system administrator can manually expire a password to force a change of password.  Attempting to log in after the password has expired results in an error message.  Click Cancel to return to the Singleview Convergent Billing login form or click OK to invoke the Set/Change Password form to set a new password.  Attempting to log in is rejected if the account is locked.  An account can be locked:  Automatically by Convergent Billing after a number (defined in the profile) of consecutive attempts to log in fails because the wrong password is specified.  Manually by a user with the appropriate privilege.  A locked account can be unlocked only by a user with the appropriate privilege.  Related Topic  Set/Change Password Form

pages.title: Statement Detail Form
pages.text: The Statement Detail form is used to:  View details of a specified statement  Document itemising charges (and possibly credits) accrued against a customer's account for services used by, or supplied to, that customer over a specified period.  Unlike an invoice that itemises charges, a statement provides a record of the charges.   Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Invoice and Reporting Level.  View an electronic image of the statement sent to the customer  Reprint the statement.  The upper part of the form summarises the statement details such as the statement number, associated customer account number, amount, date issued, and account to which the charges associated with the services listed on the statement are billed.  The upper part displays the effective date of the bill run that generated the invoice.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs, for more specific details to be viewed:  Transactions  The Transactions tab specifies details about the payments and adjustments displayed on the statement image (for example, date the transaction was completed, whether the transaction was an adjustment or payment, amount, and receipt number of the transaction).  Queries  The Queries tab specifies details about any queries raised against the statement, such as query number, type of query, when the query was opened and closed, and how the query was resolved.  Images  The Images tab is used to specify details about the statement image, such as the format of the statement, the name and address of the person who received the statement, and whether or not the statement has been printed.  General  The General tab is used to enter information relevant to a specific statement type.  The fields and number of fields on this tab depends on the statement type selected.  The form can only be displayed in View Only mode.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Statement  Two ways to search for a statement are to:  Perform a general statement search.  View the statement using the customer's account history.  To perform a general statement search:  Select the Accounts @ Statements option.  The Statement Search form is displayed.  Use any one of the search criteria to restrict the number of records retrieved by specifying a wildcard search.  Click the Search button.  A list of the records that match the selection criteria is displayed on the lower part of the form.  The list includes records for statement nodes and non-reporting nodes.  The list of records retrieved when a non-specific search is performed includes a record for each statement node (a customer node that has a report level of Statement) and each non-reporting node (a customer node that has a report level of None) that match the selection criteria.  For statement nodes, the amount displayed in the Statement Amount column is the 'rolled-up' amount displayed on the customer's statement.  The 'rolled-up' amount includes the charges incurred at the statement node and the charges for any non-reporting nodes that are children of the specified statement node.  For non-reporting nodes, the amount displayed in the Statement Amount column indicates only the charges incurred by that node.  Double-click the required entry in the list or select the entry and click the Detail... button.  The Statement Detail form is displayed.  To view a statement using the customer's account history:  View the customer’s account history.  Double-click the appropriate statement transaction in the list of transactions.  The Statement Detail form is displayed with details of the specified statement.  To locate the correct statement within the list of transactions, ask the enquirer for the date of the statement; the date is usually printed prominently on the statement in a predefined location.  Need more information on statements?  Viewing Service Details  To view details for a generated statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Click the Statement Details... button.  The Statement Item Details form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria in the Invoice Hierarchy Search Criteria group and click the Search button.  A list of entities matching the specified criteria is displayed in the Invoice Hierarchy section.  Select the appropriate entity.  The statement charges for the entity are displayed in the Item Details grid.  Need more information on statements?  Viewing a Statement Image  Image Viewer Requirements  An image can be generated in a number of different formats; the appropriate image viewer must therefore be available.  Consult the System Administrator about the relevant viewer used.  To view the image:  View the appropriate statement.  Select the Images tab and click the Statement Image... button.  Depending on whether the statement image is generated, Convergent Billing may ask whether the user wants to:  View the image  Click the Yes button to display the image using the appropriate viewer, or the No button to regenerate the image.  Schedule a task to generate the image  Click the OK button to schedule the appropriate task.  A message indicating that the schedule was submitted to, and has reached, the server is displayed.  When the scheduled task is complete, the appropriate viewer is run automatically to display the generated image.    To cancel the request to schedule a task to generate the image, click the Cancel button.  Need more information on statements?  Viewing the Associated Invoice  To view details of the invoice associated with the current statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Click the Display Invoice... button.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the invoice for the account specified.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: Statement Item Details Form

Document itemising charges (and possibly credits) accrued against a customer's account for services used by, or supplied to, that customer over a specified period.  Unlike an invoice that itemises charges, a statement provides a record of the charges.   Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Invoice and Reporting Level. Use any one of the search criteria to restrict the number of records retrieved by specifying a wildcard search.  Click the Search button. The 'rolled-up' amount includes the charges incurred at the statement node and the charges for any non-reporting nodes that are children of the specified statement node. To locate the correct statement within the list of transactions, ask the enquirer for the date of the statement; the date is usually printed prominently on the statement in a predefined location. The Statement Item Details form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria in the Invoice Hierarchy Search Criteria group and click the Search button.  A list of entities matching the specified criteria is displayed in the Invoice Hierarchy section.  Select the appropriate entity.  The statement charges for the entity are displayed in the Item Details grid.  Need more information on statements?  Viewing Details of the Associated Invoice  To view details of the invoice associated with the current statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Click the Display Invoice... button.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the invoice for the account specified.  Need more information on statements?  Viewing an Image of a Statement  Image Viewer Requirements  An image can be generated in a number of different formats; the appropriate image viewer must therefore be available.  Consult the System Administrator about the relevant viewer used.  To view the image:  View the appropriate statement.  Select the Images tab and click the Statement Image... button.  Depending on whether the statement image is generated, Convergent Billing may ask whether the user wants to:  View the image  Click the Yes button to display the image using the appropriate viewer, or the No button to regenerate the image.  Schedule a task to generate the image  Click the OK button to schedule the appropriate task.  A message indicating that the schedule was submitted to, and has reached, the server is displayed.  When the scheduled task is complete, the appropriate viewer is run automatically to display the generated image.    To cancel the request to schedule a task to generate the image, click the Cancel button.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: Submit Schedule Form
pages.text: The Submit Schedule form is used to:  Submit one or more schedules.  Defines when an activity (or task) will be executed and the frequency at which that task will be executed.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Pre-schedule Count and Task.  Submit a specific schedule (using the Submit button) and to cancel the submission of the schedule (using the Cancel button).  Regenerate all tasks associated with the schedule.  Select the notification options on schedule receipt and completion.  The three Submit options are used to:  Option  Used To  Regenerate tasks?  Cancel any pending jobs associated with the original schedule.  Regenerate tasks? is only used when modifying a schedule.  Be notified on receipt?  Direct the scheduler to open a window on the workstation to notify the user when the submitted schedule is received at the server.  Be notified on completion?  Direct the scheduler to open a window on the workstation to notify when the first scheduled task is completed.  User must be logged in to Convergent Billing at the time the notification is sent for it to be displayed.  A notification of the completion of any remaining tasks is performed using email (to the schedule's email address).  Cancel associated pending jobs.   Request notification of the received schedule.  Request notification of the first completed, scheduled task.  Associated Actions  Viewing a Schedule  To view a schedule:  Select the Server Tasks @ Schedules option.  The Schedule Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of schedules matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate schedule and click the Details... button, or double-click the appropriate schedule.  The Schedule Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on schedules?  Schedules are required to run tasks at specific times and frequencies in Convergent Billing.  Schedules are used to manage all billing tasks such as the rating of events, and the preparation and printing of invoices.  Schedules are also used to generate reports.  Tasks can be set up to run automatically at predefined intervals or at a specified time and date.  The schedule definition is determined in part by the associated schedule type.  When setting up a schedule, an instance on Convergent Billing can be specified to run the schedule.  If an instance is not specified, the schedule is run on the default instance defined for the scheduler.  (The default instance is defined in the STD configuration item.)  Preconfigured functions can be automatically executed on commencement or completion of a scheduled task, and notification messages provided to assist with system operations.  A schedule specifies:  When a task is to be run for the first time.  The Convergent Billing instance the schedule is run on.  The effective date (used as a base to compute the effective date for tasks that are created).  How often the task should be repeated.  What program the task needs to perform its function, and what parameters should be passed to it.  Selection parameters such as whether a report should include data on all customer nodes or only include data on a specific customer node.  Display parameters, such as whether the data included in a report is to be sorted, the sort order, and the sort sequence.  Creating a New Schedule  To define a schedule:  Select the Server Tasks @ Schedules option.  The Schedule Search form is displayed.  Select the Create a new schedule option and click the New... button.  The Schedule Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the data entry fields in the upper part of the form.  Complete the data entry fields on the Settings tab.  Complete the data entry fields on the Parameters tab.  Some of fields on this tab may be optional, depending on the associated schedule type.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Submit Schedule form is displayed.  Submit the schedule.  Need more information on schedules? Selection parameters such as whether a report should include data on all customer nodes or only include data on a specific customer node.  Display parameters, such as whether the data included in a report is to be sorted, the sort order, and the sort sequence.  Scheduling an Immediate One-off Task  To schedule an immediate one-off task:  Select the Server Tasks @ One-off Task option.  The One-off Task Definition form is displayed.  Select the schedule type from the drop-down list.  The lower part of the form displays the parameters associated with the schedule type.  Enter any parameters that may be required by the schedule.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The schedule is saved and a one-off task is submitted.  Click the Display Task… button to open the Task Details form and monitor the progress of the task created.  When the task is complete, a notification is sent by email. pages.title: Subtotal Definition Form
pages.text: The Subtotal Definition form is used to enter, view, update and delete a subtotal.  Variable containing calculated values (such as aggregated cost totals) stored for subsequent use in the rating and billing process.   A subtotal defines one or more subtotal terms aggregated using the method specified by the associated aggregation function.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Aggregation Function, Progressive Subtotal, Keyed Subtotal, and Subtotal Term.  The upper part is used to enter general information about the subtotal to be created such as its name, a description of what it is to be used for, its status, and the period for which the subtotal is applicable.  The lower part is used to enter more specific details about the subtotal using the following tabs:  Settings  The Settings tab is used to enter attributes for the subtotal.    The upper part displays subtotal settings such as its application environment, data type, processing context, type of aggregate functions, and currency.  The currency used for all charges generated by this tariff can also be defined on this tab.  By entering a currency expression, the components of the subtotal can be evaluated in different currencies.  The middle part specifies subtotal processing options such as how aggregate totals are handled, and where subtotals are applied (for example, normalised events).  Included on this tab are options for positions of subtotal value storage and use, and when the billing engine can access the subtotal value (progressively after the processing of each service, or after processing all events).  The lower part is used to specify if all expressions associated with the subtotal are automatically validated and the number of the invoice section in which the subtotal value is to be included, and any associated text to be included.    The Default Invoice Text field is optional and only needs to be completed if the subtotal produces billable items.  Charges  The Key Variable Name field is a local @ variable declared as the key to access the subtotal.    If the:  Subtotal is a hash, the key variable must be a string.  Tariff is an array, the key variable must be an integer.  The field is only accessible for keyed subtotals (that is, subtotals with an array or a hash data type).  Rating  The Rating tab is only displayed if the application environment for the subtotal is Rating.  The tab is used to specify whether the subtotal has a master subtotal.  If the subtotal has a master subtotal, the master subtotal must have no end date, and the slave subtotal must have subtotal terms and an application environment of Rating.    The Rating tab is also used to specify whether the:  Subtotal is aggregated in the subtotal cache.  Value of the rating subtotal can be accessed during rating.  Period for the subtotal is the customer's bill cycle.  Subtotal has access to the Rating environment variables of the From Date expression and the To Date expression.  The start and end dates used for aggregating values can also be specified.  Accounting  The Accounting tab is displayed on the Subtotal Definition form only if the GL subsystem is disabled (the GL_ENABLED reference type does not have a single enabled reference code).  Use of the Accounting tab is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  For subtotals with an application environment of Billing and a currency, the following can be specified on the tab:  GL code or an expression that returns a GL code. The GL code is assigned to the charge when it is generated.  From GL code or an expression that returns a from GL code. The GL code is assigned to the charge when it is generated.  Receivable type or an expression that returns a receivable type. The receivable type is used when an invoice is generated to create the invoice receivable type records.  Terms  The fields on the Terms tab are used to define:  The subtotal terms to be used to select the costed data records to be aggregated.  Term expression to be passed to the aggregation function (specified on the Settings tab) to calculate the value of the subtotal and the key expression to which the term expression is to be aggregated.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, with the current mode indicated in the form’s title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Subtotal  To view a subtotal definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Subtotals option.  The Subtotal Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of subtotal definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate subtotal definition and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate subtotal definition.  The Subtotal Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on subtotals?  Defining a Subtotal  To define a subtotal:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Subtotals option.  The Subtotal Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Subtotal Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on subtotals?  Updating a Subtotal  To update a subtotal:  View the appropriate subtotal.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Subtotal Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the subtotal details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on subtotals?  Deleting a Subtotal  Before deleting a subtotal, ensure that the subtotal is not referenced in another subtotal or tariff.  To delete a subtotal:  View the appropriate subtotal.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the subtotal is to be deleted.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: Table Partition Definition Form
pages.text: The Table Partition Definition form is used to view, define, and maintain a table partition.  The tables that can be partitioned are defined in the TablePartition derived attribute table.  Improves the management and the performance of the rating, billing and archive processes.  Database table scalability can often be compromised when tables that hold large quantities of data are seldom accessed, or when data is accessed very frequently.  Convergent Billing provides the capability to define and manage table partitions.   Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Billing Engine and Rating Engine.  If partitioning is implemented, the CHARGE, NORMALISED_EVENT, NORMALISED_EVENT_ERROR, SUBTOTAL_RATING_VALUE, SUBTOTAL_RATING_DELTA, and NEF_GL_GUIDANCE_DELTA (not required if the GL subsystem is not enabled) tables must always be partitioned for operational reasons (for example, archiving and upgrading).  The upper part of the form is used to enter the names of the table partition and base table used for the partition to be specified.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for viewing and updating the partition table's details:  Details  The Details tab allows the following to be specified:  Desired status of the partition.  The default for new partitions is 'Dropped'.  Table partition schedule for performing required partition changes.  Schedule task used to perform any required changes to the partition.  The task defaults to the first pending task for the schedule whenever the Schedule field is changed.  Operation to be performed on the table, in addition to the operations required to change the partition's Actual Status to match the Desired Status.  Compressing partitions is available only if Oracle Advanced Compression is activated.  The following fields are automatically populated and cannot be modified:  Actual Status  Operation Outcome  Operation Step  Contains Unbilled charges?  Data Tablespace  Index Tablespace  Exchange Table  Archive File  Compressed?  Partition Ranges  The Partition Ranges tab displays table columns and date or entity ranges used to partition the table.  The table columns cannot be modified.  The date and entity ID ranges can be modified using the Desired fields.  The View Graph... button is used to view information about the current and related partitions.  Statistics  The Statistics tab displays the statistics for the partition in reverse date order.  All data on this tab is read-only.  The Uninvoiced Count column is only displayed for partitions associated with the CHARGE table.  The following columns are only displayed for partitions associated with the CHARGE or NORMALISED_EVENT tables:  Last Sort Count(s)  Sort Date  Last Sort Duration.  The Task Details... button opens the Task Details form with the task responsible for generating the selected row's statistics.  This button is only available to users with sufficient security group privileges.  The form can be displayed in one of three form modes, the current mode being indicated in the form's title.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Associated Actions  Viewing a Table Partition  To view a table partition:  Select the Maintenance @ Server @ Table Partitioning option.  The Table Partition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of table partition names matching the specified criteria is displayed. pages.title: Tariff Definition Form
pages.text: The Tariff Definition form is used to enter, view, and update details of a tariff.  The upper part of the form contains basic details about the tariff, such as the name, description, and period for which the tariff is applicable.   Rental (recurring, activation, and cancellation) events are configured using the Recurring, Activation, and Cancellation tabs, which are only displayed when the appropriate class (on the Settings tab) is selected.  The lower part of the form consists of the following tabs for entering and reviewing more specific configuration details:   Settings  The Settings tab is used to:  Define settings for the tariff being configured (for example, class, type, and application environment in which the tariff applies)  Select check boxes (whether this is a global tariff and whether it is billable)  Define the invoice section number and associated text.  Currency to be used for all charges generated by this tariff.  By entering a currency expression, the components of the tariff can be evaluated in different currencies.  The Recurring, Activation, and Cancellation options in the Class group can only be selected for an application environment of Rating.  Click the Eligibility button to display the Expression List form to enter expressions that control the application of the tariff.  Specifies expressions that control the application of the tariff.  If the list is empty or all expressions evaluate to TRUE, the tariff is applied.  Which variables can be used in eligibility expressions depends on the application environment and context of the tariff as follows:  Application environment of Billing:  All variables with an application environment of Billing or Rating are available, except those with a context of Charge if the tariff's context is not Charge.  If a keyed charge is defined, the key variable name (defined in the Variable Name field on the Charges tab) is available.  Application environment of Rating:  Variables must have the same application environment and if the tariff is:  Global (Global Event? is selected), only variables with the same context are available.  Not global (that is, a product tariff), variables with a context of Service or Normalised Event are available, irrespective of the tariff's context.  Conditions  The Conditions tab is used to define the conditions on which the tariff table is searched.  Each condition entered defines a column in the resulting tariff table.  To add an entry (a row of data defining the condition) to the table, click the Insert button and enter details for the condition.  To rearrange the order of the conditions, use the Up and Down buttons.  To view the tariff table, click the Table... button.  Charges  The Charges tab is used to specify the charge and charge expressions to be used to calculate the value of a tariff if the conditions (specified on the Conditions tab) are met.  To add an entry (a row of data defining the charge) to the table, click the Insert button and enter details for the charge.  To rearrange the order of the charges, use the Up and Down buttons.  To view the tariff table, click the Table... button.  Accounting  The Accounting tab is used to specify:  Accounting expressions used to return GL codes and account numbers for the tariff.  Whether the account is included in charges calculated in the rating process for the specified account.  Account check expressions for actions to be taken following rating.  The expression entered in the selected field can be used to dynamically assign the account numbers and GL codes to the costed records they generate.  Any expressions entered override the charge category specified in the Settings tab, and the charge categories specified in the Tariff tab of the Product Definition form for non-global tariffs.  The Real-time Account Aggregation group is used to configure Convergent Billing to maintain a record of unbilled amounts (current amounts outstanding) for an account.  The unbilled amounts are used to provide real-time account balance management for Commerce Engine and real-time tariffs, and are displayed on the Account History form in the Unbilled Amount (or Current Amount) field.  An expression can be specified to check the account balance and perform a specific action if it exceeds a pre-set amount.  The From GL Code and To GL Code fields on the Accounting tab are deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  When the GL subsystem is enabled (the GL_ENABLED reference type has a single enabled reference code), the fields are only enabled for billable tariffs.  The GL codes are assigned when a charge is created.  However, the fields do not affect GL guidance or the sales posting process, but can be accessed by the GL guidance function.  The GL codes used during the sales posting and GL upload process are determined using General Ledger Guidance.  The From GL Code and To GL Code fields are enabled if the GL subsystem is enabled.  Recurring  The Recurring tab is displayed only when the Recurring option is selected in the Class group on the Settings tab.  The tab is used to enter parameters used by the RGP to generate an event that recurs on a periodic basis for an entity (equipment, service, facility group, or product instance).  For example, parameters can be defined for a line or appliance rental that is billed quarterly.  A generated event that spans multiple charge periods can optionally be split into multiple events, according to charge periods and a prorate period.  Parameters can be defined to prorate a recurring event by a fixed date.  The charges generated for a recurring event can be defined on the Charges tab of the tariff, or of any tariff that applies to the event.  The tab also provides the option of generating the recurring event for inclusion in an interim invoice (generated by running the Interim Bill Run schedule type), without affecting the regular invoice cycle of the customer.  A recurring event can also be generated for periods where a product has a status other than Active.  The generation of an event is controlled by the following expression lists:  Recurring/Activation/Cancellation Event Eligibility Expression List   Specifies conditions that control the generation (by the RGP) of a rental event for an entity (product, facility group, service, or equipment).  If the list is empty, or all conditions are TRUE, an event is generated.  Otherwise, if any expression in the list is FALSE, an event is not generated.  Depending on the entity the tariff is associated with, expressions can include direct variables from one of the following sets:  Direct variables based on RGP_PRODUCT_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_FAC_GROUP_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Direct variables based on RGP_EQUIPMENT_HISTORY_V.  Expressions can also include functions with an application environment of Any, Rating, or Data Entry.  A function with an application environment of Rating or Data Entry can be used within the expression list; however, rather than all direct variables available for the relevant application environment, only the direct variables referenced above are valid.  The eligibility expression lists do not run in a rating application environment, hence they do not have access to standard direct variables, tariffs and derived attributes. Derived attribute variables must not be used in this context. To access derived attribute details in the expression list, use the appropriate functional interface:  DerivedTableLookupByDatex&() for access to global derived attributes.  ServiceTableLookup&() for access to service context derived attributes.  CustomerNodeTableLookup&() or CustomerNodeTableLookup?[]() for access to customer node or customer derived attributes.  For more information about these functions, refer to the Configurer's Reference Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing (Vol. 2).  Recurring/Activation/Cancellation Event Assignment Expression List  Specifies the expressions that the RGP uses to assign values to the generated event for the entity (product, facility group, service, or equipment).  Fields of the event are assigned values by referring to direct variables based on the  RGP_NORMALISED_EVENT_V view.  For example, the C_PARTY_NAME field is set by assigning a value to the CPartyName$ direct variable.  Depending on the entity the tariff is associated with, expressions can include direct variables from one of the following sets:  Direct variables based on RGP_PRODUCT_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_FAC_GROUP_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Direct variables based on RGP_EQUIPMENT_HISTORY_V.  Expressions can also include functions with an application environment of Any, Rating, or Data Entry.  A function with an application environment of Rating or Data Entry can be used within the expression list; however, rather than all direct variables available for the relevant application environment, only the direct variables referenced above are valid.  The assignment expression lists do not run in a rating application environment, hence they do not have access to standard direct variables, tariffs and derived attributes. Derived attribute variables must not be used in this context. To access derived attribute details in the expression list, use the appropriate functional interface:  DerivedTableLookupByDatex&() for access to global derived attributes.  ServiceTableLookup&() for access to service context derived attributes.  CustomerNodeTableLookup&() or CustomerNodeTableLookup?[]() for access to customer node or customer derived attributes.  For more information about these functions, refer to the Configurer's Reference Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing (Vol. 2).  Assignment expressions are evaluated only for rental events.  Adjustment events are created by copying the values from the rental event being adjusted.  It is recommended that all data that affects the eligibility of the rating tariff or the content of the generated charge be included in the generated event (by the assignment expressions).  Including this data enables a tariff's eligibility criteria and charge expressions to avoid accessing RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V.  Depending on the cause of the adjustment, rental tariffs that access details in RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V may see the current details, rather than the details that caused the adjustment event to be generated.  Recurring/Activation/Cancellation Event Adjustment Expression List  Specifies the conditions that control the generation (by the RGP in adjustment mode) of an adjustment event for a previous rental event for an entity (product, facility group, service, or equipment).  If the list is empty, or all conditions are TRUE, an adjustment event is not generated.  Otherwise, if any expression in the list is FALSE, an adjustment event is generated.  Depending on the entity the tariff is associated with, expressions can include direct variables from one of the following sets:  Direct variables based on RGP_PRODUCT_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_FAC_GROUP_INSTANCE_V  Direct variables based on RGP_SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Direct variables based on RGP_EQUIPMENT_HISTORY_V.  An expression can include direct variables based on RGP_NORMALISED_EVENT_V.  Expressions can also include functions with an application environment of Any, Rating, or Data Entry.  A function with an application environment of Rating or Data Entry can be used within the expression list; however, rather than all direct variables available for the relevant application environment, only the direct variables referenced above are valid.  The adjustment expression lists do not run in a rating application environment, hence they do not have access to standard direct variables, tariffs and derived attributes. Derived attribute variables must not be used in the context. To access derived attribute details in the expression list, use the appropriate functional interface:  DerivedTableLookupByDatex&() for access to global derived attributes.  ServiceTableLookup&() for access to service context derived attributes.  CustomerNodeTableLookup&() or CustomerNodeTableLookup?[]() for access to customer node or customer derived attributes.  For more information about these functions, refer to the Configurer's Reference Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing (Vol. 2). The tab is used to:  Enter parameters to be used by the RGP to generate a one-off event on activation of an entity (equipment, service, facility group, or product instance).
