pages.text: An adjustment can only be reversed once it is posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, an adjustment made as part of an adjustment batch can only be reversed if that batch is applied.  Adjustments included in an adjustment batch that is not yet applied can simply be removed from the batch.  To reverse an adjustment:  Enter an adjustment of equal (but opposite) value to the adjustment to be reversed.  In the Description field, cross-reference the adjustment number of the reversed adjustment.  Need more information on adjustments?

pages.title: Delete an Adjustment
pages.text: To delete an adjustment not posted to a customer's account:  View the appropriate adjustment.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the adjustment is to be deleted.  An adjustment posted to a customer's account can also be deleted using the same procedure if:  The adjustment is not included on (appears on) an invoice or statement.  The adjustment has not been posted to the Sales Journal.  Security privileges are available.  If deletion is not possible, the adjustment should be reversed and the adjustment entered against the correct account.  Need more information on adjustments?

pages.title: View an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: To view an adjustment not yet applied, view the adjustment batch, and details of all applied and unapplied adjustments for that adjustment batch are listed in the adjustment Detail section.  To search for an adjustment batch and list adjustments in the batch:  Select the Accounts @ Adjustments @ Manage Batch Adjustments option.  The Adjustment Batch Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria. If the batch date is unknown, remove the date from the Batch Date field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Adjustment Batch form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  If a single adjustment batch record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Individual Adjustment Batch form.  If more than one adjustment batch record is returned, the records are listed on the Adjustment Batch List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Adjustment Batch form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Adjustment Batch form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Adjustment Batch List form is displayed.  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option was selected, the Adjustment Batch List form is displayed.  To access the Adjustment Batch form from the Adjustment Batch List form, double-click the appropriate batch in the list, or select the appropriate batch and click the Details… button.  The Adjustment Batch form is displayed listing each of the adjustments included in that batch.  The Details… button is enabled when the batch adjustments have been applied.  Need more information on adjustment batches?

pages.title: Create an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: To create an adjustment batch:  Collate adjustments into batches (groups) of the same adjustment type.  Select the Accounts @ Adjustments @ New Batch Adjustment option.  The Adjustment Batch Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate adjustment type and batch type.  Enter the account number or invoice number in the appropriate columns associated with the adjustment and press the Tab key. An adjustment number is assigned to the adjustment and displayed in the first column of the current row.  The account number or invoice number is verified against the account details held in the system and, if valid, corresponding account and invoice details are displayed in the relevant columns.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed on the Status bar.  To rectify this, click the Delete button and enter a valid account or invoice number.  Ensure that the customer name is correct.  If not, a valid, but incorrect account or invoice number has probably been entered.  To rectify this, click the Delete button to remove the row, click the Insert button to insert a new row, and re-enter the account or invoice number.  If there is a selected invoice for the account, the invoice number appears in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount of the adjustment in the Amount column, and press the Tab key.  The Invoices for Adjustment form is displayed in Update mode.  If there are a number of invoices against the account, the word 'Split' appears in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount of the adjustment in the Amount column, and press the Tab key.  The Invoices for Adjustment form is displayed in Update mode.  Allocate an amount to one or more of the listed invoices as required.  Press the Tab key or close the Invoices for Adjustment form.  Control is returned to the Adjustment Batch Detail form.  If the adjustment has been entered against more than one invoice, the word 'Split' is displayed in the Invoice column.  If the adjustment was not made against an invoice, the word 'Credit' (or 'Debit' if it was a negative adjustment) is displayed in the Invoice column.  If required, overwrite the default text in the Adjustment Text field and enter a description of (or reason for) the adjustment in the Description field.  Any text written in the Adjustment Text field is printed on the customer's next invoice or statement; text written in the Description field is saved with the adjustment details, but not printed.  Complete any other fields defined for this adjustment.  The fields displayed depend on the adjustment type selected for the batch.  As each adjustment is entered, the total value of the adjustments in the batch is displayed in the lower right corner of the form.  Press the Down Arrow key to insert the next adjustment.  A new row is inserted below the current row with a new receipt number.   Repeat steps 5 to 11 until all adjustments have been entered, or until the batch needs to be saved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Adjustment Batch Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  To post the adjustments to the respective accounts, apply the batch.  To close the adjustment batch without posting the adjustments, click the Close button on the toolbar.  Need more information on adjustment batches?

pages.title: Apply an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: To apply (or reapply) the adjustments in an adjustment batch to their respective accounts:  Ensure that the adjustment batch is saved.  Click the Apply button.  A message indicating that the adjustments in the adjustment batch have been applied (posted) is displayed on the Status bar.  Need more information on adjustment batches?

pages.title: Modify an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: Notes on Updating Adjustment Batches  To update an adjustment batch:  View the appropriate adjustment batch.  If necessary, un-apply the batch.  Modify individual adjustments within the batch as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to save the modifications and re-apply the batch.  Need more information on adjustment batches?

pages.title: Add an Adjustment to an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: To add an adjustment to an adjustment batch:  View the appropriate adjustment batch.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Adjustment Batch Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Enter the adjustment.  Repeat step 3 for each additional adjustment.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on adjustment batches?

pages.title: Remove an Adjustment from an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: To remove an adjustment from an adjustment batch:  View the appropriate adjustment batch.  If required, un-apply the adjustment batch.  Select the row containing the adjustment to be removed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click Yes to confirm that the adjustment batch is to be deleted.  Need more information about adjustment batches?

pages.title: Un-apply an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: Rules for Un-applying an Adjustment Batch  To un-apply an adjustment batch:  View the appropriate adjustment batch.  Click the Un-apply button.  The adjustments within the adjustment batch are un-applied and, if required, can be modified or deleted.  Need more Information about adjustment batches?

pages.title: Delete an Adjustment Batch
pages.text: An adjustment batch can only be deleted if it has not been applied or applied and is subsequently un-applied.  To delete an adjustment batch:  View the appropriate adjustment batch.  If required, un-apply the adjustment batch.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the adjustment batch is to be deleted.  Need more information on adjustment batches?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Contacts
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Contact's Details
pages.text: Contact details can be searched for and viewed using different methods:  Search for, and view details of, a specific contact.  Determine, and view details of, the contacts assigned to a specific customer.  The chosen method depends on what the primary requirement is for obtaining the information.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Search for a Contact's Details
pages.text: To search for a contact:  Select the Customer Care @ People @ Manage People option. The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria and click the Search… button.  If explicit criteria are entered, fewer contact records matching those criteria are returned.  The Family Name and Given Name fields can be used interchangeably.  Therefore, search for a family name by entering it in the Family Name field or Given Name field.  If the search returns:  A single contact, the Person Detail form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  If a single contact record is returned from a search, the details of that contact are displayed on the Person Detail form.  If more than one contact record is returned, the queries are listed on the Person List form.  The required contact record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Person Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Person Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Person List form is displayed.  Multiple contacts or the Always Display List? option was selected, the Person List form is displayed.  To access the Person Detail form from the Person List form, double-click the appropriate contact record in the list of retrieved contacts, or select the appropriate record and click the Details… button.  If, for example, the person has a status of Bad Risk, the entry for that person in the Person List form is displayed as greyed-out.  That display indicates that the person may be unsuitable as the primary contact for a customer; it does not indicate that there are restrictions imposed on the use of that person's details.  The company's business rules and practices determine whether a person having a status of Bad Risk can be assigned to a customer or be assigned queries.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: View Contacts for a Customer
pages.text: Determine the contacts assigned to a customer using either of the following forms:  Customer Hierarchy  Customer Detail  The contacts assigned to a specific customer are listed in the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, if the Contacts display option is selected.  Details for each of the assigned contacts can then be viewed.  Display options are used to select the items displayed in the right-hand panel for the customer or customer node selected in the left-hand panel.  If more than one contact is assigned to the customer, one of the contacts has the status of Primary; other contacts may display a status other than Primary, depending on the status set (if any) for that contact on the Customer Contacts form.  To search for a contact using the Customer Hierarchy form:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ Manage Customers option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter appropriate search criteria to retrieve the required customer, ensure that the Always Display Hierarchy? option is selected, and click the Search… button.  The Customer Hierarchy form is displayed listing the customers returned by the search.  Click the customer name in the left-hand panel.  The items (contacts, products, services, equipment, queries, and contracts) associated with the customer are listed in the right-hand panel (if all available display options are selected).  To view details of a specific contact, double-click the appropriate contact entry in the right-hand panel.  The Person Detail form for the specified contact is displayed in View Only mode.  The primary contact assigned to a customer can be viewed using the Customer Detail form.  The form also allows a list of all other contacts assigned to that customer to be viewed using the Other Contacts... button.  To search for a contact using the Customer Detail form:  View the appropriate customer's details.  To display details of the primary contact assigned to this customer, open the Contact tab.  The Contact tab does not display all details recorded for the primary contact.  If the required details are not displayed, click the More... button to display the Person Detail form.  To display details of any additional contacts assigned to this customer, click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode with summary details for the assigned contacts (other than the primary contact).  To view details of a specific contact, double-click the appropriate contact entry in the list, or select the entry and click the Details... button.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Record a New Contact
pages.text: Details of a new contact must be entered on the Person Detail form, which can be accessed from the:  Customer Care menu, by selecting the Customer Care @ People @ New Person option.  Customer Detail form, by clicking the New... button on the Contact tab.  The Person Search form is displayed, for recording details for the new contact.  To record details for a new contact:  On the Person Search form, enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields.  Select the Create a new person option and click the New… button.  Convergent Billing performs a search of the database and then displays either the Person Detail or Person List form.  When the New… button on the Person Search form is clicked, Convergent Billing performs a search of the database based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Person List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Person List form; the Person Detail form is then displayed.  Any information entered on the Person Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Person Detail form.  If the Person List form is displayed, view each of the records by selecting each record in turn and clicking the Details… button.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the fields in the upper part of the Person Detail form.  Select the Address & Phone tab, and enter at least one address and one phone number.  If required, complete the fields on the Other and General tabs.  Depending on the person type selected, the General tab may not contain any fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If all mandatory fields have been completed, the details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Assign a Primary Customer Contact
pages.text: A primary contact is assigned as part of creating a customer.  A primary customer contact can be changed if required.

pages.title: Change Primary Customer Contact
pages.text: To replace (change) the primary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Open the Contact tab.  Details of the current primary customer contact are displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  If details for the replacement contact are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.   If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.   Record the details for the replacement contact and then save them. A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the details of the current primary customer contact with those of the replacement contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Assign a Secondary Customer Contact
pages.text: To assign a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode, listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in Update mode with the cursor positioned at the start of a blank row.  If details for the contact to be assigned are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the contact to be assigned in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A prompt is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Alternatively, the Person List form may be displayed if the details entered on the Person Search form are similar to another person in the database. Record the details for the contact and then save the details.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation to assign the nominated contact to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button.  Repeat steps 3 to 6 for each contact to be assigned to the customer.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Change a Secondary Customer Contact
pages.text: To change (replace) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode, listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  If details for the replacement contact have been recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed. Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Record the details for the replacement contact and then save those details.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the contact.  Click the No or Cancel button to leave the existing contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Remove a Customer Contact
pages.text: A primary customer contact cannot be removed, only replaced (changed).  Secondary customer contacts can be removed, replaced, or modified whenever required.  To remove (unassign) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Select the row containing the contact to be removed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is placed in Update mode and the specified contact is removed.  Depending on privileges and the value in the Start Date field, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about customers?

pages.title: Update a Contact
pages.text: If sufficient update privileges are available, changes can be made to a contact record, and backdated.  To update a contact's details:  Display the appropriate Person Detail form.  Click the History button on the toolbar. The Person History form for the specified contact is displayed in View Only mode.  Examine the date ranges of the records in the list of historical records (if more than one) to determine whether an update is required to an historical, current, or future record.  If an update to an historical or future record is required, double-click the appropriate entry (the entry having the date range spanning the date to which the changes are to be backdated).  The Person Detail form is displayed with details for the specified contact record.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on update privileges and the start date of the record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Update the person details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If all mandatory fields have been completed, the details are saved, the message 'Changes saved successfully' is displayed on the status bar, and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Delete a Contact
pages.text: Rules for Deleting a Contact  A contact record can be deleted only if:  The record is not assigned as the primary contact for a customer or customer node.  Main or initial contact associated with a customer.  If more than one contact is listed for a specific customer, one of those contacts is specified as the primary contact.  Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  See also Contact and Secondary Contact.  A query is not assigned to that contact.  Any customer enquiry recorded and subsequently processed is referred to as a query.  [[FigureXref:2352-1]] displays the query process.  [[Figure:2352-1]]  Query Process  A query can be recorded against a customer (existing or potential) or, more rarely, against a contact.  Recording a query against a contact is used to accurately record information reported by customers, and for an organisation to obtain statistical information on the types of inquiry being handled and the frequency of each type.  A query must first be recorded (usually by the person who deals directly with the customer making the enquiry) and then either resolved immediately or forwarded electronically to a work group to be resolved.  The act of forwarding the query to a work group is referred to as progressing the query.  If the designated work group cannot resolve the query, or can only provide a partial answer, that work group progresses (forwards) the query to another work group.  Progression continues until the initial query is resolved and a response is made to the customer.  The progression of a query from creation to resolution, using one or more work groups, is referred to as the query workflow.  [[FigureXref:2352-2]] displays the query progression.  [[Figure:2352-2]]  Query Progression  Query workflow ensures that each query is resolved in the fastest possible time and in the most efficient manner, regardless of the query type.  While a query remains unresolved, it is regarded as being open.  Until it is resolved, it is regarded as being closed.  When a query is forwarded to a work group, that work group actually receives a copy of the query and uses the copy as their ‘working’ document.  The ‘working’ document is referred to as a progression and is used to record any actions taken by the work group and, where possible, the solution to the original query.  Document used to record the actions taken by a work group to resolve a query.  If the query cannot be resolved by the current work group, that work group adds resolution text to the progression before forwarding the query to another work group.    Each progression therefore contains progress text (detailing the actions taken by a previous work group) and resolution text (detailing the actions performed by the current work group to resolve the query).  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progress Text, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting confirmation that the query is to be progressed to the specified work force.  By default, the work force displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work force.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work force.  Need more information on queries?  If the query cannot be resolved by the nominated work group, that work group adds text to the progression (known as resolution text) stating what actions were taken and what progress was made, and forwards a copy of the progression to the next work group.  The resolution text copied from the previous progression becomes the progress text on which the new work group bases its actions.  The process of forwarding a copy of a progression to the next work group continues until a work group can resolve the query.  At this point, a copy of the text stating how the query can be resolved is recorded against the original query and the query is deemed to be closed.  The query workflow mechanism ensures that each progression and the original query are retained and can be viewed.  Text on which a work group bases its actions.  The progress text is created as resolution text by the previous work group before progressing the query to the current work group.  For the initial progression, the progress text is a copy of the query text.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress, Progression, Query Text, and Resolution Text.  Text added to a progression by a work group.  If this work group has not resolved the query, the resolution text becomes the progress text for the next work group.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Progress Text, Progression, and Query Text.  The contact is not in use in the date range specified.  A contact can be assigned to more than one customer record (as a primary or secondary contact).  Each primary contact assignment must be removed before the specified contact record can be deleted.  Person, other than the primary contact, assigned as an additional contact for a customer.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Customer Contact and Primary Contact.  To delete a contact record:  View the appropriate Person Detail form.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Specify the date from which to delete the contact.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, the date and time.  Click the Yes button to delete the contact record.  To cancel the request to delete the specified contact, click the No or Cancel button.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Create a Query
pages.text: A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Contracts
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Record Contract Details
pages.text: To create a contract record:  Display the appropriate customer on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag the Contract icon onto the appropriate customer node.  Click the Contract icon and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor until the required customer's name is highlighted.  Drop the icon by releasing the mouse button.  The Contract Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged onto the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one with an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  Enter the contract details.  To allocate all compatible services in the customer's hierarchy to the contract, ensure that the Allocate all services? check box is selected.  If the Allocate all services? check box is selected, in addition to all available services being added to the contract, any new services created for the customer are also automatically added to the contract.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on contracts?

pages.title: Allocate a Service to a Contract
pages.text: To allocate a service to a contract:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the Service Search… button.  The Service Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria and ensure that the Available Services option is selected.  Click the Search… button.  The Available Services List form is displayed in view only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate service and click the Allocate button.  A contract icon is displayed next to the selected service.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on contracts?

pages.title: Remove a Service from a Contract
pages.text: To remove a service from a contract:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the Service Search… button.  The Service Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria and ensure that the Allocated Services option is selected.  Click the Search… button.  The Allocated Service List form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate service and click the Deallocate button.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about contracts?

pages.title: Update Contract Details
pages.text: To update a contract record:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Contract Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the contract details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on contracts?

pages.title: View Contract Details
pages.text: To view contract details:  Select the Customer Care @ Contracts @ Manage Contracts option.  The Contract Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single contract, the Contract Detail form is displayed in View Only mode (if the Always display list? option is not selected).  Multiple contracts, or the Always display list? option is selected, the Contract List form is displayed.  To access the Contract Detail form from the Contract List form, double-click the appropriate contract record in the list of retrieved contracts, or select the appropriate record and click the Details… button.  Need more information on contracts?

pages.title: Cancel a Contract
pages.text: To cancel a contract:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirmation window is displayed.  Set the date-time from when the cancellation is to take effect.  The cancellation date must be within the date range of the current record.  If today’s date is within the date range of the current record, the cancellation date defaults to today’s date.  Otherwise, the cancellation date defaults to the Start Date of the record.  Click the Continue Cancellation button.  The message 'Record cancelled successfully' is displayed.  Click the OK button to confirm that the contract be cancelled.  Need more information on contracts?

pages.title: Delete a Contract
pages.text: A contract can only be deleted if it has a status of 'Cancelled', or if it has no services associated with it.  To delete a contract:  View the appropriate contract.  Click the History button on the toolbar.  The Contract History form is displayed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on contracts?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Customers
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Create a Customer
pages.text: Customer details are recorded on the Customer Detail form, which can be accessed by:  Using the Customer Search form  Dragging and dropping the customer icon into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Although both methods can be used to create customers, the second method is primarily used to create customer nodes within a customer hierarchy.  To create a customer using the Customer Search form:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ New Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria on the Details tab.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, click the Address tab and select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the address details.  Ensure that the Create a new customer option is selected and click the New… button.  The system performs a search of the database and then displays either the Customer Detail form or the Customer List form.  When the New… button on the Customer Search form is clicked, a search of the database is performed based on the information specified on the search form.  If no records are found that match the criteria, the Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  If one or more records that match the information about the search form are found, those records are displayed on the Customer List form.  Details of each record (using the Details… button) can then be displayed, and if an appropriate match does not exist, a new record can be created by clicking the New… button on the Customer List form; the Customer Detail form is then displayed in Insert mode.  Any information entered on the Customer Search form is inserted into the appropriate fields on the Customer Detail form irrespective of the mechanism by which the Customer Detail form is displayed.  If the Customer List form is displayed, view each of the records displayed.  If an appropriate match does not exist, click the New… button on the Customer List form.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Invoice Formats… button on the Invoicing tab.  The Customer Invoice Format form is displayed.  Select an invoice format.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To create a customer using the technique of dragging and dropping:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  To create a:  root customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the Hierarchy node (located at the top of the left-hand panel).  child customer node, drag and drop the Customer icon onto the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel.  Node that is a direct subordinate (or child) of a node (referred to as a parent customer node) located at the next highest level of the customer hierarchy.   Context:  Convergent Billing, Customer Management  A child customer node can also be the parent customer node of a node (or nodes) located at a lower level in a customer hierarchy.  See also Customer Hierarchy, Parent Customer Node, and Root Customer Node.  In both cases, the Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by the system.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the customer icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes (listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form) or the hierarchy node.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the customer icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  Complete the basic customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Create a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: To create a customer hierarchy:  Create a root customer node.  Create one or more child customer nodes.  Create one or more child customer nodes for each customer node created in step 2.  Create one or more child customer nodes for each customer node created in step 3.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Update Customer Details
pages.text: To update customer details:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Depending on available privileges and the start date of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the form is displayed in Update mode.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  Update the customer details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Change Status of a Customer
pages.text: To change the status of a customer's account:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Change the Account Status field to one of the available status options.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Generate a Bill Run for a Customer
pages.text: To create a bill run for a customer:  View the appropriate customer’s details.  On the Billing tab, click the Immediate Bill Run… button.  The One-off Task Definition form is displayed in Update mode.    Enter the appropriate information and click Save on the toolbar.

pages.title: Blacklist a Customer
pages.text: To blacklist a customer, Mark Customer as Blacklisted security privilege must be available on the Customer Detail form.  To blacklist a customer:  View the relevant customer's details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Depending on privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Change the Account Status field to Black-listed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about customers?

pages.title: View a Bill Run Details
pages.text: View the appropriate customer's details.  Select the Billing tab on the Customer Detail form.  Click on the Bill Run Details… button to see the customer's bill run details.

pages.title: View Customer Details
pages.text: To view a customer's details:  Select the Customer Care @ Customers @ Manage Customer option.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Enter the name of the customer in the Customer Name field.  Enter additional search criteria in the other fields, if required.  If part or all of the customer's address is available, select an address format from the drop-down list, then enter the details.  Select one of the following options:  Always Display Hierarchy?  If a single customer record is returned from a search, that customer’s details are displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If more than one customer record is returned, the records are listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display Hierarchy? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Reuse Last Hierarchy? option to list customers on single or multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form.  If multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form are required for display (for example, to focus a search for a specific customer) the Reuse last hierarchy? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last Hierarchy? option overrides the display of the customer hierarchy in a new form; the customer hierarchy is displayed in the existing form.  Select the Search for customers option and click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single customer record, the Customer Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display Hierarchy? option was not selected).  More than one customer record, or the Always Display Hierarchy? option was selected, the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed listing each of the customer records that matched the search criteria in a new form.  If the Reuse Last Hierarchy? option was selected, the customer records are displayed on the last Customer Hierarchy form.  To view:  Items associated with a specific customer record, click the customer name in the left-hand panel; the items (contacts, products, services, equipment, queries, and contracts) associated with that customer are listed in the right-hand panel (if all available display options are selected).  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Details of a specific customer record, double-click the appropriate customer record, or select the record and click the Details… button.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Deactivate a Customer
pages.text: To deactivate a customer:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Cancel Customer form is displayed.  Set the date on which the cancellation is to take effect.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Only the last customer detail history record can be cancelled.  The date must be between the start and end dates of the history record.  By default, the cancellation date is today's date at 12:00:00 AM.  Select the appropriate Final Invoice Details options.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Click the Continue Cancellation button.  The message 'Customer cancelled successfully' is displayed.  Click the OK button to remove the confirmation message.  Depending on the selected Final Invoice Details group options, one or more post-cancellation tasks may be performed.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Need more information about customers?

pages.title: Delete a Customer
pages.text: If the customer account is being finalised, the customer record can be deactivated (cancelled) rather than being deleted.  To delete a customer's record:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer to be deleted.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the History button on the toolbar.  The Customer History form is displayed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Change Primary Customer Contact
pages.text: To replace (change) the primary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Open the Contact tab.  Details of the current primary customer contact are displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  If details for the replacement contact are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.   If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.   Record the details for the replacement contact and then save them. A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the details of the current primary customer contact with those of the replacement contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Assign a Secondary Customer Contact
pages.text: To assign a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode, listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in Update mode with the cursor positioned at the start of a blank row.  If details for the contact to be assigned are recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Search for and display the details of the contact to be assigned in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A prompt is displayed to confirm that the nominated contact is to be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Alternatively, the Person List form may be displayed if the details entered on the Person Search form are similar to another person in the database. Record the details for the contact and then save the details.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation to assign the nominated contact to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button.  Repeat steps 3 to 6 for each contact to be assigned to the customer.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Change a Secondary Customer Contact
pages.text: To change (replace) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in View Only mode, listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the value in the Start Date field of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  If details for the replacement contact have been recorded in the system, click the Search... button.  The Person Search form is displayed. Search for and display the details of the replacement contact in the Person Detail form.  If the search retrieves more than one contact, the Person List form is displayed.  Select the replacement contact from the list and click the Assign button on the Person List form.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Continue at step 6 of this procedure.  If details for the replacement contact are not recorded in the system, click the New... button.  The Person Search form is displayed.  Enter any relevant information about the contact in the search criteria fields and click the New… button.  The Person Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Record the details for the replacement contact and then save those details.  A message is displayed for confirmation that the nominated contact be assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Yes button to replace the contact.  Click the No or Cancel button to leave the existing contact.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Remove a Customer Contact
pages.text: A primary customer contact cannot be removed, only replaced (changed).  Secondary customer contacts can be removed, replaced, or modified whenever required.  To remove (unassign) a secondary customer contact:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Other Contacts... button on the Contact tab.  The Customer Contacts form is displayed listing the secondary contacts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Select the row containing the contact to be removed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Customer Contacts form is placed in Update mode and the specified contact is removed.  Depending on privileges and the value in the Start Date field, a Confirm window may be displayed before the Customer Contacts form is displayed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about customers?

pages.title: View an Account
pages.text: The method to access and view a customer’s account depends on whether the account number is known.  If the account number is known:  Select the Accounts @ Account History option. The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the account number in the Account Number field.  Press Tab or click the Refresh History button. Transaction details associated with the specified account are displayed including the account balance.  If the account number is not known:  View the Customer Details Form for the customer.  To view the primary account, click the Account History… button.  The Account History form is displayed with details of the primary account including the account balance.  To view a secondary account, click the Other Accounts… button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Double-click the account to be viewed or select the account and click the Account History… button.  The Account History form is displayed with details of the specified secondary account.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: View an Account Transaction
pages.text: To view an account transaction:  View the account history for the relevant customer.  Display the required transaction entry in the lower part of the form by scrolling through the list of transactions.  Double-click the transaction to be viewed, or select the transaction and click the Details… button.  The appropriate form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected transaction.  Transaction Selected  Form Displayed  Invoice  Invoice Detail form  Statement  Statement Detail form  Payment  Individual Payment Detail form  Adjustment  Individual Adjustment Detail form  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: Change Status of a Customer
pages.text: To change the status of a customer's account:  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Change the Account Status field to one of the available status options.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: Create a Secondary Account
pages.text: To create a secondary account:  View the Customer Details form for the appropriate customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Click the Other Accounts... button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on privileges and the start date of the record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Enter the account number (if known) and/or select the account type.  Multiple accounts of the same type can be added to a customer node, if allowed by the account type.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The account details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  If an account number is not entered, Convergent Billing assigns a number before saving the account details.  To enter additional secondary accounts, repeat Steps 3 to 5.  Close the Other Accounts form.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: Create a Query
pages.text: A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Create a List for a Customer
pages.text: To create a list:  View the Customer Detail form for the root customer or customer node assigned the product instance.  Select the Lists tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate list form the left-hand panel of the tab.  Complete the fields on the right-hand side of the tab.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on lists?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Customer Hierarchies
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Display the Customer Hierarchy Form
pages.text: To display the Customer Hierarchy form, use one of the following methods:  Perform a customer search ensuring that the Always Display Hierarchy option is selected. Use the Reuse last Hierarchy?option to display single or multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form.  If multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form are required for display (for example, to focus a search for a specific customer) the Reuse last hierarchy? option should not be selected.  If selected, the Reuse last Hierarchy? option overrides the display of the customer hierarchy in a new form; the customer hierarchy is displayed in the existing form.  If a single customer record is returned from a search, that customer’s details are displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If more than one customer record is returned, the records are listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Customer Detail form.  If selected, the Always Display Hierarchy? option overrides the automatic display of the Customer Detail form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Click the Hierarchy… button on the Customer Detail form.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: View a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: To view a customer hierarchy:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the specified customer.  Expand the hierarchy until the relevant customer node is displayed.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Manipulate the Display
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the task:  Expand a Customer Hierarchy  Collapse a Customer Hierarchy  Scroll the List of Customer Nodes  Scroll the List of Customer Nodes while Dragging an Item  Change the Width of the Left-hand Panel  Set the Display Options

pages.title: Expand a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: To expand a customer node:  Highlight the customer node to be expanded.  Click the Expand button or double-click the customer node name.  To fully expand a customer hierarchy, repeat steps 1 and 2 for every parent node.  Alternatively, click the '+' symbol to the left of the node name.  Only parent nodes (nodes having one or more child nodes) can be expanded.  They have a '+' symbol to the left of the node name.  Expanding a node after it is collapsed displays all child nodes, regardless of whether a child node matches the initial search criteria used to select the (customer) nodes.  Because there may be a large number of child nodes, the maximum number of child nodes displayed can be limited by configuration.  If a parent node that has more child nodes than the limit is expanded, a warning message is displayed.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Collapse a Customer Node
pages.text: To collapse a customer node:  Highlight the customer node to be collapsed.  Click the Collapse button or double-click the customer node name.  Alternatively, click the '-' symbol to the left of the node name.  To collapse a customer's entire hierarchy:  Highlight the root customer node.  Click the Collapse button or click the '-' symbol to the left of the node name.  Only parent nodes (nodes having one or more child nodes) can be collapsed, and only if they are expanded.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Scroll List of Customer Nodes
pages.text: To scroll the list of customer nodes displayed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form up or down, use the vertical scroll bar.  To scroll the list of customer nodes left or right, use the horizontal scroll bar.  An alternative method of finding a specific customer node is to display customer nodes in multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form, by using the Reuse last Hierarchy? option on the Customer Search form.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Scroll List of Customer Nodes while Dragging an Item
pages.text: The vertical scroll bar for displaying a customer node in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form cannot be used while dragging an item (for example, the Customer icon or Query icon) in a single Customer Hierarchy form.  Symbol  Description  This icon can be dragged and dropped on one of the customer nodes listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form to create a new query.  Symbol  Description  This icon can be dragged and dropped onto one of the customer nodes listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form to create a new customer node.  A new root customer node can be created if the icon is dropped onto the hierarchy node.  To display nodes nearer the top of the list, position the cursor above the middle of the first displayed node.  Scroll up the list to display nodes nearer the top of the list.  To display nodes nearer the bottom of the list, position the cursor below the middle of the last displayed node.  Scroll down the list to display nodes nearer the bottom of the list.  An alternative method is to display multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form to list the customer node to which an item can be dragged.  To display multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form, use the Reuse last Hierarchy? option on the Customer Search form.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Change Width of Left-hand Panel
pages.text: To change the relative widths of the left-hand and right-hand panels of the Customer Hierarchy form:  Position the cursor over the panel divider until the cursor changes shape to <-||->.  Hold down the left mouse button and drag the cursor to the right or left.  When the required width is achieved, release the left mouse button.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Set Display Options
pages.text: Examples are:  To display a specific type of item in the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, select the appropriate display option check box.  To remove a specific type of item from the display, deselect the associated display option check box.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Display More than one Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: When moving a product between nodes in different customer hierarchies, or when moving a customer node between customer hierarchies, both customer hierarchies must be displayed.    To do this:  Using the Customer Search form, search for the first instance of the customer hierarchy.  Ensure that the Always Display Hierarchy? option is selected.  The source Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Using the Customer Search form, search for the second instance of the customer hierarchy.  Ensure that the Always Display Hierarchy? option is selected, and Reuse Last Hierarchy? is not selected.  The destination Customer Hierarchy form is displayed.  Expand each hierarchy until the customer node containing the product to be moved (the source node) and the customer node to receive the moved product (the target node) are displayed.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: List Customer Nodes in a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: To list all nodes in a customer hierarchy:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the specified customer.  Fully expand the hierarchy.  All nodes in the hierarchy are listed below the root customer node in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: View Details of a Customer Node
pages.text: To view details of a customer node:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the specified customer.  Expand the hierarchy until the required customer node is displayed in the left-hand panel.  Select the customer node and click the Details… button or double-click the customer node.  The Customer Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Create a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: To create a customer hierarchy:  Create a root customer node.  Create one or more child customer nodes.  Create one or more child customer nodes for each customer node created in step 2.  Create one or more child customer nodes for each customer node created in step 3.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Create a Root Customer Node
pages.text: To create a root customer node:  Display the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the Customer icon onto the hierarchy node (located at the top of the left-hand panel).  The Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow symbol.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by Convergent Billing.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the customer icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes (listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form) or the hierarchy node.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the customer icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  Complete the customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a customer node is created or updated with a start or end date outside of the displayed hierarchy's date, the Customer Hierarchy form is refreshed to the new date.  The refreshed form displays only the updated node and the node's parent from the record's effective start date.  Any sibling or other nodes displayed previously are not displayed.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Create a Child Customer Node
pages.text: To create a child customer node:  Display the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the Customer icon onto the appropriate customer node in the left-hand panel.  The Customer Detail form is opened in Insert mode.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to an arrow symbol.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by Singleview Convergent Billing.  Complete the customer details in the upper part of the form.  Select and then complete each tab relevant to the customer type specified.  Repeat steps 2 to 4 for each child node.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a customer node is created or updated with a start or end date outside of the displayed hierarchy's date, the Customer Hierarchy form is refreshed to the new date.  The refreshed form displays only the updated node and the node's parent from the record's effective start date.  Any sibling or other nodes displayed previously are not displayed.  A child customer node inherits the customer type of the parent node.  Many fields on the Customer Detail form default according to the customer type.  If the customer type is later changed, the fields default to the new customer type, except for the Invoice Format field.   Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Assign a Product using Drag and Drop
pages.text: To drag and drop a product:  Click the appropriate product icon and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the required customer's name is highlighted.  Drop the product icon by releasing the mouse button.  As the product icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting a hand symbol.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by Convergent Billing.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the selected product icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes (listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form).  The product icon is indicative only.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the selected product icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  The product icon is indicative only.  Only base products, not companion products, can be dragged and dropped onto a customer.   Need more information on products?

pages.title: List a Customer's Product Instances
pages.text: To list the product instances associated with a specific customer:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Companion Products display options.  Summary information about each base and companion product instance associated with the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Cancelled companion products are displayed only if both the Products and Cancelled Products options are selected.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: List a Customer's Services
pages.text: To list the services associated with a specific customer:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Services display option.  Summary information about each service associated with the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Create a Query
pages.text: A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: List Queries
pages.text: The following queries can be listed:  Queries associated with a specific customer  Using the display options on the Customer Hierarchy form, this method is used to view a list of:  Only open (unresolved) queries  Only closed (resolved) queries  Both open and closed queries.  Queries that match specific search criteria for viewing only the open (unresolved) queries that match the search criteria, or all queries that match the criteria.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: View a Contact's Details
pages.text: Contact details can be searched for and viewed using different methods:  Search for, and view details of, a specific contact.  Determine, and view details of, the contacts assigned to a specific customer.  The chosen method depends on what the primary requirement is for obtaining the information.  Need more information on contacts?

pages.title: Maintain a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: Convergent Billing is used to:  Maintain details of individual customer nodes.  Add customer nodes to a hierarchy.  Deactivate customer nodes.  Delete customer nodes from a hierarchy.  Move customer nodes within, between, and out of hierarchies.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Move a Customer Node
pages.text: Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move Multiple Customer Nodes  A child customer node can be moved:  To another location within the same hierarchy  Out of a hierarchy, creating a new root customer node  To a different hierarchy.  To perform one of these actions, the following privileges must be available:  Update privileges on the customer being moved.  View privileges on the customer node that will become the new parent customer node of the node being moved.  View privileges for blacklisted customers (if the customer node to be moved is blacklisted).  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes within a hierarchy.  Privileges to move products or child customer nodes between hierarchies.  Depending on the type of customer node move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move a customer node:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving a customer node within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the customer node and drag and drop it on to the appropriate customer node.  If moving a customer node out of a hierarchy (that is, a child node is to become a root node), select the child node and drag and drop it onto the hierarchy node.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.    Enter the appropriate date range.  Depending on security settings, the Start Date and End Date fields consist of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Click the Continue button.  The customer node being moved has its start date usually set to the customer hierarchy search date.  If this date is less than the current date and the user does not have historical update privileges, the start date is set to the current date.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  The invoice cycle for all customers being moved is adjusted to be the invoice cycle of the new root customer node.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Move Multiple Customer Nodes
pages.text: Restrictions on Moving a Customer Node  Move a Customer Node  Multiple customer nodes can be moved only if they are a group of child nodes under the same parent node.  For example, if MegaWork's Melbourne and Sydney offices are both to be moved from the Sales Division and located directly under the head office in the hierarchy, both child nodes can be highlighted and moved simultaneously.  If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and the move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  To move multiple customer nodes:  Display and fully expand the customer hierarchy for the appropriate customer.  Use two instances of the Customer Hierarchy form if necessary.  If moving child nodes within a hierarchy or to a different hierarchy, select the appropriate nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the appropriate customer node on the left-hand panel of the form.  To select:  A group of customer nodes next to each other, hold down the Shift key, select the first node in the group, then the last node in the group.  All nodes in between the first and the last are automatically highlighted.  Multiple customer nodes not grouped together, hold down the Ctrl key, and then click each relevant node.  If moving customer nodes out of a hierarchy (that is, a group of child nodes are to become root nodes), select the nodes from the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form and drag and drop them onto the hierarchy node on the left-hand panel of the form.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The forms displayed throughout the rest of the move are determined by the move preferences previously selected.  If one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves.  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed, and why.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Set Customer Node Move Preferences
