pages.text: Depending on the type of customer move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple customer nodes are being moved, and one or more of the nodes fail to move, preferences can be set to do either of the following:  Cancel all the moves  Move the nodes that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  If changes to the customer records are required directly following the move, preferences can also be set to display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences options.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To set cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all possible nodes and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group.  To display the Customer Detail form for each of the moved customer nodes, select 'Display details form in update mode after each individual customer move'.  Click OK.  Need more information on hierarchies?

pages.title: Move a Product Instance between Customer Nodes
pages.text: If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  The following restrictions apply when moving a product instance:  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance was created as part of a product offer.  A product cannot be moved if its owning customer or target customer is blacklisted at any time during the move period and the user does not have access to view blacklisted customers on the Customer Form.  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance is cancelled, moved, or upgraded at the effective start date or any later date.   A product must be assigned to a customer node.  A product dragged over a root node or blank space of the hierarchy panel cannot be dropped.   Some information regarding the lists and charge categories may need to be entered (when prompted) before the product instance move can be completed.  If a product instance is moved, any changes made to it before or after the move start date are not carried over in the move.  For example, if the product instance is moved at an effective date before an equipment allocation change, following the move the variation of equipment allocation is not reflected.  A warning is displayed so the user can cancel the move.   To move a product instance:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instance (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that the product instance and not the associated service is dragged and dropped.  To drag and drop a product instance, click the product instance and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instance onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instance is dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Move a Product Instance using Drag and Drop
pages.text: To move a product instance:  Click the product instance and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Drop the product instance onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instance is dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Move Multiple Product Instances between Customer Nodes
pages.text: If this is the first move performed since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances on the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  To move multiple product instances:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instances (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that product instances are dragged and dropped, and not the associated services.  To drag and drop product instances, select the product instances and while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instances onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instances are dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The Move Progress form is displayed.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Select Multiple Product Instances
pages.text: To select:  A group of product instances next to each other, select the first instance in the group, hold down the Shift key, and then select the last instance in the group.  All instances in between the first and the last are automatically highlighted.  Multiple product instances not grouped together, hold down the Ctrl key, and then click each relevant instance.

pages.title: Set Product Instance Move Preferences
pages.text: Depending on type of move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple product instances are being moved, and one or more of the instances fail to move, preferences can be set to do the following:  Cancel all moves.  Move the instances that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select the Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences option.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all instances possible and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report' after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group.  Click OK.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Deactivate a Customer
pages.text: To deactivate a customer:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The Cancel Customer form is displayed.  Set the date on which the cancellation is to take effect.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, date and time.  Only the last customer detail history record can be cancelled.  The date must be between the start and end dates of the history record.  By default, the cancellation date is today's date at 12:00:00 AM.  Select the appropriate Final Invoice Details options.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Click the Continue Cancellation button.  The message 'Customer cancelled successfully' is displayed.  Click the OK button to remove the confirmation message.  Depending on the selected Final Invoice Details group options, one or more post-cancellation tasks may be performed.  The available options are used to specify whether the final invoice is to be generated immediately or included in the next invoice cycle.  If the customer type references the Customer Cancel entity validation, the Generate final invoice immediately? option is enabled.  Select this option to generate and print the final invoice immediately.  If the Generate final invoice immediately? option is selected, the Show Details… button is enabled.  This button enables new values to be entered in any of the 10 General entity validation fields that have been configured.  Clicking the Hide Details… button makes these details disappear.  If invoice generation is not immediate, select the printer to which the invoice should be sent.    If any outstanding transactions should be included in the next invoice cycle, select the appropriate cycle in the Invoice Cycle for final invoice field.  An invoice cycle for final invoice should be chosen if a customer node in a customer hierarchy is being cancelled.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Prepaid without statements customers do not generate invoices. Therefore, the Final Invoice Details options are not displayed for a prepaid without statements customer.  Need more information about customers?

pages.title: Deactivate a Customer Hierarchy
pages.text: To delete a customer hierarchy:  Display and fully expand the required customer hierarchy.  Deactivate each child node at the lowest hierarchy level.  Repeat step 2 for each level in the hierarchy until only the root customer node remains.  Deactivate the root customer node.  Need more information about hierarchies?

pages.title: Delete a Customer
pages.text: If the customer account is being finalised, the customer record can be deactivated (cancelled) rather than being deleted.  To delete a customer's record:  Cancel each product instance associated with the customer to be deleted.  View the appropriate customer's details.  Click the History button on the toolbar.  The Customer History form is displayed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on customers?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Customer Accounts
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View an Account
pages.text: The method to access and view a customer’s account depends on whether the account number is known.  If the account number is known:  Select the Accounts @ Account History option. The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the account number in the Account Number field.  Press Tab or click the Refresh History button. Transaction details associated with the specified account are displayed including the account balance.  If the account number is not known:  View the Customer Details Form for the customer.  To view the primary account, click the Account History… button.  The Account History form is displayed with details of the primary account including the account balance.  To view a secondary account, click the Other Accounts… button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Double-click the account to be viewed or select the account and click the Account History… button.  The Account History form is displayed with details of the specified secondary account.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: Create a Primary Account
pages.text: A primary account is created when the details for a new customer are recorded in the system.  The primary account number can either be entered manually (when other details are recorded) or assigned to the customer automatically by Singleview Convergent Billing.  The format of an automatically assigned primary account number is determined by the account type.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: Create a Secondary Account
pages.text: To create a secondary account:  View the Customer Details form for the appropriate customer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Click the Other Accounts... button.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed listing the secondary accounts (if any) assigned to the specified customer.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar.  The Other Accounts for Customer form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on privileges and the start date of the record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Update privileges required for types of update:  Type of Update  Privilege Required  Used To  Normal  Update  Update current and future records.  Historical Update  Update an historical record, or the current record and backdate the changes.  Date range  Date Range Update  Modify the date range of an historical record.  Enter the account number (if known) and/or select the account type.  Multiple accounts of the same type can be added to a customer node, if allowed by the account type.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The account details are saved and the form is reopened in View Only mode.  If an account number is not entered, Convergent Billing assigns a number before saving the account details.  To enter additional secondary accounts, repeat Steps 3 to 5.  Close the Other Accounts form.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: View an Account Transaction
pages.text: To view an account transaction:  View the account history for the relevant customer.  Display the required transaction entry in the lower part of the form by scrolling through the list of transactions.  Double-click the transaction to be viewed, or select the transaction and click the Details… button.  The appropriate form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected transaction.  Transaction Selected  Form Displayed  Invoice  Invoice Detail form  Statement  Statement Detail form  Payment  Individual Payment Detail form  Adjustment  Individual Adjustment Detail form  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: Record a Payment
pages.text: Payments can be entered:  Individually  In batches of the same payment type.  Before entering a payment, ensure that the following information is available:  Accurate information about the customer  Amount being paid  Payment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter a payment.  When entering a payment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer whose account is being credited. Then the customer's account number can be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about payments?

pages.title: Record an Adjustment
pages.text: Adjustments can be entered in either of the following ways:  Individually  In batches of the same adjustment type.  Before entering an adjustment, ensure that accurate information about the customer is available, amount of the adjustment, and the adjustment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter an adjustment.  When entering an adjustment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer getting the adjustment.  The customer's account number can then be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about adjustments?

pages.title: Delete an Account
pages.text: Rules for Deleting a Secondary Account.  To delete a secondary account:  Security privileges must be available to delete the record.  The account balance must be zero.  No future records for this customer that specify this account must exist.  Primary accounts cannot be deleted.  To delete a secondary account:  View the appropriate account history.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the account is to be deleted.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: View an Account Type
pages.text: To view an account type:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Account Types option.  The Account Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of account types that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate account type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate account type.  The Account Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on account types?

pages.title: Define an Account Type
pages.text: To define an account type:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Account Types option.  The Account Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Account Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on account types?

pages.title: Delete a Reservation
pages.text: To delete a non-volatile reservation:  View the account history for an account associated with the reservation.  Select the Reservations tab and highlight the reservation to be deleted.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the reservation is to be deleted.  Need more information on accounts?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Usage Details
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View Customer Usage Details
pages.text: To view a customer’s usage details:  Select the Accounts @ Account History option.  The Account History form is displayed in View Only mode.  Enter the appropriate account number in the Account Number field and tab out of the field or click the Refresh History button.  The account’s transaction details are displayed.  Click the Usage Details… button.  The Usage Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria.  Specify the appropriate type of usage details to be included in the search by selecting the appropriate option in the Search for group.  To include all events associated with the specified customer node and its child nodes, select the Show all usage liability? check box.  Click the Search… button.  The Call Usage Display form is displayed.  One or more service numbers are listed in the Service Number column.  To view the usage details of a specific service number, double click on the appropriate number.  The usage details are displayed in the Usage Details grid on the right-hand side of the form.  Need more information on customer usage details?

pages.title: Print Customer Usage Details
pages.text: To print a copy of a customer’s usage details:  Display the appropriate usage details.  Click the Report… button.  The Printing Call Detail Image form is displayed.  The Report... button is only enabled if Hyperion SQR is installed.  Select a printer from the drop-down list and click OK.  Need more information about customer usage details?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Equipment
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View Equipment Details
pages.text: To view equipment details:  Select the Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.  The Equipment Search form is displayed.  The Transit tab is only displayed on the Equipment Search form if the equipment type is configured to enable the tab.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria.  Click the Search… button.  A list of equipment records matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate equipment record and click the Details... button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Update Equipment Details
pages.text: Convergent Billing provides facilities to update:  Individual equipment records  A range of two or more equipment records of the same equipment type.  To update the details of an individual equipment record:  View the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the equipment details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To update a range of equipment records of the same equipment type:  Search the appropriate equipment records and list them in the Equipment List form.  Select each equipment record to be included in the range to be updated.  For a contiguous number of equipment records, select the first record in the required range and do either of the following:  Hold down the Shift key, and select the last record in the required range.    Specify the number of records to be updated in the Select how many items? field, and click the Select button.  To select a number of individual equipment records, hold down the Ctrl key and select each record.  When more than one record is selected, the Detail… button on the Equipment List form is replaced with the Bulk Update button.  Click the Bulk Update button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode with details of the first equipment record in the selected range.  Make any required changes to the displayed record.  Any changes made to this record are also made to each of the other records in the selected range.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Record Equipment Details
pages.text: Convergent Billing provides two methods in which equipment details can be recorded in the equipment inventory:  Individually  In bulk.  To record (enter) equipment details for individual items of equipment:  Select either of the following options:  Customer Care @ Equipment @ New Equipment Items option.    Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.    The Equipment Search form is displayed.    Select the Create new equipment option.    Select the equipment type and enter the equipment serial number.    Click the New… button to insert a new equipment record.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Click the Save button.  To record (enter) equipment items in bulk:  Create the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Bulk Insert… button.  The Equipment Bulk Insert form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the serial number and/or network address for a specified item of equipment.  To add a new item, press the Down Arrow key to create an empty line and repeat step 3.  Repeat step 4 for each item of equipment to be inserted.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Close the Equipment Bulk Insert form to return control to the Equipment Detail form.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Allocate Equipment
pages.text: To allocate equipment:  Verify that the equipment to be allocated is recorded in the equipment inventory.  View the appropriate product instance.  Select one of the equipment entries and click the Allocate… button.  If the item of equipment is not allocated, a message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the appropriate button.  The Equipment Allocation form is displayed.  Select either of the following:  An item in each of the available equipment pools and click the Select button.  A list of valid equipment items is displayed.  If no equipment pools are displayed in the Equipment Pool Select group, all equipment items held in the equipment inventory are listed.  The Customer's equipment only option and click the Select button.  A list of equipment allocated to the specified customer is displayed.  Choose one of the selection options in the Allocate equipment group and where necessary, enter an appropriate value in the associated field.  The options in the Allocate equipment group on the Equipment Allocation form are used to select:  The first item in the range of items displayed  Select the First item in range option and click the Allocate... button.  Other item in the range of items displayed  The Other item in range option is available only when there is more than one item in the range.  Select the Other item in range option, enter the required item's serial number, and click the Allocate... button.  An item having a specific serial number  Select the Specific serial number option, enter the required item's serial number, and click the Allocate... button.  In each case, the specified item of equipment is allocated.  If equipment allocated to the customer is being reused, a warning message is displayed when the Allocate... button is clicked, prompting confirmation that it should be allocated.  Click the Allocate button.  The selected item of equipment is allocated.  To allocate an optional equipment item to the product instance, click the Add Equipment... button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 3 to 6 for each additional equipment item to be allocated to the product instance.   Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Configure Equipment Allocation
pages.text: To configure equipment allocation:  Define an entity validation definition to determine equipment allocation.  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option.  The Product Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Follow the steps described in Prepare for Product Definition to populate the form.  Click the Services tab.  Place the cursor in the Allocation Form Entity Validation field and click the down arrow to insert the entity validation definition created in Step 1.  Save the product definition.    When a product instance is created, the configured equipment allocation is applied on the Equipment Allocation form when allocating equipment of the specified equipment type.  The entity validation definition is usually set up to restrict the number of items displayed when allocating an equipment to a service.  For example, the definition may restrict the number of pools available from which equipment can be allocated (by Service Prefix, Region, or Pool Type).  Need more information about equipment types?

pages.title: Update Equipment Details
pages.text: Convergent Billing provides facilities to update:  Individual equipment records  A range of two or more equipment records of the same equipment type.  To update the details of an individual equipment record:  View the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the equipment details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To update a range of equipment records of the same equipment type:  Search the appropriate equipment records and list them in the Equipment List form.  Select each equipment record to be included in the range to be updated.  For a contiguous number of equipment records, select the first record in the required range and do either of the following:  Hold down the Shift key, and select the last record in the required range.    Specify the number of records to be updated in the Select how many items? field, and click the Select button.  To select a number of individual equipment records, hold down the Ctrl key and select each record.  When more than one record is selected, the Detail… button on the Equipment List form is replaced with the Bulk Update button.  Click the Bulk Update button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode with details of the first equipment record in the selected range.  Make any required changes to the displayed record.  Any changes made to this record are also made to each of the other records in the selected range.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Delete Equipment Details
pages.text: To delete equipment details:  View the appropriate equipment record.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, specify the date from which to delete the equipment.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component (date), or two components (date and time).   When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the equipment details are to be deleted.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Split a Range of Equipment Items
pages.text: Why split a range of equipment items?  A range of equipment items may need to be split.  For example, if a range of equipment items includes the serial numbers 0530 to 0539, and equipment items with serial numbers 0532 and 0533 are required to be reserved for a customer, the range of equipment items can be split to create following three ranges; 0530 to 0531, 0532 to 0533, and 0534 to 0539.    The original range of equipment is split by creating a new range 0532 to 0533, which is then removed from the original range.  The properties of the first and last range remain the same as the original range.  The range containing serial numbers 0532 to 0533 can then be changed to include a reservation for the appropriate customer.  To split a range of equipment items:  Select the Customer Care @ Equipment @ Manage Equipment option.  The Equipment Search form is displayed.  Specify the appropriate search criteria, ensuring that the Number of Items field is completed and contains a number greater than one.    Ensure the Always Display List? check box is selected.  Click the Search… button.  A list of the equipment records that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the range of equipment to be split and click the Split… button.  The Equipment Split form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate information and click the Continue Split button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed containing information about the new range of equipment items.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the form as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: Reallocating Equipment
pages.text: To reallocate equipment:  Verify that the equipment to be allocated is recorded in the equipment inventory.  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select one of the equipment entries and click the Allocate button.  The Equipment Allocation form is displayed.  Select one of the following:  An item in each of the available equipment pools, and click the Select button.  A list of valid equipment items is displayed.  If no equipment pools are display in the Equipment Pool Select group, all equipment items held in the equipment inventory are listed.  Customer's equipment option and click the Select button.  A list of equipment allocated to the specified customer is displayed.  Choose one of the selection options in the Allocate equipment group and, where necessary, enter an appropriate value in the associated field.  Click the Allocate button.  Depending on system configuration, either the Product Instance Detail form or Equipment Reallocation form is displayed.  If the Product Instance Detail form is displayed, click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the Equipment Reallocation form is displayed, enter the appropriate information and click OK.  Need more information about equipment?

pages.title: Reserve Equipment for Customers
pages.text: Equipment can be reserved by using either of the following methods:  Creating an item of equipment and reserving it for a customer.  Reserving an item of equipment for a customer.  To create an equipment item and reserve it for a customer:  Select the Customer Care @ Equipment @ New Equipment items option.  The Equipment Search form is displayed.  Select the type of equipment to be created from the equipment type drop-down list, and click the New… button.  The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Click the New… button on the Reservation tab.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Search for or create the customer for which the equipment is to be reserved.  Click the Assign button on the Equipment Detail form.  Complete the remainder of the data entry fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  To reserve an item of equipment for a customer:  View the appropriate equipment details.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the Reservation tab, and click the New… button.  The Customer Search form is displayed.  Search for or create the customer for which the equipment is to be reserved.  Click the Assign button on the Equipment Detail form.  Complete the remainder of the data entry fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about equipment?

pages.title: Change Status of an Equipment Item
pages.text: To change the status of an item of equipment:  Display the Equipment Detail form for the appropriate equipment item.  Click the Update button on the toolbar. The Equipment Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Change the setting in the Status field by selecting an alternative option from the drop-down list.  When changing the status of a equipment item to In-Transit, the Transit tab is enabled on the Equipment Detail form.  The Transit tab contains details specific to the equipment item while in transit.  The appropriate details for the equipment item while in transit are entered on this tab.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Invoices and Statements
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Select an Invoice Cycle
pages.text: To select an invoice cycle or change an invoice format selection:  View the appropriate Customer Detail form.  Select the Invoicing tab.  Click the Update button on toolbar.  Select the appropriate invoice cycle in the Invoice Cycle field.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: Select an Invoice Report Level
pages.text: To set a customer's invoice report level:  View the appropriate Customer Detail form.  Select the Invoicing tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate value in the Report Level field.  If the customer is a root customer, Report Level is automatically set to Invoice but can be changed to Transferred Statement.  Select a value in the Transferred Account Number field, if required.  The Transferred Account Number field is:  Available only if the customer is a root customer.  Mandatory if Report Level is set to Transferred Statement.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Ensure that the appropriate invoice cycle is set.

pages.title: Select an Invoice Format
pages.text: To select an invoice format or change an invoice format selection:  View the appropriate Customer Detail form.  Select the Invoicing tab.  Click the Invoice Formats… button.  The Invoice Format form is displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the required invoice format from the Invoice Format drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  After an invoice is generated for a customer in the selected invoice format, it is not possible to change the format or the order of the invoice formats for that customer.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: Search for an Invoice
pages.text: The method to use to search for and view the details of an invoice depends on whether the assigned invoice number is known.  If the invoice number is known:  Select the Accounts @ Invoices option.  The Invoice Search form is displayed.  Ensure that the Search field is set to Invoice Number and enter the invoice number in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search button.  If a valid invoice number is entered, the invoice is displayed.   Click the Detail… button.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the invoice.  If the invoice number is not known:  View the customer’s account history.  Double-click the appropriate invoice transaction in the list of transactions.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the specified invoice.  To locate the correct invoice transaction within the list of transactions, ask the enquirer for the date of the invoice; the date is usually printed prominently on the invoice in a predefined location.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: Generate an Invoice
pages.text: Invoices are raised against the customer's primary account and generated if the report level of the customer node is set to 'Invoice'.  The customer's invoice format must be set and the appropriate invoice cycle selected.    To generate an invoice, perform a bill run, ensuring that the 'To Operation' of the bill run includes invoice operations.

pages.title: Generate an Interim Invoice
pages.text: Interim invoices include all rental events whose tariffs have been marked as 'interim'.  To generate an interim invoice, perform the bill run schedule type Interim Bill Run.

pages.title: View Invoice Details
pages.text: To view the details of a generated invoice:  View the appropriate invoice.  Click the Invoice Details... button.  The Invoice Item Details form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria in the Invoice Hierarchy Search Criteria group and click the Search button.  A list of entities matching the specified criteria is displayed in the Invoice Hierarchy section.  Select the appropriate entity.  The invoice charges for the entity are displayed in the Item Details grid.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: View an Invoice Image
pages.text: Image Viewer Requirements  An image can be generated in a number of different formats; the appropriate image viewer must therefore be available.  Consult the System Administrator about the relevant viewer used.  To view the image:  View the appropriate invoice.  Select the Images tab.  If the image has been generated, click the Invoice Image... button.  If not, click the Generate Image button.  Depending on whether the invoice image is generated, Convergent Billing may ask whether the user wants to:  View the image  Click the Yes button to display the image using the appropriate viewer, or the No button to regenerate the image.  Schedule a task to generate the image  Click the OK button to schedule the appropriate task.  A message indicating that the schedule was submitted to and reached the server is displayed.  When the scheduled task is complete, the appropriate viewer is run automatically to display the generated image.  To cancel the request to schedule a task to generate the image, click the Cancel button.  Need more information on invoices?

pages.title: Reprint an invoice
pages.text: To reprint an invoice:  View the appropriate invoice.  Select the Images tab.  Click the Re-print Image button.  The Reprinting Invoice Image form is displayed.  To print the invoice immediately, select the Direct option in the Print Type group and select the appropriate printer from the Printer field.  Click OK.  To mark the invoice to print at predetermined scheduled intervals, select the Scheduled option in the Print Type group and click OK.  Need more information about invoices?

pages.title: Select a Statement Format
pages.text: To select a statement format or change a statement format selection:  View the appropriate Customer Detail form.  Select the Invoicing tab.  Click the Invoice Formats… button.  The Invoice Format form is displayed.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the required statement format from the Invoice Format drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: Search for a Statement
pages.text: Two ways to search for a statement are to:  Perform a general statement search.  View the statement using the customer's account history.  To perform a general statement search:  Select the Accounts @ Statements option.  The Statement Search form is displayed.  Use any one of the search criteria to restrict the number of records retrieved by specifying a wildcard search.  Click the Search button.  A list of the records that match the selection criteria is displayed on the lower part of the form.  The list includes records for statement nodes and non-reporting nodes.  The list of records retrieved when a non-specific search is performed includes a record for each statement node (a customer node that has a report level of Statement) and each non-reporting node (a customer node that has a report level of None) that match the selection criteria.  For statement nodes, the amount displayed in the Statement Amount column is the 'rolled-up' amount displayed on the customer's statement.  The 'rolled-up' amount includes the charges incurred at the statement node and the charges for any non-reporting nodes that are children of the specified statement node.  For non-reporting nodes, the amount displayed in the Statement Amount column indicates only the charges incurred by that node.  Double-click the required entry in the list or select the entry and click the Detail... button.  The Statement Detail form is displayed.  To view a statement using the customer's account history:  View the customer’s account history.  Double-click the appropriate statement transaction in the list of transactions.  The Statement Detail form is displayed with details of the specified statement.  To locate the correct statement within the list of transactions, ask the enquirer for the date of the statement; the date is usually printed prominently on the statement in a predefined location.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: View Statement Details
pages.text: To view details for a generated statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Click the Statement Details... button.  The Statement Item Details form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria in the Invoice Hierarchy Search Criteria group and click the Search button.  A list of entities matching the specified criteria is displayed in the Invoice Hierarchy section.  Select the appropriate entity.  The statement charges for the entity are displayed in the Item Details grid.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: View a Statement Image
pages.text: Image Viewer Requirements  To view the image:  View the appropriate statement.  Select the Images tab and click the Statement Image... button.  Depending on whether the statement image is generated, Convergent Billing may ask whether the user wants to:  View the image  Click the Yes button to display the image using the appropriate viewer, or the No button to regenerate the image.  Schedule a task to generate the image  Click the OK button to schedule the appropriate task.  A message indicating that the schedule was submitted to, and has reached, the server is displayed.  When the scheduled task is complete, the appropriate viewer is run automatically to display the generated image.    To cancel the request to schedule a task to generate the image, click the Cancel button.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: Reprint a Statement
pages.text: To reprint a statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Select the Images tab.  Click the Re-print Image button.  The Reprinting Invoice Image form is displayed.  To print the statement immediately, select the Direct option in the Print Type group and select the appropriate printer from the Printer field.  Click OK.  To mark the statement to print at predetermined, scheduled intervals, select the Scheduled option in the Print Type group and click OK.  Need more information about statements?

pages.title: View Details of the Associated Invoice
pages.text: To view details of the invoice associated with the current statement:  View the appropriate statement.  Click the Display Invoice... button.  The Invoice Detail form is displayed with details of the invoice for the account specified.  Need more information on statements?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Payments
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Payment
pages.text: Search for and view details of a receipted payment using one of the following:  Receipt number  Account number into which the payment was made.  Name of the customer's account.  To search using a receipt number:  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ Manage Individual Payments option.  The Payment Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter the receipt number in the Receipt Number field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Individual Payment Detail form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option was not selected).  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Payment Detail List form is displayed.  To access the Individual Payment Detail form from this form, double-click the appropriate payment in the list of retrieved payments, or select the appropriate payment and click the Details… button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search using an account number into which the payment was made:  Select the Accounts @ Accounts History option.  The Account History form is displayed.  Enter the customer's account number in the Account Number field.  Click the Refresh History button.  Details of all transactions associated with the specified account are listed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Detail... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  To search for the customer account into which the payment was made:  View the appropriate customer’s details.  Click the Account History… button.  The Account History form for the specified customer is displayed.  To view the details of a specific payment, double-click the appropriate payment, or highlight the payment and click the Details... button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed detailing the specified payment.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Record a Payment
pages.text: Payments can be entered:  Individually  In batches of the same payment type.  Before entering a payment, ensure that the following information is available:  Accurate information about the customer  Amount being paid  Payment type.  The details need to be recorded or verified to successfully enter a payment.  When entering a payment, it is useful to have the Customer Detail form open for the customer whose account is being credited. Then the customer's account number can be copied from the Customer Detail form and pasted into the Account Number field on the relevant form.  Need more information about payments?

pages.title: Record an Up-front Payment
pages.text: To record an up-front payment:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Click the New Up-Front Charge... button (this button is only enabled if an up-front charge is associated with the product).  A Confirm window is displayed.  Select the appropriate payment type from the drop-down list and click the OK button.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete any appropriate fields for the payment details to be recorded against the customer's account.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about payments?

pages.title: Enter a Payment
pages.text: To enter a payment:  Select the Accounts @ Payment @ New Individual Payment option.  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the payment details on the Details tab.  The payment type selected determines the currency in which the payment is recorded and whether additional information needs to be entered in the fields on the General tab.  The payment type's GL codes are  displayed on the General tab.  The Credit Account Number and Invoice Number fields are used for the account or invoice number to which the payment is being posted.  Enter the account or invoice number and press the Tab key.  The account or invoice number is verified against accounts held in the database and, if valid, the corresponding account name, account number, outstanding invoice number, and amount are displayed.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed in the status bar.  To rectify this, press the Delete key and enter a valid account or invoice number.  If the payment is being made against a specific account (by entering the account number in the Credit Account Number field) the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field does not include any unapplied payments or adjustments (for example, future-dated payments).  If the payment is being made against a specific invoice (by entering the invoice number in the Invoice Number field) the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field includes unapplied payments and adjustments.  The date-time in the Date Received field defaults to the current date-time.  The date is overridden by entering the required date either directly or using the drop-down calendar.  The time is overridden by entering the required time; this may need to be done if the payment is entered retrospectively.  If a future date is entered, the payment is not applied until the specified date.  The Paid by group specifies the person who made the payment.  If required, search for and assign a different contact as the payee (use the Search... and Assign buttons located in the Paid by group).  For payments, the Invoice Number field reflects the current status.  The word 'Credit' is displayed if there are no outstanding invoices, 'Split' is displayed if the payment was applied to a number of outstanding invoices or if the payment is allocated to one or more invoices and an amount is left over in credit.  Select the General tab, and complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Invoices tab, and allocate the amount paid to one or more of the listed invoices.  If appropriate, select the Debit Account Invoices tab and enter the appropriate amounts.  If required, select the Up-Front Charges tab and enter the appropriate item and amount.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Clicking Save generates a receipt, assigns a receipt number to the payment, saves the payment details, and posts the payment amount to the specified account.  Control is returned to the Individual Payment Detail form.  If required, print the receipt.  Rather than entering a number of payments individually, consider creating a batch for each type of payment and adding payments as they are received to the relevant payment batch.  The payment batch can then be applied at the end of a predefined period (for example, at the end of the day, or at the end of a week).  An organisation's business practices and billing cycles determine whether this is viable, and if so, the frequency at which payment batches need to be applied.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Allocate a Payment to an Invoice
pages.text: When recording a payment, it (or part of the payment) is allocated to one or more outstanding invoices, or is simply recorded as a credit.  Recording a payment as a credit (rather than against a specific invoice) may be necessary if, for example, there are no outstanding invoices or it is not obvious which invoice should be allocated the payment.  When a payment is made, Singleview automatically makes an initial allocation of these funds against any outstanding invoices (if there are any).  The initial allocations can be modified before the payment is applied. Payments are allocated differently depending on the allocation function specified for the payment type.  After the initial allocation is made, view and update the allocations by selecting the Invoices tab (for an individual payment) or by selecting a payment and clicking the Invoices button (for a batch payment).  The amount allocated to each invoice and receivable type is displayed in the Amount field in the Individual Payment Detail form (for individual payments) or the This Payment field in the Invoices for Payment form (for batch payments). Any credit amount not allocated to an invoice is displayed in the Credit field. The Credit field is updated as funds are allocated or de-allocated to an invoice or receivable type.  To adjust the initial allocations made to the payment (whichever form is displayed):  Enter zero in the Amount or This Payment fields of the invoices that are not being allocated any funds, before allocating other invoices.  If the whole amount is being allocated against a single invoice, enter the full amount in the Amount or This Payment column of the appropriate invoice.  If the amount is being allocated against one or more receivable types, enter the amount in the Amount or This Payment column for the appropriate receivable type.  To split the payment between two or more invoices, enter the required amount for each invoice in the Amount or This Payment column. If the payment is more than the combined total of the outstanding invoice balances, the funds remaining are treated as a credit against the specified account.    If an amount that makes the total allocation amount greater than the total payment is being adjusted, do not leave the Amount or This Payment field.  Enter zero in the Amount or This Payment fields of the invoices that are not being allocated any funds before allocating other invoices.  View and modify how a payment is allocated at any stage.

pages.title: Search for a Payment
pages.text: Searches for payments can be done for a:  Specific payment, if receipt number, account number into which the payment was made, or the customer's name is known.  Payment within a payment batch, if the payment batch number is known.  If the receipt number or the payment batch number is not available, perform a general (non-specific) search for payments or payment batches and select the appropriate payment from the list retrieved.

pages.title: View a Payment Allocation
pages.text: To view an invoice to which an entered payment is allocated:  View the appropriate payment.  Select the Invoice tab.  The allocations are displayed in the fields on the Invoice tab.  To view the invoices to which a payment in a payment batch is allocated:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Select the appropriate payment.  Click the Invoices… button.  The Invoices for Payment form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Modify a Payment Allocation
pages.text: The allocation of a payment can be modified for:  An individual payment.  A payment within a payment batch.  To modify the allocation of an individual payment:  View the appropriate payment.  Select the Invoice tab.  The allocations are displayed in the fields on the Invoice tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Modify the allocation as required.  The allocation of a payment to an invoice may be changed after the payment is posted to a customer's account.  However, the total amount of the transaction cannot be changed, only the allocation.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   To modify the allocation of a payment within a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Select the appropriate payment.  Click the Invoices button.  The Invoices for Payment form is displayed for viewing the specified payment.  Modify the allocation as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Generate a Receipt
pages.text: A receipt for a customer payment can be generated for:  A payment recorded within a payment batch.  An individual payment.  Receipts (and associated receipt numbers) are generated automatically by Convergent Billing.  To generate a receipt for a payment recorded within a payment batch:  Create a payment batch and record each payment (as required).  Apply the payment batch.  A receipt is generated by Convergent Billing for each payment in the batch.  Although receipt numbers are allocated to payments as they are recorded, the payment batch must be applied for the receipts to be generated.  To generate a receipt for an individual payment, record and save the payment.  A receipt is generated by Convergent Billing for the payment.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Print a Receipt
pages.text: To print a receipt:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Print Receipt button.  The receipt is printed on the default printer.  Receipt numbers are automatically generated for each payment recorded in Convergent Billing.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Reject a Payment
pages.text: To reject a payment the appropriate security privileges must be available.  Why Reject a Payment?  Payments may need to be rejected.  For example, a payment must be rejected if the customer's cheque is returned by the bank having been dishonoured because funds are not available in the customer's account, or the cheque is missing a signature.  A credit card transaction also might not be approved because the payment would exceed the customer's credit limit, so the associated payment needs to be rejected.  To resolve these situations so that the transactions in the customer's account history reflect the account status, the payment needs to be rejected.  Rejecting a payment does not remove that transaction from a customer's account history.  It inserts an additional transaction, a debit transaction equal to the amount of the original payment.  Rejecting a payment allows reversal of the effect of posting a payment to a customer's account.  A payment can only be rejected when it has been posted to a customer's account.  Therefore, a payment made as part of a payment batch can only be rejected if that batch is applied.  Payments included in a payment batch that is not yet applied can be removed from the batch.  To reject a payment:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Reject Payment... button.  The Payment Rejection Details form is displayed.  If rejecting a payment retrospectively, it may be necessary to change the rejection date.  Select a rejection code appropriate to the reason for rejecting the payment.  Unless specifically told to do so, do not change the default values in the Credit GL Code and Debit GL Code fields.  Click the Save button to reject the payment.  Control is returned to the Individual Payment Detail form, where the Payment Status field is now set to 'Rejected'.  Rejected payments are displayed as debits on the Account History form.  The rejected payment is given the same receipt number as the original payment.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: Delete a Payment
pages.text: To delete a payment not yet posted to a customer's account:  View the appropriate payment.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment is to be deleted.  A payment posted to a customer's account can also be deleted using the same procedure if:  The payment is not included on (appeared on) an invoice or statement.  The payment has not been posted to the sales journal.  Security privileges to do so are available.  Need more information on payments?

pages.title: View a Payment Batch
pages.text: A search cannot be made for a payment included as part of a payment batch if the batch is not yet applied.  To view details of such payments, view the payment batch, and then details of the required payment.  To search for a specific payment batch and list the payments in that batch:  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ Manage Batch Payments option.  The Payment Batch Search form is displayed.  If known, enter the payment batch number in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search… button.  If the search returns:  A single record, the Payment Batch form is displayed (if the Always Display List? option is not selected).  If a single payment batch record is returned from a search, the details of that record are displayed on the Payment Batch form.  If more than one payment batch record is returned, the records are listed on the Payment Batch List form.  The required record can then be selected and its details displayed on the Payment Batch form.  If selected, the Always Display List? option overrides the automatic display of the Payment Batch form when only a single record is retrieved; in such cases the Payment Batch List form is displayed.  Multiple records, or the Always Display List? option is selected, the Payment Batch List form is displayed.  To access the Payment Batch form from this form, double-click the appropriate batch in the list of retrieved batches, or select the appropriate batch and click the Details… button.  The Payment Batch form is displayed listing each of the payments included in that batch.  If the payment batch is applied, view details of a specific payment by selecting that payment and clicking the Details... button (or by double-clicking the selected payment).  The Individual Payment Detail form is displayed with the specified payment.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Create a Payment Batch
pages.text: To create a payment batch:  Collate payments into batches (groups) of the same payment type.  Select the Accounts @ Payments @ New Batch Payment option.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in Insert mode.  Alternatively, the form can be displayed by selecting the Create a new batch option on the Payment Batch Search form and clicking the New... button.  Enter a description of this batch in the Description field.  The description entry is used to identify the batch at a later date.  Select the appropriate payment type and batch type.  Enter the account or invoice number associated with the payment and press the Tab key.  A receipt number is assigned to the payment and displayed in the first field of the current row.  The account or invoice number is verified against the account details and, if valid, corresponding account and invoice details are inserted into other fields.  If invalid, a warning message is displayed on the Status bar.  To rectify this, press the Delete button and enter a valid account or invoice number.  Ensure that the customer name is correct.  If not, a valid, but incorrect account or invoice number has probably been entered.  To rectify this, press the Delete button to remove the row, click the Insert button to insert a new row, and re-enter the account or invoice number.  If the payment is being made against a specific account (by entering the account number in the Credit Account Number field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field does not include any unapplied payments or adjustments (for example, future-dated payments).  If the payment is being made against a specific invoice (by entering the invoice number in the Invoice field), the value that is automatically displayed in the Amount field includes unapplied payments or adjustments.  If there is a single invoice outstanding against the account, the invoice number and the total amount appears in the Invoice and amount columns respectively.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  If there are no outstanding invoices, the word 'Credit' is displayed in the Invoice column.  Enter the amount paid in the amount column and press the Tab key.  Click the Invoices… button.  The Invoices for payment form is displayed in Insert mode.  If there are a number of invoices against the account, the word 'Split' and the total amount outstanding appear in the Invoice and Amount columns respectively.  The Individual Payment form is used to break up the payment between the outstanding invoices associated with the account.   Allocate an amount to one or more of the listed invoices as required.  Press the Tab key or close the Invoices for payment form.  If necessary, change the date on which the payment was received.  This may need to be done if payments are entered retrospectively.  Select a value in the Payment Location column.  Complete any other fields defined for this payment.  The fields displayed depend on the payment type selected for the batch.  As each payment is entered, the total value of the payments in the batch is displayed on the lower right-hand corner of the form.  Press the Down Arrow key to insert the next payment.  A new row is inserted below the current row with a new receipt number.  Repeat steps 5 to 12 until all payments have been entered, or until the batch needs to be saved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar to save the details of the payment.  A message confirming that the payment was inserted into the batch is displayed on the Status bar.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in View Only mode.  To post the payments in the payment batch to their respective accounts, apply the batch.  To close the payment batch without posting the payments, click the Close button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Apply a Payment Batch
pages.text: To apply (or re-apply) the payments in a payment batch to their respective accounts:  Ensure that the payment batch is saved.  Click the Apply button.  A message indicating that the payments in the payment batch have been applied (posted) is displayed on the Status bar.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Modify a Payment Batch
pages.text: Notes on Updating a Payment Batch  To update a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  If necessary, un-apply the batch.  Modify individual payments within the batch as required.  Save the modifications and re-apply the batch.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Add a Payment to a Payment Batch
pages.text: To add a payment to a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Payment Batch form is displayed in Update mode.  Enter the payment.  Repeat step 3 for each additional payment.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: Remove a Payment from a Payment Batch
pages.text: To remove a payment from a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  If required, un-apply the payment batch.  Select the row containing the payment to be removed.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment should be removed.  Need more information about payment batches?

pages.title: Un-apply a Payment Batch
pages.text: Rules for Un-applying a Payment Batch  A payment batch can only be un-applied if a payment within that payment batch was not:  Included on (appeared on) an invoice or statement.  Posted to the Sales Journal.  Rejected.  To un-apply a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Click the Un-apply button.  The payments within the payment batch are un-applied and, if required, can be modified or deleted.  Need more Information about payment batches?

pages.title: Delete a Payment Batch
pages.text: A payment batch can only be deleted if it has not been applied, or applied and subsequently un-applied.  To delete a payment batch:  View the appropriate payment batch.  If required, un-apply the payment batch.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the payment batch is to be deleted.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: View a Payment History of Changes
pages.text: When working with a payment batch, it is possible to view information about a selected payment's history (for example, that a payment was rejected and later accepted).    To view the history of any changes to a payment:  View the appropriate payment batch.  Select the appropriate payment from the lower part of the form.  Click the Changes… button.  The Summary of Changes form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on payment batches?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Products and Services
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Product Instance (Summary)
pages.text: To view summary information about each product instance:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select Products or Companion Products options from the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance associated with the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: View a Product Instance (Detailed)
pages.text: View detailed information about a product instance using the following forms:  Customer Hierarchy  Service Detail  Equipment Detail  To view detailed information using the Customer Hierarchy form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products or Companion Products option in the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product assigned to the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the appropriate product instance and click the Details… button, or double-click the product instance.  To view detailed information using the Service Detail form:  View the Service Detail form for one of the services associated with the required product instance.  Click the Product Instance… button.  To view detailed information using the Equipment Detail form:  View the Equipment Detail form for one of the equipment items associated with the required product instance.  Click the Product Instances… button.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: List a Customer's Product Instances
pages.text: To list the product instances associated with a specific customer:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Companion Products display options.  Summary information about each base and companion product instance associated with the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Cancelled companion products are displayed only if both the Products and Cancelled Products options are selected.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Create a Product Instance
pages.text: Products are typically implemented with product offers, to simplify product configuration and product instance creation.   If a Product Offer drop-down list is not displayed on the Product Instance Detail form, the product is not associated with a product offer.  In this case, follow procedure 2 to create the product instance.  Procedure 1  To create a product instance from a product associated with a product offer:  Assign a product to a customer or customer node.  Select a product offer to use with the product instance. The Offer tab is displayed.  Expand the Offer Hierarchy tree, if required.  Select optional child product offers and companion products by ticking the check boxes beside their entry in the tree. Mandatory child product offers and companion products will be selected automatically.  Placement of a companion product in the tree may affect the charges and entitlements configured for the product. Check configuration in the Companion Products tab to ensure that the desired settings are available.  Click the Apply Changes button. The Companion Products tab is displayed.  Select each of the companion products displayed, and add any further configuration information required.  Allocate equipment to each service (where required).  Create the required services.  One service must be created before the product instance is complete and can become active.  If required, select one or more of the available optional product components.  If required, select one or more of the available lists on the Customer Detail or Service Detail forms and create list items for each of those lists.  To save the product instance, click the Save button on the toolbar.  Procedure 2  To create a product instance from a product not associated with a product offer:  Assign a product to a customer or customer node.  Allocate required equipment to each service.  Create the required services.  One service must be created before the product instance is complete and can become active.  If required, select one or more of the available optional product components.  If required, select one or more of the available facility groups.  If required, select one or more of the available companion products.  If required, select one or more of the available lists on the Customer Detail or Service Detail forms and create list items for each of those lists.  If required, record any up-front charges associated with the product.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Assign a Product to a Customer
pages.text: To assign a product to a customer:  Ensure that the name of the customer to be assigned a product is displayed in the list of customers in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select the product group on which the icon associated with the product to be assigned is displayed.   Drag and drop the appropriate base product icon from the selected product group onto the customer's name.  Companion products cannot be dragged and dropped.  Icon associated with a specific base product.  The same icon can be used for more than one product.  Product icons are displayed in product groups on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Base Product and Product Group.  When dropped onto the appropriate customer name, the Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Insert mode.  Create a product instance of the base product.  Save and close the Product Instance Detail form.  Summary details for the product and its associated services are listed in the right-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  If an attempt is made to close the form without creating each of the associated services, or select the required product offer, child product offers, and companion products, Convergent Billing displays a message warning that the product is not yet complete.  Either return to the form and create the remaining services, or ignore the message and complete the product at a later date.  A product cannot be made active until it is completed.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Select a Product Group
pages.text: To select a product group, click the appropriate product group tab on the Customer Hierarchy form.  If there are a large number of product groups, click the left or right arrow located to the right of the product group tabs to view the tabs not displayed.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Activate a Product Instance
pages.text: To activate a product instance:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Change the status of the product instance to Active.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  All services, facility groups, and companion products are automatically activated.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Select a Facility Group
pages.text: Facility groups can only be added to product instances that are not associated with product offers.   To select one of the available facility groups:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar, and select the Facility Groups tab.  Click in the Facility Group field and select the appropriate facility group from the list of facility groups displayed in the drop-down list.  Complete the remaining details for the selected facility group.  If further facility groups are required, click the Insert button (to insert a new row in the grid) and repeat Steps 3 and 4.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Select a Companion Product
pages.text: To select one of the available companion products:  If the Offers tab is available:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar, and select the Offers tab.  Tick one or more companion products in the tree of available product offers and companion products.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the Offers tab is not available:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar, and select the Companion Products tab.  Click in the Product field and select the appropriate companion product from the list of available products displayed in the drop-down list.  If further companion products are required, click the Insert button on the toolbar (to insert a new row in the grid) and repeat Step 3.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Create a List
