pages.text: To create a list:  Display either of the following:  Customer Detail form for the appropriate customer  Service Detail form for the appropriate service  Click the Lists tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Select the appropriate list from the left-hand panel of the tab.  Complete the fields on the right-hand side of the tab.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on lists?

pages.title: Change Status of a Product Instance
pages.text: The following procedure changes the status of the product instance, and all facility groups, services, and companion products created as part of that instance.  To change the status of a product instance:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the start date of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Change the setting in the Status field by selecting an alternative option from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Cancel a Product Instance
pages.text: Cancelling a product instance cancels each of its associated services.  If the product instance has a status of Product Creation, the following procedure deletes the product instance.  To cancel a product instance (and its associated services):  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product instance be cancelled.  The status of the product instance and each of its associated services is changed to Cancelled.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Delete a Product Instance
pages.text: A product instance can only be removed/deleted if it has a status of Product Creation.  If a product instance is not in this state, deleting a product instance is identical to cancelling that instance.  To delete an incomplete product instance (a product instance with a status of Product Creation):  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, specify the date from which to delete the product instance.  Depending on security settings, the date consists of a single component, the date, or two components, the date and time.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product instance is to be deleted.  The product instance and all associated services are deleted.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Change Product Offer Associated with a Product Instance
pages.text: When the product offer associated with a base product instance is changed, field defaults configured in the new product offer overwrite the previous product offer's field defaults. This may affect behaviour of the base product or companion product instances associated with the product offer.  To change the product offer associated with a product instance:  View the appropriate product instance.  Select the new product offer from the Product Offer drop-down list. The Offer tab is displayed.  Expand the Offer Hierarchy tree, if required.  Select optional child product offers and companion products by ticking the check boxes beside their entry in the tree. Mandatory child product offers and companion products will be selected automatically.  Placement of a companion product in the tree may affect the charges and entitlements configured for the product. Check configuration in the Companion Products tab to ensure that the desired settings are available.  Click the Apply Changes button. The Companion Products tab is displayed.  Select each of the companion products displayed, and add any further configuration information required.   Instances of companion products available in the previous product offer hierarchy are merged to the new product offer hierarchy. Instances of companion products no longer required in the new product offer hierarchy are cancelled.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about products?

pages.title: Upgrade a Product Instance
pages.text: Options on the Upgrade/Move Details tab of the Product Instance Detail form cannot be selected while creating a product instance. Product instances that are created as part of a product offer, or have been previously moved, upgraded, or cancelled, cannot be upgraded.  To upgrade a product:  View the appropriate product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  The From Product button is enabled if the product was merged or is the result of an upgrade.   The To Product button is only enabled if the product instance was previously upgraded.   Clicking the From Product button displays details of the product from which the product instance being viewed was upgraded or moved.    Clicking the To Product button displays details of the product to which the product instance being viewed was upgraded or moved.  Click the Upgrade button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the product to which the current product instance is to be upgraded.  Select the Detail tab and, if necessary, update the services required to make the new product instance active.  Complete the appropriate fields on the Facility Groups and Companion Product tabs for the upgraded product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more Information about products?

pages.title: Split a Product Instance Manually
pages.text: Notes and Restrictions  The following terminology is used in the procedures given for splitting and merging product instances:  Source product instance (from which services or equipment are to be allocated)  Target product instance (to which services and equipment in the source product instance are allocated).  A product instance can only be split or merged if:  It was not created as part of a product offer.  Update security privileges for the Product Instance Detail form are available.  Compatible base products are available.  The product is configured to allow splitting or merging.  To split a product instance manually:  View the appropriate (source) product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab and click the Update button.  The Upgrade button on the tab is enabled.  Click the Upgrade button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the target product.  Select the target product from the drop-down list and click the Yes button.  The Product Upgrade: Allocation form is displayed.  To allocate all source product instance components, click the Allocate All button.  All components in the source product instance are allocated to the specified target product instance.  The Upgrade Status field for each of these components is now set to Used.  To allocate individual source product components, select one of the source product instance components and the equivalent target product instance component and click the Allocate button.  The Upgrade Status field for this component is now set to Used.  Repeat this procedure for each component required by the target product instance.  If a component is incorrectly allocated, select it and click the Deallocate button.  Click the Done button.  A message is displayed to:  Indicate the number of source product instance components allocated and the number of components still to be allocated.  Prompt whether the remaining components should be allocated to another product instance.  Click the Yes button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the next target product instance.  Repeat steps 4 to 7 for the next target product instance.  When all components of the source product instance have been allocated, the source product instance is split and each of the target product instances are saved with their new components.  On completion of the split, the source product instance is cancelled when each of the target product instances becomes active.  Need more information about products?

pages.title: Split a Product Instance Automatically
pages.text: Notes and Restrictions  The following terminology is used in the procedures given for splitting and merging product instances:  Source product instance (from which services or equipment are to be allocated)  Target product instance (to which services and equipment in the source product instance are allocated).  A product instance can only be split or merged if:  It was not created as part of a product offer.  Update security privileges for the Product Instance Detail form are available.  Compatible base products are available.  The product is configured to allow splitting or merging.  To split a product instance automatically:  View the appropriate (source) product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab and click the Update button.  The Upgrade button on the tab is now enabled.  Click the Upgrade button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the target product.  Select the target product from the drop-down list and click the Yes button.  A further message is displayed to:  Indicate the number of source product instance components allocated and components still to be allocated.  Specify whether to allocate the remaining components to another product instance.  Click the Yes button.  A message is displayed prompting selection of the next target product instance.  Select the target product instance from the drop-down list and click the Yes button.  Repeat steps 4 to 6 until the product split is complete.  On completion, the Product Instance Detail form is displayed in View Only mode for the last target product instance.  On completion of the split, the source product instance is cancelled when each of the target product instances becomes active.  Need more information about products?

pages.title: Merge a Product Instance
pages.text: Notes and Restrictions  The following terminology is used in the procedures given for splitting and merging product instances:  Source product instance (from which services or equipment are to be allocated)  Target product instance (to which services and equipment in the source product instance are allocated).  A product instance can only be split or merged if:  It was not created as part of a product offer.  Update security privileges for the Product Instance Detail form are available.  Compatible base products are available.  The product is configured to allow splitting or merging.  To merge a product instance:  Assign the target product to the appropriate customer by dragging the product icon onto the customer listed in the Customer Hierarchy form.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed.  On the Detail tab, select one of the service component entries and click the Allocate button.  A message is displayed prompting for confirmation that the product dates are correct.  Click the Yes button.  A list of services associated with product instances of the specified product type assigned to this customer is displayed on the Service List form.  Select the service to be merged into the target product instance and click the Assign button.  The Product Upgrade: Allocation form is displayed.  The selected service component is allocated to the target product instance.  Either allocate all the source product instance components to the target product instance or allocate individual source product instance components.  To allocate all source product instance components, click the Allocate All button.  All components in the source product instance are allocated to the specified target product instance.  The Upgrade Status field for each of these components is now set to 'Used'.  To allocate individual source product components, select one of the source product instance components and the equivalent target product instance component and click the Allocate button.  The Upgrade Status field for this component is now set to 'Used'.  Repeat this procedure for each component required by the target product instance.  If a component is incorrectly allocated, select it and click the Deallocate button.  Click the Done button.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed for the target product instance.  To perform a full merge, repeat steps 2 to 6 for each of the other services required by the target product instance, then save the target product instance.  The Status field of the target product instance is now set to 'Active'; the source product instances are set to 'Cancelled'.  To perform a partial merge, create each of the other services required by the target product instance, allocate equipment (where necessary), then save the target product instance.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Move a Product Instance between Customer Nodes
pages.text: If this is the first move since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances of the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  The following restrictions apply when moving a product instance:  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance was created as part of a product offer.  A product cannot be moved if its owning customer or target customer is blacklisted at any time during the move period and the user does not have access to view blacklisted customers on the Customer Form.  A product cannot be upgraded or moved if the product instance is cancelled, moved, or upgraded at the effective start date or any later date.   A product must be assigned to a customer node.  A product dragged over a root node or blank space of the hierarchy panel cannot be dropped.   Some information regarding the lists and charge categories may need to be entered (when prompted) before the product instance move can be completed.  If a product instance is moved, any changes made to it before or after the move start date are not carried over in the move.  For example, if the product instance is moved at an effective date before an equipment allocation change, following the move the variation of equipment allocation is not reflected.  A warning is displayed so the user can cancel the move.   To move a product instance:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instance (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that the product instance and not the associated service is dragged and dropped.  To drag and drop a product instance, click the product instance and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instance onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instance is dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Move Multiple Product Instances between Customer Nodes
pages.text: If this is the first move performed since logging in, the Move Preferences form is displayed automatically.  If not, and move preferences need to be changed, they can be changed manually.  The following procedure assumes that the move preferences have been set.  When moving product instances between nodes in different customer hierarchies, use multiple instances on the Customer Hierarchy form to display both customer hierarchies simultaneously.  Restrictions on Moving a Product Instance  To move multiple product instances:  Display the source node in the left-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Ensure that the details for the source node are displayed in the right-hand panel.  Select the Products option from the Display for Customer group to ensure that the source product is displayed.  Display the target node in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag and drop the source product instances (located in the right-hand panel of the first instance of the Customer Hierarchy form) onto the target node (displayed in the left-hand panel of the second instance of the Customer Hierarchy form).  Ensure that product instances are dragged and dropped, and not the associated services.  To drag and drop product instances, select the product instances and while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Now drop the product instances onto the target node by releasing the mouse button.  As the product instances are dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate date range and click the Continue button.  The Move Progress form is displayed.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Move Companion Product Instances between Product Offers
pages.text: The companion product must be associated with the origin and destination product offers.  To move a companion product instance from one product offer node to another:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click on the Offers tab.  Ensure that both the origin and destination product offer nodes are visible.  Hold down the CTRL key and drag and drop the instance to the target offer node.  To drag and drop product instances:   Select the product instances and hold down the left mouse button.  Move the cursor into the left-hand panel until the target node is highlighted.  Release the mouse button to drop the product instance onto the target node.  As the product instances are dragged from the right-hand to the left-hand panel, the cursor changes from depicting a stop symbol to depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken.  The Move Confirm form is displayed.  Click the Continue button.  The Move Progress form is displayed.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Remove a Companion Product Instance from a Product Offer
pages.text: To remove a companion product instance from a product offer node:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click on the Offers tab.  Expand the product offer node.  Deselect the check box next to the companion product instance being removed. All instances of the companion product in that node are removed.  Click the Apply Changes button.  To remove a single companion product instance from a product offer node containing more than one instance of the companion product:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click the Companion Products tab.  Do either of the following:  Delete the record by selecting it and clicking the Delete button.  Cancel the product instance by selecting Cancelled in the Status drop-down list.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: View a Moved Product Instance
pages.text: To view a moved product instance after it is moved between two customer nodes:  View the appropriate product instance.  Select the Upgrade/Move Details tab.  The name of the customer to whom the product is assigned is displayed in the title of the form.  To view the customer who had the product assigned to them originally, click the Details… button in the Upgraded from Product group.  The name of the customer is displayed in the title bar of the form.  To view the customer who has the product assigned to them, click the Details… button on the Moved to Product group.  The name of the customer is displayed in the title bar of the form.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Set Product Instance Move Preferences
pages.text: Depending on type of move, preferences can be set to determine how the move is performed.  If multiple product instances are being moved, and one or more of the instances fail to move, preferences can be set to do the following:  Cancel all moves.  Move the instances that can be moved and display a report detailing which moves failed and why.  The Move Preferences form is displayed automatically the first time a move is performed after logging in.  If the preferences need to be set again, the form can be accessed manually.  To set move preferences manually:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form.  Select the Customer Hierarchy @ Move Preferences option.  The Move Preferences form is displayed.  To cancel all moves if one fails, select 'Back-out all moves' in the On failed move group.  To move all instances possible and to display a move report once the move is complete, select 'Continue and show Move Report' after all items have been processed' from the On failed move group.  Click OK.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Change Status of a Companion Product
pages.text: To change the status of a companion product:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar, and select the Companion Products tab.  Click in the Status field and select the appropriate status from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Modify a Product Instance
pages.text: A product instance can be modified by:  Changing its status by activating, suspending, cancelling, and reactivating the instance.  Changing the product offer that the product instance is associated with.  Changing the status of a specific service within the product instance, by activating, suspending, temporarily disconnecting, cancelling, and reactivating a service.  Changing the status of a facility group, by activating, suspending, cancelling, and reactivating the facility group.  Adding one or more of the available facility groups.  Changing the status of a companion product.  Adding one or more of the available companion products.  Changing (upgrading or downgrading) the base product.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Specify an Up-front Charge
pages.text: To include an up-front charge in the product definition:  Select the Payment Items tab on the Product Definition form.  Enter the description of the up-front charge. Press the Tab key.  To suppress a value of zero in the payment items table, select Yes; otherwise, select No. Press the Tab key.  Enter the amount of the up-front charge. Press the Tab key.  Enter an expression to define the label for the up-front charge. Press the Tab key.  Enter the receivable type expression.  If additional up-front charges are required, repeat steps 2 to 6.  Need more information about products?

pages.title: Change Status of a Facility Group
pages.text: To change the status of a facility group:  View the appropriate product instance.  Click the Update button on the toolbar, and select the Facility Groups tab.  Click in the Status field and select the appropriate status from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: View a Service (Summary)
pages.text: To view summary information about each service:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: View a Service (Detailed)
pages.text: Detailed information about a specific service can be viewed using the following forms:  Service Search  Customer Hierarchy  Product Instance Detail  To view service details using the Service Search form:  Select the Customer Care @ Service @ Manage Services option.  The Service Search form is displayed.  Specify the appropriate search criteria, then click the Search… button.  A list of the services that match the specified criteria is displayed on the Service List form.  Select the appropriate service and click the Details… button.  Details of the selected service are displayed on the Service Detail form.  To view detailed information using the Customer Hierarchy form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products and Services options in the Display for customer group.  Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate service entry in the right-hand panel.  To view detailed information using the Product Instance Detail form:  View the Product Instance Detail form for the product instance containing the required service.  Select the appropriate service on the Detail tab.  Click the Details… button.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Change Service Associated with a Product Offer
pages.text: Changing the service for any child in the same service-specific sub-tree changes it for all product offers and companion products in the sub-tree. However, only the offer node at the top of the sub-tree is assigned to the service.  To change the service associated with a product offer:  View the product instance for the customer.  Click on the Offers tab.   Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Instance Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select the product offer to be updated.  Select the required service in the Service Specific drop-down list.  Click on the Apply Changes button.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: List a Customer's Services
pages.text: To list the services associated with a specific customer:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Services display option.  Summary information about each service associated with the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Activate a Service
pages.text: To activate a service:  Set the status of the service to Active while creating that service.  Change the status of the service to Active.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Create a Service
pages.text: To create a service:  View the relevant product instance.  Highlight one of the service types listed.  Click the Create… button.  A message is displayed prompting confirmation that the start and end dates for the product instance are correct.  Click the Yes button to continue creating the service with the specified dates.  The Service Detail form is displayed.  If the dates are not correct, click the No or Cancel button to return to the Product Instance Detail form to change the dates.  Complete the form for the selected service.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  To allocate an optional service to the product instance, click the Add Service… button.  The Optional Product Component form is displayed.  Select the optional component and click the Add button.  The additional component is added to the Product Instance Detail form, the Optional Product Component form is closed, and control is returned to the Product Instance Detail form.  Complete steps 2 to 6 for each additional component to be allocated to the product instance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Update a Service
pages.text: To update a service:  View the appropriate service.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the service details as required.  Click Save on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Override a Service's Charge Categories
pages.text: To override a service's charge categories:  View the appropriate service.  Click the Charge Categories… button.  The Service Charge Category Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Update the service's charge categories as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Change Status of a Service
pages.text: To change the status of a service:  View the appropriate product instance.  Select the appropriate service and click the Details… button.  The appropriate Service Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Depending on available privileges and the start date of the current record, a Confirm window may be displayed.  Change the setting in the Service Status field by selecting an alternative option from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Cancel a Service
pages.text: Cancelling a service cancels the whole product instance.  Restrictions apply when cancelling a service.  To cancel a specific service:  View the service using one of the available methods (summary or detailed).  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Change the date, if required, and click the Yes button.  To cancel all services associated with a specific product instance, cancel the product instance.  The following applies when cancelling services:  Delete button is enabled only if the service can be cancelled within the service's record date range.  Clicking the Delete button for services that do not have a status of Product Creation, cancels the service.  Minimum cancel date is set to the earliest date at which the service becomes optional, and remains optional until the end of time. The earliest possible cancel date is the service record's effective start date.  Default cancel date is set as follows:  If the maximum number of permitted services for the service's item exceeds the number allowed by the product instance or the companion instance settings and remains at that level until the end of time, the earliest date at which this occurs is used.  If the service becomes optional at some future date and remains optional until the end of time, that date is used.  If the service is optional as of today's date and remains optional until the end of time, today's date is used.  If a service becomes optional, then mandatory, then optional again, only the last optional period can be cancelled.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: Delete a Service
pages.text: Restrictions apply when deleting a service.  To delete a service:  View the service using one of the available methods (summary or detailed).  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  A Confirm window is displayed.  Change the date, if required, and click the Yes button.  The service status changes to Cancelled.  Using the Delete button is the preferred method for deletions.  The following applies:  Clicking the Delete button for services that have a status of Product Creation deletes the service.  The date from which to delete the service must be equal to the effective start date of the service.  Need more information on services?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Tasks - Queries and Progressions
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Create a Query
pages.text: A query can be created for a:  Customer  Prospective customer (for example, a person requesting information about services), or a contact.  The procedure to create a query is similar for both types of customer, except that for potential customers and contacts the name and address of a contact need to be specified.  The details are entered automatically by Convergent Billing if a query is created for an existing customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Create a Query for a Potential Customer
pages.text: A query raised by a potential customer or contact is recorded on the Customer Query form.  The form can be accessed by selecting either of the:  New… button on the Customer Query Search form.  Customer Care @ Queries @ New Query option.  To create a query:  Display the Customer Query form using one of the above methods.  Enter text about the query in the field displayed on the Request tab.  Ensure that as much information as possible is entered to assist in the resolution of the query.  In the Query Type field, select a query type appropriate to the customer's enquiry.  For help in selecting a query type appropriate to the customer's enquiry, highlight one of the query type options in the drop-down list and click the Query Type Help... button adjacent to the Query Type field.  A description of that query type is displayed in a pop-up window and a list of questions to ask the customer about their query.  If required, select the Contact tab and assign a new contact for this query.  Use the Search... button to locate the appropriate contact and the Assign button to assign that contact to the query, or use the New… button to record a new contact to be assigned.  A contact must be assigned to the query before it can be saved.  If the query relates directly to one of the customer's services or contracts, complete the fields on the Service tab.  Use the Search… button to locate the appropriate service and the Assign button to assign that service to the query.  Select the General tab.  If this tab contains any fields, complete each of the fields.  The presence of fields on this tab depends on the query type specified.  Select the Dates tab.  The dates displayed on this tab are entered automatically based on the query type selected.  The Response Due field specifies the date-time that the customer should receive a response to the query, not the date by which the query must be resolved.  For example, if the query is a complex one, the Response Due date indicates when the customer should be contacted regarding the progress of the query.  The Resolution Due field specifies the date-time by which the query must be resolved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode.  A unique number is automatically assigned to the query when the query details are saved, and displayed in the Query Number field on the Customer Query form.    The format of the query number is based on the specified query type.  If the query can be resolved immediately, close the query.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, progress the query.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Create a Query for a Customer
pages.text: A query raised by a customer is recorded on the Customer Query form.  The form can be accessed by conventional methods, and by:  Dragging and dropping the Query icon onto the appropriate customer (or customer node) in the Customer Hierarchy form.  Clicking on the New Query button on the Customer Detail form.  The method chosen depends on which form is displayed and preferred method.  To create a query using the Customer Hierarchy form:  Ensure that the name of the customer for whom the query is to be created is displayed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  Drag the Query icon and drop it onto the appropriate customer's name.  To do this, click the Query icon and, while holding down the left mouse button, move the cursor until the required customer's name is highlighted.  Now drop the icon by releasing the mouse button.  Symbol  Description  This icon can be dragged and dropped on one of the customer nodes listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form to create a new query.  As the icon is dragged into the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form the cursor changes from one depicting a stop symbol to one depicting an arrow.  If the icon is dropped when the stop symbol is displayed, no action is taken by Convergent Billing.  Symbol  Description  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that the Query icon can be dropped onto one of the customer nodes listed in the left-hand panel of the Customer Hierarchy form.  This cursor symbol is used to indicate that dropping the Query icon will be ignored by Convergent Billing; that is, no action will be taken.  When dropped onto the appropriate customer name, the Customer Query form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter text about the query in the field displayed on the Request tab.  Ensure that as much information as possible is entered to assist in the resolution of the query.  In the Query Type field, select a query type appropriate to the customer's enquiry.  If assistance is required in selecting a query type appropriate to the customer's enquiry, highlight one of the query type options in the drop-down list and click the Query Type Help... button adjacent to the Query Type field.  A description of that query type is displayed in a pop-up window and a list of questions to ask the customer about their query.  If required, select the Contact tab and assign a new contact for this query.  Use the Search... button to locate the appropriate contact and the Assign button to assign that contact to the query, or use the New… button to record a new contact to be assigned.  A contact must be assigned to the query before it can be saved.  If the query relates directly to one of the customer's services or contracts, complete the fields on the Service tab.  Use the Search... button to locate the appropriate service and the Assign button to assign that service to the query.  Select the General tab.  If this tab contains any fields, complete the appropriate fields.  The fields displayed on this tab depend on the query type specified.  Select the Dates tab.  The dates displayed on this tab are entered automatically based on the query type selected.  The Response Due field specifies the date-time that the customer should receive a response to the query, not the date by which the query must be resolved.  For example, if the query is complex, the Response Due date indicates when the customer should be contacted regarding the progress of the query.  The Resolution Due field specifies the date-time by which the query must be resolved.  Click the Save button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode.  A unique number is automatically assigned to the query when the query details are saved, and displayed in the Query Number field on the Customer Query form.    The format of the query number is based on the specified query type.  If the query can be resolved immediately, close the query.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, progress the query.  To create a query using the Customer Detail form:  View the appropriate customer’s details.  Click the New Query… button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter text about the query in the field displayed on the Request tab.  Ensure that as much information as possible is entered to assist in the resolution of the query.  In the Query Type field, select a query type appropriate to the customer's enquiry.   If assistance is required in selecting a query type appropriate to the customer's enquiry, highlight one of the query type options in the drop-down list and click the Help... button adjacent to the Query Type field.  A description of that query type is displayed in a pop-up window and a list of questions to ask the customer about their query.  If required, select the Contact tab and assign a new contact for this query.  Use the Search... button to locate the appropriate contact and the Assign button to assign that contact to the query.  If the query relates directly to one of the customer's services or contracts, complete the fields on the Service tab.  Use the Search... button to locate the appropriate service and the Assign button to assign that service to the query.  Select the General tab.  If this tab contains any fields, complete the appropriate fields.  The fields displayed on this tab depend on the query type specified.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode.  Convergent Billing automatically assigns a unique number to the query when the query details are saved, and displayed in the Query Number field on the Customer Query form.    The format of the query number is based on the specified query type.  If the query can be resolved immediately, close the query.  If the query cannot be resolved immediately, progress the query.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: List Queries
pages.text: The following queries can be listed:  Queries associated with a specific customer  Using the display options on the Customer Hierarchy form, this method is used to view a list of:  Example 1  To list all queries associated with the current customer node, select the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options.  Example 2  To list all components associated with the current customer node, select all thirteen display options.  Only open (unresolved) queries  Only closed (resolved) queries  Both open and closed queries.  Queries that match specific search criteria for viewing only the open (unresolved) queries that match the search criteria, or all queries that match the criteria.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: View a Query
pages.text: To view a query:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number, work group, or query type (or any combination).  Select the Query option in the Search for group and either the All or Opened option in the Status group.  Select the Opened option if you want to restrict the search to unresolved queries (that is, still open).  Select the All option if you want the search to include both open (unresolved) and closed (resolved) queries.  Click the Search button.  Any queries that match the specified selection criteria are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query List form.  To view a specific query, double-click the query or highlight the query and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query form is displayed in View Only mode with details of the selected query.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Determine the Status of a Query
pages.text: To determine the current status (open or closed) of a query, use one of the following methods:  Search for and display the appropriate query.  The current status of the query is displayed in the Status field on the Customer Query form.  List the queries for a specific customer on the Customer Hierarchy form.  The current status of each query is displayed in the Status column in the right-hand panel of the form.  Both the Open Queries and Closed Queries display options on the Customer Hierarchy form may need to be selected to view all queries associated with a customer.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Determine the Progress of an Open Query
pages.text: To determine the progress of an open query:  Display its progression history.  Select and view the current progression.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Progress a Query
pages.text: To progress a query:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Progress button.  A message is displayed, prompting you to confirm that you want to progress the query to the specified work group.  By default, the work group displayed is that associated with the query type selected.  If required, select an alternative work group.  Click Yes to progress the query to the nominated work group.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: Resolve (Close) a Query
pages.text: A query recorded in Convergent Billing can be resolved in the following ways:  Immediately  If you can provide the enquirer with the details they require, without having to forward the query to a work group to get it resolved, you can enter text on the Resolution tab and close the query; there is no need to progress the query further.  By progressing it to a work group  If you cannot provide the enquirer with sufficient information, you must progress the query to the appropriate work group.  To resolve a query without progressing it to a work group:  Ensure that the appropriate query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Select the Resolution tab and enter text detailing how the enquiry was resolved.  Click the Save button.  A unique query number is assigned to the query.  If the query needs a response date and time assigned to it, click the Update button, then click the Respond button.  Click the Save button.  The date and time that the query was responded to can then be viewed on the Dates tab.  Click the Resolve button.  When prompted, confirm that the query is being closed.  Click Yes to close the query.  As a result of this action, the query status is set to 'Closed'.  To progress a query to a work group:  Ensure that the appropriate query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  The Customer Query Progress History form is displayed.  Select the most recent progression and click the Details… button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed in View Only mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  Select the Resolution tab and enter text detailing how the enquiry was resolved.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the query was resolved, click the Resolve button.  When prompted, click the Yes button to close the query.  If the query is not resolved, click the Progress button to forward the query to another work group.    When prompted, select a work group and click Yes.  As a result of this action, a progression is created and the resolution text from the query is copied to the Progress tab of the new progression.  Need more information on queries?

pages.title: View Customer Usage Details
pages.text: To view a customer’s usage details:  Select the Accounts @ Account History option.  The Account History form is displayed in View Only mode.  Enter the appropriate account number in the Account Number field and tab out of the field or click the Refresh History button.  The account’s transaction details are displayed.  Click the Usage Details… button.  The Usage Detail Search form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate search criteria.  Specify the appropriate type of usage details to be included in the search by selecting the appropriate option in the Search for group.  To include all events associated with the specified customer node and its child nodes, select the Show all usage liability? check box.  Click the Search… button.  The Call Usage Display form is displayed.  One or more service numbers are listed in the Service Number column.  To view the usage details of a specific service number, double click on the appropriate number.  The usage details are displayed in the Usage Details grid on the right-hand side of the form.  Need more information on customer usage details?

pages.title: Create a Progression
pages.text: A new progression can be created by:  Progressing a query to a work group.  Forwarding an existing progression to a new work group.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: List Progressions
pages.text: A list of the progressions associated with a specific query can be obtained by:  Searching for the progressions associated with a specific query.  The progressions are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  Click the Query Progressions button on the Customer Query form.  The progressions are listed on the Customer Query Progress History form.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: View a Progression
pages.text: View a progression by:  Searching for the progressions associated with a query and then viewing the relevant progression.  Clicking the Query Progressions button on the Customer Query form and then viewing the relevant progression.  To search for and view a progression:  Select the Customer Care @ Queries @ Manage Queries option.  The Customer Query Search form is displayed.  Enter the query number.  Select Progress-All in the Search For field.  Click the Search button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are retrieved and listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  To access and view a progression using the Customer Query form:  Search for and display the query with the relevant progressions.  The selected query is displayed on the Customer Query form.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  Any progressions associated with the specified query are listed on the Customer Query Progress List form.  To view a specific progression, double-click the progression or highlight the progression, and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed with details of the selected progression.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: Work on a Progression
pages.text: To work on a progression:  View the appropriate customer query.  Click the Query Progressions… button.  The Customer Query Progress History form is displayed with each of the progressions associated with the specified query.   Select the last progression and click the Details... button.  The Customer Query Progress Detail form is displayed.  Click the Update button.  The Customer Query Progression Detail form is displayed in Update mode.  In the Action tab, record any actions taken to resolve the query.    Record the actions taken even if the query is not fully resolved  In the Resolution tab, record the results of the actions taken to resolve the query.  The record of actions taken is used as the basis for any further progressions or as the resolution text of the original query.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the query has been resolved, resolve the progression.  If the query cannot be resolved, forward the progression.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: Forward a Progression
pages.text: To forward a progression to another work group:  Ensure that the appropriate progression is displayed on the Customer Query Progress form and that the details have been saved.  Click the Progress button.  When prompted, select a new work group and click Yes.  As a result of this action, a new progression is created and the resolution text from the current progression is copied to the Progress tab of the new progression.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: Resolve a Progression
pages.text: Ensure that work on the progression is completed.  To resolve a progression (and therefore resolve the associated query):  Ensure that the details on the Customer Query Progress Detail form have been saved.  Click the Resolve button.  A prompt is displayed for confirming that the query is to be closed.  Click Yes to close the query.  As a result of this action, the resolution text of the progression is copied to the Resolution tab of the associated query and the query status is set to Closed.  Need more information on progressions?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Configuration Tasks
pages.text: This section describes customer care configuration tasks performed by configurers.

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Configuration Tasks - Reference Types
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Reference Type
pages.text: To view a reference type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Reference Types option.  The Reference Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of reference types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate reference type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate reference type.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on reference types?

pages.title: Define a Reference Type
pages.text: To define a reference type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Reference Types option.  The Reference Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Add reference items to the table in the lower part of the form as required.  Each reference item must be entered on a separate row of the table.  To add a row to the table, press the Down Arrow key.  To insert a blank row before the current row, click the Insert button on the toolbar.  If necessary, change the order of the reference items using the Up and Down buttons.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on reference types?

pages.title: Update a Reference Type
pages.text: Modifying a reference type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the reference type.  To update a reference type:  View the appropriate reference type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the reference type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on reference types?

pages.title: Delete a Reference Type
pages.text: Deleting a reference type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the reference type.  To delete a reference type:  View the appropriate reference type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the reference type is to be deleted.  Need more information on reference types?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Configuration Tasks - Attribute Types
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View an Attribute Type
pages.text: To view an attribute type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Attribute Types option.  The Attribute Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of attribute types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate attribute type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate attribute type.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on attribute types?

pages.title: Define an Attribute Type
pages.text: To define an attribute type:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Attribute Types option.  The Attribute Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on attribute types?

pages.title: Update an Attribute Type
pages.text: Modifying an attribute type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the attribute type.  To update an attribute type:  View the appropriate attribute type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Attribute Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the attribute type as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.    If the attribute type is used by another element, a Confirm window is displayed.  Click the Yes button.  Need more information on attribute types?

pages.title: Delete an Attribute Type
pages.text: Deleting an attribute type may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the attribute type.  To delete an attribute type:  View the appropriate attribute type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the attribute type is to be deleted.  Need more information on attribute types?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Configuration Tasks - Entity Validation
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View an Entity Validation Definition
pages.text: To view an entity validation definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Entity Validation option.  The Entity Validation Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of entity validation definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate entity validation definition.  The Entity Validation Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.title: Define an Entity Validation Definition
pages.text: To define an entity validation definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Entity Validation option.  The Entity Validation Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Entity Validation Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the Entity Name and Description fields.  Select a validation table.  Enter key field functions if required.  Enter validation expressions for Row Validation and Pre-Commit Validation, as required.  Select a field from the Column Name field, then the attribute type to be associated with the field from the Attribute Type field.  Set the Control Next field to Yes if required.  Enter a default expression if required.  To associate an attribute type to another field, position the cursor in the grid section of the form and press the down arrow.  A new row is inserted in the grid.  Repeat steps 7 to 9.  Enter in-transaction expressions in the In-Transaction Expressions tab, if required.  Enter post-commit expressions in the Post-Commit Expressions tab, if required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.title: Enter Validation Expressions
pages.text: To define:  Row validation, click the Row Validation… button.  The Expression List form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate expression or expressions.  Used within entity validation to display messages to the user, or to execute actions.  If the entity being validated is in a list, row validation is executed when the row loses input focus.  If the entity being validated is not in a list, row validation is executed when the form is saved, but before the data is committed to the database.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Entity Validation, Input Focus, Post-commit Expression, and Pre-commit Validation.  Pre-commit validation, click the Pre-Commit Validation… button.  The Expression List form is displayed.  Enter the appropriate expression or expressions.  In entity validation, validates user actions when the active form is saved in the order specified as part of the pre-commit process.    Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Entity Validation, Post-commit Expression, In-transaction Expression, and Row Validation.  In-transaction expressions, click the In-Transaction Expressions tab.  Enter the appropriate expression or expressions.  Post-commit expressions, click the Post-Commit Expressions tab.  Enter the appropriate expression or expressions.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.title: Use the Control Next Feature
pages.text: To set an attribute type to control another attribute type:  Complete the Column Name and Attribute Type fields for the controlling attribute type.  Set the Control Next field to Yes.  Complete the Column Name and Attribute Type fields for the controlled attribute type.  Ensure that this is done in the row directly below the controlling attribute type.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.title: Update an Entity Validation Definition
pages.text: Modifying an entity validation definition may result in corruption of data and forms that use the definition.  To update an entity validation definition:  View the appropriate entity validation definition.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Entity Validation Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the entity validation definition as required.  Select the Post-Commit Expressions tab to check if a legacy post-commit expression exists.  If a legacy post-commit expression exists, choose either the Move to In-Transaction List button or Move to Post-Commit List button.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If the entity validation definition is used by another element, a Confirm window is displayed.  Click the Yes button.  If the entity validation is being used for a derived attribute and the number of columns or the data types of the columns have changed, the index expression rows on the Indexes tab of the Derived Attribute Definition form must be updated.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.title: Delete an Entity Validation Definition
pages.text: Deleting an entity validation definition may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the definition.  To delete an entity validation definition:  View the appropriate entity validation definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the entity validation definition is to be deleted.  Need more information on entity validation?

pages.title: How Do I - Customer Care Configuration Tasks - Context-sensitive Help
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Define a Help Entry Definition
pages.text: To define a help entry definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Help Entries option.  The Help Entry Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Help Entry Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on context-sensitive help?

pages.title: Delete a Help Entry Definition
pages.text: Deleting a help entry definition deletes the context-sensitive help for a Convergent Billing component.  To delete a help entry definition:  View the appropriate help entry definition.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the help entry is to be deleted.  Need more information on context-sensitive help?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Charge Categories

pages.title: View a Default Charge Category
pages.text: To view a charge category:  Select the Maintenance @ Accounts @ Charge Categories option. The Charge Category Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button. A list of the defined charge categories matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate charge category and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate charge category.  The Charge Category Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).

pages.title: Modify a Tariff/Charge Category Pair
pages.text: The association between a tariff and a charge category can be modified by:  Changing the charge category configured as part of a tariff.  Overriding the charge category when the tariff is included in a product definition.  To change the charge category configured as part of a tariff:  View the appropriate tariff configuration.  Select the Settings tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Tariff Configuration form is displayed in Update mode.  Select an alternative charge category from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar  To override the charge category in a product definition:  View the appropriate product definition.  Select the Tariffs tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Select an alternative charge category for the appropriate tariff.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?

pages.title: Modify a Charge Category Instance
pages.text: Charge category instances can be edited after they are created.  The instances can be attached to the service instance, customer node, or customer (root node), depending on the context of the tariff.  To modify a charge category instance:  View the appropriate Service Detail form (for service instances) or the Customer Detail form (for customer nodes or the root node).  Click the Charge Categories… button.  The appropriate Charge Category form is displayed in Update mode.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  Change the values in the Account Number field to the required values.  It is is the only field requiring an edit.  Using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?

pages.title: Proportion a Charge
pages.text: Restrictions on charge proportioning.  To split a charge between two or more accounts, it is necessary to duplicate the charge category instance.    To create a duplicate instance:  View the appropriate Service Detail form (for service instances) or Customer Detail form (for customer nodes or the root node).  Click the Charge Categories… button.  The appropriate Charge Category form is displayed in Update mode.  Select the charge category to be duplicated.  Click the Insert button on the toolbar once for each duplicate required.  Edit the proportions and the destination account numbers as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about charge categories?

pages.title: Globally Update Charge Category Instances
pages.text: Changes made to charge category defaults are not automatically applied to existing charge category instances defined using those defaults.  If changes are made to default charge categories and the changes should apply to all existing charge category instances and future ones, ask the System Administrator to schedule an Update Charge Categories task on the server before the next bill cycle.  Need more information on charge categories?

pages.title: Define a Derived Attribute (General Procedure)
pages.text: To define a derived attribute:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Derived Attributes @ Definition option.  The Derived Attribute Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Derived Attribute Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the data entry fields as required.  Evaluation Type: Conditional: Single Value Returned  Evaluation Type: Conditional: Multiple Values Returned  Evaluation Type: List  Evaluation Type: Simple Expression  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Best Match  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Multiple (1-10) Keys  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Searching  To define a derived attribute having an evaluation type of Table Lookup by Searching:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  Complete the data entry fields on the Details tab.  Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to Table Lookup by Searching.  Select the appropriate storage context.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field, ensuring that the definition is defined with at least one index and one result column.  If a user-specified wildcard is required, enter the wildcard value in the Wildcard String field on the Lookup Table tab.  Otherwise, leave the field blank and undefined values are treated as wildcards.  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global-Shared is used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed with the defined index and result columns.  Populate the table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  If a user-specified wildcard is set in the Wildcard String field, ensure that the wildcards entered in the index columns match the value in the field.  If Wildcard String field is not set, any undefined index columns are treated as wildcards.  A row can be included in the derived attribute table with all index columns specified as undefined wildcards.  This is the default row returned if no matches are found.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Single Range.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.text: To define a derived attribute with an evaluation type of List:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  Complete the data entry fields as required. If a storage context of Facility Group was selected, click the Save button on the toolbar and disregard the remainder of the procedure because the Lookup Table tab and Indexes tab are not displayed.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field, ensuring that the definition is defined with a single index column, of any data type.  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression (the expression must contain an @value<data type> variable, where <data type> is the data type of the attribute type for the index column).  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global-Shared was used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.
