Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to 'Simple Expression'.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Best Match
pages.text: To define a derived attribute having an evaluation type of Table Lookup by Best Match:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  Complete the data entry fields as required.  Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to Table Lookup by Best Match.  Select the appropriate storage context.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field, ensuring that the definition is defined with a single string index column and at least one result column.  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global Shared is used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed with the defined index and result columns.  Populate the table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Multiple (1-10) Keys
pages.text: To define a derived attribute having an evaluation type of Table Lookup by Multiple Keys:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  Complete the data entry fields.  Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to Table Lookup by Multiple Keys.  Select the appropriate storage context.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field (ensure that the definition is defined with at least one index and one result column).  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global-Shared was used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed with the defined index and result columns.  Populate the table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Searching
pages.text: To define a derived attribute having an evaluation type of Table Lookup by Searching:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  Complete the data entry fields on the Details tab.  Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to Table Lookup by Searching.  Select the appropriate storage context.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field, ensuring that the definition is defined with at least one index and one result column.  If a user-specified wildcard is required, enter the wildcard value in the Wildcard String field on the Lookup Table tab.  Otherwise, leave the field blank and undefined values are treated as wildcards.  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global-Shared is used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed with the defined index and result columns.  Populate the table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  If a user-specified wildcard is set in the Wildcard String field, ensure that the wildcards entered in the index columns match the value in the field.  If Wildcard String field is not set, any undefined index columns are treated as wildcards.  A row can be included in the derived attribute table with all index columns specified as undefined wildcards.  This is the default row returned if no matches are found.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Single Range
pages.text: To define a derived attribute having an evaluation type of Table Lookup by Single Range:  View the Derived Attribute Definition Form.  Complete the data entry fields.  Ensure that the Evaluation Type field is set to Table Lookup by Single Range.  Select the appropriate storage context.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Select the Lookup Table tab.  Select the appropriate entity validation definition in the Validation field, ensuring that the definition is defined with at least two index columns, Integer or Real, and at least one result column.  If required, enter the result column number and maximum number of rows.  Select the Indexes tab.  Enter the appropriate index expression.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  If a storage context of Global or Global-Shared was used, continue with the procedure.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed with the defined index and result columns.  Populate the table with the required lookup (index) and result values.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Define a Master Derived Attribute
pages.text: A derived attribute only becomes a 'master' when it is referenced by another (slave) derived attribute.  To define a master derived attribute, define a derived attribute in the usual way.  The master derived attribute must not have an end date selected.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Define a Slave Derived Attribute
pages.text: To define a slave derived attribute:  View the Derived Attribute Definition form.  In the Master Derived Attribute field, select the name of the derived attribute to act as the 'master' for this 'slave'.  Details associated with the specified master derived attribute are displayed on the current form.  The Master Derived Attribute field is enabled only if one of the table lookup evaluation types is specified.  Change the value of the Result Column Number field to a number other than one.  The number one is used to identify the result column associated with the master derived attribute.  Complete the data entry fields as required.  Evaluation Type: Simple Expression  Evaluation Type: Conditional: Single Value Returned  Evaluation Type: Conditional: Multiple Values Returned  Evaluation Type: List  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Best Match  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Multiple Keys  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Searching  Evaluation Type: Table Lookup by Single Range.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Access a Derived Attribute Lookup Table
pages.text: Convergent Billing provides facilities to:  List lookup tables (using the Derived Attribute Table Search form), to use a specific lookup table.  View a specific lookup table (using the Derived Attribute Definition form).  To search for a lookup table:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Derived Attributes @ Table Maintenance option.  The Derived Attribute Table Search form is displayed.  Specify search criteria and click the Search button.  Lookup tables that match the specified criteria are listed in the lower part of the form.   To view a specific lookup table in more detail, select the table name in the list of lookup tables and click the Detail... button, or double-click the lookup table name.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed in View Only mode.  To view a specific lookup table:  View the appropriate derived attribute.  Click the Table… button on the Lookup Table tab.  The Derived Attribute Table form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information about derived attributes?

pages.title: Access a Derived Attribute Table's History
pages.text: To view the history record table:  Access the required Derived Attribute Table form.  Click the History button.  The Derived Attribute Table History form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information about derived attributes?

pages.title: Update a Derived Attribute
pages.text: Modifying a derived attribute may result in corruption of data and/or forms that use the derived attribute.  To update a derived attribute:  View the appropriate derived attribute.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Derived Attribute Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the derived attribute details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Delete a Derived Attribute
pages.text: To delete a derived attribute:  View the appropriate derived attribute.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the derived attribute is to be deleted.  Need more information on derived attributes?

pages.title: Update the Index Expression Rows for a Derived Attribute
pages.text: If entity validation is being used for a derived attribute and the number of columns or the data types of the columns have changed, the index expression rows on the Indexes tab of the Derived Attribute Definition form must be updated.  To update the index expression rows:  View the appropriate derived attribute.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Derived Attribute Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   A message is displayed indicating that the number of index rows defined for the validation selected is not the same as defined in the Indexes tab.    Click the OK button to repopulate the indexes.  The additional index rows are displayed in the Indexes tab.   Configure the index expressions as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.   This procedure can be followed for individual, master, and child derived attributes and must be done for each affected derived attribute definition.  Updating the index expressions on a master definition does not automatically update the index expressions on its children.

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Equipment Types
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View an Equipment Type
pages.text: To view an equipment type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Equipment Types option.  The Equipment Type Search form is displayed.  Specify the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of equipment types matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate equipment type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate equipment type.  The Equipment Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on equipment types?

pages.title: Define an Equipment Type
pages.text: To define an equipment type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Equipment Types option.  The Equipment Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Equipment Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment types?

pages.title: Update an Equipment Type
pages.text: To update an equipment type:  View the appropriate equipment type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Equipment Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the equipment type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on equipment types?

pages.title: Delete an Equipment Type
pages.text: To delete an equipment type:  View the appropriate equipment type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the equipment type is to be deleted.  Need more information on equipment types?

pages.title: Configure Equipment Allocation
pages.text: To configure equipment allocation:  Define an entity validation definition to determine equipment allocation.  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option.  The Product Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New… button.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Follow the steps described in Prepare for Product Definition to populate the form.  Click the Services tab.  Place the cursor in the Allocation Form Entity Validation field and click the down arrow to insert the entity validation definition created in Step 1.  Save the product definition.    When a product instance is created, the configured equipment allocation is applied on the Equipment Allocation form when allocating equipment of the specified equipment type.  The entity validation definition is usually set up to restrict the number of items displayed when allocating an equipment to a service.  For example, the definition may restrict the number of pools available from which equipment can be allocated (by Service Prefix, Region, or Pool Type).  Need more information about equipment types?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Functions
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Function
pages.text: To view a function:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Functions option.  The Function Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of defined functions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate function and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate function.  The Function Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: Use an EPM Built-in Function
pages.text: To use one of Convergent Billing's EPM built-in functions, include it in an expression.  Ensure that the correct function syntax is used.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: Use an EPM Callback Function
pages.text: To use one of Convergent Billing's EPM callback functions, include it in an expression and ensure that the expression is evaluated within a process where the EPM callback function is available.  Ensure that the correct function syntax is used.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: Use a User-defined Function
pages.text: To use one of the user-defined functions provided in Convergent Billing, include it in an expression.  Ensure that the correct function syntax is used.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: Define a Function
pages.text: To define a function:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Functions option.  The Function Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Function Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: Update a Function
pages.text: To update a function:  View the appropriate function.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Function Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the function details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: Delete a Function
pages.text: Before deleting a function, ensure that it is not referenced in a tariff or derived attribute.  To delete a function:  View the appropriate function.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the function is to be deleted.  Need more information on functions?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Direct Variables
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Direct Variable
pages.text: Direct variables reference specific fields in a database record, so it is necessary to identify a specific database view to display the required variables.  To view the direct variables having a Service context:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Variables option.  The Variable Definition Search form is displayed.  Select Variable Name in the Search Field and the appropriate view in the Search Criteria field.  Context  View  Normalised Event  NORMALISED_EVENT_V  Service  SERVICE_HISTORY_V  Customer Node  CUSTOMER_NODE_HISTORY_V  Customer  CUSTOMER_V  Charge  CHARGE_V  Click the Search button. A list of each of the direct variables accessible in the specified context by the rating engine and billing engine is displayed.  Select the appropriate variable and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate variable. The Variable Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on direct variables?

pages.title: Define a Direct Variable
pages.text: To define a direct variable:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Variables option.  The Variable Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Variable Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on direct variables?

pages.title: Use a Direct Variable in an Expression
pages.text: Like other variables, direct variables can be referenced in tariffs and subtotals simply by including the name of the variable in an expression.  Need more information on direct variables?

pages.title: Update a Direct Variable
pages.text: To update a direct variable:  View the appropriate direct variable.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Variable Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the details of the direct variable as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on direct variables?

pages.title: Delete a Direct Variable
pages.text: A direct variable that is used by another variable cannot be deleted.  To delete a direct variable:  View the appropriate direct variable.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the direct variable is to be deleted.  Need more information on direct variables?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Facility Groups
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Facility
pages.text: To view a facility:  Select the Maintenance @ Data Definition @ Reference Types option.  The Reference Type Search form is displayed.  Select Type Label in the Search field.  Enter FACILITY in the Search Criteria field.  Click the Search button.  If the required reference type is not displayed, define it.  Select the FACILITY reference type and click the Detail… button, or double-click the reference type.  The Reference Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Define a Facility
pages.text: To define a facility:  View the list of facilities on the Reference Type Definition form.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Reference Type form is displayed in Update mode.  Position the cursor in the last reference item listed and press the Down Arrow key on the keyboard.  A new row is inserted at the bottom of the table of reference items.  Enter details for the required facility.  If a facility is defined in error, delete that facility's definition by selecting the table row on which the facility is defined and clicking the Delete button on the toolbar.  Repeat step 4 for each facility required in the new facility group.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Delete a Facility
pages.text: Deleting a facility that is referenced by one or more database entities may corrupt the Convergent Billing database.  Unless a facility has been defined in error, do not delete a facility.  To delete a facility:  View the list of facilities on the Reference Type Definition form.  Select the table row containing the facility to be deleted.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the facility is to be deleted.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: View a Facility Group
pages.text: To view a facility group:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Facility Group Definition option.  The Facility Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of the defined facility groups matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate facility group and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate facility group.  The Facility Group Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Define a Facility Group
pages.text: To define a facility group:  Ensure that all facilities to be included in the group have been defined.  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Facility Group Definition option.  The Facility Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Facility Group Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: List Facilities Associated with a Facility Group
pages.text: To view a list of facilities associated with a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Facilities tab.  A list of the facilities associated with the facility group is displayed.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Include a Facility in a Facility Group
pages.text: To include a facility in a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Facilities tab.  Position the cursor over the data entry field in the Facilities column and click the left mouse button.  Click the arrow on the right-hand side of the field and select one of the listed facilities.  To include another facility in the facility group, click the Insert button and then repeat the previous step.  The order in which the facilities are listed is irrelevant.  Repeat the previous step for each facility to be included in the facility group.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Remove a Facility from a Facility Group
pages.text: To remove a facility from the list of facilities specified for a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Facilities tab.  Select the table row containing the facility to be removed from the facility group.  Click the Delete button.  The facility is removed from the list.  Repeat steps three and four for each facility to be removed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about facility groups?

pages.title: Include a Facility in List of Compatible Facility Groups
pages.text: To include a facility group in the list of compatible facility groups:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Compatibility tab.  Position the cursor over the data entry field in the Compatible Facility Group column and click the left mouse button.  Click the arrow on the right-hand side of the field and select one of the listed facility groups.  Enter a description of the facility group in the Description field.  To specify another compatible facility group, click the Insert button and then repeat the previous two steps.  Repeat the previous step for each facility group to be included.  The order in which the compatible products are listed is irrelevant.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Remove a Facility from a List of Compatible Facility Groups
pages.text: To remove a facility group from the list of compatible facility groups:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Compatibility tab.  Select the table row containing the facility group to be removed from the list of compatible facility groups.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  The facility group is removed from the list.  Repeat steps three and four for each facility group to be removed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about facility groups?

pages.title: Update/Modify a Facility Group
pages.text: Impact of Updating a Facility Group  To update a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Facility Group Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the facility group details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Delete a Facility Group
pages.text: Do not delete a facility group if the facility group is referenced in one or more product instances because the product instances will be corrupted.  To delete a facility group:  View the appropriate facility group.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the facility group is to be deleted.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Product Definition
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Product Definition
pages.text: To view a product definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option.  The Product Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of product definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate product definition and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate product definition.  The Product Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Prepare for Product Definition
pages.text: Before attempting to define a product, ensure that all the following components required by that product are available:   At least one service type  Equipment types required by the specified service types  Tariffs to calculate the charges (or benefits) for each of the services specified  Charge categories to be associated with each of the specified tariffs  Entitlement types to be associated with the product  Subtotals required to aggregate the specified costed event records  Generic Convergent Billing components required by each of the above product components (for example, derived attributes, functions, reference types, and attribute types)  Invoice sections or invoice templates.  If the product is not to be used with product offers, facility groups facility groups containing a minimum of one facility can be defined for a base product.  Need more information about products?

pages.title: Define a Base Product
pages.text: To define a base product:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option.  The Product Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields in the upper part of the form.  If a required component was not defined while specifying the product definition, define it and then return to creating the product definition.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields on the Settings tab.  Select each of the other tabs in turn and complete the data entry fields or table rows as required.  Specifying Service Types and Equipment Types  Specifying Tariffs  Specifying Subtotals  Specifying Compatible Products  Specifying Facility Groups  Specifying List Types  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Perform the necessary post-product definition tasks.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Define a Companion Product
pages.text: To define a companion product:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Definition option.  The Product Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  In the upper part of the form, enter the name of the companion product, its description, and the period for which it is to be in effect.  Complete the appropriate fields on the Settings tab, and ensure that the Companion Product? option is selected.  Complete the appropriate fields on the Tariffs tab, Subtotals tab, and optionally, the Compatibility tab, Derived Attribute Tables (Lists) tab, Offer Tables tab, and Entitlement Types tab.  The Offer Tables tab defines the derived attribute tables used to store pricing data for companion products associated with product offers. A derived attribute table may be shared by more than one companion product.   The tab is displayed only if the Companion Product check box is selected.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Perform the appropriate post-product definition tasks.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Select a Product Icon
pages.text: To select a product icon, either select an icon from the drop-down list on the Product Definition form or create a new icon.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Specify Service Types and Equipment Types
pages.text: To identify service types and equipment types for inclusion in the product:  Select the Service Types tab on the Product Definition form.  In the upper part of the tab, select the required service type and complete the details for that table row.  When a service type is selected, default values may be inserted in the Minimum Range, Maximum Range, and Creation Order fields.  The default values are defined by the equipment type associated with the specified service type.  These values can be overridden if required.  The number inserted in the Creation Order field determines the order in which the service types are displayed.  Choose an order that reflects the normal order in which users create a product, or the order in which the services must be created.  For example, if equipment is shared by more than one service, the service type that controls the service number should be positioned before other associated service types.  In the lower part of the tab, select the equipment type to be associated with the specified service type and complete the details for each type selected.  If a default equipment type is specified for a specific service type, that equipment type is displayed in the list of equipment types.  Repeat steps 2 and 3 for each service type required in the product.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: Specify Tariffs
pages.text: To include a tariff in the product definition:  Select the Tariffs tab on the Product Definition form.  Select the tariff from the drop-down list of tariffs.  Press the Tab key.  If available, values are entered in the Default Invoice Text, Charge Category, and Priority columns.  A value is only entered in the columns if default text was specified when the tariff was defined.  If required, enter text (or change the text) in the columns.  If unsure what priority to give a tariff, select a number that allows the product to be flexible.  For example, if there is a possibility of adding companion products with tariffs in the future, select a number that will allow room to assign both lower and higher priorities to other tariffs.  Repeat steps 2 to 4 for each of the other tariffs defined for this product.  Tariffs associated with entitlement types are automatically included in the product definition and do not need to be specified separately.  Need more information on tariffs?

pages.title: Define a Tariff/Charge Category Pair
pages.text: To associate a charge category with a tariff:  View the appropriate tariff configuration.  Select the Settings tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Tariff Configuration form is displayed in Update mode.  Select a charge category from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).

pages.title: Modify a Tariff/Charge Category Pair
pages.text: The association between a tariff and a charge category can be modified by:  Changing the charge category configured as part of a tariff.  Overriding the charge category when the tariff is included in a product definition.  To change the charge category configured as part of a tariff:  View the appropriate tariff configuration.  Select the Settings tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Tariff Configuration form is displayed in Update mode.  Select an alternative charge category from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar  To override the charge category in a product definition:  View the appropriate product definition.  Select the Tariffs tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Select an alternative charge category for the appropriate tariff.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?

pages.title: Specify Subtotals
pages.text: To include a subtotal in the product definition:  Select the Subtotals tab on the Product Definition form.  Select the subtotal from the drop-down list of subtotals.  Press the Tab key.  If available, values are entered in the Default Invoice Text column and the GL Code column.  A value is only entered in the Default Invoice Text column if default text was specified when the specified subtotal was defined.  If required, override or enter text in the Default Invoice Text column, and override the GL code.  The use of the GL code specified on products is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only.  GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance.  Repeat steps 2 to 4 for each of the other subtotals defined for this product.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: Specify Compatible Products
pages.text: If the product is to be used with product offers, each base product needs to be configured to be compatible with any companion products with which it will be sold, and no compatibility needs to be specified on companion products.   To specify a compatible product:  Select the Compatibility tab on the Product Definition form.  Create a new table row by clicking the Insert button on the toolbar.  In the Compatible Product column, select the required product from the drop-down list of products.  The list from which a compatible product can be selected is restricted to those products (base and companion) defined in Convergent Billing.  If in step 3 a base product was entered, press the Tab key and set the Reuse permitted? field to either Yes or No.   The setting of the Reuse permitted? field is used only when upgrading a base product (and  merging/splitting a product):. It is is set to:  Yes, services and equipment specified in the existing product instance can be transferred to (reused in) the new product instance when the upgrade is performed.  No, services and equipment cannot be transferred to the new product instance when the upgrade is performed.  Whether the services and equipment are reused depends on the service type and equipment type specified in the existing product and new product.  To determine this, a simple match is performed.  If the service type exists in both the old product instance and the new product instance, the service is reused (if the Reuse permitted? field is set to Yes).  A similar match is performed for equipment types.  If a base product was entered, press the Tab key and set the Manual Allocation? field to either Yes or No.  If in step 3 a companion product was selected, press the Tab key twice to move the cursor into the Description column.  Do not select a setting in the Reuse permitted? field; it must remain blank.  To delete a value set in this field, press the Backspace key.  Enter a description for the specified product.  Repeat steps 2 to 5 for each of the other products to be specified as compatible with the product being defined.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Specify Facility Groups
pages.text: Facility groups are not compatible with product offers.  To include a facility group in the product definition:  Select the Facility Groups tab on the Product Definition form.  Select the required facility group from the drop-down list of facility groups.  Press the Tab key.  If available, values are entered in the Included as standard? and Status columns.  If the specified facility group is to be automatically included in every product instance, set the value of the Included as standard? field to Yes.  If the facility group is to be available, but not automatically included in a product instance, set the value to No.  Select the appropriate initial status of the facility group in the Status field.  Repeat steps 2 to 5 for each of the other facility groups to be included in the product.  Need more information on facility groups?

pages.title: Specify Derived Attribute Tables (List)
pages.text: To specify a derived attribute tables (list):  Select the Derived Attribute Tables (List) tab on the Product Definition form.  Complete the fields in the table row.  To add another derived attribute table (list), press the down arrow key to insert a table row and repeat step 2.  Need more information about list types?  Facility for deriving a new variable based on the values of other variables, which can be achieved by:  Using a simple expression  Conditional evaluation (similar to functions)  List evaluation type  Table look-up based on single, multiple, searching, or range indexes.  Context:  Convergent Billing  See also Evaluation Type, Master Derived Attribute, Product Definition, Slave Derived Attribute, Keyed Derived Attribute, and Variable.

pages.title: Specify Base Product Compatibility
pages.text: Base products that are part of a product offer cannot be upgraded. However, the product offer assigned to an instance of the base product can be changed.  To specify one or more base products to which the current base product can be upgraded, add the appropriate base product to the list of products (if any) on the Compatibility tab of the Product Definition form.  Any base products listed on this tab are available for selection using the Upgrade Detail tab of the Product Instance Detail form.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Specify Base Product and Companion Product Compatibility
pages.text: If the product is to be used with product offers, each base product needs to be configured to be compatible with any companion products with which it will be sold, and no compatibility needs to be specified on companion products.   To specify one or more companion products that can be added to the current base product, add the appropriate companion product to the list of products (if any) on the Compatibility tab of the Product Definition form for the base product.    If the base product is associated with a product offer, any companion products listed on this tab are available for inclusion in the product offer.   If the base product is not associated with a product offer, any companion products listed on this tab are available for selection using the Companion Products tab of the Product Instance Detail form.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Specify Companion Product Compatibility
pages.text: If the product is to be used with product offers, each base product needs to be configured to be compatible with any companion products with which it will be sold, and no compatibility needs to be specified on companion products.   To specify one or more companion products that can be used with the current companion product, add the appropriate companion product to the list of products (if any) on the Compatibility tab of the Product Definition form.  Any companion products listed on this tab are available for selection using the Companion Products tab of the Product Instance Detail form  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Enable Product Merging and Splitting
pages.text: The processes of merging and splitting products are similar to allowing product upgrades and downgrades.    Product merging and/or splitting can be performed only on base products not associated with product offers. It cannot be performed on companion products.   To enable product merging and splitting:  Follow the steps for defining a base product.  Ensure the product definition contains two or more service types (and optional associated equipment types) when service types and equipment types are specified.  Follow the steps for specifying base product compatibility, ensuring that the product definition is compatible with any associated base products.  Set the Reuse permitted? field settings to Yes on the Compatibility tab for each compatible product, to allow service and equipment to be transferred to the new product instance when the split/merge is performed.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Update a Product Definition
pages.text:
Information in a product definition cannot be changed if it will invalidate product instances based on that product definition. Effect of Updating Product Components on Product Instances Product Component Effect of Update on Product Instances Tariffs Available immediately. Used next time events are rated. Example of how changing a tariff can adversely affect charges. When updating a product definition, the following changes cannot be made: Removing service or equipment types Increasing service or equipment type minimum values Decreasing service or equipment type maximum values Adding new service or equipment types to product definitions with a minimum
value > 0. Changing a tariff outside of the start/end date of the bill period. Changes to a tariff should be restricted to the start or end of a bill period, ensuring that charges are billed correctly. The following is an example of when a tariff is changed in the middle of a bill cycle. Product 1 is effective 01/01/00 to 15/01/02 and contains Tariff 1. Product 1 is effective 16/01/01 to end of time and contains Tariff 2. If the product is sold to a customer on 01/01/01 and the bill run is scheduled for 30/01/01, the charges for the bill run are based on Tariff 2. The bill run picks up the tariff that is effective at the time of the bill run and bases charges for the billing period on that tariff. Charge Categories Existing charge categories available immediately. Additional charge categories only available if the server process to update charge categories is run. Subtotals Available immediately. Used next time rated events are aggregated. Service Types Updating not permitted if product instances exist. Equipment Types Updating not permitted if product instances exist. Facility Groups Available to existing product instances, but only when product instance is itself updated. Facilities Available immediately in facility groups if the facility is used in a product instance. Derived Attributes Existing derived attributes available immediately. Additional derived attributes only available if the process to update lists is run. Product Group None. Product Icon Available immediately. Product Compatibility None. Payment Items None. Limitations when updating a product definition To update a product definition: Define any new product components, or modify product components required in the updated product. View the appropriate product definition. Click the Update button on the toolbar. The Product Definition form is displayed in Update mode. Update the product definition details as required. Click the Save button on the toolbar. Notify the system or billing administrator that a product has been updated. For the updated product to be available in the next rating/billing operation, some server tasks must be performed. Need more information on products?

pages.title: Delete a Product Definition
pages.text: Deleting a product definition invalidates product instances based on that product definition.  To delete a product definition:  View the appropriate product definition.  Click the Delete button of the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product definition is to be deleted.  Need more information on products?

pages.title: Add a Product to a Product Group
pages.text: To add a product to a product group:  View the appropriate product group.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, and select the product to be added to the group from the drop-down list.  Repeat step 2 for any other products to be added to the product group.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Add a Base Product to a Product Offer
pages.text: A base product can be added only to top-level product offers, and only one base product can be added to each product offer.  To add a base product to a product offer:  Modify the appropriate product offer.  Select the Top-Level Offer? check box.  Select the product from the Base Product drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Add a Companion Product to a Product Offer
pages.text: To be available for adding to a product offer, a companion product must be added to the compatibility list for the base product associated with the top-level product offer in the hierarchy.  To add a companion product to a product offer:  Edit the appropriate product offer.  Select the Companion Products tab.  If the base product is associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to view and change the status of companion product instances selected for this base product instance. Companion product instances are added using the Offer tab and can be created before the product instance has been completed.  Any companion instances created on an incomplete product instance receive the initial status of Product Creation.  If the base product is not associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to select one or more companion products to be added to this instance of the base product. The available companion products are defined when the product on which this instance is based, is defined. Companion products can be added to this tab only when the product instance is completed.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, select the product to be added to the offer from the Companion Product drop-down list, and select either Yes or No from the Mandatory drop-down list.  If a companion product is configured as mandatory, it is automatically assigned with the product offer.  If the companion product has a derived attribute table associated with it, edit the derived attribute table.  Any derived attribute tables configured in the companion product definition as mandatory must be populated with at least one row.  Repeat steps 3 and 4 for other companion products to be added to the product offer.  Enter a minimum and maximum number of companion products that must be selected when the product offer is sold.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Post-product Definition Tasks
pages.text: When a product has been defined, the following further tasks need to be performed before the product can be tested and implemented.  Base Products  Create a top-level product offer based on the product.  Add the product to one or more product groups.  Notify the System Administrator or Billing Administrator that a new product has been created.  For the product to be available in the next rating/billing operation, a number of server tasks must be performed.  Companion Products  Add the product to one or more product offers.  Notify the System Administrator or Billing Administrator that a new product has been created.  For the product to be available in the next rating/billing operation, a number of server tasks must be performed.  Need more information about products?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Product Groups
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Product Group
pages.text: To view a product group:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Group Definition option.  The Product Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of product groups matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate product group and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate product group.  The Product Group Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Define a Product Group
pages.text: To define a product group:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Group Definition option.  The Product Group Definition Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Product Group Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter the name, description, start date and, if required, the end date, for the new product group.  Select the first row in the product table, click the Insert button on the toolbar, and select the product to be added to the group from the drop-down list.  Repeat step 4 for any other products to be added to the product group.  If the wrong product is inserted, select the appropriate table row and click the Delete button on the toolbar.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Add a Product to a Product Group
pages.text: To add a product to a product group:  View the appropriate product group.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, and select the product to be added to the group from the drop-down list.  Repeat step 2 for any other products to be added to the product group.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Remove a Product from a Product Group
pages.text: To remove a product from a group:  View the appropriate product group.  Select the product to be removed from the product group and click the Delete button on the toolbar.   If required, repeat step 2 for each product to be removed.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information about product groups?

pages.title: Modify a Product Group
pages.text: A product group can be modified at any stage after it is defined by:  Adding a product to a group.  Removing a product that is no longer required.  Moving a product to another group.  Modifying the group details (for example, name, description, and effective dates).  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Modify Product Group Details
pages.text: To modify product group details:  View the appropriate product group.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Group Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the product group details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Move a Product between Product Groups
pages.text: There is no direct method of moving a product from one product group to another.  To move a product between product groups:  Remove the product from the group.  Add the product to the appropriate group.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: Delete a Product Group
pages.text: To delete a product group:  View the appropriate product group.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product group is to be deleted.  Need more information on product groups?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Product Offers
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Product Offer
pages.text: To view a product offer:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Offers option.  The Product Offer Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of product offers matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate product offer and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate product offer.  The Product Offer Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Define a Product Offer
pages.text: Product offers can be created manually, or copied from an existing product offer and modified.  To define a product offer:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Product Offers option. The Product Offer Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Product Offer Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Enter name, display name, description, start date, and if required, end date for the new product offer.  If required, enter a code in the Stock Keeping Unit field, so the product offer can be quickly searched for.  If the product offer is a top-level offer, select the Top-Level Offer? check box.   Select a base product to associate with the offer.  If the product offer is not a top-level offer, and:  If the product offer is to be associated with a specific service, select the Service Specific? check box.  If the product offer is to be hidden when a product is sold to a customer, select the Hidden? check box.  If required, select a category and sub-category for the product offer.  If required, select a customer type to which the product offer is restricted.  Add companion products.  Add child product offers, if required.  A product offer must contain at least one component; that is, either a companion product or child product offer.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Duplicate a Product Offer
pages.text: Product offers can be created manually, or copied from an existing product offer and modified.  To duplicate a product offer:  Select the Maintenance @ Configuration Explorer option.  The Configuration Explorer form is displayed.  Click on the Products entry in the left-hand pane of the Configuration Explorer.  Click on the Product Offers entry in the right-hand pane.  Locate the product offer to be duplicated.  Right-click on the product offer, and select Duplicate.... The Duplicate Product Offer form is displayed.  Enter a name for the new product offer.  Click the OK button.  Modify the new product offer as required.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Add a Base Product to a Product Offer
pages.text: A base product can be added only to top-level product offers, and only one base product can be added to each product offer.  To add a base product to a product offer:  Modify the appropriate product offer.  Select the Top-Level Offer? check box.  Select the product from the Base Product drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Add a Child Product Offer to a Product Offer
pages.text: To add a child product offer to a product offer:  View the appropriate product offer and select Update.  Click on the Child Offers tab.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, and select the product offer to be added from the Child Product Offer drop-down list.  Enter the minimum number of optional child product offers in the Offer Min field.  The child product offer is mandatory if the value is greater than or equal to 1.  If a child product offer is mandatory, it is automatically assigned with the product offer and its availability period is ignored.  If a child product offer is optional, it is available for sale with the parent offer, if the current date is within the availability period.  Enter the maximum number of optional child product offers in the Offer Max field.  Offer Max must be greater than or equal to both, Offer Min and 1.  For Offer Max to be 2 or greater, the child product offer must have at least one mandatory companion product. That is, either the minimum number of companion products is greater than or equal to 1, or at least one of the companion products is mandatory.  For optional child product offers, complete the Available Start Date and Available End Date fields as required.  Repeat steps 3 to 6 for any other child product offers to be added.  Enter a minimum and maximum number of child product offers which must be selected when the top-level product offer is sold.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the product offers in the child product offer table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the product offers are listed determines the order in which they are displayed in the tree pane on the Offers tab of the Product Instance Detail form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Add a Companion Product to a Product Offer
pages.text: To be available for adding to a product offer, a companion product must be added to the compatibility list for the base product associated with the top-level product offer in the hierarchy.  To add a companion product to a product offer:  Edit the appropriate product offer.  Select the Companion Products tab.  If the base product is associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to view and change the status of companion product instances selected for this base product instance. Companion product instances are added using the Offer tab and can be created before the product instance has been completed.  Any companion instances created on an incomplete product instance receive the initial status of Product Creation.  If the base product is not associated with a product offer, the Companion Products tab is used to select one or more companion products to be added to this instance of the base product. The available companion products are defined when the product on which this instance is based, is defined. Companion products can be added to this tab only when the product instance is completed.  Select one of the rows in the product table, click the Insert button, select the product to be added to the offer from the Companion Product drop-down list, and select either Yes or No from the Mandatory drop-down list.  If a companion product is configured as mandatory, it is automatically assigned with the product offer.  If the companion product has a derived attribute table associated with it, edit the derived attribute table.  Any derived attribute tables configured in the companion product definition as mandatory must be populated with at least one row.  Repeat steps 3 and 4 for other companion products to be added to the product offer.  Enter a minimum and maximum number of companion products that must be selected when the product offer is sold.  If necessary, rearrange the order of the products in the product table using the Up and Down buttons.  The order in which the products are defined determines the order in which those product's icons are displayed when that product group is displayed on the Customer Hierarchy form.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Modify a Product Offer
pages.text: A product offer can be updated to:  Add or remove optional companion products.  Add or remove child product offers.  Modify availability dates for the product offer and other attributes of the product offer.  Modify derived attributes associated with a companion product, for a date range in the future.  The Product Offer Detail view in Business & Administration Studio can be used to perform these updates.  It is also possible to view product offers and perform some operations on product offers using the Product Offer Editor in Configuration Studio.  To modify a product offer:  View the appropriate product offer.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Product Offer Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the product offer details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Delete a Product Offer
pages.text: A product offer cannot be deleted if it is:  A child of another product offer.  Referenced by a current product instance.  To delete a product offer:  View the appropriate product offer.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the product offer is to be deleted.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: Associate a Service with a Product Offer
pages.text: A service can be associated with a product offer if the offer is:  Not a top-level offer  Configured as a service-specific offer  To associate a service with a product offer:  Display the Product Offer Definition form.  Ensure that the Service Specific? checkbox is selected.  Select a service from the Service drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on product offers?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Entitlements
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: Create an Entitlement Type
pages.text: Create the entitlement type in the Configuration Studio.  Entitlement types are configured as part of the implementation and not expected to be updated by the service provider (see the Customer Care and Product Configuration Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing).  Need more information on entitlements?

pages.title: Create an Entitlement Category
pages.text: Create an entitlement category for the entitlement by updating the EntitlementCategory derived attribute table.  Need more information on entitlements?

pages.title: View an Entitlement
pages.text: Entitlements can be viewed from the following forms:  Customer Detail  Product Instance Detail  Service Detail.  To view an entitlement using the Customer Detail form:  View the customer’s details.  Click the Entitlements button.  To view an entitlement using the Product Instance Detail form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products or Companion Products option from the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate product record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Product Instance Detail form is displayed.   Select the Companion Products tab on the Product Instance Detail form.  Click the Entitlements button .  To view an entitlement using the Service Detail form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select Products and Services options from the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate service record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Service Detail form is displayed.   Click the Entitlements button.  Need more information on entitlements?

pages.title: View Entitlement History
pages.text: To view entitlement history:  View the appropriate entitlement.  Entitlements can be viewed from the following forms:  Customer Detail  Product Instance Detail  Service Detail.  To view an entitlement using the Customer Detail form:  View the customer’s details.  Click the Entitlements button.  To view an entitlement using the Product Instance Detail form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select the Products or Companion Products option from the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate product record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Product Instance Detail form is displayed.   Select the Companion Products tab on the Product Instance Detail form.  Click the Entitlements button .  To view an entitlement using the Service Detail form:  Display the Customer Hierarchy form for the appropriate customer.  Select Products and Services options from the Display for customer group. Summary information about each product instance and its associated services for the specified customer is displayed in the right-hand panel.  Double-click the appropriate service record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Service Detail form is displayed.   Click the Entitlements button.  Need more information on entitlements?  Click the History button on the toolbar.  The Entitlement History form in displayed in View Only mode.  Double-click the appropriate record, or select the record and click the Details… button. The Entitlement Detail form is displayed.

pages.title: Create/Modify the Entitlement associated with a Companion Product
pages.text: To configure entitlements for a companion product.  Define a companion product.  Select the Entitlement Types tab on the Product Definition form.  The Entitlement Types tab defines the entitlement types available for use with a companion product (see the Customer Care and Product Configuration Guide for Singleview Convergent Billing).  Changes to the tab are reflected on the Tariffs tab, with the list of real-time tariffs associated with the product automatically updated to match the tariffs specified by the current entitlement types.   The tab is only displayed if the Companion Product check box is selected.  Entitlement types are configuration objects that are delivered as part of an implementation, and are not expected to be updated by the service provider, and are created and maintained in Configuration Studio.  Select the entitlement type from the Entitlement Types drop-down list.  Click the Save button.  Update the ProductOfferEntitlementCat derived attribute table with the categories associated with the entitlement type.  An entitlement is created for each entitlement type specified, when an instance of the companion product is activated.  Need more information on entitlements?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Service Types
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Service Type
pages.text: To view a service type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Service Types option.  The Service Type Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of service types that match the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate service type and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate service type.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: Define a Service Type
pages.text: To define a service type:  Select the Maintenance @ Products @ Service Types option.  The Service Type Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in Insert mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  If required, override the default charge category.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: Update a Service Type
pages.text: To update a service type:  View the appropriate service type.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Service Type Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the service type details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: Delete a Service Type
pages.text: To delete a service type:  View the appropriate service type.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the service type is to be deleted.  Need more information on service types?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Subtotals
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Subtotal
pages.text: To view a subtotal definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Subtotals option.  The Subtotal Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of subtotal definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate subtotal definition and click the Detail… button, or double-click the appropriate subtotal definition.  The Subtotal Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: Define a Subtotal
pages.text: To define a subtotal:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Subtotals option.  The Subtotal Search form is displayed.  Click the New... button.  The Subtotal Definition form is displayed in Insert Mode.  Complete the appropriate data entry fields.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: Update a Subtotal
pages.text: To update a subtotal:  View the appropriate subtotal.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Subtotal Definition form is displayed in Update mode.  Update the subtotal details as required.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: Delete a Subtotal
pages.text: Before deleting a subtotal, ensure that the subtotal is not referenced in another subtotal or tariff.  To delete a subtotal:  View the appropriate subtotal.  Click the Delete button on the toolbar.  When prompted, click the Yes button to confirm that the subtotal is to be deleted.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: Create a Progressive Subtotal
pages.text: To create a progressive subtotal:  Create the subtotal.    On the Settings tab, select the Service context, and select the Use Subtotal before final value? check box.  Select the Terms tab.  Create a subtotal term expression that returns a constant value of 1.  Select the Normalised Event evaluation context.  Save the subtotal.  Define a tariff configuration.  On the Settings tab, select the Normalised Event context.  Click the Eligibility… button on the Settings tab to enter an eligibility expression.  The eligibility expression should return TRUE if the progressive subtotal is less than or equal to 3.  Select the Charges tab of the Tariff Configuration form.  In the Charge Expression field, enter an expression specifying that if the subtotal of normalised events is less than 3, no charges are applied to the subtotal.  In the Default Charge Expression field, enter the default charge -Charge# (to cancel out the rating charge).  Save the tariff configuration.  The value of the service subtotal can be accessed by the normalised event variables after each normalised event is processed.  Need more information on subtotals?

pages.title: How Do I - Product Configuration Tasks - Tariffs
pages.text: Select the option most appropriate to the required task.

pages.title: View a Tariff Definition
pages.text: To view a tariff definition:  Select the Maintenance @ Tariffs @ Tariffs @ Definition option.  The Tariff Definition Search form is displayed.  Enter or select the appropriate search criteria and search method.  Click the Search button.  A list of tariff definitions matching the specified criteria is displayed.  Select the appropriate tariff definition and click the Detail... button, or double-click the appropriate tariff definition.  The Tariff Definition form is displayed in View Only mode.  Need more information on tariffs?

pages.title: View a Tariff Table
pages.text: Before a tariff table can be viewed, the appropriate tariff definition must be defined. pages.title: Define a Tariff Table
pages.text: To define a tariff table:  For a given set of:   Conditions, determine the appropriate charge values to be used in the charge expression to calculate the value for the tariff. pages.title: Include a Tariff in a Product Definition
pages.text: Real-time tariffs are included automatically with entitlement types and cannot be added manually.  To assign a tariff to a specific product definition:  View the appropriate product definition.  Select the Tariffs tab.  Click the Insert or Update button on the toolbar.  Ensure that the form is in Insert or Update Mode.  A form can be displayed in one of the following modes:  Form Mode  Description  View Only mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed, but not updated (modified).  Insert mode  Allows new information to be recorded (entered) in Convergent Billing.  Update mode  Allows information held in Convergent Billing to be viewed and updated (modified).  To change the form mode:  Current Form Mode  New Form Mode  Click the …  View Only mode  Update mode  Update button  Update mode  View Only mode  Save or Cancel button  View Only mode  Insert mode  Insert button  Insert mode  View Only mode  Save button  Select the tariff from the drop-down list of tariffs.  Press the Tab key.  If available, values are entered in the remaining fields of the current row.  If required, enter default invoice text (or change the existing text) and/or change the charge category.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on tariffs?

pages.title: Define a Tariff/Charge Category Pair
pages.text: To associate a charge category with a tariff:  View the appropriate tariff configuration.  Select the Settings tab.  Click the Update button on the toolbar.  The Tariff Configuration form is displayed in Update mode.  Select a charge category from the drop-down list.  Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?  Charge Category Examples  A charge category specifies an account type and, optionally, an account, to which a tariff’s charge or benefit is posted, and is an essential part of tariffing.  Another account type can also be defined and, optionally, an account, to which a balancing (opposite) entry can be posted (known as the ‘from’ account).  The term ‘tariff/charge category pair’ is often used to emphasise that the two objects are independent, but always go together.  Charge categories cannot reference account types that permit multiple accounts of the same type on a customer node.  The account inferred from an account type assigned to a charge category must be unambiguous.  A charge category instance is created for every tariff used by a service whenever a product containing the service is sold, creating a product instance.  The charge category instance is located at the customer node, the customer (root node), or the service level, depending on the context defined for the associated tariff.  A different instance of the charge category can exist at each level, for use by tariffs with different contexts.  A charge category instance is created using values from the default charge category specified in the appropriate tariff configuration.  The values used can be overridden.  Only one instance of the charge category is created at each location, no matter how many services reference the tariff.  Any defaults for services after the first are ignored.  A charge category instance can be re-defined so that proportions of a charge are posted to more than one account.  They can also be edited after creation, to redirect payments to a different account.  When the rating or billing engine processes an event, the process involves looking up details of the service stored at the customer node, identifying the applicable tariffs, and then using the tariffs to calculate the value of each charge or benefit.  The appropriate charge category instance is then used to identify the account.  The combination of the charge and the account information makes up the charge record in the CHARGE table of the database.  A charge category instance can also define a GL code to assign to the charge or benefit, if required.  However, using charge categories to assign GL codes is deprecated and provided for backward compatibility only. GL codes are assigned to charges using GL guidance (for more information, refer to the Finance Guide for Singleview).

Click the Save button on the toolbar.  Need more information on charge categories?
